The bulk of the implementation was done by Norbert Janssen, Artifex added bug fixes and enhancements for pcl downloaded fonts.  The changes fixes most of the visual discrepancies in PCL6 CET C706.BIN.
Fix bug where image->colorspace was still treated as an enum.
Simplify and fix the implementation of operator --mul--, which mishandled some cases like "16#80000000 -1 mul". Bug 691412.
Fix for bug691415.  When equivalent ICC profile is already created we should just use it.  Thanks to Ken for getting the details together.
Fix for bug 689836 and 691248.
uint8_t type located in usual header on HP-UX needed for jbig2dec ; bug 688184
Fix for 691359. Problem tracked down by Alex.
Fixes bug #691397 comment #3.  Set the heap limit properly when using the heap allocator without a chunk allocator.  Thanks to Norbert Janssen for this fix.
Whitespace and indentation fixes.
Set GENDIR to "./debugobj" in debug builds for the other languages as well.
Fix for bug 689836 and 691248.

Revert rev. 7964 and use a different approach: allocate all structures and proceed with their initialization only if all allocations were successful. Fix memory corruption that happens at the PostScript stack overflow. Bug 691295.
Add a /.notdef entry to /CharStrings dictionary if it's missing from an embedded Type1 font. Bug 691406, customer 130.
Fix so that new icc changes work with svg.  This fixes the seg faults for 691360.
auto-detect host as *BSD and use a differently named obj directory; no effect on non-*BSDs. fixes bug 687214
adding more borland-related build tips; part of borland build fixes (bug 691400)
nsis-based installer script, makefile adaptation, documentation update; bug 691363
borland build fix (bug 691400): borland defines P_tmpdir but not _P_tmpdir; similiar difference between borlandc and msvc has been seen with setmode/_setmode in the ijs code in ijs/ijs_server.c
borland build fix (bug 691400): update and complete documentation on working around for too-many-warnings-equal-error problem of borland c++
borland fix (bug 691400): Borland c++ does not support c99 LL nor ULL, but use i64/ui64 like MSVC for 64-bit integer literals
4 borland build fixes (bug 691400):
borland build does not create the obj and bin directories. part of borland build fix (691400)

defines a unix target, since win32 requires specific compiler flags; HP-UX make/MS nmake both issues a warning and borland make issues an error for duplicate targets; fixes bug 691337, and also part of the problems with borland build (bug 691400)
Fix malformed ICC profile generation on big endian systems, which was caused by confusion between internal and external representation of an integer.
Don't leave wild bytes at the end of a generated ICC profile. Fix Valgrind warnings and spurious hash value differences.
Fix so that when the CIE color spaces are released, the icc equivalent space is also rc decremented as is the profile.
Fix for memory leak in creation of icc profile from def(g) objects.
Fixes typo in 11384.
Use operator --search-- instead of --token-- during PDF rebuilding to reduce the load on the name table, slightly improve the speed, and work around the bug 691005 in a few cases.
adjust self-reference of bswin32.mak to correct location. Part 1 of fix to bug 691400
mentioning -P-/-P and further reference to the INITIALIZATION FILES and Use.htm in the man page. bug 691350
split make_filelist functionality out of setupgs, to allow UAC restriction during packaging of the installer. Bug 691302
add info about silent batch installation; bug 691268

Change to help track down any memory leaks related to the new icc code.  Also fix so that gs_init_iccmanager copies the null character from the default profile string names.  There was a mismatch between what happened here and what happens when the default user params are set.  This was causing the profiles to reset in the manager when they did not need to be.

Fix (FAPI) move two FAPI related members from the show enumerator structure to the text enumerator structure. This ensures that these members are always available for rendering and eliminates a GPF caused when a device's text_begin method returns a text enumerator rather than the show enumerator returned by gx_default_text_begin.

Addition of code to use new icc color architecture in xps rendering.  Tor to provide minor fixes to this, primarily to remove the ctx->icc object.  There will be xps differences with this commit since icc profiles were previously ignored.

A new debug configuration definition so the languages (pcl, pclxl, and xps) will only use the heap allocator.  Useful if using tools such as valgrind and leak checking tools that don't know about the gs allocator.
Fix yet another case where memcpy() copies a memory block on itself. This doesn't cause any problems on Linux or Windows but violates the spec and irks Valgrind. Bug 691394.
Fix (pdfwrite) : limit composite object sizes when producing PDF/A
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't emit invalid PDF/A files
Fix pdfwrite - device reference counting problem with patterns and XPS

In bytes_copy_rectangle() clamp the length of each row to be copied to the stride of the raster. This takes care of problems copying bitmaps from FT (or potentially other font libraries) which use different alignment to the "internal" rasters. Bug 691328.

Check whether the font has /Encoding before trying to use it. Recent FAPI changes give /BuildChar procedure to all fonts including CIDFont resources. So the check for non-null pfdata->BuildChar no longer guaranteed that the font has /Encoding. Bug 691311.
Fix for Bug 691368.
Fixes bug #691357, in pathological input cases the polyline encoding functions could enter an infinite loop requesting more data with a full input buffer and not consuming any of the data.

Fix for Bug 691367.  Seg fault should no longer occur.  If an attempt is made to set a color space in the graphic state and the ICC manager's profiles have not yet been initialized, it will be taken care of.

Fix for indeterminisms in some PS files where the alternate tint transform color space for a DeviceN or Separation color space is CIE based.  Previously we were  returning either CMYK, or RGB based based upon the channel count for the CIE space.  Now we are returning an equivalent ICC based color space.  Also minor fix for uninitialized memory in generated profile.
Fix for crashes when handling fts_27xx.xps.
observe minst->search_here_first condition in file search; bug 691350
Adding -P- and -dSAFER to many POSIX shell scripts, win32 and OS/2 batch scripts; bug 691355
Fix pdfwrite, faulty matrix transformations for Shading dictionaries
Fixes bug #690793.  PJL Formlines was not set correctly if the paper size changed.  Also, refactors such that PXL and PJL get paper sizes from the same source table.
Fix indentation error.

Fix so that shading strokes that go through the clist transparency code communicate the transparency device so that the proper color information is used as opposed to the color information related to the final target device.  This should fix the indeterminism with bug688807.pdf when going out to a monochrome device.
Fix failed compilation of gxps.exe and pcl6.exe with Visual Studio 2008.

Fix for indeterminism when using psdcmyk device and interpolated images.  For cases where the device profile has fewer components than the actual number of device colorants we need to use the slower interpolation code.  Otherwise we end up encoding uninitialized memory.

Fix for bug690218.   For clist reader the pdf14 device was getting its color information set based upon the number of spot colorants in the page.  The real number should be based upon the number of actual components the device is capable of handling.  This occurs when using separation device with a limited set of colorants invoked via a command like -c "<< /SeparationColorNames [ /Cyan /Magenta /Yellow /Black ] /SeparationOrder [ /Cyan /Magenta /Yellow /Black ] >> setpagedevice"
Improvements and fixes in icc search path description and bolder alert with respect to Windows delimiter \" interpretation . Thanks to Ray.

The languages (pcl, xps, pclxl) debug builds were broken with the icc branch merge, gs_abort() is not supported.  The code has been changed similarly to the old exit upon failed assertion code in gsalloc.c where gs_abort() is replaced with return, fixes bug #691340.
Fix copy CIDFontType 2 properly Bug #690930 "Unicode Output: DEVICE=pdfwrite"

Bug 691336: Resolve some confusion between the original global variable removal changes, and subsequent changes, that could result in warning emprintf calls using a memory pointer that could not exist at that stage.
manually fixing the last few files which escaped fileutils' identification.
Recognize Corel tint transform function and replace it with an equivalent calculator function. Bug 690986.
Decide whether load a CFF font as a simple font or a CIDFont based on the /Subtype of the font object instead of the /Subtype of the font stream. Acrobat appears to ignore the latter. Bug 691334.
White space change to test previous fix for indeterminism issue.

Fix for indeterminisms in ICC branch.  Indexed spaces whose base space is PS CIE should return the equivalent ICC color space as the concrete color space.    This insures that a remap based upon the target device profile is performed instead of a remap based upon the PS CIE color space's component count.  Thanks to Masaki for editing down a PS file with this issue.

Following Acrobat implementation but contrary to TTF spec, consider cmap entry that has endCode < startCode as an entry with endCode == startCode. According to the spec, "to use these arrays, it is necessary to search for the first endCode that is greater than or equal to the character code to be mapped. If the corresponding startCode is less than or equal to the character code ...". I.e. an entry with endCode < startCode should have no effect. Thanks to Ken for the patch. Bug 691326.
Fixes Bug 691225, integrates Norbert Janssen's work to correctly set the next font source.  No expected difference this functionality is not regression tested.
Fix: device reference counting problem with patterns and clipping
Fix up the eol-style of the rest of the executable files by hand. Remove executable bit from toolbin/bmpcmp.c

Fix of an issue that was causing a deadlock in the link cache access during multi-threaded clist rendering.  With this commit, the link cache is now shared amongst the threads.  Ran a test case with a small cache (3 slots) with 8 threads where each thread needs 7 different links (not all at once but during the rendering of the band) and the code completed successfully.  Thanks to Ray for all his help with this.

Fix of bug in link cache.  Thread was being placed in wait state during check for an available slot in the cache.  Also fix in profile cache.  A pointer to the previous entry in the cache was not being properly set prior to its use.
Some work towards (but not a complete cure for) bug 691030.
Bug 691291. Fix reading uninitialized memory.

Initial commit of code to perform multi-threaded clist rendering with the new ICC color management.  Thanks to Ray for writing the bulk of this.  This still needs additional testing but since I have fixed a few issues with Ray's initial patch and it is running in the cases I have tested so far, it is worthwhile to commit now.  The individual threads each maintain a pointer to the icc_table and the link_cache which are member variables of the primary clist reader device.  During the creation of a link in the link cache in gsicc_get_link_profile a lock is placed on the cache.   If the number of links is at (or above) the maximum a wait semaphore is signaled to the thread.   When a link is released in gsicc_release_link, gx_semaphore_signal is applied for all threads that are waiting for a cache slot.  Note that gsicc_release_link is also wrapped with a cache lock (i.e. gx_monitor_enter and gx_monitor_leave).   The threads that are waiting will then race in gsicc_findcachelink to lock up the cache and grab the available slot.
define -DHAVE_CONFIG_H and run jbig2dec/configure from top-level configure. The fixes some portability issues seen on opensolaris; further follow-up to bug 691304
typo in one word. bug 691323

Bug 691313: remove the IBM Omni driver from the default build on Linux. Previously it could be excluded by giving configure "--without-omni", this revision reverses the logic, so Omni can be include by giving configure "--with-omni".

Addition of two new PDF14 compositor actions for pushing and popping the softmask color.  These are only used during clist writing and during immediate rendering when the pdf14_device device is actually installed.  In the case of pdfwrite the compositor actions are ignored.  Since the compositor actions never make it into the clist they do not occur during clist reading.   This should fix the issues that I had with the previous commit with respect to pdfwrite since the code in that commit was not going through the compositor actions and was treating the pdfwrite device as if it were a pdf14_device device.
Fix - type 1/CFF font interpreter. The gs_type1_piece_codes routine interprets a type 1 or CFF glyph program to determine whether the glyph is composed of two subglyphs (a SEAC).
adding check for header stringprep.h; fix bug 691312
Fixes portability issue properly with r11256 (which is identical with r11520), first discovered by Ralph 6 months ago with r10520 which results in its being reverted in r10540 .
fix windows build breakage in r11249
rename PDEP to TIFFDEP to avoid clashing with PDEP from libpng.mak; bug 691299
comment out a later duplcate definition; bug 691299
another fix to bug 691306 This was broken in r2746 (June 2002) which nobody has noticed for 8 years. This code path is only used for 'make -f unixansi.mak' (very generic unix cc compiler).
generate tif_config.h if it is not there. part of fixes to bug 691306
part of fix to bug 691306.
freetype2 dependency in base/unixansi.mak to make "make -f base/unixansi.mak" work; another part for bug 691306
freetype2 dependency in base/unix-gcc.mak to make "make -f base/unix-gcc.mak" work; bug 691306
fix an obvious typo in the makefile
Added support to unix-gcc.mak and unixansi.mak to build/use libtiff (also fixed some typos and made the device lists more similar).
remove one extra tab introduced in r10994; non-GNU Make on Tru64 and HP-UX is picky. Bug 688184 and bug 691299
HP compiler quirk - apparently the same workaround is needed for SUN Pro C and GCC 1.x (see a few lines before this change) ; bug 688184
uint8_t type located in usual header on HP-UX needed for jbig2dec ; bug 688184
fix conflicting types against HP-UX system header in jasper; bug 688184
adding NULL check before closedevice - bug report 691296 and patch from Tim Waugh. Thanks.

Fix FAPI interface There is code in the FAPI interface for replacing a font's /FontBBox entry, this sometimes has to create a new array to insert into the dictionary, if the old array is not suitable for storing real values.
Fixes bug #690877, update the PXL default fill algorithm to use any-part-of-pixel not center-of-pixel.  Unfortunately we expect differences in most the pxl test files with this change.
bmpcmp was reporting the wrong page number for images, due to me forgetting to increment the imagecount when images were loaded. Fixed here.

Fix potential customer reported problems associated with the ATS files: PL2KBSC2.BIN, WW2K7SC2.BIN, a PA command without arguments does not draw a dot in the pen down state.  A number of regression files are affected by this change, usually by removing the printing of a single extraneous pixel which we never noticed before.

Bugs 690356 and 690832: have the colour space object take a copy of string data associated with an indexed colour space lookup table. This prevents the colour space finalising code (gx_final_Indexed) freeing the contents of a Postscript object which may still be in use.

Fix (FAPI) The PDF interpreter, when a font is missing, and it has the 'small caps' flag set, creates a substitute by altering the CharStrings of the substitute font, replacing the lower case glyph CharStrings with procedures which 'show' the upper case glyph at a reduced size.
Fix for bug 691249 - error caused by failing to initialise new member of libctx that was previously a global.

Debug code for helping in debug of 689737.  The pattern that is created is 1 bpp.  With this code the pattern bit map is dumped for opening with photoshop as a raw 8bit image.  The source of the problem appears to be incorrect creation of the pattern bit map when GraphicAlphaBits is set to greater than 1.
Fix (fonts) Bug #691290 "new freetype code gives error /typecheck in definefont"
Fix (FreeType) : illegal use of setcurrentpoint not handled as per Adobe. Bug #691172, file type1-ce1_setcurrentpoint.ps

Retry of fix for Bug 69048 (this one actually builds...) Again this should only be a factor when using GraphicsAlphaBits.  The fix was to make sure that when GraphicsAlphaBits is used we initialize the pattern bits buffer.  Otherwise the get_bits operation used during the gx_default_copy_alpha grabs uninitialized memory.  Since we do not test with GraphicsAlphabits in the regression testing I don't expect there to be any differences.

Fix for Bug 690487.  This should only be a factor when using GraphicsAlphaBits.  The fix was to make sure that when GraphicsAlphaBits is used we initialize the pattern bits buffer.  Otherwise the get_bits operation used during the gx_default_copy_alpha grabs uninitialized memory.  Since we do not test with GraphicsAlphabits in the regression testing I don't expect there to be any differences.
Update license headers of a few retaining files with AFPL header. Bug 691285.
Detect and break an infinite loop when some of the image data source are at EOF, some are not, and the image code doesn't take more data. Bug 691285.

Fixes a customer reported problem with pcl6 cet 3.0 T427.BIN (no bug report was filed).  The placement of hpgl/2 graphics could be placed incorrectly in PXL passthrough mode.  See the comments in the code change for more details.
Fixes a coding error the enumerated type value pcl_reset_printer was being treated as a boolean.  This doesn't seem to be associated with a known bug.
Fix clist_band_height to use the macro defined in gxband.h as other code does to prevent future bitrot. Also use macros for the clist_ cfname, cfile, bfname, bfile.
Fix number of elements in the BAND_PARAMS_INITIAL initializer macro to correspond to the size of gx_band_params_t (needed since rev 5751).
Remove gs_debug_out global variable as it is never used.

Update overprint device to avoid writing back to 3 global variables ({generic,no,sep}_overptint_procs). We still have those global variables but each instantiated device takes copies of them and does any writing back into the copies. This is part of the work for bug 691207.
Move gs_interp_reschedule_proc, gs_interp_time_slice_proc, and gs_interp_time_slice_ticks into context to avoid global variables as part of the work for bug 691207.

The color space at the time a pattern was created and the color space in the graphic's state when the pattern is used must match otherwise an error is reported and the job is aborted.  The fix seems to bypass (not fix) several indeterministic problems in the PCL XL regression test suite.
Fix (FAPI & FreeType)
Fix compilation errors on Visual C that wants "ui64" suffix instead of "ULL" for "unsigned long long" numerals.
More work towards bug 691207 (global variable removal).
More work for bug 691207 (remove global vars). Change the gp_ interface and all its implementations to pass a gs_memory_t in some cases to allow eprintf calls to be made safely.
A fix for 691164 "PDF loads blank when not Administrator on Vista using GS 8.7".
adding --ldflags to cups.mak ; bug 690268
Incoporate the reporter's suggested change to config.guess , bug 69020
minor wording and grammar corrections. Bug 690005

As part of the work for bug 691207 (remove global variables) we introduce a new set of macros, "emprintfX". These do the same as the "eprintfX" macros, except they take an explicit memory reference rather than using the mem_err_print global.
Revision 11146 (move op_array_table_global) has broken the language switch build. This commit fixes it.
As part of the efforts towards bug 691207 (global variables must be removed) this commit reduces the reliance on mem_err_print.
Fix compiler warning (return from incompatible pointer type) introduced with making the font cache part of the library context, revision 11165.
Applied Michael Constant's patch to support reading 256-bit AES encrypted PDFs (bug #690702).
Fix (pdfwrite) incorrect ToUnicode CMap. Bug #691274 "Missing or incorrect ToUnicode when using Identity ordering"
Fix unix so build regression; fixes regression from r9948 which was committed for bug 690695
fixes multiple jpeg devices listed in gs -h (bug 691176)
Rewording build instructions for unix systems, and adding more warnings about instructions for legacy old systems being deprecated; bug 691264.
Check all PDF files for transparency features because some files have incorrect version number but Acrobat renders them just fine. Bug 691273.
rev 11149 for fixing bug 691014 had still some compiler warnings. This rev fixes them.

Fix for crash with Bug688584.ps.  Source was that the NULL device through which DeviceN colors were getting mapped has no ret_devn_params proc.  Need to go back and check this since I would expect the device to obtain the default function.

Doubling the arbitrary 0x100000 alloc size limit; the alloc_size_is_ok() check is complied out and replaced with DO_NOTHING in release build so this has effect only on debug builds. Fixes Bug 691271 .
Fixed segfaults caused by setting and changing the page geometry parameters incorrectly (bug #691014).

Associate cached font instance with PDF font resource dictionary instead of font descriptor. The latter may be shared by font resource dictionaries with different encodings causing incorrect rendering. Bug 690714.
Simple fix to remove dict_default_pack from being a global bool. (Make it an enum instead).
Add missing cast to fapi_ft.c to quiet a warning. This was missed out of yesterdays commit of such fixes.
Bug 691260: make the FAPI and Freetype related warning messages debug only, and depend on -Zm for the FAPI warnings or -Z1 for the Freetype warnings. Also address compiler warnings in fapi_ft.c.
Made the CUPS Raster output device working in a multi-threaded mode, removing all global variables. Thanks to James Cloos for the patch. Fixes bug #691241.

Test for this really should include one for 'A'.  Otherwise, as mentioned in the code comment, debugging with 'A' will end up accessing a freed object when it displays the structure name.   This commit should not create any differences, but will fix crashes that may occur with using -ZA.

Clean up of memory management for the icc objects (the cache and the profile list) that are created and used in patterns that are drawn as clists.   Fixes errors associated with Bug689851.pdf in ICC branch.
Remember the allocator in the dynamically allocated scanner_state to ensure proper deallocation. Current allocation may be reset when a PS error occurs. Bug 691167.

Change so that when a graphic state is restored, the overprint compositor action only occurs if there is a change from the current overprint state.  This fixes a problem in one of the files associated with bug 691014.  In the particular file, overprint compositor actions were getting placed into a pattern clist.  The file in fact had no overprint settings.  Ran regression test, no differences expected.
Add ANSI/ASME Y14.1 A - F paper sizes named ANSI_A - ANSI_F for completeness. Bug 691217.
Introduced a real get_color_comp_index() method, to fix bug #690338 correctly.

Add -dNONATIVEFONTMAP option to disable the use of font map and corresponding fonts installed on underlying platform. This may be needed to ensure consistent rendering on the platforms with different fonts, for instance, during regression testing. Bug 691240.
Fix for crash with ps2write device.  If the base color space of an ICC profile is not defined, we will write out the device color space related to the profile.

Fix for Bug 691014.  Problem was caused by the fact that we had a soft mask present and a pattern with no transparency.  This means the PDF14 device is installed and more importantly that transparency state pushes and pops occur to keep the softmask in sync with the graphic state.  This particular files pattern is installed as a clist, which happens to not have any transparency.  The transparency state pushes and pops were getting placed into the pattern clist when the Q and q operations occurred in the pattern, which was causing problems since the pattern clist device had no pdf14 device installed to handle such commands.

Remove rudimentary code that maps out-of-range character codes to 0 causing dictionary overflow in some cases. Unlike earlier array, dictionary representation of 'cmap' table doesn't need this. Bug 691253, customer 780.

Fix so that color type 4 images are rendered properly.  Since mask comparisons are slow and mask image are not very common, this is put into the slower color image rendering code.  Fixes rendering issues in 468-01.PS

Fix of minor memory leak found by Ray.  maskbuf entry of transparency ctx object was not getting freed.  The large mask buffer, which is a member variable of maskbuf was getting freed but not this 12 byte structure.  No expected differences.
Fix so that if base color space of Separation space is PS CIE color space, then the proper ICC profile is use.  Fixes crash in 09-34.PS
Always load CFF font as a CIDFont when it is used as a descendant font of a composite font in PDF file. Bug 691253.
Fix so that in image interpolation of indexed images the icc profile of the base color space is used as the source profile.
Fix for issue in color image decode range.
Fix so that the shading code makes use of the ICC profile equivalent to the PS color space when we encounter a PS color space for our shading fill.
Fix bug where a glyph could be dropped when flushing the text accumulation buffer.
Trap errors that happen in the font reader, issue a warning, and proceed as if the font was not embedded. Bug 691242.
Fix so that spot colors that have a CIELAB alternate color space are properly concretized.

Fix for a problem in the rinkj driver for Epson Stylus Photo 2200. The code was accessing indexes 4,5,6 in plane_offsets[6] and hence was running off the end of the array. This was causing a warning at compile time but never caused a segv as it was merely corrupting the next entry in the structure which was reset to 0 shortly afterwards.
Move CPSI_mode from being a global to living in the libctx, as part of the efforts for bug 691207 (remove global variables).
A fix for a regression introduced by r11074 (bug 690094).
A fix for a regression introduced by r11074 (bug 690094).
A fix for 690094, "missing letters replaced by little vertical lines".
Fixed jbig2dec command getopt() parameter for -v option.
Fixed an indent. No influence on code.
A fix for 691081, 691206, and part of 690094.

This commit should fix most of the differences observed between the branch and the trunk for the PS CET tests that used CIE color spaces.  There were several errors in the icc branch that lead to the problems.  1) When the CIE color space is collapsed into a single table in an ICC profile the table indexing was incorrect.  2) When a color image is defined with respect to a CIE color space the range on the data was not being corrected properly.  3)  The finalize function which creates the vector cache from the scalar caches was not being invoked.  In addition, the cache for the profiles created from PS definitions is now temporarily disabled awaiting a solution for a unique ID from Alex. Code was put in place to detect PS definitions of CIELAB.  It needs a bit of work still however.  Finally,  better error handling was put in place for littleCMS and the code no longer will use the ICC profile contents to determine the size of the profile when reading the profile.
Updated ReadMe.txt to clarify that if the ufst libs are installed in a non standard place, then the arguments for debugging will need adjusting too.
Remove invalid_file_stream and invalid_file_entry global variables, as part of the effort for bug 691207 (remove global variables).
Backported and applied libtiff patches from libtiff bugs #2125 and #2125. These get rid of some of the global variables in libtiff (in particular rgb_refblackwhite and whitepoint in tif_aux.c).

Fix for bug 691244, reported/patch supplied by Norbert Janssen. In revision 11045, I'd moved some globals into the libctx, which is accessed via the gs_memory_t pointer. This has required certain functions to now take a gs_memory_t pointer as an extra arg. In this particular case the gs_memory_t pointer in question could be NULL. The fix is to use one obtained from gs_lib_ctx_get_non_gc_memory_t, a call to which happens conveniently to be on the previous line.

Tweaks to experimental xcode project to make debug ghoscript build work properly; pull gs build into line with others in that we redirect via the xcode.mak file to pass appropriate options into the builds.
Fix for experimental xcode project. xps was incorrectly trying to build svg.
A fix for 690094, "missing letters replaced by little vertical lines".
Update the clist band list compressor code to work without using global variables as part of the workd for bug 691207 (remove global variables).

Fix FreeType FAPI No bug for this (probably should be). Noticed while testing that using a TrueType to replace a missing CIDFont (ie entry in cidfmap) was rendering the wrong glyphs, and applying a vertical advance.

Move real_time_0 from being a static variable in zmisc.c to being an entry int libctx. Instead of initialisation happening in zmisc it now happens in gslibctx.c. Part of the effort for bug 691027 (remove global vars).
Fixed jbig2dec command getopt() parameter for -v option.  Not used by ghostscript itself but worth for standalone debugging.
Fixed an indent. No influence on code.
Remove BITTAG global variable by moving it into the libctx, as part of efforts towards bug 691207 (multithreaded gs). This has required several accessor functions to gain gs_memory_t * arguments.

Fix FreeType A prior update which re-initialised a glyph index to prevent old Metrics override values persisting after a glyph was discarded did not check the ft_inc_int member of the 'FF_face' structure before dereferncing it, leading to a potential crash if the font was not incrementally loaded.

Move global variables from gshtscr.c (screen_accurate_screens, screen_min_screen_levels, screen_use_wts) into libctx. This has meant updating the functions to read/write these to take a gs_memory_t pointer too. Part of the efforts for bug 691207.
A fix for 691081, 691206, and part of 690094.
Remove extraneous debug statement in revision 11050.

FAPI Enhancement We need a way in the initial release where we set FreeType as the default font scaler to switch it off and revert back to the Ghostscript internal font scaler, in case there are significant problems. Bug #691237

Fixed a recently introduced bug in the cluster that caused gs head to be used when compiling GhostPCL/GhostXPS even if a previous revision should have been used (as is the case when two or more commits occur while the cluster is busy).

Fix UFST and enhance FAPI Define a new API call for FAPI to allow font engines to replace a FontMatrix. This is to allow FreeType to replace the FotnMatrix with the identity as it makes the 2-step scaling performed by FreeType simpler.

Fix Bug #691180 This alters the described 'odd behaviour' of the font substitution code whereby fonts whose name does not contain either 'Serif' or 'Sans' are substituted with Helvetica, but those which contain 'Italic' are substituted with Times. Italic fonts are now treated the same as Oblique fonts, and substituted with Helvetica, unless the font is identified as a serif font.

Revision 10259 was incorrect, a page is ejected unconditionally if we exceed the bottom margin.  The test files designated fixed in revision 10259 were thought to print additional blank pages, in fact these pages should have been printed.  This fixes the original issue reported in 691215 but other similar problems have been raised in that bug that are still being investigated.

Fix TrueType interpreter Bug #691227 Another nasty hack for another broken TrueType font. In this case the font tries to execute a DeltaP instruction with an argument greater than the number of points in the glyph, which is an error.
Stop a function scope static from being static as nothing was gained by it, and this removes it from the list of global variables as part of the efforts for bug 691207 (multithreaded safety).
Change a static (that happens to be const) to be a static const to remove it from the global variable list for bug 691207.
Remove globals from gdevmgr.c as part of efforts on bug 691207 (multithreaded safety).
Remove the function scope static variables from gdevcdj.c as part of the efforts for bug 691207 (multithreaded safety). These only affect the ESC/P driver.
Make a table of 4 zeros be static const, and update the cast where they are used to also be static const. This should remove them from the global variable list in bug 691207.
Remove global variables in gdevcdj.c as part of the effort for bug 691207.

Fix for CIELAB rendering bug in Altona.Page3 test file.  Only remap function applies the correction for the CIELAB data (ie. L (0 to 100) and a b ( -128 to 128).  Data input to concretization data is 0 to 1 and only needs rescale for input to CMM.
Remove global variable lbp8_end from gdevlbp8.c - it was permanently NULL so removing it isn't hard, or risky. This will help towards the "No global variables" goal (bug 691207).
Fix for bug 691228, problems with wide strokes with round caps/joins with antialiasing enabled.
temporary reversion on commit 11028 until I track down a bug with CATX1593.pdf which has an invalid profile in the file.
Fix for bug introduced in merge of trunk into branch.
Fix so that the contents of the iccprofiles directory are put in the romfs.
Another attempt to fix Bug 691115. This corrects the clipping of a trapezoid to a rectangle within the shading code. My previous attempt had failed to allow for one case.

Fix FAPI and FreeType interface. The Metrics override was broken, the code to retrieve the /Metrics entries (1 to 4 values) stored the results in an array in a different order to the code which read the values back.
Fix FreeType. The revision 11012 fixed a problem with an invalid font but accidentally introduced a regression because an 'else' clause was missed.

Change so that link requests in the imaging code occur during initialization of the the image enumeration object.  This avoids having the code request a link with every line processed. Also addition of faster code for handling ICC profiles in interpolated images.  This avoids many of the conversions that were taking place within that code.  Fixes also for rendering bugs that existed when we processed CIELAB colors in graphic fills and when we did interpolation of CIELAB images.
adding comments about using globs not expandable by shell; bug 691229
adding /*.ttf glob ; since change r10994, mkromfs requires explicit wildcards to work. fixes bug 691229.
adding escaped quotes around $0 in "basename $0" ; 2nd part of bug 691219
adding escaped quotes around $0 in "dirname $0" ; bug 691219
adding reference to msmin04, msgoth04 and ngulim,nbantang; fixes the remaining issues in bug 689456
Fix line endings. The previous commit (11012) accidentally used DOS line endings which made it appear every line in the file was different.

Fix FreeType When using bitmaps from a TrueType/Type42 font FreeType uses a heuristic approach to synthesize vertical metrics for the glyphs, including a horizontal advance. As in the past, this works well as long as the client knows whether the advance direction is horizontal or vertical and uses the correct advance.
Fix FreeType The test file objlune_font2_mine.ps contains a Type 1 font which has a technically  invalid glyph. The glyph executes a 'lineto' class operation before a 'moveto' class operation.
Fix the FAPI implementation of finding the appropriate bytes for a given character code from an array of strings representing a CMap.
'Fix' FAPI with FreeType.
Fix a bug in the FreeType scan conversion.

Fix bug 691132 by ensuring that whenever we set a line width, we set it to the absolute value of the line width. This seems consistent with PDF, and cures the clipping problem in PCL referred to by the bug.
Drop 'loca' entries that point beyond 'glyf' table during re-spliting sfnts glyfs strings. Bug 691221.

Fix so that CIELAB images are rendered properly.  They do not need to go through the decode procedure but can be pushed through the CMM directly.  Note that gxiscale.c could use some optimization for the icc flow to avoid multiple conversions.  Basically need to do similar change that was done to gxicolor.c to avoid conversions between float, frac, color_value....
White space clean up before I fix a couple bugs in this.
Fix compilation error in pngs2html.pl (forgot to define variable).
Fix for crash with IA3Z4663.pdf pbmraw.300  Caused by pdf14 device information not getting updated during a softmask push.
Fix for accidental local variable declaration.  Was causing error in Bug688584.ps

Fixes GC errors with PS files that have DEF/G tables.  Since the color spaces for these objects are currently cached, the tables have to be stored in stable memory.  This will change when I fix the cache to only store the profiles and not the color spaces.  This should fix several errors.

Fix for case when we have a transfer function and no halftoning.  I forgot to make sure that the color value is encoded into the device value in this case.  Fix for crash with pbmraw -r300  Bug688728a.pdf
Fix so that gx_device_must_halftone check will work when the pdf14 device changes the current device color_info.  Fixes crash of SingleMask.pdf with pgm device.
Fix for bug 691115.
Fix for missing header includes in shading code as well as missing releases of icc links.
Fix for unsigned short casting during subtraction

Correct problem with bmpcmp whereby certain sizes of changed areas within images could cause overlapping output bitmaps. This causes problems with the output of bitmaps now due to the new 'in-place' generation of the diff bitmap. Fixed by choosing sizes more smartly.
CUPS Raster output device: Error out correctly with the return_error() macro and not with "gs_exit(); exit()", force banding mode as there are files which do not render otherwise (Bug #691170).
Code clean-ups in the "cups" output device to fix the segfaults in bug #691170 and bug #691014 (but does not fix the bugs yet).
Fixed maxdiffs argument in bmpcmp.c (was acting as maxpage).
Fixed a couple of compiler warnings in bmpcmp.c

Creation of ps color spaces in stable memory since they are currently cached and should not be freed with a gstate restore.  This will change when I do a fix to only cache the profile and not the color space, but for now this fix avoids the seg faults that have cropped up in the PS test files that have PS color spaces.
Fix for seg faults caused by trying to set the background content which did not account for the fact that all the softmasks are now rendered into a gray buffer.

Fixes for issues with soft mask in icc branch.  This approach makes the pdf14 device use a gray color space when the soft mask is pushed.  Internal groups to the mask can still be blended in other spaces, but with this approach we end up avoiding a final conversion to the gray mask at the end.  Comparison with AR appears to be very close.
Addition of debug code for icc conversions.

Fix so that the comp_shift and comp_bits are properly updated when the PDF14 device changes to a different color space.  This was causing a problem when we encountered shadings that included transparency.
Write TIFF directories before the page data.  This might help bug #691172 and probably some other non-conforming TIFF readers.

Don't throw an error when a filter returns 0 bytes and a normal return code. This often happens with eexecDecode filter, which has to return the control to the interpreter after every space character since Adobe no longer adds zeros at the end of the encoded block. Document new return code 2 used by eexecDecode filter. Bug 690909.
Partial fix for bug #691172: The tiff resolution tags are floating point values and need to be passed as such to TIFFSetField.

Applied Tim Waugh's patch from bug #691171: A NULL check for the argument of TIFFCleanup was missing, which caused a segfault when opening the output device failed for any of the devices in gdevtfax.c.
Fixes PCL XL FTS 3.0 T333.BIN panel 01.  The rectangles were not scaled correctly because the unit conversion table was accessed improperly, the row and column were transposed.
Fix for wrong order in creation of clut during sampling.  We now get reasonable results with the PS color spaces.
Removal of a debug statement.

Fixes so that CIE based colors will be properly scaled prior to getting a link applied to them.  The ICC profile is created such that the range of inputs must be between 0 and 1.  Also, fixes for the lack of completion on the Decode DEF(G) cache, which is needed in creating the Profile as well as having the profile be generated by a pure CLUT in cases when we cannot map the PS CIE Color objects easily into an ICC type.
Apply a change submitted to FT and accepted - see FT bug #27442

Fixes in ICC profile creation from PS color types.  This fixes issues with CIEBased A Color spaces which AR always renders to achromatic output even when according the PS definition it would not be.  Basically the final matrix in the ICC profile has columns which consist of weighted versions of the D50 illumination.  Next problem to fix is that the curves are sampled by the PS interpreter over the defined range as opposed to a 0 to 1 range as is assumed in the conversion to ICC code.  There may need to be some internal scaling to correct for this.  Also, there is a bug lurking in the DEF/G table reading that I need to track down.  Finally the chad tag is added to the profile for illumination white point differences.  CIECAM02 is used to generate this matrix.

Fix bug in bmpcmp.c: When reading images from multi-image sets, we stop the comparison process as soon as we fail to find any differences in the current image. With this fix we correctly keep searching to the end.

Fix for SEGV with the psdcmyk device on 258-01.ps. This was a fundamental memory problem with any device that used the compressed_color_list functions in gdevdevn.c since a 'restore' could free structures which were still needed by the device. Use stable_memory to avoid this. Bug 691150.

Norbert Janssen's improvements for converting HP's Master Symbol List (MSL) to unicode and back.  Several symbols were incorrect in the previous code, an inverted table is now used and binary search replaces linear search.  Fixes bug #691158.
Fix pngs2html.pl to number images according to both directory and image number (needed now as images restart from 0 within each directory). This really should fix the bmpcmp html output.
More fixes for the bmpcmp html page generations javascript.
Misplaced bracket in the javascript meant that only the first images would swap on mouseover properly. Fixed here.
Fix javascript problems in bmpcmp output page generation. What sort of stupid broken language depends on whitespace?

Fixes on CUPS Raster output device: - Fixed memory reallocation on bitmap size change. Reallocation is not only   needed when dimendions and margins change, but also when the color depth   changes. Fixes bugs #691029 and #691108. - Fixed arrayoption() macro in cups_put_params() function. Array values did   not get actually set in cups.header data structure. Bug only showed via   a compiler warning. - Silenced compiler warning by presetting c0..c3 in cups_map_cmyk() to zero.
Attempted fix for bmpcmp output javascript problems with the coordinate tracking.
Fix typos in the javascript code for pngs2html.pl and bmps2html.pl; this should get at least some of it working, but the coord stuff still baffles me.
Fixed longstanding bug fuzzy.c that caused pbm files to be misread.
updating documentation to mention how to run mkcidfm.ps manually; bug 688437
convert font file name to lowser case before matching; make it possible for upper case ARIALUNI.TTF to match; bug 688437
updating windows CJK font substitution list for more commonly found MS CJK fonts; bug 688437
revert to r8185 version of the korean example - it was removed in r8190 and a corrupted version r9325 was subsequently checked in; found during fixing bug 688437 (incompete font substitution list)

Ongoing bug fixes for #690448. The FreeType code will synthesize vertical metrics for TrueType (Type 42) fonts which do not contain a vmtx table. This includes the vertical advance, which will be returned to the FAPI code, and used even if there were originally no vertical metrics and the font should not have any vertical advance.
Minor changes due to bugzilla update.
Fix FreeType Ongoing fixes for bug #690448. In this case FreeType generates vertical metrics for TrueType (in our case Type 42) fonts which lack vhea/vmtx tables, which is generally the case.
Fix pbm reading and png writing in bmpcmp.c.
fix small bug introduced in r10859 where the operator pos in the output comment becomes off by 1
print Unknown enumeration if enumeration is not found, to avoid side effect of //; affect bug 690083 and 691146
allow the look-up and interpretation of uint32 attribute values in addition to byte attribute values; part of fix to 690083
process the VUDataLength optional payload of the VendorUnique operator; part of fix to 690083
another VU attr value used by the CLJ35003550/3600 VendorUnique operator; part of fix to bug 690083

Two cosmetic/usability change as part of the patch submitted for bug 690083: Treat keyboard interrupt (user pressing control-C) and broken pipe (piping output to pager program like GNU less or more and user choosing to quit the pager program) as normal exit. Both are user actions to interrupt the program - there is no need to print backtrace due to user action.
more VU attribute tags - part of fix for 690083
Fix so that image color render with ICC profiles properly applies the transfer curve and/or the halftoning for the device.
raise error instead of continuing to creating broken PXL stream, when the input is wrong; part of fix to bug 691146
informative message when assembly fails; another issue uncovered in trying to fix 691146
adding a few VendorUnique attribute numbers; 2nd part of fixing 691146
First part of fixing 691146: script should abort with suitable informative message when encountering unknown tags instead of silently emitting wrong result.
Fix stupid memory overwrite bug on bmp load.
bmpcmp.c tweaks: Add (largely untested) code to allow "plain" (ascii) ppm, pgm, pbm files. Also fix some compile warnings on 64bit platforms. Now compiles cleanly with -Wall.
More fixes to gs_2_colors.

Fix in lcms that should be kicked up to Marti.  He is doing a new release of lcms soon, which does a different approach to this problem so it may not be relevant.  The issue is that he uses a binary search algorithm to invert a nonlinear 1-D LUT.  As he approaches the black point, he may hit a value of zero before getting to zero.  This ends up causing black (0) to be mapped to something close to black (e.g. rgb = [3,3,3]).  I am fixing this here, since it is the source of a lot of regressions from the trunk.
Attempt to fix the javascript in the created files. The change to use numeric filenames padded to 5 chars had broken the javascript. This might fix it.

Fix in pdfwrite so that we do not add in the graphic state color space for the group color if there was not a group color specified in the original document.  In this case, the parent group is inherited from the previous group or the device color space per the PDF spec.  This is likely a bug in the trunk but it was the source of a crash in the icc branch when rendering a pdfwrite created file that had placed a separation color space as the group color space.  This is not allowed in the pdf specification.  In the original source document, the color space was not specified.

Integrate Michael Vrhel's changes.  Moves the initialization of the default icc color spaces immediately after the graphics state constructor for pcl, pxl and xps.  Also fixes a crash in the test T427.bin where the PXL interpreter creates a new PCL instance and associated graphics state.  The icc code was not properly initialized for this particular case.

Fixes bug #691154 and the regressions associated with revision 10823. Unfortunately, performance-wise, the wtsimdi device must always use a contone buffer until we've had a chance to see which raster operations can be eliminated correctly.

Remaining fix related to keeping PDF write from writing out the default profiles that were forced upon DeviceGray, DeviceRGB, and DeviceCMYK.  This fix cleans up spurious color space settings that were occurring. Now pdfwrite for the icc branch should be identical to the trunk in all cases except for when there were PS CIE color spaces present in a PS source document.
First half of patch from John Wehle for bug 691149 - vac C compiler on AIX 5.2 does not like function with a void prototype returning a void function e.g.

Fixes part of 691149 - void function returning value, thanks to John Wehle for the fix.  Also, there were several compiler warnings in this file related to the casting of the gs memory type pointer which have been cleaned up as well.
Following PDF reference, version 1.7, section 10.10, crop /TrimBox and /CropBox by the /MediaBox. Bug 691145.

Fixes bug #691147 customer 861, the optimization to strength reduce the raster operation here is wrong, it is premised on the assumption the colors are opaque.  If either texture or source is transparent the strength reduction which effectively ignores the source or pattern is wrong and it will subsequently cause opaque painting.  We've simply removed the optimization instead of conditionalizing on opaque cases, because tests indicate the reduction not that significant.  The example in the bug report was reduced from a file in the XL ATS 305 test suite.  The following customer reported bugs in that test suite are fixed by this change:
Upgrade Adobe Glyph List to v. 2.0. AGL is used for character mapping in non-symbolic TrueType fonts in PDF files. Bug 691116.
Add missing newline in a TTF debug message.
Fix errors that crept in during the merge. New calls to stroke weren't being wrapped by .swapcolors calls in the PDF interpreter postscript code.
Fix so that high level devices do not write out the default profiles that were forced upon DeviceGray, DeviceRGB, and DeviceCMYK.  We may want to have this as an option.
Fixes to our makefile for the third-party freetype library.

Split of image_render_color into two rendering procs.  One is called image_render_color_icc, which will be the common case.  This uses the ICC work flow on buffers (rows) of data.  The other one is called image_render_color_DeviceN, and is for DeviceN images for which we do not have ICC profiles associated.  In this case, we have to do the remaps in a slow manner, (looking for changes in values along the rows) since we may need to go through the alternate tint transform depending upon the output device.  Fixes crashes with 09-34.PS
add quotes around the expansion of DEVSTUDIO variable when it's used for the recursive nmake call for debug targets - in case it has white space in it.

Fix for bug 691103.  The pdfwrite device now considers FDArray fonts' FontMatrix and writes correct W/W2/DW/DW2 widths for CIDFont with unusual FontMatrix.  This also fixes a problem gs_font::orig_FontMatrix not being initialized for CIDFont. Bug687832.pdf and Bug690834.ps will show differences which are improvements.
Fix to allocate icc link cache for clist device when pattern is a clist.
Fixes for various compiler warnings.
Remove some unused icclib code and fix xpstop and the makefiles so that we can compile against the icc_work branch.
ensure the DEVSTUDIO value is propagated when we recursively nmake for the debug targets.

Fix, ignore a class of broken TrueType font. Bug #691121 "gs stops in interpreting tt instructions". The font executes an MDRP instruction with point number 28, the glyph only contains 28 points numbered 0 to 27 so the interpreter (correctly) flags an error.
Fix for implicit function declaration due to missing include.  This was causing a pointer to be cast to an int type which caused problems on 64bit builds.
Fixes bug 690967, a diagnostic problem with dumping memory the debug -ZA option.  See the comment in the code for details, the change has no effect on production builds.

Fix obviously wrong code in .fixsethalftonescreen procedure that is used by the setscreen (and setcolorscreen) procedure and caused a PS error if the third 'proc' argument to setscreen is a read-only Halftone type 1 dictionary. Thanks to Jonathan Dagresta for the patch. Bug 691130, customer 1130.
Simplify sed script that extracts libTiff version number for compatibility with AIX sed. Include our portable header before tiff.h to make sure that all stdint types are found. Bug 691102.

Fix (pdfwrite) Bug #691133. If producing PDF/A output. and a DOCINFO pdfmark string was UTF_16BE encoded *and* contained a numeric character, then decode_escape incorrectly consumed any numeric characters following the first octal byte of the UTF16 code.
Update pdf2dsc.ps to match the changes in pdf_main.ps introduced by the rev. 10341. Thanks to William Bader for the patch. Bug 691124.
Include stat_.h before estack.h, which defines esp macro. Prevent a spurious macro substitution in Cygwin version of signal.h. Bug 691123, customers 661.

Fix so that devc in gximono inherits the type from the image enumerator device color so that it uses the proper proc during gx_color_load_select.  This occurs when there are ready made bit maps for the device color.

Fix for bug introduced with image clues removal.  image_render_mono was writing over the icolor1 entry in penum.  Also added equivalent function to make it easier to debug the uber-macro present in this code.
Fix so that concretization of an ICC color from a source color space to the same destination profile will not be applied.

Fix so that if a image with a DeviceRGB or DeviceCMYK etc is to be written as a high level image into the clist and it has ICC profile information it will be written into the clist as an ICC color space and the ICC data will be added to the clist's ICC table if it is not already in there.  Thanks to Ray for helping with this.
Fix for crash introduced with previous commit for the case when we are rendering a mask image.

Fix for bug that was introduced with the removal of the image clues.  We will want to revisit this later since having a cache for the indexed case makes sense.   For now, this should give use proper rendering with indexed images.
Fix of various CIEDEF(G) bugs that were in the first commit of the code.  Now we are making it through some of the PS CET DEF(G) test files!
Add missing dereferencing of indirect objects in /Mask array. Bug 691112, customers 870.

Absurd as it may seem, all device independent color space requests simply install the sRGB space on recent HP printers (ie Color Laserjet 4600).  Add a configuration option to follow the printers and not the specificiation.  "Fixes" pcl 5c fts panels: 800-804, 810, 871, and 978.
Fix colour processing. It was possible for nested ICCBased colour spaces (ie an ICCBased space whose Alternate is another ICCBased space) to cause segmentation faults.
Fix for incorrect calculation of buffer end with image render color.  Problem only occurred with separation devices.
Fix for error in getting CIEDEF and CIEDEFG table.
Fix so that we avoid problem of icc color spaces having an alternate color space that is also ICC based.
Fix (pdfwrite) bug #691104 "pdfwrite emits garbage in the XMP metadata when DOCINFO pdfmarks contain UTF-16BE text strings"
Fix (pdfwrite) bug #691101 (part 2 of 2)
Fix (pdfwrite) bug #691101 (part 1 of 2)

Addition of code to fix PS seg faults.  These were occurring when links were requested during the image color render code and the color space was CIE based and the ICC profile had not yet been created.
Fix for missing rc_decrement of icc profiles when pop of soft mask or transparency group occurs.
Fix so that most of PS files should now run.  There are some efficiency fixes that will need to be done here.
Undo debug define that was mistakenly checked in and also some minor pointer checking.
Remove the list of open bugs.
Fix a manpage grammar error.
Remove the "Known Problems" section from win32/ReadMe.txt as Hin-Tak fixed the parallel build bug (691061).
Set rc.exe location according to MSSDK variable - fix build problem with windows 7 SDK - bug 691062.

Re-implement optional content support to avoid dependence on proper nesting of optional content and q..Q blocks. Check for the visibility flag and skip most graphic operations when needed. Skip test rendering operations by installing nullpage device to minimize changes in a rather complicated code. Bug 691076, customers 531, 850.

Fixes bug #691098, a regression knowingly introduced with the change to allow the pcl urwfonts to contain a glyph slot for the space character (see revision 10645).  We had intended to merge the pcl font branch to address this problem, it only supports unicode internal font objects, but due to release proximity we settle for a simpler workaround: exclude Master Symbol List (MSL) and symbol encoded fonts when rendering the unicode space character undefined.
Fix Windows UninstallString registry entry to use " " around the path and uninistgs.exe so that (the usual) spaces in the path don't cause problems. Thanks to Stefan Kanthak for pointing this out.
Fix to create only allowable ICC types when using the lutAtoB type.  See Page 47 of ICC spec.  This is the primary ICC type we will be using for almost all the PS CIE conversions.
Patch font resource category for CET testing to always return the font memory usage as unknown (-1) to avoid differences between hosts. Bug 691057.

Add a check whether the current layer is visible to Do operator. This is a first step to replace implementation that relies on installation of an non-rendering output device (nullpage) with an implementation that uses direct checks. Bug 691059.

Fix 'undefined' error in 29-07C.PS CET test file that was happening because .selectmedia procedure in gs_setpd.ps was building an error information dictionary ('<failed>' in its comment) with many keys those doesn't exist in <request> dictionary, such as /LeadinEdge or /InsertSheet.  This draws the policy 0 procedure (line 544) to 'get' non-existant keys from <merged> dictionary. Thanks to Masaki Ushizaka for the patch. Bug 691065.
Preserve /F and /BS attributes of /Link annotation during PDF to PDF conversion. Thanks to Ken for the patch. Bug 691092, customer 1.
Fixed missing codes on pcl 5c fts panel 1790.  Codes are always printable in transparent data mode.

Fix so that CIE matrices are transposed to be more easily copied into icc format.  CIEABC forms giving close to proper color.  Final difference is caused by PS D65 versus ICC D50 reference illumination.  I will fix that tomorrow.

Fix of a number of bugs related to converting CIEABC to ICC type.  Getting close.  Valid profiles are created, ICC color space is installed in place of CIEABC color space.  Converted color are not quite right though.  Will debug this more tomorrow.
Fixed typo in clusterpush.pl.

The UFST line printer font's character complement was still set to HP Master Symbol List (MSL) instead of Unicode.  We recently modified all internal objects to use Unicode, this fix should have been made with the change to Unicode.  Also undefined characters were detected in the UFST line printer when converting from MSL to Unicode.  This should be looked at, but, is not known to be associated with a visual difference.
Fixes 2 math symbol set codes, both are incorrectly documented in the specification.
Fix free of incorrect pointer in bmpcmp. Also tweak pnm reading so that no seeks are used, so we can use the
Fix (FAPI)

Fix for memory leak reported in bug 690754.  The memory leak occurred when processing xps transparency files.  The softmask group buffer was not being deallocated properly.  We now properly deallocate an old soft mask buffer that will no longer be used when new one is coming in to replace it.  There should not be any rendering differences with this commit.
Fix problems with htmldiff.pl introduced when introducing iframes mode. (Javascript wasn't working, image source was incorrect).
Fix for dyslexic writing of CMYK in user params.
generate private copy of plver.h per language to allow parallel build, and remove reference to it in vcproj ; fixes bug 691061
cups output device: Reallocate memory for raster data only if the size of the bitmap has changed, to avoid data getting messed up by unneeded reallocation. This should finally fix bug #691029.
Fix (pswrite)
Fix some leaks in XPS. Make sure we call close_job at the end of an XPS file and free the zip_table and xps fonts at dnit time.
adding the tiff directory to the list of files to zip up during a windows build. Thanks Gennadiy Tsarenkov or the report and patch. Fixes bug 691069
Fixed handling of back sides when duplex printing via the CUPS Raster output device. With PostScript as input format the y-axis of the back sides was often flipped (bug #691029).
This commit is a fix for bug 691021 which had quantized (unsmooth) shading artifacts when transparency was present.

Attempt to fix bug 691030, regression with thin lines. This regression was caused by revision 10391, where I pulled the rectangle special cases into line with the more general case. Sadly, the more general case appears to be wrong in the way it rounds lines lying on integer values.
Improve the debug tracing for downloaded symbol sets and font selection.
Fix (FreeType)

Fix (FAPI - FreeType). The current FAPI implementation for FreeType ignores any vertical advance defined in a glyph. This causes type 1 glyphs defined with an sbw (not hsbw) which have a vertical advance as well as, or instead of, a horizontal advance to not advance the current point correctly.
Fix (FAPI). The code to 'serialise' a CFF font (that is to convert the internal GS representation back to a stream resembling a disk font) was seriously broken when writing a local Subrs DICT.
Fix the syntax error accidentally committed in revision 10608 which prevented Ghostscript from building.
Fix (pdfwrite) Bug #691058 "Incorrect embedding of CIDToGIDMap for CIDFontType 2".
Fix two warnings introduced in rev. 10603.  Signed/unsigned incompatibility.
Fix overallocation in bmpcmp.c that was causing out of memory errors.

Don't use operator 'execute' because it resets the /command attribute in $error dictionary. Use '.execute pop' instead. Keep 'execute' as an operator for backward compatibility. Thanks to dakka.akka@gmail.com for analysis of the bug. Bug 691050.
Fix a Coverity warning. We were potentially passing a NULL pointer to a routine which would unconditionally dereference it. Fixed by taking no action if the pointer is NULL.
Fix a previous bug fix in FreeType. Removing an illegal operation check accidentally removed the reset of the flex flag, which led to contours being ignored. Patch sent upstream to the FT team.
Add documentation on the limitations of -sstdout=_____ where users expected _all_ stdout I/O to be redirected, not just PS writing to stdout. Bug 691037.
ReadMe.txt file describing how to use the solution. In particular it describes how to set up typical debugger invocations as these cannot be checked in by default.
Fix typo in nmake invocation in selection file - thanks to Ken for spotting this.

Changes to the MSVC makefiles to prepare for the prototype vs2005 solution file. Firstly, we introduce an SBR symbol; if this is set when invoking the makefile, we add a new flag to the C compiler (held in SBRFLAGS) to cause the generation of the browse data for each source file. Next, we introduce a new bsc build target to combine those .sbr files into appropriate .bsc ones. The final change is enable debug builds to put their builds into debugobj rather than obj directories.

Fix bug #691043 "Vulnerability report : Ghostscript gs_type2_interpret null ptr dereference (Segmentation Fault)". The problem appears to be caused by a corrupt compressed data stream which results in garbage font data being sent to the type 2 and under some conditions the type 1, font interpreters.
See the revision log for 10564 (deterministic printing of font page bug #691024), this change is the associated modification needed for the ufst font scaler.

FreeType interface fix. When using the incremental interface to FreeType (which in fact we always use), Ghostscript is responsible for locating and passing the glyph description data to FreeType, and so we don't bother to track certain kinds of data in the FreeType structure.
Fix error recovery code that messed up operand stack trying to break out of post table processing when the offset to the glyph name is beyond the table length. Bug 690837.

Implement symbolic glyph mapping as described in PDF 1.7. Use it for TrueType fonts with symbolic flag set or having no encoding entry. The flag -dIgnoreTTEncoding is removed because symbolic fonts always do this now and non-symbolic fonts should never ignore encoding. Bug 691035, customer 220.

Fix of clist read back code for when color space is set for high level images.  An entry for the ICC hashcode is stored in even when an non-icc color space is used.  This was causing the clist reader to run off into the woods.

Changes in littleCMS.  One is to ensure that errors do not kill the whole application.  The other is a change that I will send up stream to Marti.  He has a limit of 100 for the clut entries.  This is reasonable except for the case when the profile source space is Gray.  We have run into tables with 255 entries in the regression tests (Bug690495.pdf) .
Fix of typo for test on calrgb gamma value.
Remove C++ comments (//) and commented out code because this is not compatible with old compilers and breaks our coding standard. Comments were introduced by rev. 9664 and 9778. Bug 691032.
Add a check whether the entry in post table of TrueType font crosses the end of the table. Fill the rest of the table with /.notdef and continue. Bug 691031.
Use safer function vsnprintf() instead of vsprintf() for error reporting. Truncate long messages, issue a warning, and continue. Bug 690829.

Remove stage 2 from seticcspace() and a corresponding PS procedure because it's no longer needed. Since rev. 10563 the string data source is converted to reusable stream without a call-out. Bug 690828.

Fixes bug 691024, the font list is now printed deterministically. Sundry refactoring and cleanup related to printing the font list and loading fonts.  Adds a new scheme for aliasing fonts, as they are loaded, allowing the removal of the font WingSub.ttf.
Don't use long and buggy call-out process to convert a string to a reusable stream. Do it in 3 lines of C code. Bug 690828.
Assume /FirstChar is 0 and /LastChar is 255 when they are not defined, and issue a warning. Bug 691022.
Consider fonts without font stream and with wrong or missing /Subtype attribute as Type 1 fonts. Bug 691023.
Fix a compile error on UN*X platforms introduced by the previous commit (rev. 10558).
Fix a Coverity warning about checking after dereferencing. In this case dereferencing means &((foo *)0)->bar, which is harmless.
Move checking gstate for 0 immediately after allocation. Fix a Coverity warning about checking after dereferencing.
Don't dereference a pointer before checking it for NULL. Fix a Coverity warning about checking after dereferencing.
Fix a case where a pointer is first dereferenced and then checked for 0.
Clear Coverity warnings about unreachable code. Fix incorrect error processing in some contributed drivers. Also remove a spurious *.orig file.

Fix detection for nearing/passing command list buffer limit to allow for the condition when the pointer is past the limit (which is NOT the end of the buffer, but is only a warning). Change this variable name to 'warn_limit' to avoid confusion with the 'limit' used in most other buffer management areas, such as streams. Bug 691016.
Merge of trunk into branch through rev 10541 to capture fix for MSVC break of tiflib.

Fix (pdfwrite) Bug #691009 "Regression: 14-01.PS fails with pdfwrite". revision 10297, a fix for pdfwrite involving composite fonts with type 3 descendants, did not check a return value. This could cause a segment fault later, if a type 0 font was invalid.
Fix a Coverity warning: comparing array against NULL is not useful.
Fix a Coverity warning about an expression with undefined order of evaluation.
Fix a Coverity warning about an expression with undefined order of evaluation.
Fix Coverity warnings about unchecked return code.
Fixes of mistakes made in previous commit with respect to initializing the icc manager default values.
Fix Coverity warnings about unchecked return code.

Fix an array overrun in zsethalftone5() caused by an unchecked error code when the number of colorants exceeds the current implementation limit; throw a /limitcheck error instead. Also fix an unrelated Coverity warning about unchecked return value from dict_int_param(). Bug 691001.
Update some obsolete gs_throw() calls. Bug 691010.
Add a missing header to ensure delaration and definition match for mem_mono_strip_copy_rop(). Fixes a warning in the gcc build.
The lowercase icelandic eth in pcl symbol set 19U was not mapped correctly, fixes bug 690941.  Thanks to Masaki for identifying the problem.

Emulate HP TrueType parser bug which ignores the metrics in component glyphs, fixes bug 690888.  We rewrite the truetype data after it is downloaded updating the component flag field of the component glyph description disabling the bit to use metrics from the component (see the TrueType Reference Manual) .  No expected differences.
Fix to have ICC serialize call return something reasonable.  This procedure is used by PDF write to determine if a resource is already present.
Fix for bug 690620. Original patch from HenryS. This adjusts rectangular fills to more closely match that used by Acrobat v8.
Fix for error made in image_render_mono with the removal of the image clues.
Fix for incorrect bbox test in bmpcmp.
Broken fix for incorrect bbox test in bmpcmp; please ignore this revision and use 10507 instead.
Increase the limit on the number of color components to 12. A file with 9 components has been found in the wild, add 3 more for a small reserve. Bug 691002.
Fix to avoid access violations when we have patterns with transparency.

Clean up of reference counting of ICC profiles in transparency code as well as proper reassignment of the device profile for the PDF14 device based upon the transparency group color space.  This fixes a GC problem.
Fix for proper handling of indexed images in the clist when the base space is ICC based.
Fix a botched use of references where a pointer to a reference in a PostScript VM was used as a temporary variable. Bug 690828.
Fix (FAPI) : Silence a compiler warning

Accept ASCII85 stream that ends with bare '~' in PDF files for compatibility with Acrobat Reader. Add /PDFRules ASCII85Decode filter parameter to select between PS and PDF logic. Bug 690976, customer 870.
Fix RasterOp texture rendering from uninitialized memory (past end of buffer) when the texture was 'expanded' and the unexpanded texture had repitions in y. Bug 690299.
Fix hang condition due to pointer comparison, bug 690638.
Fix incorrect calculation of the operand stack base (pdfemptycount) in PDF interpreter, which caused incorrect processing of scn operator. Bug 690977.

Fix to check if output profile is in clist device when a link is requested.  This can occur when we are dealing with transparency groups since the output profile can be dynamic and stored in the clist.
Fix to properly step through ICC profiles in clist icc_table when looking for a hash code match.
Fix to free icc_table when the clist reader device is shut down.
Fix for bug in freeing of link cache.
Fix for double decrement of ICC profile reference count when PDF14 put image occurs.
Fix (pdfwrite) : regressions with revision 10474

Fix to clip negative XYZ values when mapping CalRGB into a Display type ICC profile.  Add a warning message.  It is possible that I need to change how I handle CalRGB due to the fact that we can have negative values in the Matrix.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Unchecked return value causing indeterminisms
Fix to set device color procs during image color render.  These were previously set when the clues were initialized.  This caused an access violation when we had a skewed image.
Fix for errors in rinkj device.
Fix (FAPI) : Handle Type 42 fonts with CharStrings dictionaries with real PS glyphs
Fix (FreeType) : Don't throw error on a particular class of invalid font
Fix a Coverity warning. Don't assign a value to a variable if it isn't used.
Fix Coverity warnings caused by a recurring error in opvp driver where 'if (i > sizeof(foo)/sizeof(*foo)) ...' was used to prevent out-of-bounds access to foo[i] .
Fix a Coverity warning. Avoid a FILE pointer leak in an unlikely case when gs_main_init2() fails.
Fix (FAPI) : Ignore some TrueType faults
Fix a Coverity warning. Add missing assignment to 'code' variable. The later use of 'code' in the conditional expression indicates that this was the author's intention.
Fix a Coverity warning. Add missing assignment to 'code' variable. The later use of 'code' in the conditional expression indicates that this was the author's intention.
Fix a Coverity warning. Check the return code from sget_variable_uint() in image4 serialization.
Fix a Coverity warning and improve readability. Don't define a local variable with the same name as a function argument.
Fix a Coverity warning and improve portability. Don't access sequential members of a structure as an array.
Fix a Coverity warning. Change the logic in obj_cvs() to handle all possible combinations and avoid a potential SEGV.
Fix a Coverity warning and a potential SEGV caused by a wrong pointer checked for NULL after memory allocation.
Fix a Coverity warning. Remove dead and commented out code that didn't change since April 2000, rev 324.
Fix (FAPI) : empty glyphs causing problems after revision 10434
Fix (FAPI) : TT tables > 64Kb not read properly.
Fix a Coverity warning by removing redindant checks. The 'pie' pointer cannot be null here because it is dereferenced earlier.
Add argument list and 'minst' address to -Z: debugging report to assist in tracking cluster test logs (to see which, if any, jobs start but don't finish).
Include GCFLAGS in GLLCMSCC. Fixes a compile error on 64 bit MacOS X.
Fix GC pointer count for graphic state.  Forgot to increment when profile cache member was added.
Fix (FAPI): error in revision 10433
Fix (FAPI) : FAPI code not expecting unsorted LOCA/GLYF tables

Fix vertical positioning of interpolated images that caused images to be moved down, possibly past the end of the band. An extra multiplication by -1 was the culprit. Bug 690885, customers 531 and 850.
Fix dropouts seen with thin lines by using the method described in bug 687721, namely, that of extending the trapezoids filled by a small triangular region at each end.
Fix a Coverity warning and a potential array overrun in obj_cvp().
Fixed localcluster/clusterpush.pl to work with casper3.
Check if a resource dictionary was loaded before dereferencing to set the base URI. Fixes a segfault for bug 690967.
Fix so that code return of setting device profile does not interfere with code return to clear page during zsetdevice.
Fix a Coverity warning about unchecked negative return and a possible access to an array at a negative position.

Fix for bug 690218.   If the SeparationOrder was specified, then we should only allocate buffer space for those colorants.  See devn_put_params for details on this.  Right now, the PDF14 device will always include CMYK.  A future optimization is to be able to NOT have those included in the bufferallocations if we don't specify them.  In that case it would then be possible to output 8 separations at a time without using compressed color.  Note that if SeparationOrder is not specified, the number of colorants used in the pdf14 device buffer allocations is equal to the number of colorants in the document up to a maximum of 64.
Fix for segfault when image 'clues' are accessed during a GC after a restore has erased (set to zero) the contents. Bug 690915.
Remove an unnecessary diagnostic debug printf which should not have been checked in.  No expected differences.
debug_dump_allocator() is only defined in DEBUG mode.

Add a memory leak debugging option -l to be used by pcl, xps, etc.. The output can be quite verbose it is best searched by looking for the string "type=".  Note the output should be used in concert with -ZA to find the client name.  This output only has access to the stype name, the client name can be found by searching back for the memory address in the -ZA output.

Modified to not enumerate dictionary keys, this is incorrect as the key can be dynamically or statically allocated based on size.  The only use of enumeration for the non gc languages is for debugging memory so there are no expected differences.
Fix (FAPI): Can't handle FontBBox as 't_mixedarray'
fix typo introduced in r5556
avoid setting join to invalid value; issue found in bug 690585
Fix to correct mask offsets (bit order) for big_endian as well as sharing this array for the various devices. Bug 690954.
Fix (FAPI) : segmentation violation with Multiple Master fonts
Fix dereference of NULL when target device passed to gx_forward_put_params was NULL. This occurred with the standalone 'bbox' device.

Fix for Device N capable device segfaults (psdcmyk, tiffsep, tiffsep1, ...) that use the gdevdevn.c parameter handling. A 'restore' could free up separation names but the pointers in the device were unchanged. Bug 690956.
Fix (FAPI) : invalid fonts resulting in errors

First of a 2 part commit, fixing the special case horizontal/vertical rectangle code in the thin line code in gdevddrw.c, as it doesn't match the general case. This will cause many differences in the regression tests.
Fix (FAPI) : intermittent crashes with TrueType fonts
Fix (FAPI) : Incorrect GID supplied to font interpreter for CIDFonts with TT outlines
Fix (FAPI) : CIDFonts not working with fonts containing a CDevProc
Report enhancments as a separate category in the the weekly bug aging report.  Closes bug 690524.
Fix for bug 688655: stroking of wide curves with high curvature would previously have left strange effects under the curve, and had nasty flattening artifacts on the outside of joins.
Fix for bug 690938. Revert revision 10294, an attempt to fix a valgrind bug, and instead initialise the bbox of paths to the maximally invalid bbox.
