In revision 10351 I commited a partial fix for Bug 690531 that added a new method for stroking a path. Due to a silly mistake on my part when stroking paths with round caps, we could occasionally fail due to a confusion over which caps to use.

Fix for segfault reported in 690880 with separation devices. The is_open flag was not being properly maintained when put_params resulted in a target device closing due to DeviceN color state changing.
Fix (pdfwrite) : problems with type 3 fonts and glyphshow

Fix segfaults in tiffsep and tiffsep1 -- After TIFFCleanup, need to set the tiff structure pointer to NULL to prevent later use. Fix separation file name logic to substitute a harmless '_' character for characters that cause file system action ('/'. '\' and ':').

Symbol set fixes and additions courtesy of Norbert Janssen.  The changes did introduce unexpected side effects, a missing apostrophe could result when using the hpgl/2 stick and arc font.  That compelled the code change in pgfont.c.  The change does effect many regression test files in particular the mapping of ascii 0x27 to 0x2019, apparently we're not the only ones confused about this (http://www.unicode.org/unicode/reports/tr8/#Apostrophe%20Semantics%20Errata), causes most of the regression differences.  All were visually verified.
Fixes to enable pdfwrite device to work with new icc color flow.
Fix for segfault reported in bug 690927 and two of the segfaults of bug 690880.
Fix for failure to increment command buffer pointer after reading icc hash code from clist color.
Fixes for more compiler complaints and missing includes.
Fix for conflicting definitions for create compositor.  Failed to update default compositor actions to include pointer to clist parent device.
Fix stupid typo: ; for , - pointed out by tor. Sorry everyone.
Fix for Bug 690531, excessive slowdown while rendering a complex stroked path with anti-aliasing.

Handle optional content following the default viewing optional content configuration dictionary. Skip invisible XObjects and render invisible parts of content streams to nulldevice. Bug 690633, customer 1110.
Fix (TT font substitution) : Incorrect Widths applied to CIDFont glyphs from PDF file

Fix to have clist_playback_band end when we encounter a cmd_opv_end_page even if there is supposedly stuff in the command buffer.  This was causing a problem since the ICC profile was getting parsed as commands.  This change was tested on the regression run of the trunk.  It passed all tests.   Also change to write the ICC information after the cmd buffer is finished in clist_end_page.  Additional debug output also.
Fix (TT fonts) : regression with TrueType fonts
Bug fix for Bug 688604, "incorrect rendering of a returning curve".
Fix pointer misdirection bug.

Fixes bug #690911 for customer 861.  Our understanding of HPGL/2 Raster Fill (RF) was not quite correct.  In particular, there were many places the code treated a colored pattern as a mask.  This accounts for most of the problems in the new HP 4700 Color Laserjet 5C ATS.  The change is not quite complete, small problems have been noted with an infrequently used feature in cet files 28-06.BIN, 31-08.BIN and 32-02.BIN, these will be addressed shortly.
Fix so that our interface to littleCMS works correctly with nSig color spaces.

Fix of minor bug in ICC creator code.  Also change in color name order since A2B0 entries must be ordered such that the slowest changing colorant is the first element and the fastest changing element is the last element.  Also, littleCMS currently does not support duotone CLUTs so I added a test example using a 3clr ICC profile that can be associated with the DeviceN color space in the tritone.pdf file.
This patch fixes Bug 688269, by making ghostscript use pie joins rather than round ones when stroking in non CPSI_mode.
The cups_map_cmyk() function applied density corrections to RGB values. They can only get applied to CMYK values. Fixed by applying the cupsDensity correction before converting CMYK to RGB.

Increase the size of the initial buffer in the scanner dynamic area to accept the string of maximum valid size. Protect the buffer from overflow when the scanner state is saved during reading of a name that exceed max name length. Bug 690902.
Fix (pdfwrite) : correct introduced regression

Fixes to have the ICC profile reference count properly set and updated when it is assigned to a color space and when the color space reference count is incremented or decremented.  Also change so that an nclr ICC profile will drive the laydown order of the deviceN colors when it is so specified.
Fix of mistaken commit of change in stdio_.h
fix (signed 16-bit)0 problem with r10267, and separate signed/unsigned numbers.

Fix bug #690901, customer #861.  HPGL/2's clip region is at least one pixel larger in extant than the specification.  I have measured 2 pixels wider on the HP 4600 but I suspect this will change with different devices.  I used the minimum expansion to accommodate the test files in the bug.  Many 1 pixel changes in the regression tests are expected of which a sample were visually verified as unimportant.
reverting r8733, which was a faulty fix to bug 688372.

Buffer mask data source in a reusable stream when needed for type 3 image with separate data sources. Check all possible combinations of data source types and fix a bunch of bugs in the code that handles cases untested before. Bug 688389.
Fix (pdfwrite) : type 0 fonts with type 3 descendants could confuse pdfwrite by using stringwidth
Fix to devs.mak: PXL requires a runlength compression function from PCL, so correctly add the dependency to the makefile.
Fix for valgrind problem in bug 690864.
Adobe Acrobat considers the use of clip operation on new path a no-op. Check this and don't clip when there's no path. Bug 690891.

Save and restore the graphics state around the dummy fill that was added in rev 10284 in order to make sure that pages have at least one fill_path call. The 'copypage' operator does not perform initgraphics so the FTS test that expected the graphics state to be unperturbed by copypage would fail. Bug 690894. Thanks to Alex for spotting the cause of the regression.
Fix for bug 690890. We always use the CPSI_mode version of the gs_strokepath code (when executing strokepath or ustrokepath postscript operators). This means we better match acrobat.

Clamp coordinates when the path is scaled up for anti-alias rendering. Leave 1000pt slack at the edge because the path drawing routines can't handle values close to the edge of the representable space. Bug 690864.
updating the internal graphic state as in the else part; 2nd half of fix to bug 690853
Fix a const propagation warning.
Remove some unused variables from the PDF 1.4 compositor device, fixing several warnings. Also cleans up some formatting.

Revert revision 9451 fixing 690756 and reopening 689361.  PCL rectangle coordinates (y coordinate device space is wrong, x is okay) are not positioned properly in landscape mode.  Likely the 689361 fix should have focused on raster graphics (not rectangle) positioning. This will shift rectangles by 1 pixel in many of the test files.

Fixes bug #690185 incorrect line spacing.  Line and horizontal spacing should only be set to default with a change in logical page orientation, oddly, page size changes does not affect spacing. Improvements also noted in C705.bin.
Fix a line split without the '\' at the end of the line. By some reason gmake tolerates this but MSVC nmake doesn't. Bug 690886, customer 661.
new SetPageScale/Unset utility routine before the fix to bug 690858
new SetPageOrigin utility routine before the fix to bug 690858
fixes age-old typo.
Add missing return type and static scope to the definitions of pdf14_push/pop_transparency_state. Fixes a gcc warning.
Advancing the y position past the bottom margin should advance the page only if the page is marked.  Fixes one of the many issues reported in bug #690468.  Improvements noted in:

When a stream error occurs, Ghostscript sometimes print a spurious "Additional information" line containing uninitialized data as part of the error message. Initialize error_string in s_init_state to fix this. Thanks to Michael Constant for the patch. Bug 690874.

Fix for indeterminism from psdcmyk and any other devices that use rgb_cs_to_spotn_cm or other gx_cm_color_map_procs that don't set all color_info->num_components elements of the "frac out[]" array. Fix for Bug 690713.
Fix a typo in a recently committed patch (rev. 10246) that broke a branch that handles Type 3 images with string data source in the image and file data source in the mask. Bug 690451, customer 200.
Consider '0000000000 00000 n' as a free entry, issue a warning, and continue processing xref table. Files with this error, generated by Quartz PDFContext are getting increasingly common. Bug 690873.

Implement support of large resource dictionaries. Store XObject dictionaries that exceed 65534 elements as arrays of dictionaries. Increase default operand stack limit to 300000 elements. Bug 690778, customers 850, 531.
Fix of a few minor bugs in the clist writer code for the ICC profiles.  Primarily a change to write the ICC profiles into the cfile at the end of the writing process.
Fix comment formatting.
Work around a requirement of .image3 operator to have image and mask data sources to be of the same type. Convert the data sources to the same type on PostScript level. Bug 690850, customer 870.
Fix of minor bugs in ICC table and profile clist writing.  Addition of code to read ICC table from clist.  Also clean up of namespace for icc clist functions.

Fix line join, or more exactly a "curve join" problem noted in bug #690852.  I don't know the exact history of gs_setcurvejoin() beyond what is in the documentation and svn logs.  Also, I am not sure which HP printer justified it's addition to the pcl code, but it certainly is wrong on the HP Color Laserjet 4600.  The procedure and the associated state member in the line parameters type (gxline.h) probably should be deprecated entirely, it's no longer in use.
Fix for clist setcolor when compressed color encoding is used which is the default build case for the tiffsep and psdcmyk and others . Bug 690851.
Build optimized with debugging symbols and all warnings under jam.

Prevent overflow in delta row compression, bug #690844.  We use a generic graphics error instead of an HP error because the HP error is not documented and is not in the standard error format of single word camel case, so we suspect it will change in the future.
Reset color space to eRGB just in case a previous fill/stroke had set it to eGray. Fixes 688320.
custom media size patch + bug fix.
Fix for bug 690831.

Fix so that the monochrome devices do not use the non-separable blending operations that are used for RGB devices. This was the source of an indeterminism in Bug 690477. Thanks to Marcos for the detailed bug information.
bmpcmp.c: Fix bounding box calculation that could cause SEGV.
Fix for bug 687295; force transparent stroking to construct the entire path before stroking it, thus eliminating nasty effects where edges overlap.
Fix bounding box adjustments that were causing rendering glitch in bug 687295.
Correct format string type mismatches in some debugging statements.

Fix bug# 690841 and fts panel 340 and others.  The glyph was inappropriately clipped if it was too large to fit in the cache. Intellifonts should not be clipped as the bounding box with Intellifonts in not reliable.  We change the font type to ft_MicroType and assume this clipping behavior is appropriate for user defined font types (see the discussion in the bug report).
Add prototypes for xpsdoc debug functions called from xpstop.
Correct a tranposed digit in the A4Small imageable area in the ghostpdf ppd. Bug 690814.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Unchecked return value from pdf_write_spot_function

Fix mistype of which procs to set to when we change the color space for a transparency group.  If we are running with a separation device with spot colors then we need to use the compressed encoding and decoding.  This fixes bug 690816.
Fix incorrect tilde variants in several symbol sets.  Fixes the bad tilde characters in the test file metrictest_public.pcl of bug #690833. Progression noted in fts 270 as well.

Reintegration of gs_extendgraphic branch into trunk.  This fixes bug690777.pdf.  The main purpose of this commit is to relay information about q and Q operations (extended graphic state push and pops) to the pdf14 compositor.  The reason this is needed is that the softmask is part of the extended graphic state.

Fix for when the transparency groups soft mask bounding box can be used in determining the range of the soft mask for the clist.  This only can occur when the BC (background content) value for the soft mask is white ( a non default and not so common case).  If it is white, then drawings outside the bounding box will be visible.  If it is not white, they will go through with the alpha value defined by the BC luminosity.  In that case, we need to use the larger (parent) bounding box.
Fix to use proper reference counting when popping from a transparency group that had internal to it another soft mask and group.  Also clarify an old comment regarding this.
Fix to assign mask buffer to new reference counted structure when the background alpha is not 255 and we have no drawing in the mask.
Fix for bug 690805.
Fix to do proper reference counting of current context maskbuf during softmask group push and pop.
Fix (ps2write) : Allow use of /Indexed colour spaces in PostScript output.
Fix for incorrect parameters in device procedure call for transparency state push and pop.
Fix so only negative error codes return to the interpreter during the transparency state push and pop.

Finish implementation of ColorSpace extraction from JPX streams. RGB, Gray, and ICC-based color spaces are extracted and passed to PDF interpreter. Palette colors need no further processing in PDF interpreter because they are expanded on C level. Bug 690207.

Fix in pdf_ops.ps so that the communication of the pop of the extended graphic state command is sent to the transparency compositor BEFORE the gsrestore.  In general, we should obtain one extra pop compared to the number of pushes that we have to effectively remove the softmask buffer.  I.e. we set a GS with a soft mask and it will remain there until we run into a Q (or set another GS).
Move xps_tiff_debug() to the head of xpstiff.c.
Fix (ps2write) : Problems with type 3 fonts causing errors
Fix (ps2write) : Pattern colour spaces broken
Don't disable dprintf() and friends in non-debug builds.
Remove a debug message about whether a page has transparency.
Fix (ps2write) : Problem with TrueType /.notdef encoding
Add sRGB and a similar one-component color space for the upcoming patch that will extract color space information from JP2 stream. Bug 690207.
Fix a long-standing bug in ps2ascii conversion that caused concatenation of the lines within a paragraph. Bug 690806.
Fix so gx_remap_ICC pays attention to when the link transform is the identity.
Skip non-PDF files during enumeration of embedded file streams in PDF portfolio. Bug 690422, customer 531.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Undo escapement of PostScript strings when writing XMP metadata for PDF/A
Fix (pdfwrite) : The PDFACompatibilityPolicy switch was being overwritten by PDFA on setpagedevice

Fix for run length encoding bug of image color render with ICC profile.  With this fix, we now have simple non-clist transparency groups working with the ICC color management.  Also, debug code added into gdevp14.c.

Fix for failure to allocate buffer in non-ICC flow (introduced in previous optimization commit).  Also setting of ICC profile to the device profile for the PDF14 put image operation.  PDF14 put image converts the planar PDF14 buffer to scan lines and puts them to the parent device as an image.  Setting the profile properly avoids a potential double color management problem since the buffer is already in the device color space.

Fix to properly transfer alpha information during ICC color conversion of transparency buffers.  Also optimizations to avoid unneeded allocations and memory copies if color space buffers are the same size as well as avoid transforms when the link transform is the identity.

Fix so that a new transparency group with an undefined color space will use the parent groups ICC color space.  This color space is the icc manager's device color space, which is updated when a new group is pushed.
Correct typos in the MacOS X linker options. Bug 690783.
Fix (pdfwrite) : incomplete submission #10124
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve symbolic font detection
Fix incorrect calculation of the page size in cljet5 driver that returned the size in inches instead of points causing /rangecheck in .installpagedevice . Bug 690799, customer 870.
Work around some awki formatting bugs.
Mention getting an NDA to access private attachments as part of the bug bounty program, and generally expand the description a bit. Thanks to Robin Watts for the suggestions.
Fix SEGV caused by unknown %device% prefix. Add missing check for return code during lib path parsing. Thanks to Piotr Strzelczyk for the patch. Bug 690800.
Silently ignore point displacement request when the point number is out of valid range. This patch has been backported from FreeType2. Bug 690795.
Lots of general code cleanup. Fixed termination of long jobs on some systems. Added explicit detection of seg faults with pdfwrite.
Fix to make sure that we use the proper bounding box when computing the band range for the soft mask transparency group in the clist.

Initial creation of branch to enable the proper communication between extend graphic state push and pops (q and Q in PDF) and the transparency compositor actions so that the softmask is maintained in sync with the graphic state.  See discussion on bug690777 for details.
Thread base_uri argument to fixed page parsing functions so that resources specified with relative paths can be resolved in the right context. Also fixed a few warnings.
Fix for segfault when peekstring requests more data than remains in a %rom% file. Bug 690697.

A quick dirty hack to enable reading of wts plane files (wts_plane_x) on 64 bit machines.  Wts plane files contain a image of little endian 32 bit specific structure with a pointer, and was preventing wtsimdi device to run on 64 bit machines. Tested on little endian 32 and 64 bit machines.  Should not change anything on 32 bit machines with current wts plane files.  Hope to work on big endian machines but not tested. Bug #690710.
Finishes up the reference counting fix for bug #690785.  No expected differences.

Force out-of-range values of color mask to the valid range by calculating bitwise 'and' with the maximum color value. Experiments show that this is what AR does. Earlier code mapped out-of-range values to the nearest valid value. Bug 690786, customer 531.

Draw a smooth curve through the points of Ink annotation. The algorithm Adobe uses is unpublished but our curve is close enough to Adobe when the points follow a smooth path. For random points the curve is different but looks more logical than Adobe's. Bug 690758, customer 580.
Fixes part of 690785.  End graphics mode when pcl exits, no expected differences.
Fix some broken documentation links. Bug 690787.
Fix line endings and a corresponding file attribute in a recently added file.
Revert the change to EOF handling in the romfs iodevice. It fixed the segfault, but broken compiled-in font access on PCL. Bug 690697.
Improve EOF detection with the romfs iodevice. Fixes a segfault loading shorter resources. Patch from Alex Cherepanov, bug 690697.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Remove limit on images in patterns when creating later versions of PDF

Fix for transparency problem, caused by the alpha parameters in the ExtGState in the PDF interpreter (dictstack) not being maintained properly. Bug 690770 for customer #1110. Thanks to Michael Vrhel for analyzing the PDF to find the area that the PDF interpreter was mishandling.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Stricter checking when converting type 4 to type 1 masked image

Implement rendering of PDF Ink annotation without appearance stream. PDF Spec doesn't say how to connect points in the annotation. This version uses simple lineto operation but Acrobat uses curves for smoother look. Bug 690758, customer 580.
Fixed bug in automatic speed tuning of local cluster nodes and modified build process to make use of fixed parallel makefiles.
Fixed dependencies for parallel make.
Fix (build) : Incorrect path for Visual Studio 9 in make file
Fix (type 1 parser) : Correct logical flaw in SEAC parsing

Fixes 690719 and many other unreported issues associated with the wtsimdi device.  The default strip_copy_rop musn't be used, the clist code will constant fold raster operations before determining if a contone buffer is needed to render the band, the same optimizations must be used when the clist is being played back and rendered, the default strip_copy_rop does not (by design) have these optimizations. I don't know the intent of the cryptic comment above the section where the procedure override occurred.
Fix a botched pointer comparison which fails if the pointer difference overflows the signed integer range. Patch from Mark Davies with changes. Bug 689711.
Fixed typo in comment that was generating groff warning.
Add gc enumeration to the two string members of the svgwrite device structure. Fixes a segfault with large input sets. Bug 690757.
Fix for bug 690534.
A fix for the rendering issue that occurred with bug 689581 after fixing the rangecheck error.  This should fix 689581.

Skip everything before 'begincodespacerange' in regulat CMap stream to avoid PostScript errors in CMap headers. PDF interpreter doesn't need any data from the header. See rev. 9240 for the bug 689842 that did the same for ToUnicode CMap files. Bug 690737, customer 580.

Change to avoid having a rangecheck error occur when the softmask group colorspace is a pattern.   This keeps us from having the error occur with bug 689581 however there is still a rendering issue when we go to a sep device.  I have that narrowed down and hopefully will have fixed soon.
Fix for mistype from previous ICC branch commit.
Fix a compile error in the UFST build, a result of implementing and testing in the default bug without checking the UFST build.

Fixes 690206.  Explicitly set font types in the resident font table. The symbol font was incorrectly classified with font type Bound, 8-bit (256 characters, All codes are printable except 0, 7-15, and 27) instead of Bound, 8-bit printable (192 characters, character codes 32-127 and 160-255 printable).  Thanks to Norbert Janssen for discovering this problem.
Fix (pdfwrite) : quiet a compiler warning
Fix (pdfwrite) : Remove some unused variables
Fix (pdfwrite) : Minor compiler warning
Fix : Minor compiler warnings
Fix (pdfwrite) : Silence Coverity warning

Fix 690471, a seg fault on snow leopard resulted from the compiler casting a pointer type incorrectly because the prototype was not visible.  Could have been completely avoided had the compiler warning for a missing prototype been heeded.  Introduced in 9717 as part of the romfs work.
Add additional parsing attributes for the vendor unique operator.  We only parse this operator, there is no HP documentation to support the operator.  Fixes 690736.
New attributes required to fix 690736, the actual fix will be in the next commit to PCL XL.  We can't update the trees simultaneously.
Work around a bug in PDF generated by "PdfWrapper v1.00" that sometimes writes "." instead of "0." in content stream. Bug 690730.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Write ToUnicode CMaps with 2-byte code space ranges and keys

Add check for NOTRANSPARENCY in patternusestransparency since this is also used by resolvepattern in pdf_draw.ps. If this flag is set, but the pdf14 device is not active, "unregistered" error occurs. Bug 690727 for customer 531.
Fix of bug that made %rom% not searched for ICC profiles and addition of warning messages.
Ghostscript caches pattern instances in the pattern dictionary. This patch doesn't cache anything in the null pattern dictionary because it's read-only. Bug 690725.
Process embedded files as a portable collection only when /Collection attribute is defined in the document root. Bug 690709.

Adjust ht cache allocation to a size that will actually be used by the cache logic. The changes allow for replicating tiles along the width axis up to a ulong multiple that optimizes tile blitting in the mem device logic. Addresses bug 690693 by reducing the memory used from > 1Gb to < 200 Mb. As noted in the comments to that bug, there still may be some optimizations remaining.
Add 'used' and 'max_used' information to the -Za output. This is handy for investigating memory usage and only affects a debug build when -Za (or -ZA) is used.

Improve diagnostics for detecting problems with virtual memory spaces (see bug #688333).  The vm space id was not initilialized for all allocations.  This change reduce the list from hundreds down to tens of entries for a very simple postscript job.
Fix rendering artifacts in interpolated images caused by intermediate bit buffer not reset when data get flushed to output buffer. Bug 689566.
Fix to use default ICC Gray, RGB and CMYK profiles for Device Gray, RGB and CMYK when a link is requested using those spaces.  This fixes seg. fault with smask_withicc.pdf

Fixes part of bug #690704.  There was a reference counting problem with producing the PXL error page.  In fact, the problem was part of a deprecated text API, so we moved forward to the later text (gstext.h) API for the error page.  Also the commit includes some simplification, the code really did not require allocating all the resource for the error page at the beginning of the job.  The added complexity was not worth the benefit in this case.

Remove code that tries to pause at the end of the .PFB binary data in an attempt to keep from reading beyond the end of the encrypted data, sometimes misidentifying the end of the actual data, and stopping early. Bug 465936.

Change literal /FontBBox array into executable one for better compatibility with legacy software. QuarkXPress 3.31, idraw, and some versions of dvips assume that /FontBBox is executable. Bugs 690683, 687120, customer 460.

In hex form of eexec stream, break out of reading loop and try to interpret the accumulated data when a whitespace character is encountered. Skip whitespace characters when the control returns to /eexecDecode filter. Bug 689577.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Check pointer before dereferencing
Fix for incorrect endian setting for lcms and to make sure we reset the buffer description when transforming a single color.  With this, we are now transforming solid colors correctly though zfill.

Initial code for remap/concretization of ICC colors in gsicc.c.  Also reduction in code for getting number of channels in ICC color spaces with lcms and fix for setting data types when transforming single colors with lscm.
Fix (pdfwrite): Writing invalid numbers for linecap and linejoin parameters
Fix for either cast problem or lack of bit masking when calculating profile size from header on 64 bit machine.
Stop processing of embedded Type 1 font as soon as operator eexec returns. Skip the trailer that may be truncated or corrupted. Bug 690701, customer 780.

Fix a reference counting problem by moving the text enumerator release ahead of the error checking. This releases the enumerator (and counts down the device rerference count) even if the text operation returned an error.

The debugging code to dump an allocator crashed when printing references, also add a convenience function so it can be easily called from the debugger and a reminder in ilocate.  All debugging changes, no expected differences.
Reorder a logical expression in bbox device to avoid evaluation of uninitialized part. Fix a Purify warning.

Adds a new memory device constructor (gs_make_mem_device_with_copydevice) to replace gs_make_mem_device and fixes several device reference counting problems (leaks) which affected all the the client languages.  No expected visual differences.

Fix some issues with CFF fonts and XPS when the device is pdfwrite. A couple of font methods were being left uninitialised, and pdfwrite tries to use them, setting to the graphics library defaults causes pdfwrite to produce type 3 fonts which is at least an improvement over a crash.
Fix a problem with reference counting patterns in a client_color structure which is allocated on the local heap rather than via the GS memory manager.
Fixes to remove dependencies of various files on littleCMS library.  Now, the only files that should depend upon littleCMS are the API file gsicc_littlecms.c and gsicc_create.c.
Propagate LDFLAGS to the shared library gs client link command lines in the the autoconf build. Bug 690695.
Fix a benign type cast warning from MSVC 2008 by explicitly casting the glyph name.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Embedded TrueType fonts not correctly flagged as Symbolic
Fix for bug 690670.  Softmask color space was incorrectly getting set to DeviceN when the color space was undefined for the group and the output device was a separation device.
Fixes a regression with revision 5219, the log for this revision says:
Initialize symbol sets before fonts to fix bug #690601.  Thanks to Norbert Janssen for identifying and analyzing this problem.
Add missing initialization of the path rule member during setting up the stack-allocated clipping path structure. Fix a Purify warning.
Fully initialize CFD stream state. Fix a Purify warning in 23-12B.PS and stop printing wild core instead of error messages.
Fix all remaining MSVC warning other than C4018 or C4244 that have little value and should be suppressed. Bug 690660.
Fix a common Purify warning; skip calculations with uninitialized values during processing an empty glyph, such as /space .
Fix yet another case of missing dereference of indirect objects. Bug 690675.

Fix processing of -dUseCropBox that was broken by the rev. 9805. Old code messed up the operand stack when -dUseCropBox was requested but no /CropBox attribute was in the PDF file. Bug 690676, customer 330.
Update changelogs and open bug numbers for 8.70 final.
Change the operand types of encode_binary_token() to match the the type of PostScript integers in the ref structure. Bug 690660.
Fixes for issues found when converting colors in image_render_color.  Current code at this point is using the link cache, transforming colors successfully through lcms, and making it through GC.

Fix incorrect right shift on 64-bit platforms. PLRM defines bitshift operator as a logical shift. On 64-bit platform, the integer operand was promoted to 64-bit long value, shifted, and assigned back to 32-bit int, effectively emulating the sign extension.
Fix (pdfwrite): Excessive redefinitions of CIDFonts causing memory exhaustion
Fix for issues found when trying to create link in image_render_color.
Fix a typo in a debug statement.
Fixes for several bugs/issues found during first attempt to create links and add them to the link cache.
Fix for issues with hash code retrievals from color spaces during link request.
Fixes for setting new ICC profile member when color space is set to ICC type.
Add some debug that can be handy in tracing memory usage with the chunk manager. This code has not effect on non-debug builds.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Incorrect table in /Unicode /Decoding Resource

Temporarily address bug #690646 with a fatter fill adjustment default. This will only affect tests with resolutions less than 150 dpi.  The change makes superfluous code in gs_init.ps which initializes the default fill adjust to .5 iff the resolution is greater than or equal to 150 dpi.
Clean up of a few items for debug testing.
Add output buffer alignment code to one of the image handling branches where it was omitted. Fix a SEGV on Sparc platform that cannot access misaligned data. Bug 690613.
Fix a typo in compile time flag that prevented GNU libiconv to emulate system libiconv and caused link errors on the systems that use GNU headers but system libraries. Bug 690123.
Fix for case when underlying buffer includes shape plane, plus fix of minor offset calculation bug during memcpy fills.

Revert the change in c9860 to allow xps to build built without the pcl source. This method breaks the language-switch build, and cannot be fixed in the context on nmake. For now it will just be a source dependency.
Fix processiong of numeric entry in /W2 array. Bug 690635.
Fix (pdfwrite): Crash with font errors.
Fix for infinite loop that was caused by failure to update the current pattern cache size during the freeing of a tile that included a transparency object.
Switch the order of an assignment and condition to fix (harmless) reading of uninitialized memory. Clear a Purify warning.
Don't take empty string for an answer when searching 'name' table in TrueType font because some MS fonts have empty strings for platform IDs MS doesn't use. Bug 690611, customer 0.
Set default color and colorspace for colored pattern stream that relies on default values; keep the color unset as required for uncolored pattern. Bug 690609, customer 531.

This patch is a continuation of revision 9842, to derive the fill adjustment parameter from the graphics state and not assume the value is 1/2.  Interestingly, the patch seems to result in improvements for postscript in several regression test files.  For example cet file 13-13.ps page 3 appears to improve the clipping of the large (W) character.  Previously the (W) character obscured the line on the top border of the page, now the line is visible.  Unfortunately the non banded result is still wrong and with the fix does not match the banded output.  Analysis of this issue is incomplete and ongoing.
Fix (CID fonts): The fallback when totally failing to find a character code in a CMap sets the CID to 0 (/.notdef) but failed to select a descendant font.
Fix for segfault caused by dereference of a stale pointer (pgs->dev_color). Bug 690519 detected with pkmraw during regression testing.
Turn off debug defines.

Fix for missing matrix translation from clist phase changes during tiling code.  Also clean up of commented code and fix for potential access violations.  This is close to being finished. Need to do a bit more testing, merge in the trunk changes and do a cluster push to test.
Fix (graphics library) : Conversion to base colour space of an /Indexed colour space was not catering for spaces with a string lookup instead of a procedural lookup.
Fix for access violations when transparency pattern is stored and read from clist.
Add a check for a null value of SMask attribute in ExtGState. This also works for invalid SMask reference, which is already converted to null. Bug 690597, customer 870.
Fix for crash when tiles are outside printable areas seen with bug 690558.
The advance was not properly rounded for Monotype UFST resident fonts. Fixes 690589.
Fix language_switch UFST build to put the FAPIconfig-FCO file into the correct place in the %rom% file system (for when COMPILE_INITS=1). Bug 690470.

Removal of temporary debug code and implementation of non-simple tile case (e.g. tile with 30 degree rotated step matrix).  Need to implement case where tile is a clist and need to do a bit more testing.
Fix to make sure we push an isolated transparency group and also get the proper pointer to the buffer.  Start of code to perform tiled filling.
Extract all documents from PDF collection to temporary files and process them in the order they are listed in the /Names array. Bug 690422, customer 531.

Fix regressions associated with 690316.  Apparently, with the Monotype UFST scaler the y coordinates are mirrored if an outline was substituted for a bitmap but not mirrored if an outline is requested directly.
Look into JPX stream to get color space and color depth when it is omitted from the image dictionary. Bug 690518, customer 850.
As part of fixing bug #690520 correct the long standing annoyance of pcl pitch being stored in different units, with this change all font pitch attributes are stored in centipoints.

Fix for bug690546.  Problem was caused by double application of opacity for knockout fills.  The opacity was being applied in the alpha value and in the opacity value.  The alpha value is the product of the shape and opacity and can be used directly.
Fix typo introduced in r9812.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Update 'where_used' in case object is used across pages
debugging arguments were not being propagated to the gs library.
Add missing returns and a NULL check to previous transparency analysis fixes.
Fix a technically uninitialised variable (Coverity warning).
Fix a minor Coverity warning about implicit function declarations.
Add manifest files to the Windows setup and uninstall programs, to force Windows Vista to run them as Administrator. Bug 690510.
Add TrimBox support and a corresponding -dUseTrimBox option. Bug 690547.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Make type 3 bitmap font text-searchable if possible

Clamp character shear operands to reasonable values.  This should fix the nightly regression problems with the Quality Logic 310 series of files.  We suspect it will fix bug #690241 comment #12 item 2, and it will effectively mask (not fix) bug #690541.
Fix memory corruption caused by long names. The length of name in the scanner buffer may exceed the maximum name size and should be checked. Bug 690523.
Fix detection of extra Q operators in the page contents stream, which never worked before. Remove some level 1 rudiments and comment the code. Bug 690540, customer 750.
Fix for access violation that can occur when processing PS files with spot colors into a sep device.
Export t1_glyph_equivalence table, which provides alternative glyph names. Modify pf2afm.ps to disable glyph aliasing and generate AFM files that match the font. Bug 689014.
Fix for a few byte boundary bugs in the ICC creation.  Now successfully creating valid ICC profiles from simple CIEABC color spaces.
Fix (pdfwrite): Bug in pdfmark processing
Addition of debug dump for internally created ICC profiles and setting of ICC curves when procs in PS are identity.

Provide for filling zero width areas to prevent dropout in some strange stroked characters. This seems to be the intent of the code, and definitely conforms to the PS PLRM, but the PDF Reference Manual says zero width fills may or may not be filled (although Adobe Acrobat does). This is not (yet) enabled by default, but is provided to simplify regression analysis and for customer 531, bug 690466.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Bug with DOCVIEW pdfmark handling
Switch to 32-bit PostScript integers on 64 bit platform. Bug 690474.
Validate /Border attribute of annotations. Following AR, use invisible border when /Border value is incorrect. Bug 690509.
Several memory related fixes.

Current PDF font loader fails when Type 1 font executes 'restore' at the end of the file and discards all the collected data. The patch breaks the check for /UniqueID in the font to force a branch without 'restore'. Bug 690502.

Fix the file stream opening logic so that when the open failed, it did not leave buffers and other structures up to the GC for collection. This only affected PS and PDF, but happened on files that needed fonts that were not immediately in the Fontmap. This resulted in up to on the files from bug 690422.
Fix (Graphics library) : Inappropriate testing of shading co-ordinates
Addition of raw image dump of pattern for debug purposes.
Initial creation of branch from rev 9762.  This branch is for the purpose of obtaining proper transparency rendering for patterns that contain transparency.  When completed, this will fix bug 690467.
Fix (colour handling): improper handling of ICCBased space with a /Alternate ICCBased     space
Fix an uninitialized variable warning in FAPI_do_char.
Trap /ioerror and load the font by name when embedded font stream is unreadable. Bug 690492.
Fix the jam build to work without config.h.

The "ps2write" output device produces PostScript which is not DSC-conforming, so do not advertize it as DSC-conforming with a "%!PS-Adobe-..." magic string. Use "%!" instead. Otherwise the "pstops" CUPS filter cannot handle this output (Ubuntu bug #377011).
Fixed recognition of page size via /cupsPageSizeName. All page sizes were considered custom sizes if /cupsPageSizeName was not set.
Reformat code to improve readability and fix messed up tab/space indentation. Also removed the m_ prefix on struct fields.
When /Length attribute is incorrect, PDF interpreter removes it from the stream dictionary. Add support of missing /Length attribute to the pattern handling code. Bug 690488.
Bind all procedures in ps2ai.ps to prevent errors caused by redefined operators, such as redefinition of 'length' as a number in examples/colorcir.ps. Bug 690484.
Fix (FAPI) : FAPI doesn't support Multiple Master fonts
Consider PDF files that has /StmF attribute but no /CF attribute as having ARC4 encryption. Bug 690478.
Fix (ps2write) : Crash caused when converting large shading to image.
Fix (FAPI) : Type 2 fonts with local Subrs fail
Add aliases for paper size JIS B4 and JIS B5, fixing bug #689677.  No regression differences are expected.
Fill in omitted paper sizes as part of fixing bug #689677.  Thanks to Jeffrey Vance for providing several of these paper dimensions.  No regression differences are expected.
Use 32 bits for fixed coordinates even on 64 bit cpus.
Fix regression caused by the changes to make PCL work. Bug 690463.
Fix : Windows drag&drop has a fixed path limit of 80 characters.
Bug fix in hash code computation for profile.
Fix PostScript interpreter : ICC colour space could cause crash
Fix (FAPI) : FAPI doesn't handle Encoding arrays of type mixed_array
Fix (FAPI) : FAPI fails when FontBBox is missing
Commit .h file missed by the previous revision. Bug 690318, customer 631.

Supprt -dBigEndian=[true | false] so that the TIFF can be optimized for a target host on a machine of another 'endian' byte orientation. This is a mostly worthless change since the raster data doesn't change (only 16 or 32-bit values have endian issues). Thanks to wendyst2 at gmail.com for this fix. Bug #690318.
Check for unbalanced q/Q operators in content streams of PDF forms. Add missing Q when needed and issue a warning. Bug 690449, customer 870.
Fix for case when blending color space of soft mask is not specified.
Fix (FAPI): Incremental Type 42 font with GlyphDirectory & missing glyphs fails
Adde support for the "*APDuplexRequiresFlippedMargin:" PPD keyword to the "cups" output device, fixed also the margin handling for custom paper sizes.
Fixed unprintable margin handling of the "cups" output device.
Fixed compiler warning about /* within comment.
cups output device: Added support for the new "*cupsBackSide:" PPD keyword, fixed "*cupsFlipDuplex:" for landscape documents.
Take measures against Type 1 fonts that do 'systemdict begin' and bypass all our font loading tricks. Bug 690450, customer 870.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Enlarge the hardcoded threshold for subsetting True Type fonts.
Fix (FAPI) : FAPI fails when FontBBox is a packed array
Fix (FreeType) : SEAC glyphs fail with incremental interface

Fix 2 oversights in AES decryption code: (1) add enumeration of ctx member in AES state. Unmovable blocks are still garbage collected and need enumeration; (2) use correct names to access /CFM attribute in PDF file. Bug 688958, customers 870, 850, 531.
Fixes bug #690420, several state variables could be read uninitialized under certain error conditions.  Thanks to Norbert Janssen for the fix.  No regression test differences are expected.
Fix of includes and definitions.

This is a merge of the smask_work branch into the trunk.  The merge fixes issues related to missing soft masks, improperly rendered soft masks and transparency group color spaces.  It addresses a number of bugs including 688728 689422 689512 689931 688601 689968 690958 690115 690157 and 690170.

Change 'doimagemask' so that the SMask image is not processed twice when the device is 'pdfwrite'. Also fix the 'freed SMask' issue of 690345 since the first improvement results in a dereference of this that did previously was only detected during Valgrind.
Fix (colour) : Ensure /UseCIEColor sets for initial space correctly.

Some broken TrueType 1 fonts may declare more tables than they actualy have. Use .peekstring instead of for readstring for resding the font directory to avoid positioning non-seekable input stream past the 1st table data. Bug 690423, customer 580.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Work aroung wrong numGlyphs.
Fix (pdfwrite): Ignore missing side bearing/width in type 1 fonts.
Add range checking of width and height for for downloaded bitmap fonts, thanks to Norbert Janssen for the fix, fixes most of bug #690375.

Fix longstanding font bugs for customer #951 - bug #689675 and #689676.  We had worked on these for quite some time without success and overlooked the simple, but undocumented fix.  If a font is selected by id and later a family selection for bold is occurs the current font will not be reselected.  If a different attribute other than weight (bold) is used, for example typeface, the font will be reset.  Generally font attributes either reset or do not reset the current font when id selection is in place.  Which attributes reset the font under these condition appear random.  It is quite unusual to mix font selection by id and by family in the same job so we suspect this is just untested interaction in the hp printer.

Some broken Type 1 fonts define some of the attributes in the external scope instead of defining them in the font dictionary. The patch tries to pick the keys from the external scope and put them back to the font dictionary. Bug 690418, customer 1110.

Detect /Pages node without /Kids and bail out early. The code that tries to determine the number of pages in the document takes such node as a /Page node, which causes very long search for the last page. Bug 690389.

Boilerplate parsing for the "set logical page command" as documented in the HP D640 Manual (ref. Bug #690417).  Implementation for the command is forthcoming, no regression failures are expected, it is a new command.

Prevent the 'extra image' problem with pdfwrite. This fixes 689422.pdf with the pdfwrite device (not the scaling issue -- just the black vs. white in the pattern). This area needs to get cleaned up since with this change I suspect the 'skip image' hack is now not needed.

Write color to the clip list even when it has no variable data, as in [/Separation/None ...]. Fix a bug introduced by r. 8770 that causes rendering of invisible objects with the last visible color. Bug 690395, customer 330.
Fix a typo in a comment.

Fix bug #690334, this problem was a documented side effect of fixing the memory leak bug #689822.  We now avoid a double free by copying the palette data before rebuilding the color space.  This corrects fts.2410 and fts.2411, the only expected regression testing differences.
Repair broken PDF files created by "OKI HotKey" that misspell "endobj" as "enbobj". Bug 690397.
Fix for crash on 18-02B in clist code. The clist cbuf (on the stack) would write past the end of the buffer are polluting the next varaible on the stack (data_bits). Fixes 690399.
Fix for crash of bug688728.pdf when going to pdfwrite.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Omitted to write CIDToGIDMap when it was Identity, even if writing PDFA
Fix (pdfwrite): remove unused code for Font metadata.

The massive 'DeviceN' commit (r2925) broke this. The correct b_w w_b palette should not rely on color_info.polarity, but instead needs to be determined from the value of color black. Inverted if black is not 0. Bug 690314 for customer #661.
Removed the function pdf_color_space, which simply called pdf_color_space_named, with two additional fixed parameters, NULL and 0.
Fix (ps2epsi): rounding problems calculating bbox.
Fix (pdfwrite): Incorrect handling of short images with subsampling.

Skip Identity /TR function in soft mask dictionary on PostScript level instead of passing {} to .begintransparencymaskgroup because ref_function() only accepts function made of data and operator %execfunction. Bug 690379.

Revert initial /PolicyNotFount to 1. The previous value, 7, introduced by ESP Ghostscript merger (rev. 8026) was non-standard and handled by Ghostscript like 0. Fix '/undefined in --setpagedevice--' error in CUPS mode (-dNOMEDIAATTRS) when setpagedevice request has unsupported keys. Bug 690376.
Correct a typo in a debug message.
Remove a debug printout.
Fix (ghostpcl): Can't build using MSVC since revision 9599
Check the return value from pdf_open_docuemnt to fix a Coverity warning.
Fix (pdfwrite): Incorrect handling of type 1 counter control hints.

The clip mask and path when emulating a non-solid brush fill was not gsave/grestore bracketed properly, causing funny behavior when combined with transparency masks. Solves bug 690358 and fixes FTS test 0202 among others.
Fix (fonts): Potential dereference of NULL pointer.
Recognize composite fonts and process descendant fonts according to -dShowEmbeddedFonts flag. Bug 690363.
Accept a string (instead of a name) as a possible /FontName value in FontDescriptor. Recover broken PDF file generated by "MapForm". Bug 690365.
Ignore /XObject attribute if it's not a dictionary. Recover broken PDF file generated by "Allegro Design Publisher". Bug 690364, customer 870.

Fixes for 690203 and 690323, some pcl drivers write incorrect TrueType headers, we work around that by setting the header to the default sfnt version 1 header so the corrupt fonts will work with the font scaling code.  Cluster testing reports an error in 4316.pxl, which can't be reproduced locally.

Properly setup the "nogc.dev" allocator.  This fixes the memory performance problem seen in 390002wts.pcl discussed in bug #690346. Local cluster regression testing reports an unexpected problem with the test fontpage.pcl, this cannot be reproduced locally.
Remove allocator debugging code as this scheme will not work with forthcoming changes to setup nogc.dev properly.
build pcl debug systems in a separate directory.
Fix (pdfwrite) : NeverEmbed/AlwaysEmbed not working properly.
Fixes in the "cups" (CUPS Raster) output device driver:
Don't apply mapped transfer function to the uninitialised buffer. Old code had no effect other than causing Valgrind warnings. Bug 688908.

When CCITTEncode'd stream is not properly terminated and used as an embedded image, the filter may consume 'E' from 'EI'. Change PDF interpreter to accept 'I' as a synonym to 'EI'. Bug 690300, customer 353.
Fix (fonts) : Sheared/rotated text incorrect with FreeType bridge
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong page orientation with italic font.
Fix (fonts) : Coverity warning
Fix (pdfwrite) : Skip OpenType tables EBDT, EBLC, EBSC.
Fix (fonts): Allow copying TT descandants of CIDFonts with no name table.
Fix (pswrite) : extra '%' output in DSC comment
Allocate a file name string returned by .tempfile independently of the file object. Don't free the file name string when the file is closed. Fix a Valgrind warning and potential SEGV.
Fix (fonts): Uninitialised variables in FreeType bridge.
Fix (fonts): PaintType 2 fonts not working.
Fix (fonts): PaintType 2 fonts not working.
Fix (fonts): Crash caused by missing tests.

Norbert Janssen has provided this fix for bug 690316.  Using the ufst font scaler apparently characters which are too large to be rendered as bitmaps (returned as paths) and normal charpath operations scaled y in the wrong direction.  We suspect this must be a change in the ufst as this functionality has passed previous tests.
fixes 690280.  Clean didn't remove all the configuration files.  NB, the msvc build probably has similar omissions.

For a debug build we stack up 2 heap allocators instead of using 1 heap allocator and a chunk allocator.  In debug mode each allocation and free resolves to a corresponding system malloc and free so that memory tools such as valgrind, mpatrol, etc. are effective.

Fix 689822, the previous code did not free the palette associated with an indexed color space to remain backward compatible wih pcl and pclxl.  The previous setup, before 8928, allowed the clients to manage the table for memory.  The commented out code in this module was a workaround until we fixed the pcl clients.

This continues the fix for 689822.  Freeing the indexed palette in the graphics library exposes a problem in pxl.  PXL was sharing the color space associated with an image and the color space in the graphics state and juggling the memory pointer.  Now that the palette memory is "owned" by the graphics library PXL can no longer do that.  So we create a separately allocated object for the palette associated with the image to fix the problem.

Part of the fix needed to address 689822 - "memory leaks during clist rendering".  This change is prerequisite to fixing the problem, which will be explained in a subsequent change to gscolor2.c.  This particular change simply let's the graphics library "gx_final_Indexed" free the palette associated with an indexed color space.  We don't expect any changes with this fix other than to create a temporary memory leak, it's unavoidable since we lack a convenient way to do simultaneous changes to pcl/pxl and gs in svn.
Add hagaki (Japanese postcard) paper size to the list of known paper sizes because this format is widely used in Japan and popular PAPERSIZE option takes a paper name. Bug 690213.
Fix chunk_resize_object to retain the old data and add gs_debug['A'] debug printing.
Fix Segfault in the 'resize_object' of the chunk memory wrapper.
Fixed typo introduced in r9545.
Set the log_op (ROP) to a straightforward value when doing the pdf14 put_image ignoring the input imager state log_op. Bug 690321.
Propagate error code from gs_path_enum_next() upstream in operator .getpath . Fix a Coverity warning.
Add the soclean and debugclean targets to distclean. Bug 690263.
Fix to have the clist pdf14 gray device use the proper pdf14 encode and decode functions instead of the gxdefault ones.
Fix for issue when target device is monochrome and we are using the pdf14 device also now always updating the color mapping procs for all transparency group and soft mask push and pops.
Fix FreeType incremental interface. the test in ttgload.c against 'glyf_offset' being 0 seems incorrect, if the first glyph is called for then the offset should be zero.
Fix the FreeType bridge code for outlines (result of charpath).
This change deprecates the pl allocator and reintigrates pcl with the old ghostscript allocator (nogc) for better performance.  -K does not yet work properly and will be fixed shortly.
Fix (colour): Faulty error handling

Add support for BITS=2, remove left over debugging messages. Note that this has only been tested for BITS=1, BITS=2, BITS=8. BITS=4 is not supported (Indexed color space is limited to palette of 4096 colors).
When /JBIG2Decode filter takes /.jbig2globalctx parameter and retains a pointer to it, the filter must not be allocated in global memory if the parameter is local. Bug 690308.
Protect refinement debug image dumps from the normal debug build.

Fix for access to potentially uninitialized memory in gx_hld_get_gstate_ptr when called with an imager_state that is on the stack (as it is when this is called from the clist). Valgrind spotted this. See coment #5 in Bug 690299.
Add some documentation on a useful debugging PS operator and it's C code hook.
Fixes to makes sure the clist writer uses the clist_color_info information to obtain num_components as this is adjusted for the transparency group color space.  Fixes CATX1792.pdf
Fix for incorrect handling of Pattern with ExtGState entries. Fixes CATX1792.pdf.
Fix to ensure that the target device is not used if we end up using gx_default_begin_typed_image.
Fix (ps2write)
Fix for postscript crashes in regression tests.
Check that gs_init.ps can be found at $(GenericResourceDir)Init/gs_init.ps Issue a warning if this file cannot be found. Bug 690289.
Fix for segfault on the file from Bug 690189 caused by not having an open substream for a transparency group when the transparency group ended.
Fix for segfault reported as bug 690051 caused by the assumption that the architecture had 32-bit integers. Thanks to Wendy for the patch.
Fix for GC bug introduced with introduction of trans_device into imager state.
Fixes for compiler warnings.
Fix for type defs warnings and forced casting issues.
Set native eol-style on the jasper library source. Bug 690292.
Convert a jasper source file to unix line endings. Bug 690292.
Fix for proper handling of device color mapping procs for PDF14 device in the presence of the clist writer forwarding its shading operations to the target device.

Fix to use clist device bit depth for deciding how many bytes of color to write during clist creation instead of the target device bit depth.  These can be different when we have a transparency group color space that is different than the target device color space.
Fix for type mismatch on extern debug variable
Fix (TrueType interpreter): Ignore a 'faulty font' condition

Fix rangecheck in 'patternusestransparency' due to extra element left on the operand stack -- this occurs with PDF Pattern colorspaces that did not have either Resource or ExtGState elements which is common with Shading Patterns.

Limit the length of a buffer string for CCITTFaxEncode compression in Type 32 font to 65535. Old code used worst case estimation (5x expansion) that exceeded maximum string size for large glyphs. Bug 690286.
Fix (TrueType interpreter): Ignore a 'faulty font' error
Fix (graphics library): Rotated/skewed text not anti-aliased

Hack to keep a bug in gximage3x.c from causing an infinite loop with the soft mask branch.  This occurs with the file related to bug 689290.  It is related to the fact that there is a size mismatch between the image and its 1x1 soft mask
Minor addition to debug code to allow the dumping of soft mask and transparency group buffers only when we are processing a particular clist band.
Propagate LDFLAGS when linking the pdftoraster utility. Bug 690279.

Fixes to transparency to recognize Patterns with transparency in a PDF and install the pdf14 compositor (push_pdf14trans_device) when the pattern is rendered in to the pattern_accumulator device. Bugs 688278 for customer 700 and user bugs 690189 and 690422.
Add a reference to doc/Use.htm#CIDFontSubstitution to the message about CIDFont substitution based on registery and ordering data. Bug 690102.

Correct handling of the operand stack overflow requires one more element than the normal case. The maximum operand stack size has been reduced by 1 element relatively to the size set by rev. 6889 for the bug 688764. Bug 690209.

Fix for case where the transparency group color space is DeviceN.  Currently the code returns an error in this case.  With this fix, if the output device is a separation device, the blending will occur in DeviceN.  However, if we have a CMYK, RGB or Gray output device, the blending will occur in the concrete color space.

Fix for 0 length files from the bit*** devices when -dLastLine was not set. The LastLine now defaults to the last line of the page (height-1). Bug 690217. Thanks to Piotr Strzelczyk for spotting this.
Position of pcl rectangles was incorrect in some cases.  This change fixes #689361.  The change is authored and documented by Jan Stockenius.
Fix to achieve proper image color handling with the clist when we have transparency group color spaces that are different than the target device.
Fix (pdfwrite): Limit on CIDFont size too low
Fix (pswrite): Incorrect A3 page size

Keep reading the data sources until all of them reach EOF instead of bailing out when the first one reaches EOF. Different data sources can use different compression techniques and buffer sizes. The mask in masked images also has different length than other streams. Bug 690237, customer 850.
Add one more header type to the list of possible CFF headers. Bug 690256, customer 210.
Process the SMask and any transparency groups it contains without UseCIEColor. This eliminates the dark gray background on the text blocks with the bug 690027 PDF file when -dUseCIEColor is set.
Fix broken bbox device caused by the 'fillpage' commit of rev 9288. This resolves bug 690260 and other cases where the bbox was all 0's.

Revert the patch of 9314 that caused a problem with the Ubuntu bug 160203 (https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ghostscript/+bug/160203). This patch appears to be a fix for a much older (~2004) version of gs and should not be needed as of rev 8161 that resolved segfaults when there is a NULL get_color_mapping_procs pointer. The mapping of 'black' and 'white' is needed to properly allow for non-white painting in the bbox device to avoid 0 0 0 0 BoundingBox.
Fix for improper casting of a byte pointer value to a gx_color_index without considerations for 4 byte boundaries constraints on some systems.
Fix to ensure shading fills do NOT occur in the device color space when we are within a transparency group with a different color space.
Provide proper type casting to gx_color_index when it is read from clist.  This completes the bug fixes for 690157 within the softmask branch.
Fix an potentially uninitialized variable.
Fix fillpage in the x11alpha device.
Fix for confusions relating to number of color, separations, spotcolors, and process colors.  This came about looking at the Pantone.pdf file that has over 100 colorants.
Limit raw debug dump in transparency code to 56 bands. This is the max for viewing with photoshop.
Fix for the soft mask branch to work properly in the presence of spot colors and separation devices.
Fix (pswrite): Incorrect PageBoundingBox comment location
Make the GS_SPLIT_LIBS configure function only recognize -l at the start of an argument, to avoid false positives from hyphens inside linker arguments. Bug 690254.
Continue the the fix from rev. 9384, plug 2 more ways that caused multiple inclusion of page objects into the linearized file. Bug 690140, customer 932.
Fix multiple inclusion of page objects referenced from beads array. Bug 690140, customer 932.
Fix for Segfault with tiffsep devics when a file has more than 64 spot colors and uses transparency. Clean up indentations to C-style. Problem seen with Bug 690157.
Check for and skip null objects (and other junk) in the /Anots array. Bug 690244.

Set max number of possible PDF14 planes to GX_DEVICE_COLOR_MAX_COMPONENTS+1 to account for alpha channel.  Also fix related bug in transparency group color conversion that occurs during the group pop.
Make the content type maps a compile time option (they're not necessary, and take a lot of processing time to maintain). Fix some bugs in the handling of the part hash table.
Fix bugs in hash table implementation.
Revision 8951 missed an important part of the fix for pswrite, emitting a %%PageBoundingBox for each page of the output.
Fix (pswrite): %%BoundingBox comment geenration    (ps2write): media selection and %%BoundingBox generation
Fix SEGV in 'inferno' device caused by insufficient memory allocation. Pass correct device type to prn_device_body() macro. thanks to Wendy for the patch.
Added additional debug output in gdevp14.c related to the pushing and popping of the device color procs.
Fix (pdfwrite): Invalid metadata for PDF/A output
Adding of debug raw buffer dump at pdf14_put_image.
Fix to handle smask with CIE spaces properly to match AR output.
Adding additional debug output for seeing transparency blending group color space.
Fix (pdfopt): Minimum optimised file size changed in Acrobat 9
Fix (pdfwrite)
Fix compilation on Windows NT, which doesn't define LOCALE_IPAPERSIZE.
Check for a null target_info in bbox_image_end_image before trying to free it. Fixes bug 680019.
Fix major rendering problem when blend space is ICC based.
Fix the previous checkin which committed code from a different project breaking the tree.
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 7).
Return 0 when accessing Type1C font table out of range or the table is too short and display a warning if possible. Bug 690050, customer 353.
Revert .outputattrkeys to the list prior to rev 8026 to fix problems with Duplex introduced with that change. Bug 690041.
Fix of pdf14_device ENUM_PTRS_WITH decrement count for case switch default.  Thanks Ray!
Fix a gcc warning in gxshade6.c.
Update of pdf14_device ENUM_PTRS_WITH and RELOC_PTRS_WITH to include the color procs stack.  Also fix for improper description of pointers in color_procs structure for garbage collector.
Fix (pdfwrite): Invalid metadata for PDF/A output
Add "-sstdout=%stderr" to scripts that call gs so that they don't corrupt their own output when outputing to stdout (Thanks to Dan Sheridan (djs at adelard dot com), Ubuntu bug #314439).
Fix (TT font handler) : Wrong glyph posiitions with vertical writing mode (continued).
Fix stackunderflow when specified PAPERSIZE is unknown. Ghostscript will now use the device default page size when PAPERSIZE is unknown.
Fix for overprinting with transparency.  This fixes bugs related to the lack of overprint support when there is transparency present in the file.
Fix (PDF Interpreter): Default Unicode decoding clashing with ToUnicode CMap
Fix (pdfwrite): Missing glyphs in CIDFont causing errors.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : A more explanatory message when a CID font is missing.
Fix sigbus/segfaults on sparc, hppa, etc. Debian bug 453903.
Fixed syntax error in gs.css.
Assorted script fixes.
Fix insecure script in toolbin.
Typo fixes in "gs" man page.
Fix segfault in X device when page size changes.
Fix a problem with Brother 7x0 GDI, contributed to Debian by B. Janssen.
Fix segmentation fault on -sDEVICE=bbox, contributed to Debian by Yaroslav Halchenko.
Debug raw dumping code that I have found useful in my debug of transparency and overprint issues.
Fix (graphics) : Incorrect bounds for clipping list.
Continue to access the stream while reading a string (sgets()) until the string is filled, EOF is reached, or an error occurs. Don't return after first partial read. Bug 690152.
Fix (garbager) : Wrong object marks when the object is freed by a garbager callback.
Script to print out open customer/P1/regression bugs by engineer.
Fix for Bug 689895.  gx_put_blended_image_cmykspot was improperly inverting the alpha channel.
Use a proper destructor to free a file stream when access to the file is not permitted in the safe mode, not just close the file and drop the rest of the file structure. Bug 689975.
Fix 3 last cases of missing prototypes in MS Windows build.
Fix a buffer overflow in base font writer module of pdfwrite defice. Allocate sufficient buffer for the worst case. Bug 690211.
Fix (pdfwrite): Image with SMask fails when inside transparency group.
Fix (pdfwrite): DSC comments interfering with Page Tree Orientation.
Fix (PS interpreter) : The operator 'gstate' leaked memory.
Implement Algorithm 8.1 from PDF 1.6 Reference. Map /BBox of the appearance stream transformed by /Matrix onto the annotation rectangle. Bug 690195, customer 770.
Fix: Problem with /DeviceN [/All].
Change accessors to cmap data to support cmap subtables exceeding 64K-1 bytes. Bug 690206, customer 870.
proper error processing for bug #690203 to detect a true type collection.  The code previously ignored error returns.
Fix a typo in commit r9288 which broke the X11 device build. Bug 690202.
Add the CVS directory to the romfs exclusion list. Bug 690205.
Fix of memory initialization size.
Fixed wrong byte count in memory initialization.
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 6).
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 5).
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 4).
Fix (pdfwrite): Fonts with unusual FontMatrix generating incorrect FontBBox.
Fix (pdfwrite): Tidy up code.

Addition of code to restore device color settings during transparency group pop plus minor bug fixes related to the number of channels and planes when dealing with isolated groups with mismatch color spaces between the groups.
Set standard properties on pdf_main.ps. Bug 690198.

Addition of more debug code plus fixes for a few small issues introduced with addition of transparency group color change.  Currently have a major issue with a mismatch between the device color space and the first (outer) transparency group.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Avoid extra erasepage, part 1.
Fix for weird math issue under AIX that cause problems in glpyh spacing when writing type42 fonts for ps2write and pdfwrite.
Fix (pdfwrite): regression with type 3 fonts using show charpath stroke combinations.
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 3).
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued 2).
Fix (pdfwrite): Large type 1 or 2 fonts caused errors with text.

Check the whole Decode array to detect special cases of identity and inverse decoding. Previous test analyzed every channel separately and misidentified decoding arrays like [0 1 1 0 0 1]. Bug 690178.

Adds special, tolerant to singular matrix processing, to the case when ImageMatrix is differs from the CTM by the translation vector only, which happens in cached character rendering. The patch clears PostScript errors during text rendering with singular CTM. Bug 690179, customer 870.
Ignore /ToUnicode attribute when it points to an object other then a stream. Bug 680138.
Remove some debug print outs in the XPS interpreter. Make zip-file debug tracing depend on a variable.
Fix (pdfwrite): more issues with PDF Text rendering modes.

Use the same name (/PDFType3Untitled) for all Type 3 fonts without /FontName attribute. PDF interpreter doesn't need unique names and the previous attempt to generate unique names didn't work. Bug 689358.

Restore language level after loading pdfwrite.ps for consistency and compatibility with PS utilities. Also pick a few nits that may cause errors if some of start-up files ever loaded in level 1 mode. Thanks to SaGS for the patch. Bug 688151.
Fixed paper tray selection for the PCL 4/5/5e drivers (bug 690182). Works fine now with "-dMediaPosition=..." and for all possible trays. Needs review to see whether it does not break anything else.
Skip everything before 'begincodespacerange' in ToUnicode CMap stream to avoid PostScript errors in CMap headers. PDF interpreter doesn't need any data from the header. Bug 689842, customer 870.
Fixed input tray selection support in the PCL-XL drivers ("pxlmono"/"pxlcolor"), fixes on CUPS filter and PPDs to make input tray selection actually work.
Fix (CID font emulation) : CID from another writing mode rendered a wrong glyph (continued)
The "cups" output device was logging way to much in CUPS' debug logging mode. Moved some logging to debug2.
Add a check for bogus '>>' after 'endstream' to recover files generated by 'Kroll Background Screening'. Bug 690161.
Move validation of the page tree after installation of the decryption handler because access to encrypted xref streams needs decryption. Fix regression introduced by the rev. 8933. Bug 690175.
Fix (pdfwrite): Not considering all glyphs in a string when noting first/last character
Fix (PS interpreter) : Eliminate unuseful transfer of left side bearing to type42_finish.
Fix (TT font handler) : Wrong glyph posiitions with vertical vcriting mode.
Fix PS interpreter: issues with ICCBased spaces
Skip null entries in /Annots array. Bug 690161.
Revert 8.63 behavior where the /Alternate key/value pair in ICCBased param dictionaries is optional. Bug 690165 for customer 850.
fix for conflicting type on gdev_pdf_end_transparency_mask .  Added imager state, as it is needed in pdf14_end_transparency to reset the color mapping procs.
Fix for link failure mistake in lib.mak from addition of file to do color buffer processing in transparency code.
Fix (clist writer) : A crash when transparent object appears over the page top.
Fix (CID font emulation) : CID from another writing mode rendered a wrong glyph (part 2).
Fix (CID font emulation) : CID from another writing mode rendered a wrong glyph (part 1). This revision is incomplete due to a commitment error. Please use next revision.
Clean up of transparency buffer debug dumping.  All now go through a single function when it is enabled.
Fix in raw buffer debug output.
Fixed typo.
Fix (graphics) : A missed dependency in makefile.
Fix (clist interpreter) : A faster procesing without a preliminary clearing of the band buffer.
Fix (pdfwrite): several issues with PaintType 2 (stroked fonts) and PDF Text rendering modes.
Add support for indirect objects in /W and /W2 entries in the CIDFont dictionary. Bug 690151.
Export (i.e. don't undefine) runpdfpagerange procedure for the benefit of PDF manipulation utilities. Bug 690153.
Fix a bug in object stream handling that sometimes dropped incremental updates. Bug 690141.

Fix Floating Point excpetion caused by improper initializer of a private device structure subclassed (in the klunky C ghostscript fashion) from the gx_device_printers_s structure. Restructure a macro in base/gdevprn.h to help prevent similar bit rot in the future.  Bug 690122.

Don't assume that the top of the dictionary stack is writable or can be made writable by allocating a new PDF graphic state. The latter cannot be done in pdfinflt.ps and similar clients. This patch replaces my previous fix (r. 9124) for the bug 690088. Bug 690134.
Ignore named encodings for known symbolic fonts. Bug 690135, customer 580.

Fix for bug 690103.  This issue was introduced with r8868 where spatial interpolation in the source color space was introduced.  The part that was missing in that commit was to handle the case where we had 8 bit image data that was non CIE based and NOT encoded with [0 1] .
Fix (TT font handler) : Properly process a broken TTC header.
Fix a makefile dependency which should have been added in r8872.
Fix (PS intetreter) : Crash in garbager when resetting marks in names table.
Fix (pdfwrite): Conversion of PaintType 0 fonts to text rendering mode 1 sometimes produced incorrect stroke width.
Fix of a missing debug #ifdef.  Getting everything committed before I try to merge trunk changes into the branch.
Search for 'startxref' instead of '%%EOF' in PDF recovery code because '%%EOF' is mangled more ofthen than 'startxref'. Bug 690071, customer 384.
Extend the size of the array for procedures scheduled for binding in DELAYBIND mode to 2000. Prevent an overflow when 3rd party code (such as Ubuntu CJKV patch) binds many new procedures. Bug 690124.
Fixed bug #690032: bjc600/bjc800 drivers do not work with PDF input
Fix a bug in a new reusable stream implementation introduced in rev. 8810. Take into account unread data left in the stream buffer before refilling the buffer. Bug 690090, customers 384, 581, 661.
Fix (clist writer) : Wrong compositor cropping when a shading is entirely clipped out (continued).
Fixes more 64 bit portability problems.  The python format specifier 'L' (Long) is 64 bits and we intended 'I' (Int) which is 32.  Thanks to Hin Tak for spotting some of these.
Fixed several bugs, like crash if input is PDF (bug #690101), duplex not working, ...
Consider /Identity CMap compatible with any CIDFont /Ordering. Bug 690120.
Fix (pdfwrite): ICCBased color spaces in input PDF files, /Alternate space converted to ICCBased in output PDF file.
Fix a whitespace error in a makefile.
Switch file I/O of 'opdfread.ps' to 'strmio' that supports the %rom% file system as well as the default (%os%) file system. Bug 690074.
Fix for bug 689961.
Fix (PS interpreter): .seticcspace leaving operand on stack.

Addition of function to compute the soft mask luminosity value.  The computation is different depending upon if the source buffer data is device gray, device RGB, device CMYK or CIE based.  Also included is some minor debug code for dumping data buffers.
Adds a readme admonishing edits of generated files.  Also documents the required use of forward slashes in directory paths when setting the font path (bug #690015).
Remove spurious un-definition of GlobalSubrs attribute during loading of OpenType CFF fonts as CIDFont resources. Bug 690113, customer 1110.
Scale widget annotations in x and y directions to fit the BBox of the appearance stream into the annotation rectangle. Old code considered y direction only. Bug 690109.
Creation of new branch for fixing of soft mask bugs.

Log: Fix: ps2write. Very large TrueType fonts (>64Kb), when converted to Type 42 fonts for use in PostScript, must contain an /sfnts entry, which is an array of strings comprising the TT font. There are restrictions on where the original data is split to form the strings, which ps2write was not honouring.

Fix Windows stack overflow when NumRenderingThreads > 0. This was identified during testing for bug 690108 (see comments, #1 and #2). This is a work around as it does not address the excessive stack usage, but does work around the problem by throwing memory at it. Bug 690198.
Fix SEGV when NumRenderingThreads > 0 caused by improper clist reader phase initialization. Bug #690108.
Set the temporary value of PDFDEBUG flag using 'gput' procedure instead of 'def' because initial PDF graphic state is represented by a read-only dictionary. Bug 690088.
Process invalid PDF operator QBT as Q BT . Bug 690089, customer 384.
Fix (printer devices) : Allow retries for raster buffer allocation when BufferSpace is default.
Fix (clist writer) : Wrong compositor cropping when a shading is entirely clipped out.
Fix (PS interpreter) : Incorrect data in garbager descriptor for reusable stream state.
Fixes 690087.  Change the behavior of the pcl interpreter to continue instead of returning an error if the font type is not recognized.  No expected differences.
Fix a double fclose().
Fix a gcc warning. Bug 690054.
Remove a spurious $(_I) and add use portable $(D_)...$(_D) for defines as needed by the openvms build. Bug 690084.
Fix typos in third-party library paths introduced in r6514. Bug 690084.
Additional leading space characters before colons in makefiles. Bug 690084.
Space makefile colons for the benefit of VMS. Bug 690084.
Fix: default to MITER line joins in the opvp device. Bug 689079.
Fix: don't treat char as unsigned in the opvp device. Bug 690079.
Fix typo in svg_stroke.
Allocate missing FontInfo dictionary in a matching global or local memory and use .forceput to override read-only status of the font directory. Bug 690063.
Fix : Divide gdevp14.c into 2 modules.
Fix (graphics) : Preovide a right check for incorrect call to pdf14_pop_transparency_group.
Check the return code from pdf_write_resource_objects when closing a page. Fixes Coverity warning.
Fix : gcc compiler warnings (continued).
Fix : gcc compiler warnings.
Fixed small bug in the patch to add a PJL command for setting the resolution to the pxlmono/pxlcolor drivers (rev 9060).

Let pxlmono/pxlcolor drivers add resolution setting to the PJL header. Printers need the PJL command to set the resolution (see bug 689230). Now the printing resolution can be easily controlled with the "-r" command line option.
Fix incorrect error code test in the calculator function validation procedure.
Fix a warning from older versions of gcc. Spotted by Russell Lang when doing OS/2 build. Oddly, newer versions of gcc don't spot this, even though the code was technically redundant.

Make PDF interpreter run our /Install procedure after the user's procedure because: (1) PDF interpreter caches the CTM, (2) the user's procedure may replace CTM by calling setmatrix. Bug 689914, customer 770.
Fix (PS interpreter) : Wrong dependencies in makefile.
Fix gcc warning on OS/2.
