Fix the OS/2 build after the source reorganization. Remove the os2pm device and the old DLL interface for OS/2, to avoid direct links from the graphics library into the PS interpreter.
Replace 3d with 3rd in the documentation and regularize '3(r)d party' as 'third-party'. Bug 690004.
Fix some code style issues in the svgwrite device.
Update warnings policy; we agreed to fix all warnings.
Fix more html conformance problems with the documentation.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Implementing a temporary option for development needs of images with soft mask.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : A wrong comment about procedure operands for is_big_mask .
Fix (graphics) : Scanline algorithm missed pixels at horizontal boundaries.
Fix 6 Coverity warings about local variables hiding function arguments by renaming local variables.
Fix a code separation issue: int.mak and psromfs.mak are in PSSRC.
Fix a code separation issue: expat.mak declares itself to be in GLSRC.
Add copyright and description banners to the xps and svg code. Bug 690008.
Fix some more Coverity warnings
Fix memory and file handle leaks in the unix persistent cache error handling. Also document that it is not re-entrant.
Fix __func__ on the default (non-C99) gcc build.
Add the svgwrite device to the default windows build. Bug 690028.
Fix a bug in error checking code introduced in the rev. 8996 in pamcmyk32 device. Bug 689583.
Check return values from all stdio functions in all pnm drivers and propagate error codes upwards. Bug 689583.
Add one more NMAKE version recognized as MSVC 7. Bug 689816, customer 351.
Work around a bug in a PDF file produced by "Nitro PDF Driver". Assume invalid operator '-' to be a number 0. Bug 690012,

Fix parsing of large embedded TrueType fonts by ps2write header: (1) read the file into multiple strings for sfnts array. (2) use multiple reads to skip over large parts of the file. Also modify Type42 font reader to allow TrueType objects to span sfnts string boundaries. Bug 690012.
Fix some ChangLog typos.

The selected pen must be set explicitly during initialization. Calling the command to select the pen is not correct as it tests the pen's state value resulting in an uninitialized read.  This fix may address recent reports of fts.0740 failing in the cluster regression reports.
Fix: Genoa file renders incorrectly with current color code
Fix (PS interpreter) : Wrong glyph positions with CIDFontType 2 WMode 1.
Fix (TT interpreter) : AVector bug workaround was wrong.
Fix (graphics) : A clist-based pattern supplied a wrong clipping box.
Fix single '~' expansion in generic POSIX persistent-cache implementation.
Fix a potential crash after failed memory allocation in RAM-based command list.
Fix a typo in get_data() macro used by PDF 1.4 composition devices because the typo caused dependency on the side effect order.
Add a --disable-cairo option to block linking to libcairo for packagers. Bug 689999.

Fix 'rangecheck in showpage' with NumRenderingThreads>0 if the lines requeested do not range from 0 forward or height-1 backwards. Bug from customer 531 and 850. Also fix problems with reversion to non-multithreaded rendering with file and memory based BAND_LIST_STORAGE.
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist (continued),
XML debug printing fix.
A pointer to allocated memory was used before checking it for 0. This bug was discovered by Klocwork static code analyzer.
Fix (graphics) : Redundant patterns in clist.
Fix (graphics) : Memory leak from Indexed color space.
As of rev 8928 the palette data is freed by the graphics library. Fixes 689990.
Detect and reject PDF files with circular references in the page tree. Avoid an infinite loop. Bug 689954.
Fix (graphics) : A slow stroking with big patterns.
Fix (graphics) : Memory leak from Indexed color space.

Fix the OS/2 build, which was broken because it was trying to use the Windows synchronisation code. While OS/2 does support thread synchronsation, there is no ghostscript implementation for the OS/2 platform, and no interest in writing one.
Reduce heap size limit (/Zm) on MSVC6 to fix internal compiler error when COMPILE_INITS=1.
Fix problem with NumRenderingThreads>0 with devices that request data from the bottom up such as the 'bmp*' devices. Bug 689985.
Add support to NULL pointers in t_structs or t_astructs objects to execstack operator. Thanks to Ken for the analysis. Bug 689535.
Avoid a segfault with invalid ccitt fax data streams. Bug 689917. Patch from Tim Waugh.

Fix for Bug 689983.  This was introduced with the source space interpolation code.  Fixes indexing direction in source data when we have indexed data, interpolation and a negative xx value in the geometric transformation.
Fix a syntax error from r8548.
Fix extraction of the default subfile from PDF file collection on save level 0. Export the file name as a PS name from PDF interpreter instance to protect the name from restore. Bug 689981.
Fix (clist writer) : Improve the logic about zero tile id.
Fix (printer) : A check for buffer space overflow was dramatically overestimated.
Fix (shading) : Empty clipping was entirely lost.
Fix (clist) : Skip writing unuseful data with linear color triangle.
Fix (True Type font loader) : Can't work around unsorted 'loca' when 'loca' is not loaded.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : A temporary work around huge images with a soft mask.
Fix direct access to a subfile in the %rom% file system by reusable stream. Bug 689976, customers 661, 580.
Use reusable stream when the data stream of type 0 function doesn't fit into a string. Bug 689978, customer 770.
Fix source style warnings from the nightly regression.
Clean up of // comment in code and debug ifdef that should have been removed for r8868
Fix some compile problems in Brian Gladman's AES implementation and disable 'on the fly keying' routines we don't need.

Fix for Bug 689246.  When performing interpolation, the interpolation is now performed in the source colorspace as opposed to the device space.  Custom color callback is no longer bypassed by direct concretization as it was previously.

Fix possible use of uninitialized variable 'mem_space'. Compute the value when no-transparency is in effect prior to adding in the space needed for transparency. Thanks to Michael Vrhel for spotting this.
Fix (graphics) : Write tile id into a pattern clist (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite): limit checking of CIDfonts for 'fixed width' property.
Fix (graphics) : Write tile id into a pattern clist.

Wrap string data source into a procedure when /ImscaleDecode filter is installed, to ensure repeated reading of the string when the imagemask needs more data than has the string. Allocate new composite objects with the same global status as old ones. Bug 689889, customer 330.
Fix for Seg fault caused by wrap around of an unsigned long. Seen at 600 dpi to pkmraw with Bug689369.pdf and -dBufferSpace=32000000.

Partially fixes bug #689967 (test file fts.0810 returning -15).  The report claims there are other errors, local regression testing indicates fts.0810 is the only file affected by this particular change.  The configure image data parameters for long form were not being properly ignored when pcl is configured to allow color conversion to occur in the device (the default).  Also removes a ranting comment.

Update documentation to describe multi-threaded rendering (NumRenderingThreads) and improve the documentation about the clist/banding parameters and the effect on performance. Addresses issues raised in bug 689668.
Write pure white as a background in the pngalpha device. Bug 689934.
Fix (transparency) : A mask buffer could left unreleased due to banding.
Ignore out-of-range UniqueID in embedded Type 1 PDF fonts. Bug 689973.
Remove the obsolete pnga device. Bug 689971.
Cache the pattern instance in the PDF pattern object to prevent reprated pattern instantiation and improve performance. Bug 689896, customer 531.
Allows the Epson AcuLaser device output to be sent to a pipe (closes bug 689953).

Rop devices now require access to an allocator instance.  Fixes crash in running pxl fts file T326.BIN with a halftoning device.  The bug was reported by a potential customer and a bugzilla report was never filed.

Use /.notdef instead of null in the array of PostScript names of TTF glyphs. This saves the trouble of checking for null values and fixes a case where a null entry slipped through. Bug 689962, customer 384.

TrueType instruction definitions (IDEF) are addressed by a single byte index. So there cannot be mode than 256 different instructions. Nevertheless, a request a for larger array for instruction definitions should not be a fatal error. Bug 689960, customer 330.
Use '%PDF-' instead of '%PDF-1.' to recognize PDF files because PDFsharp 0.8.2 generates '%PDF-0.0' and Acrobat accepts this. Bug 689949, customer 384.
Fix warnings from the JPX decoder when using Visual Studio 9.
Fix (pdfwrite): Images ina DeviceN space with more than 60 inks caused a crash.
Fix address/value problem. How this ever seemed to work, who knows. Thanks to Matthias Kilian for this patch.
Fix a bug in the error recovery code that handles invalid font streams. Bug 689936, customer 661.
Parse common color space keys in JPXDecode filtered images and pass them to the filter, allowing JPX-encoded CMYK images to display properly. Fixes bug 688807.
fixes bug #689908.  The select pen command has the side effect of drawing the current path only if the pen state changes.  Minor pixel differences noted in
Fix a hang in s_jpxd_process. Bug 688807.
Fix (clist writer) : Indeterminizm writing a degenerate curve.
Fix (clist writer) : The maximal compositor command size was wrong.
Document the output filename behavior of ps2pdf in the manpage. Bug 689920.

We did not anticipate having to use HP's obsolete Master Symbol List (MSL) in PCLXL.  However, the builtin lineprinter font provided by Monotype is encoded with MSL.  Fixes bug #689905.  No changes expected in the regression tests.

Ghostpcl revision 3094 exposed a new problem in the PCLXL cet, there was no protection against infinite recursion of streams.  This fixes the test file E601.bin which has shown up in regression reports since rev. 3094.

Add one more way to store data of the reusable stream: an array of strings. Read the input stream into an array of strings during reusable stream construction and use the array directly as a data storage. Bug 689476, customer 190.
Make /?dblacute and /?hungarumlaut glyph names equivalent in Type 1 fonts. Add a missing glyph when the font is loaded if another glyph is defined. Bug 689014, customer 580.
Fix some missing prototypes.
Fix compile problem on MSVC (in strict C, declarations must precede any executable statememts).
Use extended name table by default and adjust the settings to have up to 1M names of up to 1K characters long. Bug 689913.
Fixed compile for Linux.
Fix (graphics) : Clean image enumerator before releasing it.
Fix (TT interpreter) : A work around a wrong maxPoints.

Fixes indeterminism in C307.BIN reported last in cluster regression report ghostpcl-r3086+8793.  The pen was not properly set for the TextPath operator.  The non deterministic behavior in C307.BIN was the result of stroking with a pattern that had been deleted.  Setting the pen fixes this.  We also add a heuristic to check for marking a page to the TextPath operator resulting in progressions for E104.BIN and E102.BIN.
Undoing change introduced in rev 8794.  This change will need to occur after Bug 689889 is handled.   rev 8749 introduced 37 differences in the regression.

For bug 689888.  This fixes the hang in the while loop.  If end of file occurs during the reading of the stream it is passed along by the filter.  However, proper output does not occur due to a different issue.  Another bug was opened related to this postscript noncompliance of string reading reuse in imaging operators.  See 689889.
Use a dictionary (instead of an array) to represent cmap table in a TrueType font because the array cannot accept fonts that have both 0x0 and 0xFFFF codes. Bug 689136, customer 870.
Fix (stroking) : Prevent unpainted gaps between neighbour strokes that could appear due to stroke adjustment.
Replace incorrect FontMatrix in CFF CIDFont with a most common value to recover a PDF file that Acrobat 8 manages to shows correctly. Bug 688517.
Add work-around for PDF files that misspell 'endobj' as 'endjobj'. Bug 689876.
Dom't interpret ^D (0x04) as a self-delimeted character in PDF mode because PDF doesn't need this hack. Bug 689875.
Fix (True Type font loader) : Work around incorrect numGlyphs (continued).
Fix a typo introduced in the rev. 8146 that prevented running PDF files from stdin. Bug 689847.
Fix to enable proper custom color callback when indexed images with ICC profiles are used.  Bug 689863.
Addition of debug code to dump embedded ICC profiles for external analysis.
Enable printafm to emit a comment with UniqueID, that may be of some use when investigating versions of fonts used. Thanks to Michail Vidiassov for the patch. Bug 688610.
Work around broken JBIG2Decode streams created by several versions of Xerox WorkCentre. Bugs 689841 and 689852.
Work around broken streams created by Xerox WorkCentre products, where the final segment length is written as -1. Ghostscript bug 689841.
Fix : MSVC warnings.
Fix (True Type font loader) : Work around incorrect numGlyphs.
Revert the rev. 8509 because it is not needed after rev. 8774 but interferes with FONTPATH search and memory font resources. Bug 689637.
Continue the changes started by the rev. 8772. Remove one more definefont from embedded TrueType font loader. Bug 689644, customer 243.
Change all shell scripts to treat a single dash '-' as a positional parameter rather than an option. Bug 689846.

Use embedded PDF fonts directly. Don't define them as resources and look them up later by the name. Leave findfont operator for fetching non-embedded fonts only, which are now unaffected by embedded fonts. Bugs 689510, 689514 from customer 700.

Change parameters to gdev_prn_allocata_mesmory to explicit width and height to work around a (suspected) bug in gdev_prn_allocate when new_width and new_height are 0 and the page has transparency. That issue will be adddressed separately. Crash with multi-threaded rendering reported by customer #850.
Fix for 689811.  Enables custom color callback when banding of images is occurs.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : The missed flex hewristic malfunctioned.
Fix the autoconf build when libcairo isn't available.
fix 689828.  PCL pixel encoding mode has the side effect of setting bits per index to 8.  Progression noted in cet file 22-05.BIN page 14 and 16.
Consider Index object in CFF font as empty if the offset element size is incorrect. Bug 689854, customer 580.
Permit opening of temporary files in the safe mode. Fix /invalidaccess error during interpretation of PDF 1.7 file collections in the safe mode. Bug 689847.
Ignore annotation appearance stream when it has a wrong type i.e. not a dictionary. Bug 689839.
Replace various access techniques to PDF annotations with 'knownoget' in preparation to fix the bug 689839.
Use PDFScanRules to scan ToUnicode CMap. Fix a case where CMap stream has a name starting with 2 slashes that should not be parsed as an immediately evaluated name. Bug 689642, customer 870.
Fix for previous commit.  I had the wrong version number test in the define.
Fix an incorrect curveto coordinate.

Reduce generation of garbage and the time spent on garbage collection by placing gstate into the 2nd element of the patterm implementation array in Adobe compatibility mode only. Ghostscript doesn't use this gstate at all. Bug 689488.

Finally fixing bug #689159.  HPGL/2 beziers were not properly joined to other path segments.  The fix depends on previous patches and upgrade is recommended to address the bug.  The following regression tests had trivial pixel differences or progressions:
Fix a bug that leaves a junk value on the stack for every empty row on the page during execution of a redefined showpage. Bug 689832.
Ignore OutputIntent attribute if it is not an array; recover a broken PDF file. Bug 689831.

Fix missing dependency that caused builds that included the 'bmpa' devices to fail because the locking memory code wasn't included. Currently PCL builds still had the bmpa devices included, so they failed.
uncodes 33 and 34 repeat a zero code length symbol id, not the previous symbol like runcode 32. Bug 689824.
Windows build fixes. Patch from Ghostscript trunk.
Reject incorrect ICC profile that has 0 offset in one of the tags and use alternate color space. Bug 689830.

Use 'realtime' instead of 'usertime' for -Z: timing information. On some systems (Windows) these are equivalent, but on linux, 'usertime' is the time for the current thread which interferes with timing collection on different threads (multi-threaded rendering did not include any time for the threads). INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE, but this is only debug info.
Fix MSVC warning -- mismatched type.
Fix gcc warnings, unused variables and type mismatch, implicit declaration.
Fix memory leak observed with DEBUG=1 build on mtrender branch. The 'levels' and 'bit_data' of halftones were being leaked when halftones were set by the clist reader.
Fix compiler warning due to missing prototype for strncmp.
Fix (graphics) : Wrong pattern phase when pattern applies to a band with non-zero origin.
Fix (graphics) : Imprecise pattern phase with negative cell origins (continued).
Repait yet another broken PDF file that abbreviates /Indexed to /I in the color space array. Bug 689815.
Fix and simplify implementation of operator Q. Collecting the path with the current ctm and re-playing it with the restored ctm transforms the path exactly as PDF needs. Bug 689812.

Eliminate leaks caused by lost 'maskbuf' elements. Only the uppermost maskbuf is (currently) used by the pop_transparency_group that applies the mask, but the chain of maskbuf->maskbuf elements was never freed. This also improves performance (at least for the test case of bug 689534). Customer #870.

Fix re-opening a file for write, so that existing file is opened instead of cloning an instance. Also add code to clean up a cloned 'log_blk' chains if they were created because the memfile was compressed. Fixes a SEGV on multi-page files when BAND_LIST_STORAGE=memory.
Fix (graphics) : Imprecise pattern phase with negative cell origins.

Eliminate leaks detected during rendering bands. The pdf14 device was leaking 'maskbuf' elements and the 'ht' logic was leaking 'levels' and 'bit_data' elements, per component, of the 'order'. Other leaks detected will be opened as bugs.

Add more debug statements for error conditions and make some informational debug output conditional on -Z: (gs_debug[':']). Add timing information collection and reporting per thread for -Z:. Collection of thread timing is only for DEBUG builds to prevent slowing down release builds with the gp_usertime calls.

Add debug_dump facility to the chunk memory wrapper to allow for leak detection. Also add a 'sequence' element to the object header in chunks so that a debugger conditional breakpoint can be used to trigger on the allocation of a leaked object.
Fix various code policy warnings.
Fix some warnings.
Fixed issue with NULL pointer in gsncdummy.c when ICC color space was used in custom color callback.  Also, made the object based coloring an option define and fixed minor header issues.
Fix some warnings.

Fix for bug 689806 which was introduced when fixing bug 689803.  The current bug was related to a CIELAB image with a colorspace ICC profile (LAB to LAB).  The image data was incorrectly being normalized between 0 and 1 (float). It is now properly normalized to the range of the CIELAB ICC space.  There still exists an issue with this file as absolute colorimetry should be used.  This is the source of the current difference between AR and GS.  However, the image is no longer black now but should match the GS result prior to rev 8664.

Fixes 689699.  Curves should have beveled joins.  Actually we had a comment documenting what should be done but no associated code.  I did not look to see if it was mistakenly removed.  Unfortunately this change has small effects on many tests.  A large sample of differing tests (not all) were spot checked.
Make pf2afm utility friendlier to Windows users: check for .pfa or .pfb extensions case-insensitively and accept backslash as a path separator. Bug 689804.
Refine calculation of di member of a trap_line structure to avoid integer overflow when the source operands are big. Bug 689448.
Fix a minor header dependency skew.
Implement spacial handling of transfer functions during Gray to CMYK conversion: ignore transfer functions for non-black components. Bug 688360.
Check the error code early. Fix a SEGV in PDF file with invalid ICC profile that was introduced by the rev. 8664.
Fix for bug#689803.  Set bounds correctly when input data is LAB and color also includes a colorspace source profile (e.g. LAB to LAB).
Fix initialization of 'stable_memory' element in the allocator.
Fix (graphics) : Convert imagemask into a clipping path when painting a big pattern.

Since we always write a complete "classic" xref, the Trailer may need to be adjusted: (1) remove keys that pertain to xref-streams and hybrid-xref PDFs; (2) if it's a PDF stream, turn it into a PDF dict by removing keys used for PDF streams (both standard and GS-specific), and the executable attribute. Thanks to SaGS for the patch. Bug 688152.
Changes limit of undocumented vendor unique attribute.  Fixes 689797, no expected differences.
Ignore DSC comments in nested EPS files and data blocks. Thanks to William Bader for the patch. Bug 689791.
Skip bogus endobj operators inside the object stream. Bug 689795, customer 870.

Fix a problem when the default transfer function of the target printer is not in global space. Seen with Konica Minolta (QMS PostScript). Fixes 'invalidaccess' error caused by attempting to store a 'local' currentcolortransfer into a 'global' array. NB: The 'cp2g' will then convert the array to global which is needed to store into InitialExtGState.
Add diagnostic information for start of rendering (Outputpage start) so that parsing as well as rendering time can be observed with -Z: (gs_debug[':'])
Fix PDF transmuting utilities. Remove '#' from the list of characters that may occur in PDF names unescaped. Bug 689770.
Implement loading of OpenType CFF font as a CIDFont resource in PDF reader. Bug 689763, customers 531, 850.
Use -O0 with the autoconf debug build instead of -O which seems to hide some symbols.
Repair broken CFF CIDFont stream generated by "Exstream Dialogue Version 6.2.004m (DBCS)". Bug 689753, customer 353.
Fixed Colorspace enumeration order for debug printing.
Increase the static command and path buffers in echogs to deal with longer build paths. Bug 689788.
Use the correct GEN directory references. Bug 689788.
Fix (PDF interpreter): Improve omission of .notdef glyphs.
Fix (PDF interpreter): Optionally omit rendering of /.notdef glyphs from TrueType fonts.
Avoid a spurious warning "CS/cs (setcolorspace) operand not a name". Acept array values for /CS attribute. Bug 689738.
We no longer have any outstanding port requests. Bug 689745.
Use operator .execn to keep the operand stack size and .pdfcount value consistent during /BuildChar execution. Operator scn depends on the correct value of .pdfcount. Bug 688796.
Fix PDF empty stack count (pdfemptycount) in the tiling pattern. Operator scn depends on the correct value of pdfemptycount. This bug was introduced in the rev. 8308. Bug 689776.
Remove duplicate 'config-clean' target that caused 'clean' target to fail. Thanks to Michael for the patch. Fixes bug 689784.
Fix (pdfwrite): Incorrect cmap aubtables written for 'non-symbolic' TrueType  fonts, when PDF/A output is enabled.
Fix (pdfwrite): code tidy up.
Include stdlib.h for malloc and free in the rinkj device. Bug 689780.
Fix incorrect scanline length calculation in 1 bit/component images on pswrite and epswrite devices. The bug was introduced in rev. 8233. Bug 689771, customer 73.
Do not invoke the s_jpxd_template set_defaults method if it is null. Fixes bug 689743, whose attachment segfaults with the luratech decoder for which this method is not implemented.
Fix (graphics) : Stroke width was wrong for short segments.
Fix (graphics) : rectfill applied a wrong path adjustment.
Improve detection of transparency usage. Search for transparency featires in the resource chain of annotattion appearance streams. Bug 689764, customer 531.
Fix (pdfwrite): endstream/endobj not always emitted PDF/A compliant.
Replace florin with adieresis.  This is the second encoding problem found with our lineprinter font.  This fixes 689675 but an exhaustive test of all the characters in the font is needed.
Fix (vector device): Operation order could result in failure to apply clipping.

PDF font descriptor may be shared between CID and simple fonts. We cache the font object in the font descriptor dictionary. To prevent collision, use different keys to store font and CIDFont objects. Improve the fix for the bug 689301.
Fix (clist writer) : Smaller tiles for strip_copy_rop (continued).
Fix (vector device): %pipe% IO device being opened as seekable (continued).
Fix (clist writer) : Smaller tiles for strip_copy_rop.
Enter PCL Mode should not be executed in macro mode.  This is part of fixing 689747, no differences in local regression testing.
Fixes a compiler warning caused by the previous change.  No expected differences.
Note an error location so it can be seen with -Z#.  This is related to fixing 689747.  No expected differences.
Fix (Windows application) : Provide a better visual trace support interface for use with other interpreters.
Fix (pdfwrite): pdfwrite embedded TrueType/Type 42 fonts which specifically forbid embedding.
Fixes a compiler error in MSVC.  int32_t is defined in system headers on many unix boxes so it was not noticed earlier.  Thanks to Leo for reporting this.
Fix (vector device): %pipe% IO device being opened as seekable.
Handle TT fonts that have short post table with less than 256 glyphs. Pad the generated Encoding vector with /.notdef glyphs. Bug 689515, customer 700.
Work around a bug in the PS interpeter by not using nulldevice in the PDF interpreter where it isn't really needed. Bug 689751.
Install a 16x16 spot halftone when initializing the device. We should be able to specify the halftone somewhere, but leaving that for later. Solves the immediate problem of bug 689343.
Rearrange XPS parser init/deinit code to allow multiple jobs to run in sequence. Fixes bug #689744.
Fixed duplexing for ljet3d and ljet4d devices; thanks to karsten@sengebusch.de for the changes.
Fix (graphics) : A bug in the pattern color serialization.
Fix (graphics) : Optimize filling a path with a shading color (continuewd 3).

Fix MSVC makefile for the 'Big console mode EXE' case when COMPILE_INITS=1. Also minor cleanup to gs.mak 'clean' target and redundant dependency in ugcclib.mak. MSVC build problem noted by customer #531.

When the font has no /FontBBox but provides character width through /Metrics dictionary, use them instead of the calculated width. The old code did so only when both the width and side bearings were defined. Bug 689740, customer 353.
Fix divide by zero when CLIST_THREADS=1 when page mode rendering caused by the previous fix.
Fix (transparency) : Transparency compositor device recreation was incorrect.
Fix (bbox device) : box_fill_path needs as path for shfill.
Correct a default return value. Follow on to Bug 689569.
Remove notice about 64 bit problems which were fixed some time ago.
Fix SEGV when the 'big pattern' clist logic is used.
Fix (clist) : Some transparency compositor commands don't need CTM.
Fixes 689659, replaces "o acute" with "em dash" in the font.
Fix (clist) : Crop transparency commands while clist writing, step 4.
Fix (images) : Revert an unintentional change to siscale.c .
Fix (clist) : Crop transparencsy commands while clist writing, step 3.
Fix (clist) : Crop transparencsy commands while clist writing, step 2.
Fix (clist) : Crop transparencsy commands while clist writing, step 1b.
Fix (clist) : Crop transparencsy commands while clist writing, step 1a.
Fix (clist) : Crop transparencsy commands while clist writing, step 1.
Fix for compression always falling back to no compression in pclxl_write_image_data(), bug 689732.
Fix properties
Fix $Id: keyword line
Fix $Id keyword line.
Fix (pdfwrite): problems with type 3 fonts executing 'show'.
Fix (pdfwrite): problems with type 3 fonts executing 'show'.
Fix the gs revision and pl version string for the ghostpdl 1.52 release.
Fix typo that caused unbalanced 'q' 'Q' operators in PDF's (caused by rev 8501). Bug 689728.
Fixes for COMPILE_INITS=1. Tested on Windows and linux with AFS and UFST font scalers. Note that this requires/expects gs rev 8558.
Fix COMPILE_INITS=1. Note the next commit to the PCL tree will combine with this one, but we can't commit to both trees atomically.
Attempt to repair invalid embedded TT fonts without cmap table. Bug 689707, customer 531.
Fix re-opening the clist files when reverting to single threaded mode. Also Handle PageCount which is a dynamic value to fix problems with multi-page files.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improve transparency performance, step 4a.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improve transparency performance, step 4.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improve transparency performance, step 3.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improve transparency performance, step 2.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improve transparency performance, step 1.
Change the decimal separator in generated strings to '.' effectively selecting a C numeric locale without calling any locale functions. Bug 689624.
Remove a space betveen -f and a file name to prevent parsing of the file name that starts with '-' as an options. Bug 689682.
Add a check for null value. Since rev. 6956 following Adobe implementation Ghostscript doesn't accept null as a key in dictionary look-up. Bug 689696.
When the values of the color key mask exceed the valid range clip them to the nearest valid values and continue. Don't discard the mask as we did before. Bug 689717, customer 580.
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 8).
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 7).
Fix link errors in the file descriptor-based implementation of file streams. Move function used by both fd and stdio implementations to a separate file and compile it in both versions. Bug 688918.
Fix typo that caused Cygwin build to fail if 'fontconfig' package was present.
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 6).
Fix (FAPI) : Embedded fonts didn't work (continued).
Fix (FAPI) : Embedded fonts didn't work.
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 5).
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 4).
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 3).
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued 2).
Fix for regressions introduced with rev 8526. Some resolutions of CMYK, 1-bit per component devices that had CMYK colors and Gray colors had strange dithers. Bug 689706.
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image (continued).
Include 12 and 16 bit image support as part of the core graphics library. Bug 689688.
Fix (pdfwrite): problems with unusual PDF text rendering modes.
Manipulate matrix stack directly instead of using gsave/grestore for PathFigure.Transform. Fixes disappearing graphics when PathFigure.Transform is present.
Fix (images) : Improve coordinate precision when scaling an image.
Always use non-zero winding rule for Glyphs that are rendered using a char path. Fixes rendering errors when glyphs overlap in fts_25 and fts_28.
Fix a stupid typo in reading uncompressed TIFF data strips. Should fix most TIFF image errors we have been seeing in XPS test files.
Modify pdf_info utility to match the changes in PDF interpreter interface. Bug 689680.
Fix (graphics) : Interpolated images were shifed in a half of source pixel.
Fix ColorValues parameter problem when device has total number of bits (depth) of more than 31 bits, resulting in a "rangecheck" (-15) error.
Fix typo that caused line joins to be confused with line caps.
Adjust dash offset by stroke width. Fixes rendering error in fts_06 page 8.
Fix (graphics) : Optimize filling a path with a shading color (continued 2).
Fix (TT): Ignore broken post 2.0 table generated by "Windows Type 1 Installer".
Fix (graphics) : Optimize filling a path with a shading color (continued).
Fix (graphics) : Optimize filling a path with a shading color.
Fix: ignore the embedded font resource when PDF interpreter resolves      the unembedded font resource.
Fix (TT): Fix a bug in /getinterval_from_stringarray
Fix (clist & transparency) : Improve the compositor queue logic (continued).
Fix (clist & transparency) : Improve the compositor queue logic.
Fix (transparency) : Memory leak after an image with soft mask.
Fix (Font renderer) : Horizontal metrics sometimes applied with WMode 1 fonts.
Fix (clist & transparency) : Inconsisting compressed color index info.
Fix (DSC parser) : Avoid a structure type name duplicate.
Fix (patterns) : The clipping was wrong with antrivial pattern matrix (continued).
Fix (patterns) : The clipping was wrong with antrivial pattern matrix.
Fix (pdfwrite): Wrong format string for pprintg.
Fix (shadings) : A memory deallocation problem.
Added HP's KRGB patch for improved control of true black text printing on color printers with HPIJS. Bug #689065 (Ubuntu LP: #69905) is fixed in this updated version of the patch.
Fix (save/restore) : Remove gs_ref_memory_s::inherited.
Fix (save/restore) : Do not create invisible save levels.
Only report the ICC Profile colorspace when the jasper library's debug level is above zero. Bug 689662.
Fix (save/restore) : Compact the changes list against big memory leak.
Explicitly close CMap files opened during CMap-CIDFont font enumeration. On certain systems file handles were used up before GC freed inaccessible handles causing PostScript errors. Bug 689594.
Add redefinition of setpagedevice to ps2epsi utility to support PS files that call setpagedevice. Bug 689650.
Rename variables according to the names used in the formulas in the SVG spec. Fix bug where the translation component of the final matrix used when drawing arc segments was wrong. Solves bug 689482.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 6.
Fix (visual trace) : Add a single pixels painting operation.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Comment-only change: remove obsolete reference to MS-DOS limitations and mention that PDF interpreter passes un-escaped font names to PS level. Bug 689651.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 5.
Fixed umlauts (maybe, am having trouble testing the results).
Fix (pdfwrite): Tidy up after the prior patch, algorithmically this is the same as before.
Don't ignore xref stream in a hybrid  "classic xref" + "stream xref" file as PDF 1.5-compatible should do. Thanks to SaGS for the patch. Bug 688282.
Replace clearly invalid generation numbers out of 0..65535 range with 0 during rebuilding of xref table. Bug 689634.

Add a flag that marks PDF text rendering mode 3 to avoid confusion with other non-rendering text operations such as stringwidth. This avoids unnecessary calculation of the current point, which fails when the CTM is singular. This patch continues conservative approach to the text rendering modes started in rev. 4006. Bug 689614, customer 384.

Don't try to obtain the bounding box of a glyph when FontBBox is invalid and CTM is singular. Set an empty box and consider it valid. The bounding box is not used when the CTM is singular. Bug 689614, customer 384.
Remove the ARCH_CAN_SHIFT_FULL_LONG define and its derivatives. Bug 689611.

Fixes several issues associated with bug #689598.  pcl6_gcc.mak now initializes FPU_TYPE and adopts similar warning and code generation options from gs.  In pxvalue.c:real32at the compiler did not generate the expected code with -O2 optimization.  We suspect this is because the code was not compliant with C99 strict aliasing rules but don't know for sure.  The procedure has been replaced with a "legal" equivalent.  No differences expected on 32 bit regression tests.
Fix (jbig2dec): The global data stream for a JBIG2 image in a PDF file was being released, and the data freed by the garbage collector, before the data was used.
Ignore operator readonly when it is applied to a wrong type inside an embedded Type 1 font. Bug 689617, customer 580.
Treat the text after empty ASCII block in PFB stream as ASCII sub-stream terminated by 0x80 character, a presumed header of the next block. Bug 689617, customer 580.
Fix (pdfwrite): Font Descriptors for fonts not embedded, due to EmbedAllFonts=false, did not preserve the original font name.
Fix (pdfwrite): PDFXTrimBoxToMediaBoxOffset used the supplied data incorrectly.
Fix (transparency) : Providing a right nested masks logic (continued).
Improve outline pdfmarks produced by the pdf interpreter. Add page number and view values. Thanks to Leon Bottou for the patch. Bug 689599.

Fixes 689609.  The double byte hpgl parsing implementation was completely wrong.  This commit is a quick fix for the implementation, but generally the hpgl/2 label code should be rewritten.  The customer motivating the fix is regression testing, we do not have tests that exercise this fuctionality.  No differences expected in our regression testing.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Improving debug trace about compositors.
Don't skip space characters after eexec in embedded PDF fonts but continue to do so in other cases. Bug 689615.
Work around a GCC 4.2.1 bug on PowerPC that generates incorrect code in the release build affecting scanning of binary tokens containing floating point numbers. Bug 689586.
Added casts to sprintf debugging statements (thanks for Michael Rutter for finding these).
Align the pointer to gx_clist_state array in gx_device_clist_writer device to the natural boundary to avoid misaligned memory access and bus errors on ARM processors. Bug 689600.
Fix (transparency) : Providing a right nested masks logic.
Fix (transparency) : Unwinding the nested masks logic.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 4.
Fix for SEGV when more than 4 colorants used with psdcmyk device. Bug 689457 for customer #460.
Store the posix persistent cache's last modified line as an unsigned long to avoid portability problems when reading and writing. Bug 689604.
Fix (jbig2dec): Missing support for decoding multiple symbols from a symbol dictionary, when using refinement/aggregation.
Fix a compilation error on Tru64's native cc, which doesn't tolerate spaces between -I and the directory. Thanks to M. Rutter for the patch. Bug 689602
Fix (jbig2dec): Missing support for decoding multiple symbols from a symbol dictionary, when using refinement/aggregation.

Use a smaller buffer for eexecDecode filter to avoid consumption of the data that follow a short (and incorrect) run of 0's in PS files generated by Adobe Acrobat from PDF files with usage restrictions. Bug 689577

Fixes 689582.  Apparently, the formlines feature was disabled to fix a problem.  Minor visual changes are noted in cet 22-09.BIN, 22-15.BIN, 25-06.BIN, C705.bin which has been opened as a new bug 689601.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 3.

Fixes #689589.  HP printer implementations appear to return the cursor to the "home" position upon entering an overlay macro.  This behavior is not specified in the documentation.  In addition to fixing the test file in the bug report progressions are noted in PCL5C CET files 22-09.BIN and 25-06.BIN with this change.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 2.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Skip idle compositors, step 1.
Let CUPS filters use buffered input to Ghostscript via '-_', to work around bug #689577.
Fixes 689587.  The jpeg device was mistakenly identified as a halftone device.  This should not have any effect on regression testing.
Fix (shadings) : Optimize fill_linear_color_scanline with analitic computation of the color change position.
Fixes bug: -Z89 produced slightly mangled output (-Z9 output inserted in the middle of a line of -Z8 output).
The vertical substitution boolean was not initialized properly for hpgl/2.  PCL and XL initialize it explicitly.  Doesn't fix any known problem and should not result in testing differences.
Fix (shadings) : Optimize path manipulations for shading fill (continued).
Use environment variables to enable some debug tracing and to save deobfuscated font data to file.
Document the jasper build file version skew menioned in Bug 689570.
Fix #defines when USE_COMPRESSED_ENCODING == 0 so that the number of components, separable/linear and encode/decode values are correct. Also add checking for TIFF file larger than max_long.
Fix CIEBasedA problem, add DeviceGray and DeviceRGB support to this utility.
Also install gdevdsp.h in the unix so build. This header contains the callback definitions for the "display" device. Bug 689576.
Fix (graphics) : Improving the setoverprint logic.
Fix (pdfwrite): Fonts containing glyphs with no sbw or hsbw instruction caused pdfwrite to crash.
Check that a device halftone exists before writing it.  Fixes segmentation fault in xps.  No differences expected.
Fix compiler flag conflict for non-debug build (seen when switching PCL6 build to default to non-debug default). Changes /ZI to /Zi.

Make the non DEBUG build the default for pcl6 with MSCV. Add the missing parts needed to include the 'wtsimdi' device. Fix some formatting problems (spaces instead of tab) and add the support for including the gsromfs.obj module with PCL6 only build when COMPILE_INITS=1. NOTE: COMPILE_INITS=1 not yet functional on MSVC. This requires the gs/src/msvccmd.mak change for /Zi instead of /ZI as well (external tree means it must be a separate commit).

Fix broken MSVC 6 build issue caused by change in src/msvccmd.mak that puts a LIBPATH into the link command line. MSVC linker can't handle spaces in the LIBPATH even if within " ". We use an environment variable set by Microsoft MSVC 6 'vcvars32.bat' instead. This can be manually set if needed.
Remove the DebugSettings element from the project file entirely. This seems to ignored outside the user-specific project file.
Attempt to set the executable for debugging in the source project file. This seems not to be effective.
Fix (transparency) : Wrong background color of a soft mask group.
Normalize weigts in the Mitchell filter and use proper rounding to ensure that the constant value is not changed by the filter. Bug 689556, customer 581.
Fix (clist interpreter) : Transparency caused a wrong color depth.
Remove incorrect and unnecessary gtk+ separation code. Fixes bug 689541.
Fix (clist) : Improving the debug printing.
Fix (clist) : Improving the debug printing.
Fix dependency problems that caused obj/gs_init.ps to be missed. Also fix a typo that caused CMap files to be missing.
Fix dependency problems that caused obj/gs_init.ps to be missed. Also fix a typo that caused CMap files to be missing.
Correct typos and spelling errors in the change log. Bug 688940.
Fix (clist) : Providing clist instruction ids and offsets to debug trace (continued 2).
Don't generate build files for the ijs package when building. Since this is distinct from 'make dist' the results are not optimal Bug 689425.
Fix (clist) : Providing clist instruction ids and offsets to debug trace (continued).
Fix number of macro arguments that showed an error when FPU_TYPE=-1 (no FPU)
Fix formatting.

Add changes for  building COMPILE_INITS=1 without PS (PCL only build). Make sure gs/src/ugcclib.mak does conditional assignment of COMPILE_INITS. Fix main/pcl6_gcc.mak for UFST fco location when COMPILE_INITS=1. Add -ldl in (again) since it _is_ sometimes needed on modern linux.

Make UFST DEBUG builds use a different directory to aid development where the debug build is used for invetigating problems, but the non-debug build is needed for performance analysis. Fixup copying miscellaneous files to the appropriate directory. Minor format changes.
Fix (clist) : Providing clist instruction ids and offsets to debug trace.
Fix (clist) : A preparation for providing clist instruction ids and offsets to debug trace.
Fix (make) : Could not build for x64 platform with Developer Studio 2005.
Fix (pdfwrite): type 3 fonts with exceedingly small BoundingBox entries were clamped to 0 or 1.
Fix (pdfwrite): named objects, created via a pdfmark such as /BP, could not have their content modified after the object was completed.
Pre-scan the stream for '{' during the stream length check to avoid reading to the end of the stream and closing it. Bug 689551, customer 661.
Add debugobj to the list of excluded directories when synchronizing with the cluster.
Fix: Ignore problematic post table in format 2.0 with ISOLatin1Encoding glyph names.
Fix for Bug 689316.
Make sure that errors are propogated to caller in the WTS device (such as VMerror). Bug 689511 for customer 951.
Add Postcript bindings to gs_getdefaultdevice() and use them to set the default device in the interpreter. Bug 689273.
Add a gs_getdefaultdevice() call and use it when printing the help message. It just returns the first device as before. Bug 689273.
Fix (banding) : Improving the debug trace about compositors (continued).
Fix (banding) : Improving the debug trace about compositors.

Move "true .setaccuratecurves" to the PDF graphic state initialization where it belongs. This fix enables accurate curve rendering by GSview doesn't use some parts of Ghostscript startup code. Bug 688434.

Change pdf_base.ps::.pdfrun and pdf_sec.ps::.decpdfrun to ensure "PDFScanRules" == "true" while scanning the PDF, and if necessary revert it back to "null" before returning. Thanks to SaGS for the patch. Bug 688598.
Stop reading the xref+trailer at the closing ">>" because PDF 1.7 Reference made "startxref" optional in some cases. Thanks to SaGS for thr patch. Bug 688283.
Fix (pdfwrite): Type 1 CharStrings could be converted to invalid type 2 CharStrings if the glyph program used implicit start points for subpaths.
Document how to use -dTTYPAUSE with -dSAFER. Bug 687988.
Include an example of how to create non-ASCII font names in the cidfmap. Bug 688203.
Append the CUPS font directory to the search path. Bug 689334.
Add an XCFLAGS macro to the MSVC build to match the variable of the same name in the unix builds. This is intended mainly for adding preprocessor defines at make time. Bug 689530.
Only add XLDFLAGS to LDFLAGS temporarily when checking for the additional X libraries. Bug 689411.
Fix (pdfwrite) : An integer arithmetic overflow while converting Type 1 CharStrings into Type 2.
Handle yet another type of broken PDF generated by Adobe Acrobat 8.1 that lacks startxref operator. Bug 689413, customer 531.

Process duplicate entries in PDF 1.5 context stream the same way as the entries from regular streams: the first entry found (i.e. the last in the xref chain) takes efferct. Keep rebuilding logic intact, where the last entry wins. Bug 689513, customer 700.
Check for unbalanced q operators in the pattern stream and add Q as needed. Bug 689523, customer 870.
Relax ICCBased color space validation. Don't reject correct PDF files that have ICCBased color space as an alternative color space to another ICCBased color space. Bug 689524, customer 870.
Install header files as data, not executables. Bug 689466.
It's the client's responsibility to call the set_defaults method on a new stream. Bug 689362.
Prevent C-stack overflow caused by infinite recursion. Related to previous fix in same function to access the correct target color procedure.
Fix SEGV when clist used with pdf14_cmykspot device. Bug 689493 for customer #190.
Fix divide by zero crash. Bug 689493 reported by customer #190.
For help in tracking down bug 689483: Initialize font->is_cached. Set the encoding to iso-latin-1. Draw glyphs one at a time with TEXT_FROM_SINGLE_GLYPH.
Fix incorrect colors with transparency to cmyk+spot devices (such as tiffsep). Bug 689494 for customer #190.
Fix for MXDW/CambriaPoster.xps geometry parsing bug.
Fix (stroking) : Prevent installing an extra clipper device, step 2.

Pass the results of calling cups-config to cups.mak from configure through the top-level makefile rather than calling cups-config directly, so that passing an alternate cups environment to configure works. Bug 689496.
Turn on keyword substitution on pdf_cslayer.ps. This is the correct fix for the issue mentinoed in r8283. Also set native line endings and remove some spurious executable properties.
Fixed Id line to make nightly regression run happy.
Fix (stroking) : Prevent installing an extra clipper device.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Optimize the buffer backdropping, step 2.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Optimize the buffer backdropping, step 1.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Don't allocate transparency buffer for bands that appear outside the transparency bounding box.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Properly intersect rects when composing transparency buffers (continued 2).
Fix (FAPI / UFST bridge) : A crash when processing an embedded CIDFontType 11.
Fix (font emulation) : Could not handle unknown Ordering with FAPI.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Ignore font errors that do not belong to embedded subset.

Revert patch 8268 (restoring the FCOfontmap-* files) and add the Encoding/ directory to the RESOURCE_LIST so that it will be include in the %rom% file system. This is the _real_ fix to bug #689050 and explains why the symptoms appeared to be related to having Wingdings installed on the system. Thanks to Henry and Igor in pointing out the incorrect Encoding used in the previous patch that led me to the actual problem.
Remove a lot of debugging/progress/printf noise.
Fix FCOfontmap-* files so that Wingdings will be found. Bug #689050 for customer #951.
Document the .IgnoreNumCopies device parameter. Bug 689491.
Improve portability in the autoconf build. Solaris doesn't support 'grep -q'. Bug 689490.
Fix: (TT font handler) : Use given prebuilt_encoding when Apple Roman TrueType cmap subtable is chosen
Fix: Preprocess the glyphnames in prebuilt_encoding by AdobeGlyphList for Microsft UCS2 cmap subtable
Following the PDF spec, don't use .notdef glyph in Type 3 font. .notdef may not be present at all. Bug 689475
Remove the mkromfs code under 'make clean'. Bug 689474. Also, use the GS_INIT define instead of hard-coding gs_init.ps as the root of the postscript library code.
Install iapi.h and ierrors.h as part of the soinstall makefile target. Bug 689466.
Prevent BandWidth from being set smaller than the page width. Fixes crash reported in bug #688734.
Fix (Windows installer) : MSVC can't build dwinst.c .
Fix multiple inclusion of page objects in the optimized PDF file. Extend special handling of page objects to Annots and AcroForm object enumeration. Bug 689292, customer 932.
Ignore color operations in uncolored type 3 font in PDF files for compatibility with Acrobat Reader 6 and higher. Bug 689302, customer 870.

Contrary to the specification the HP 4600 printer uses the default pixel placement mode with the gl/2 command RQ, this fix emulates the device behavior and fixes bug #689468.  The RQ command is not tested in the regression tests so there are no expected differences.
Fix : A crash in garbager after clist playback fails in image.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Allow image encoding filter initialization with no parameters passed from the client.
Update the build instructions to reflect current practice of shipping all the 3rd party libraries we depend on. Bug 689446.
Correct some documentation errors. Bug 689433.
Remove obsolete font encoding and compilation instructions from the documentation. Bug 689432.
Fix : The interpolation of imagemask must not apply to high resolution images (continued).
Fix : The interpolation of imagemask must not apply to high resolution images.

Fixes 689454 and 689453.  Aliasing of the hpgl/2 polygon buffer and the path in the current graphics state resulted in unintented modifications to the polygon buffer.  Now the path is unshared before modification for pixel placement.
Fix bug #689455.  The hpgl/2 RQ command was not implemented properly. It should not use the polygon buffer.
Add recognition of a CFF file fith the extended header = <01000C02>. Bug 689449, customer 1110.
Fix (filling algorithm) : Split big segments before filling a path.

Make pswrite and epswrite devices generate proper line-interleaved image stream even when they receive several scan lines at once. This happens when the source image operator takes large strings as multiple data sources. Bug 688200, customer 632.

Save decoded image data in the parts so images drawn multiple times do not need to be decoded each time. Use XPS_DISABLE_TRANSPARENCY environment variable to disable transparency device for debugging.
Replace non-standard function call fdopen64() with fdopen(). The former is not available on most platforms and not needed anyway because O_LARGEFILE flag is set earlier in the code. Bug 689175.
Use colorspaces in all color code. Colorspace loading is stubbed to use device colorspaces only. Fix font crash when using the pdfwrite device.
Fix (TT fonts) : Suppress loading trailing data after chosen cmap subtable.
Fix reference counting logic for clip stack elements. The reference counter now shows the number of gstates that point to a given element directly or indirectly. Bug 689429.
Fix workaround for pdf 1.4 device resetting. Remove some debug messages.
Fix (graphics library) : Always set HWResolution to clipper device.
Fix (graphics library) : Distinguish two methods gx_make_clip_device_on_stack, gx_make_clip_device_in_heap.
Fix (graphics library) : Expand gx_make_clip_path_device, gx_make_clip_device.
Fix : Remove the pdfwrite/NODISPLAY nonsense from the documentation.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A wrong encoding of Metadata (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : A crash with incorrect shading.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Infinite loop in t1_hinter__fix_subglyph_contour_signs.
Fix (font rendering) : alloc_char_bits could fall into infinite loop.

Fix (pdfwrite) : Properly handle FontMatrix of a Type 3 font.
Fix (TT font handling) : pdfwrite recieved meanless font names.

Fix (TT font handler) : Place thr True Type interpreter and its data into stable memory (continued).

Fix a typo in a contributed driver for HP color printers detected by aC++ compiler. Assuming that pointers compare as unsigned values, the fix doesn't have any run-time effects.
Switch from using gs development trunk to a fixed tag for the 1.50 release. This version of Ghostscript is the 8.60 release with a few minor patches applied to resolve build issues.
When the same name maps to more than one glyph change the name. Don't treat /.notdef names specially because glyphs corresponding to /.notdef names can look different. Bug 689408, customer 770.
Fix (TT fonts) : Ignore invalid entries in loca table.
Correct more changelog substitution errors. Bug 689388.

Fix command list-based devices on 64-bit platforms. Ghostscript always writes int values to the command list but old code interpreted the bit pattern as a long int, causing conversion of the negative values to large positive ones. Bug 689353.
Fix stdint.h related problems with the Cygwin build (gcc 3.4.4)
Fully initialize pdf_resource_t object allocated in pdf_alloc_aside() to avoid a Valgrind warning. Bug 688907.

Add missing initialization of txy_fixed_valid field. Since the fixed coordinates are valid, the patch eliminates possible re-calculation of the fixed coordinates but doesn't affect the end result. Bug 688914.
Additional fixes to build the ufst support code under MSVC. Thanks to Henry for these. Resolves bug 689403.
Update the msvc makefile to set proper values for the ufst build. Partial fix for bug 689403.
Fixed DESTDIR support in Koji Otani's CJK patches
Use inline and intristic functions to improve the speed of CIE cache set-up. Bug 689153, customer 850.
Change stream keyword handling to accommodate yet another kind of a broken PDF. Bug 689400, customer 580.

With this fix we begin our foray into the Japanese Quality Logic Tests.  Bitmap character colors were incorrect in test file PTCPM_FG2_P5.prn (Windows 2000 PCL ATS-IF Japanese).  Reported by customer 951.  No expected differences.
Updating CMAP files as per bug report #689386

Pacify MSVC 7 run time checks. Change the order of condition checking to avoid returning an uninitialized value. The code is algorithmically equivalent, except it doesn't assign anything instead of assigning an uninitialized value. Bug 689387
Fix (pdfwrite) : A wrong encoding of Metadata.
Change the order of tests to identify fonts with FID attribute that have been both scaled and copied. Bug 689390
Take rendering intent type from the /Intent key of the CRD created by Adobe ProcSet "Adobe_AGM_Core 2.0 0" and pass it to the graphic state. Bug 689379
Fix for seg fault caused by undersized buffer as reported in bug report #687397

XPS arcs were not drawn with the correct rotation sense (clockwise vs. counterclockwise).  Fixes several panels in fts_19xx.xps.  There are still open problems in this fts for what appear to be pathological cases.
Fix (transparency in clist) : Write transparent paths and images to clist as high level objcts.
Pacify Valgrind - initialise both operands of the product. Valgrind considers a product of 0 and an uninitialized value to be uninitialized. Bug 689384.
Update change logs and the open bug list or final release.
Fix problem seen with stcolor device where the get_color_mapping_procs device proc was NULL, causing SEGV. Bug #689371.
Fix for gv hang, where an application sends (less than 1023 bytes) PostScript and expects a response. AppleTalk PAP and some other interactive viewer front ends may run into this. Bug #689237.
Fix a misleading typo in an error message: s/UseCUEColor/UseCIEColor/
Remove inappropriate PNG_CONST qualifier from a few libpng arrays, where it adds 2nd const qualifier, which is rejected by MSVC 6. Bug 689383.

Use a correct name for the absolute colorimetric rendering intent. Change the encoding of the rendering intents in the graphic state to use ICC numbers from Table 18 (section 6.1.11) instead of the PDF order to reduce re-coding and confusion. Bug 689377.
Ignore named actions in PDF link annotations that refer to a page outside of the document page range. Bug 689286.
Fix a bug in the "LastPage" named action handler that pushed an extra operand to the stack causing "/rangecheck in pdfmark". Thanks to Heiko Oberdiek for the patch. Bug 688311.
Apply a long pending patch that only affects an ancient 'alphaimage' operator (Next display PostScript extension). Bug #592160.
Add a missing member to the initialiser macro for the device structure of japanese laser printer vector PDLs. Fix a FPE crash. Bug 689366.
Fixing broken pcl -> pdf in anticipation of upcoming pcl release.
Opacity in gradient brushes plus some refactoring and bug fixes.
Revert patch for rev 7904 which caused regressions (bug 689215). The fix for this will be committed in a following patch that fixes 688543 and 689364. Fixes bug 689215.
Fixed installation of data files from the contrib/ directory
Fix for the clip mask of images being too wide for the fixed size buffer. New size wide enough for 54 inches at 2400 dpi. Problem seen at 600 dpi with AC405122 from the PS ATS for customer #951.
Fix (shadings) : Decomposition limit could be too small.

Partial fix to optimize the usage of artificially boldened characters. There is no facility to uniquely identify a boldened character to the character cache, these character are never cached but we also have to make sure a previously cached character is not loaded incorrectly resulting in a non boldened character.  Previously we used the heavy handed approach of emptying the font cache prior to using the boldened algorithm, which is a performance problem.  Now we use the undocumented "can_cache" member of the text enumeration API to indicate a cached character should not be loaded.  We need a better API for this.  This is a performance enhancement for customer 951 with no associated bug reported.  There are no expected differences.

Provide a special case for the undocumented symbol set 590 (XL only). This does not appear in any pcl documentation that we have, experimentation on the HP 4600 suggests it a unicode mapping, so no pcl symbol set is required.  Testing this exhaustively is not possible at this time.  Fixes 689346.
Fix a divide by zero that would show up on linux, but not cygwin. Seen with 001-01.ps to the x11 device.
Tiling images. Fix TIFF resolution bug.
Make failed dictionary look-up return /undefined instead of /dictfull. Bug 689360
Add a few dummy system parameters for compatibility with Adobe products. Bug 689272, customer 411.
Fix incorrectly named LANGUAGE string. Customer #951.
Replace to includes of the system stdlib.h for malloc() with malloc_.h. Bug 689320.
Complete support for DESTDIR in staged installs with the unix makefiles. Bug 689277.
Fixed bug 689323: bjc600's gs_closedevice breaks get_page_device and causes NumCopies to barf
PCL's halftone was being set unnecessarily resulting in the performance problem documented in bug 689319.  No differences are expected.
Add a shebang line to afmdiff.awk and use more portable option ( -3 ) to request 3-column listing. Bug 688621.

Explicitly bind setscreen, setcolorscreen, and sethalftone pseudo-operators. When a pseudo-operator is redefined several times, the last definition is bound in a final sweep over the systemdict but other definitions aren't. Bug 689254, customer 661.
Fix : Restoring high level objects in clist.
Fix : Improving documentation for gxclpath.c .
Fix : A wrong path filling.
Let scripts search Ghostscript (or subscripts) in the same directory where they reside, bug 689318.
Fix for bug #689312.
Let dvipdf support "-R" option, bug  689328.
Allow spaces in the input file names for pv.sh, bug 689329.
Use mktemp in ps2epsi, bug 689324.
Fix for local ExtGState values that would caused invalidaccess on printers or RIPS that have any of blackgeneration, undercolorremoval, colortransfer or halftone in local VM. Customer #534.
Add a newline to a debug printf. Bug 689330.
Fix a typo in the jpeg config that resulted in MAX_ALLOC_CHUNK being too small (0xfff0). Bug 689321.

Make sed in pstoepsi correctly work independent of the current locale. In LC_COLLATE=en_US{,.UTF-8} and a bunch of other locales '~' comes before '!' when sorting, so you really cannot write !-~ but ~-! in those locales. Bug 689325.
Fixes a buffer overflow (bug #689258).  Thanks to Norbert Jansen for discovering the problem and isolating the offending code.  No expected differences.
Make the top dictionary in the file generated by pswrite device writable. Reportedly, setpagedevice writes to a top directory on an Epson printer. Bug 689315, attachment 3108.
Fix a harmless typo, replace bitwise '&' with logical '&&' in a couple of logical expressions. Bug 689315, attachment 3115.

Include the system headers first to avoid name conflict between Cygwin headers and a Ghostscript macro. This works because (1) we don't use the affected structure, (2) system header files are protected from double inclusion. Bug 689276.

Compare the type of the object cached in the font descriptot with the expected type and ignore the cache when the types mismatch. The same descriptor can refer to Font and CIDFont resources if they happen to have the same name and are not embedded. Bug 689301, customer 870.
Replase setglobal operator with .setglobal in Type 1 font support code to make it bindable during start-up. Bind other standard executable names in the file. Bug 689311, customer 411.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 7.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 6.

Fix optimization for 0 and 0xff (non-dithered) colors in the wtsimdi_copy_mono routine. Also add a (temporary) change to force color==0 to cmyk=0x000000ff (only 100% black). This would be done differently if the input color were tagged RGB where presumably text objects would map. This is a reasonable temporary approach since copy_mono is used for bitmapped text.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 5.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 4.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 3.
Lower the PDF version searched for transparency features to 1.2 to handle broken PDF files generated by SPIRIT 14.22. Bug 689288, customer 850.
Enable dynamic driver support on Solaris. Patch from Norm Jacobs, Bug 689307.
Fix an out of bounds buffer write in the wts_load_halftone logic and fine tune the wts_resolve_one color conversion cache hashing for 4K (the default). Bug 689255 for customer 951.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 2.
Fix : Expanding gxcldev.h macros, part 1.
Replaced the $(install_prefix) from ESP Ghostscript by $(DESTDIR).

It was convenient to address two issues at the same time: (1) a fix for bug #689216.  Bitmap fonts with orientation 180 and 270 were not properly supported.  And (2) we use setcachedevice for portrait bitmap fonts to improve performance.  This avoids the overhead of creating a new image for each bitmap font.  Trivial pixel differences noted in:
Replace exponential format of a real number with a decimal point format in PDF writing utilities because PDF doesn't support exponential format. Bug 689293, customer 932.
Fix : MSVC8 compiler warnings.
Fix (PS interpreter) : "undef" data change was not properly saved.
Add version and revision numbers to %%BeginResource DSC comment generated by epswrite and pswrite devices. Bug 689285.
Fix: Setting a right property on gscicach.c gscicach.h .
Fix: Setting a right property on idicttpl.h .
Fix (PS interpreter) : Replace packed_search_* macros with a template (continued).
Fix (The filling algorithm) : Improving a condition for visual trace.
Fix (PS interpreter) : Replace packed_search_* macros with a template.
Use newly created operator .getpath to implement PDF path handling without 64K limit on the user path imposed by upath, which we had before. Bug 689123, customer 870.

Fix bmpa and gomni devices to account for changes to mem_*_size function calling sequences (rev 8056). These were missed since they were not part of the 'standard' build on most platforms and will be the 'async' method of gdevprna etc. will be deprecated.

Fixes for ulong overflow in memory device buffer sizing that caused problems with very large (>4Gb on 32-bit machines) page buffer sizes not invoking clist mode. Also the internal 'mask' image allocation in ImageType3 would silently wrap around, causing SEGV crashes.

Fix 689275.  The slow rop flag was not set to true for ROP 170 (paint with destination), this is an unexpected problem because it is the most basic rop that requires setting the "slow rop" flag.  In addition to fixing the tests in the bug resport The following CETS recorded differences in automated testing, but only a few have been visually verified as fixes.
Fix misleading error message from runlibfile0 that always referred to the last libfile that was ever STARTED, even if it finished and control returned to another file. Bug 688738.
Fix to limit GraphicsAlphaBits and TextAlphaBits to legal values.
Implement quoting in GS_OPTIONS environment variable. Bug 688965.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A crash when comparing resources of different types. Bug 689269 for customer 411. Fix by Ray Johnston.
This is a fix for regression bug report 689263.
Fix false detection of circular references in the resource chain. Valid PDF resource references form a directed acyclic graph but the old code was checking for a tree. Bug 688479.
Avoid an invalidaccess error. Skip execstack elements in the execstack_lookup procedure for which rcheck returns false. Bug 688934.
Fix : MSVC8 warnings.
Don't leave ccolor.pattern uninitialized for the null pattern because this field is enumerated by GC. Bug 689002.
Fix processing of very small PDF files ( < 1024 bytes) that was broken by rev. 7834 that increased the size of look-ahead buffer to 1024 bytes.
Add a work-around for malloc(0) returning a 0 pointer - call malloc(1) instead. Bug 688532, customer 870.
Fix a memory corruption and a SEGV after applying a filter to a closed stream. Don't replace an closed stream with invalid_file_stream, which is an open, 0-length stream. Bug 688712.
Port recent changes in MSVC build to Borland C build. Fix minor compilation problems in the components that has not been compiled by Borland C before.
Fix incorrect decompression of large files (>= 16M) by JPXDecode filter on Windows. Don't open the temporary file in text mode.
Fix (shadings) : Optimize path manipulations for shading fill (continued 3).
Fix (shadings) : Optimize path manipulations for shading fill (continued 2).
Fix (shadings) : Optimize path manipulations for shading fill (continued).
Fix (shadings) : Optimize path manipulations for shading fill.
Fix for Segv with psdcmyk device when a job specifies DeviceGray. Test file 477-04.ps, Bug #689179.
Fix indeterministic behavior in fuzzy raster match that can cause premature exit and miss all the differences. Encountered on GNU+Linux, i686, GCC 4.1.2.

Primarily fix for wtsimdi problem with wts dithering phase shift at band boundaries (add band_offset_x, band_offset_y), adding band_offset_x and band_offset_y to the device structure and corresponding initializer changes. Also clean up gdevwts.c MSVC warnings, and add a fast check to gdevbit.c for /dev/null (mirroring a much older change for Windows "nul:" device) OutputFile that aids in benchmarking. Fixes bug #689245 for customer #951.
Fix missing dependencies for the witsimdi.dev
Fix (shadings) : Account inner poles for computing a tensor shading flattening.
Fix : More tolerance for bogus tintTransform.
Fix (shadings) : Optimize filling a radial shading extension.
Dont't enumerate /Threads attribute when it has null value. Bug 689250
Fix (shadings) : A bug in tensor patch size formula caused extra or missewd subdivisions.
Implement hpg/2 rectangle fill RQ command correctly.  Fixes 689243.
Fix : Remove a redundant definition of gs_error_interrupt.
Fix (shadings) : Reuse shadings while a PDF interpretation.
Add support for /UserUnit. Also fix some related bugs that stayed in the way while testing it. Patch from SaGS. Bug 688124 from customet 870, bug 688359.
Fix handling of uncompressed contect streams with incorrect Length parameter or missing endstream operator. Use operator obj as one more way to detect the end of the stream. Bug 689239.
Define IMDISRCDIR in the top level makefiles and pass this through to the compile lines in devs.mak. This the the correct fix for the issue addressed in revisions 7970 and 7971.
Fix uninitialized cxs.present as detected By Valgring on Bug687846.ps test file and nullpage device.

Back out the changes associated with 7715 and 7773.  This fix is probably wrong, it only masks an underlying problem by disabling high level images and it slows down many jobs.  I believe the problem was misunderstood from the outset but I don't clearly understand the svn change log, it reads:
Fix (shadings) : Shorten a radial shading when it is larger than paint area.
Don't issue a warning for PDF TrueType fonts without /Encoding because it is optional even for non-symbolic fonts. Bug 689205.
Fix stupid typo in last commit.
Support ZIP64 format data descriptors and fix several issues with the heuristic to detect the end of a stored part when the size is unknown.
Use operator oforce instead of exec to evaluate indirect references to /OutputIntents members for consistency with the existing code. Bug 689233.
Remove even more debugging messages. Fix copy & paste error when setting media size.
Removing many debug messages. Fix a buffer overflow and some uninitialized reads.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Failed with an indirect OutputIntents element.
Avoid a Valgrind warning about uninitialized memory and fix a potential memory access violation where look-up of the last value of the interpolation table caused access past the end of the table.
Avoid a Valgrind warning and fix an error in debugging statistics collection, where 0-th element of the table can be used before being assigned a value.
Fully initialize stream_jpxd_state structure to avoid Valgrind warnings and bogus results when the state is printed on error. Bug 688877.
Try again to fix the Id keyword line.
Fix (shadings) : Removing a dead code from radial shadings.
Make AcroForm rendering a non-default option because it is not yet fully implemented and causes raster differences. Bug 689197.
Fix a UMR bug when creating a larger palette.  The change effects the following test files:
Point to bugzilla instead of the old bug-report email address in the help text. Also remove the unused constant defining the address.
Fix (shadings) : The decomposition limit must depend on resolution.
Workaround for fixed length buffers in stream_cursor_read logic.
Protect expression "$Id: ... $" against being replaced by SubVersion (bug #689093).
Fixed file properties
Fix (shadings) : Implement a color index cache.
Trap input errors when reading PDF content streams and issue a warning. Acrobat Reader silently ignores such errors. Bug 689026, customer 850.
Fixing a bounding box pixel rounding issue in pdf14_begin_transparency_group.
Fix (functions) : Improving the documentation for make_interpolation_tensor.
Undefine /Length in the stream dictionary when the value is incorrect to distinguish streams of 0 and unknown length. Old code re-defined incorrect length as 0. Bug 689208, customer 770.

Fix an indeterminacy found in cet 23-01.BIN and possibly others.  The problem arose when an 8 bit per pixel pattern was used with a palette with fewer than 256 entries.  This was discovered with regression cluster testing and was not seen previously because pcl was always regression tested with -Z@ which effectively masked the problem.  The change is also associated with a subtle visual discrepancy in 23-01 pp 21 and 24. (see comments in code for more details about the fix).
Move allocation of a large structure from the stack to the heap to avoid C stack overflow on Windows NT that allocates 12K less of the stack space than requested by the application. Bug 688998.
Fix (shadings) : Extra subdivision of axial and radial shadings.
Fix (shadings) : The color space linearity check didn't account the color precision.
Fix (shadings) : Always adjust smoothness according to the minimal color precision.
Fix (shadings) : Early skip parts that fall outside the clipping box.
Pacify Valgrind. Initialize an uninitialized variable that is used in conditional expression but doesn't affect the end result. Bug 688910.
Fix (shadings) : wedge_vertex_list_elem_buffer overflow.
Fix typo in 7887. Local regression testing missed this -- was seen in nightly run. This was part of the "optimization" in the 4 component source color case.
Fix structure problem (this could have caused out-of-bounds access).

Implementation of a new non-linear image filter that prevents dropout when images are scaled down to a 1-bit per component device. Bugs 689147 for customer 531 and image quality problem for customer 780. This filter is used whenever /Interpolate == true (or -dDOINTERPOLATE command line option is used) and the image is being scaled down on a 1-bit per component device.

Fix regression tools to remove dependency on PYTHONPATH since the environment variable method isn't very convenient for those running local regressions and add those python files from peeves:/home/regression/python to this directory (under svn).
Fix for slow PDF performance reported in bug report #688830.
Fix (TT fonts) : Allow sfnts string breaks inside TT tables.
fix an unititialized memory access.  No known associated problem.
Fix (TT fonts) : Allow 'loca' elements to be broken into parts with 'sfnts' strings.
Fix (TT fonts) : Could write past len_glyphs array.
Fix (TT fonts) : Do not consider overlapped glyps while computing glyph length.
Partly implement AcroForm feature: all fields that provire appearance streams and text fields with variable text. Bug 687498.
Fix (TT fonts) : A faster computation of glyph lengthes.
Margin adjustments courtesy of jbrown@cs.ucsd.edu.  We have no way of testing this change since we do not have a Laserjet II.  Bug #688054.
Fix (p*mraw devices) : Removing an incorrect debug printing (continued 2).
Fix : Provide alternative char codes in a CIDDecoding resource (continued).
Fix : Provide alternative char codes in a CIDDecoding resource.
Fix (p*mraw devices) : Removing an incorrect debug printing (continued).
Fix MSVC 7 warnings about unused variables and unreferenced labels.
Fix (p*mraw devices) : Removing an incorrect debug printing.
Fix (TT fonts) : A faster seeking through 'sfnts' array.

Clear the polygon buffer if a syntax error is detected in the parsing of polygon operator arguments.  The specification is not clear what error conditions should cause clearing the polygon buffer, we will do more complete experiments as time permits.  This change fixes bug #689185 and causes no regressions in the test database.
Fix all warnings generated by MSVC 6 & 7 except the warnings matching "C4018|C4244|jbig2dec|jasper" regular expression.
Fix a few warnings generated by GCC 4.1.2.
Fix : A bug in device_cpath_accum_enum_ptrs.
This is a patch for bug report #689171.
Fix : gs_copydevice2 crashed on error.
Scan numbers in the range of 2147483648..4294967295 in PDF Encrypt dictionary as unsigned integers for compatibility with Acrobat Reader. Bug 689010, customer 870.

This fix is associated with closed bug 689139 and was not checked in when that bug was closed due to a bookkeeping mistake.  It adds attributes needed to parse the pxl color treatment operator.  There is no implementation associated with these new attributes so no change is expected.

The range of runcode32 was not correct.  The specification says 3 (not 2) should be added to the run length.  See the JBIG2 spec, Table 29 in section 7.4.3.1.7 (Symbol ID Huffman table decoding).  Fixes 688009 for customer 670.
Fix for the band_complexity_array overflow issue. First reported in bug report #689165. Also encountered by me when running the test file for bug report #688830.
Interpret PDF PageLabels dictionary and include the labels in %%Page comments in the PS file. Thanks to Jason McCarty for the patch. Bug 688071.
Remove unused static rendering procedures for 16-bit samples identical to the corresponding 12-bit procedures. Fix bug 687399.
Increase the size of %stdin buffer to support larger lookahead requests and look for for %PDF- tag in the first 1024 bytes of the file. Fix bug 687125,
Add missing calls needed to properly send data to the printer on Windows. Thanks to Luke Bakken for this fix. Bug 687250.
Following Adobe implementation don't restore the operand of --begin-- when it overflows the dictionary stack. Fix CET 20-02-02.
Fix : MSVC8 warnings. Also replaced cumbersome type casts and fixed ambiguous naming in gxclread.c .
Accept a perfectly valid 0-length pattern stream. Work around a strange restriction on 0-length target string in the readstring operator. Fix bug 689162.
Add #ifdef protection to some new debug printouts for the OutputIntent parameter.
Fix compilation on MSVC 6. Add a best effort simulation of C99 __func__ keyword on older compilers.
fixes a UMR that was caused by a typo.
Fix (pdfwrite) : a composite font with a Type 3 descendent and FMapType 2 (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : a composite font with a Type 3 descendent and FMapType 2
