Fix (ps2write) : Device initialization problems.
pscet_status.txt : Closing 11-16-8, which appears eventually fixed; Passing 17-04-2 to Alex.
Fix typo that caused undefined during build.
Fix : MSVC warnings.
Don't store part of the state of readhexstring in not yet written bytes of the target string to avoid the string modification when the operator fails and the stack is restored. Fix CET 23-20-01.
Propagate CloseSource or CloseTarget flags to the temporary stream created by filter_ensure_buffer(). Fix CET 23-12k-02.
Make FontBBox a required attribute in CPSI compatibility mode. PLRM says that it's a required attribute and recent Adobe interpreters enforce this. Fix CET 15-11.
Change the status of CET 11-18-6 to AOK. Adobe interpreters have obvious rendering bugs that are hard to simulate in Ghostscript.
Clear a Purify warning. Fix yet another case where a non-0-terminated string was directly used as a sscanf() argument, causing an access to the wild core.
Add a new option for ignoring an Encoding entry of a True Type font dictionary. Work around the bug 688596.
Don't check current row position in the mask of the image type 3x when the mask is not defined. Fix an infinite loop. Fix the bug 688912, and a part of the bug 689138.
Fix an off-by-one error in the glyph array sorting logic detected by Purify.
Clear a Valgrind warning. Initialize a buffer overshot area in CCITTFaxDecode filter. Bug 688905.
Fix C++ -style variable definition introduced by the previous commit, which is not supported by older compilers: MSVC 6, gcc 2.96.
Fix (PDF interpreter, pdfwrite) : Transparently pass unusialrenedering modes.
Apply Ray's patch to muffle the debug output on the non-debug build. The original noisiness can be recovered by building with -DDEBUG.
Minor cleanup, fix the phony target list.
Default to running the vanilla pcl build. Remove some debug prints.
XPS build fixes.
Reset the dashed line array at initgraphics. Fix CET 09-28-01.
Update revision, dates, and list of open bugs for release.
Fix (stroking) : Apply the right math for computing always_thin,
Fix (stroking) : Apply the right math for computing always_thin,
The raster width and height commands were incorrectly parsed as integers.  Fixes pcl ATS file PM707122.prn.
Fix (user paths) : Wrong current point after uappend closepath.
Fix : MSVC compiler warnings.
Add a utility to dump out information about PDF files. Fix for customer #259.
Fix image banding error with high level images ctm.
Fix (Type 1 interpreter) : Account the replaced side bearing in setcurrentpoint.
Fix (Type 1 interpreter) : Account the replaced side bearing in setcurrentpoint.
Fix (TT interpreter) : memory leaks with PCL (continued).
Fix (TT interpreter) : memory leaks with PCL.
Remove stray debug print that was left in previous commit (colorspace refcount patch).

Make sure that memory for jpeg_decompress_data gets allocated from the same memory as the stream structure that owns it. Previously, the stream structure would be allocated in global, and the jddp in stable local, which is a violation of GC invariants. Fixes bug 689118, which was a GC crash in the regression file H00216q.pdf.
Fix a regression introduced with the warning cleanup.  The last release was not properly regression tested.
Fix X mirroring for all color modes of the interpolated image. The mirroring was missing from non 8 bits/colorant modes resulting in the mirrored output images.
Fix (user paths) : Remove the uneven behavior with uappend.
Fix a stack nix-up that occured when cm operator was used inside BT/ET block. Bug 688985, customer 580.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handle a text with degenerate CTM.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handle a text with degenerate CTM.
Fix (graphics) : Imprecise current point after drawing an arc (continued).
Fix (fuzzy.c) : An incorrect image difference format for multipage files.
When a chain of decoding filters encounters EOF, close the last filter in the chain. This seems to contradict PLRM3 but matches the observed behavior of Adobe interpreters. Bug 688745, customer 384.
Fix (fuzzy.c) : Multipage files processed incorrectly.
Validate arguments of the operator startjob. Fix CET 31-10-02.
Fix (graphics) : Imprecise current point after drawing an arc.
Fix indeterministic behavior of fuzzy.c with -w > 1. Initialize the rest of the window buffer that would be uninitialized before half_win lines is read.
Set upper font cache limit to 1e8 bytes in CPSI compatibility mode. Fix CET 27-02-01.
Fix MSVC-specific code added to fuzzy.c in the rev. 7743.

Banding fix where triangles where incorrectly detected and rendered as parallelograms when rendering out of the clist.  Triangles are only used to fill bevel joins so this occurs infrequently, and the use of fuzzy comparisons will hide all but the largest stroke width errors.
Fix (fuzzy.c) : Further improvements.
In Level 3, operator setscreen takes the value of AccurateScreens from the user parameter even with the dictionary argument. PLRM p682. Partly fix CET 09-49-02
Set /errorinfo to null in the error handler when it undefined. Fix missing 'null' in CET 09-47c and 09-47j.
Fix memory leak (PCL) due to extra gstate creation. PS did not leak thanks to the Garbage Collector.
Don't include systemdict, globaldict, and userdict into the array of dictionaries that is pushed to the operand stack on dictstackoverflow. Partly fix CET 20-02-02.

Fix regression on 124-01.ps. Emulate bizarre Adobe behavior so that the procedure operand of a 'for' is not executed when BOTH the initial value and the increment are 0 (or 0.0). Seen with CET 28-07 and FTS 124-01 and verified with custom test file against CPSI.
Fix zero-length part ZIP parsing again.
Fix for language_switch build 'invalidrestore. Allow filter allocation in systemVM as needed by .runstring and .runstringbegin in gs_init.ps. This fixes problem intoduced by rev 7629.
Fix CET 28-05-2, Adobe CPSI and Tek do not execute procedure if increment value is 0. The PLRM does not mention increment value == 0.
Require resource category to be a name in the findresource operator. Convert 1st operand to a name if it's a string. Fix CET 23-13-04.
Fix CET 20-23-01 - undefine /deviceinfo from systemdict in gs_cet.ps

Fix the remap table to not record a second white palette entry if there is not second white entry in the original table.  Looking at this code, it had to be motivated by arcane pcl files which we don't have anymore.  So we attempt to fix what is clearly wrong without disturbing the rest.

Document HP 4600 not properly supporting 26 fractional bits in polyline encoding command.  Also setting the pattern reference point to the current cap does not appear to work properly. Customer Bug #'s (964, 965, 966, 968, 1028)
Free memory after processing. Fixed bug with ZIP parsing parts that are both stored and interleaved.
Fix CET 29-02 - increment page count after copypage operation.

Fix for banding of some images not matching non-banding output. Added check for an invariant that the translation matches in the two matrixes used in rendering.  In this case the non-high level image path is taken.  A better solution would be to a single matrix, as this will increase the display list size for some files.

fix to use 64 bit color index for the language switch build and not for pcl standalone.  Neither this change or the previous is complete. USE_LARGE_COLOR_INDEX should be defined conditionally in msvc32.mak and the variable USE_LARGE_COLOR_INDEX should be passed to the recursive invocation of make on msvc32.mak.  For the pcl build the recursive make's argument is not msvc32.mak but msvclib.mak and USE_LARGE_COLOR_INDEX is undefined and so 32 bits is used not 64.
assign unassigned problems.  Add NF category.  NF means "not fixing" in the near term.  It should be used if we don't have short term plans to fix a problem.
Fix (stroking) : An imprecise miter limit check. Thanks to Ray Johnston for analyzing this problem and identifying the type of fix.
Fix error reporting in CET 35_all-06. Add font type 32 to the check for CIDFont resources, which was missing from the rev. 7574 patch.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : An inaccurate estimation of matrix precision.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : An improvement for very small matrices.

Avoid large memory allocation that can happen when random data are recognized as a binary object sequence. Add a preliminary syntax check before allocation of a reference array for a binary object sequence. Bug 688833, customer 1130.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Consider quazi-degenerate CMT as degenerate.
undo previous edit - look in Bugzilla instead
add bug 0455 for Dev Informatica

Change the order of allocations because alloc_save_change_alloc() leaves alloc_change_t structure it allocates in the state that causes SEGV in GC if where member is not initialized. Bug 688833, customer 1130.
Fix (interpreter) : Must not remove cshow, kshow procedure operands.
Fix (interpreter) : Provide a right execution stack on *show errors.
Fix logic expression error preventing -dLeadingEdge=[2,3] from running.
Fix (interpreter) : Early check for degenerate CTM in 'kshow'.
Fix (interpreter) : 'noaccess' must be idempotential operator.
Fix (interpreter) : 'definefont', 'show', 'setcachedevice' error inconformity (continued).
pscet_status.txt : Taking 13-12-4 because I fixed a similar problem.
Fix (interpreter) : 'definefont', 'show', 'setcachedevice' error inconformity.
Infer relations from FixedPage content when .rels part is not available. Call page processing when all required resources are available.
Fix (TT font loader) : Removing a dead code.
Fix (TT font loader) : Account PDF Encoding with embedded symbolic TT fonts that include cmap platformID=3 specificID=1 .
Pad short look-up table in the Indexed color space with 0's in PDF documents when the table comes from a stream. Bug 688987, customer 580.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Allow 2-byte ToUnicode CMap for 1-byte fonts.
Fix : MSVC doesn't implement snscanf (continued).
Fix : MSVC doesn't implement snscanf.

Adds an error string and error object to the token scanner state, and an error object to interpreter contexts, to allow operators to set an arbitrary object as the "error object" ($error.command) for a PostScript error, and to allow the token scanner in particular to set special error objects for syntax errors.  Fixes PS3 CET 23-32-4; partially fixes 21-11-6 and 23-32-2.

Move decryption filter past /SubFileDecode filter installed by the /resolvestream procedure and remove redundant /SubFileDecode filter before decryption. The latter didn't handle the case when the stream length was incorrect. Bug 688722, customer 700.
Fix (FAPI) : A wrong encoding for the font SymbolMT.
Fix (memory management) : Make the NO_INVISIBLE_LEVELS feature be permanent.
Generate unique names and create a new Charstrings entries for all elements of the encoding array that need it. Bug 688613, customer 1110.
Fix (memory management) : Propagate error codes from mark_allocated.
When Tf refers to an unknown resource name, use the resource name as a font name. This fully recovers the given sample file and avoids fatal PostScript errors in other cases. Bug 689037.
Fix : gcc warnings.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fixes a bug in the DCTDecode filter that could cause segvs (bugs 689064, 689065, 689066).  This fix parallels r3097 for DCTEncode.
Fix (True Type renderer) : Allow TTC format 2.
Document customer bug #0063 - CET 20-07.BIN page 18 (repeats) as an anomaly we won't emulate.
Fix (True Type renderer) : Account glyph bbox when setting up the cache device (continued).
Fixes two harmless compiler warnings.
Fix a bug, introduced in rev. 7513, that caused /undefined in setpagedevice when -dNOBIND flag was in effect and a similar bug in restore.

Move image interpolation tweaks from gs_init.ps which runs after pdf_draw.ps to gs_img.ps which runs before pdf_draw.ps. This way, image operator can be bound in pdf_draw.ps subject to NOBIND/DELAYBIND flages. Bug 688890, customer 1110.
Fix some gcc compiler warnings.
Updates doc to reflect fixes made by r7642.

Makes FontDirectory (including Local, Global, and Shared) read-only, using .forceput, .forceundef, and superexec where necessary to modify them. superexec now affects undef and .setmaxlength as well as put; .dictcopynew is renamed .forcecopynew and will store into a read-only dictionary, just like .forceput.  THIS IS A NON-BACKWARD-COMPATIBLE CHANGE required for fixing numerous diffs in the PS3 CET.
Parse the start part FixedDocumentSequence and FixedDocument to create a list of page parts.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A crash when /OUT pdfmark refers to undefined node.
Fix a problem created by r7629 (invalidaccess with shading patterns with a file data source).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handle an invalid Type 3 font that misses setcharwidth, setcachedevice[2].
Fix : MSVC8 build of revision 7630 crashes in zupath.
Fix (PS interpreter) Discontinue the interpretation on interrupt.
Fixes bug: writeobject/printobject didn't zero out the 'unused' fields in marks and nulls.  (PS3 CET 23-36-2)
Fixes bug (PS3 CET 17-0[1-5]-3): if a user path ended with extra operand values, they were not popped from the stack.

Fixes the ReusableStreamDecode filter so that it allocates the stream in the correct VM (per the PLRM3), rather than the current VM, even when it is necessary to read the entire contents of the source into a string.  (PS3 CET 23-12W-2) Also fixes filters in general so that they allocate the stream in the correct VM, rather than always allocating in local VM if the current VM is local.  THIS IS A NON-BACKWARD-COMPATIBLE CHANGE.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) A crash while recognizing a missed flex.
Fix (pdfwrite) Don't reassign object ID for shared descendent fonts.
Fix (pdfwrite) Don't reassign object ID for shared descendent fonts.
Fix makefile error.
report fix to 0060
fix for bug 0060, PCL5 CET 20-01 page 36. Improve rendering of Intellifont soft font.  Improve use of aux points.

implement finalization in the small allocator.  This fixes some recently noted memory leaks in the clients.  Note, a similar change should be made in the gslite allocator.  This has been tested on 32 and 64 bit machine but the code is not conventional.  The object header size and type should be maintained in a padded c struct as it is in ghostscript.

Fix for (yet another) a PDF file that does not meet Adobe's PDF spec, but Adobe Reader opens silently. In this case there is an Annotation that is missing the required /N (Normal Appearance) entry. Bug 689045 for customer 531. Thanks to "SaGS" for this fix.
23-12E-2 fix/analysis from Peter.
Fixes bug (PS3 CET 23-32-4): immediately evaluated names in binary object sequences were treated as literal (not evaluated).
fixed xps compile error.
add xps_debug target to ghostpcl Makefile
Clean out old code. Silence ZIP debug tracing.
fix customer number 0074 cet 22-18 p 5 red text instead of black.  The device color was cached after changing the color mapping procedures for mononchrome mode.  Also fixes 23-10 page 17.
Fix for regressions introduced with rev 7217 (returning proc as array rather than packedarray for PS CET 09-33-5.PS. Fixes FTS 050-01.ps and 246-01.ps.
document customer #434 - pxl cet C705 page 3.  Also, correct spelling errors in debug messages.
Fixes some long-standing data-dependent bugs in the CCITTFaxDecode filter caused by incorrect initialization.  PS3 CET 23-12E-2.  Also cleans up some formatting.
Mark more files found that had been previously fixed that were still DIFF. Mark 12-07C-7 OK since it matches Tek hardcopy (no thin lines).
Updates for pages fixed as of rev 7598.
pscet_status.txt : Closing issues which appear fixed with rev 7542.
Fixed bug where PJL DEFAULT variable where not seen in the next JOB. Fixed bug where PJL SET variable where overwritten by DEFAULTS. Fixed bug where PJL page size defaults didn't clear the page.
Changes user paths so that in CPSI mode, setbbox appends a moveto only if the path is otherwise empty.  Fixes a regression in PS3 CET 11-17 caused by r7512.
document customer bug 321 - missing wedges in passthrough mode CET C705.BIN page 19.

various fixes to get pcl running on msvc version 8.  This will build a debug seession system but will not build a production system because the options /ZI (symbols) and /O2 (optimize) are enabled and conflict.  I haven't looked into this.
Fix a typo in the description of 23-12U-1 (which is now fixed).
Update to reflect Peter's fixes and analyis.  Also reassign color problems to Raph.
Make sure there is a default value (0) for DEBUGSYSM. Fixes an non debug syntax error seen by nmake.
Update to reflect improvements from rev 7563 (strokepath fix). Thanks to Tim Osborn for this fix. Minor revision to analysis on some that still have other problems in addition to the strokepath.
Fix (shadings) : Ignore a huge BBox.
Fix : 'show' must throw error when the current font is a CID font resource.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (True Type renderer) : Account glyph bbox when setting up the cache device.
Change the order of argument checking in awidthshow operator. Check that the character code is in the range 0 to 255 for the base fonts. Fix CET 13-02-05.
Change the order of argument checking in widthshow operator. Check that the character code is in the range 0 to 255 for the base fonts. Fix CET 13-26-04.
Fix : Adding OrigFont to CIDFont resources for CPSI conformity.
pscet_status.txt : Fixing some misprints.
Update with some fixes found during regression of rev 7534.

Fix for yet another broken PDF that AR handles silently, specifically, a /Count value of 0 for the Pages tree. When the Count is 0, find the page count by walking the Pages tree. Bug 689008 for customer 580 and 460.
Fix : Early check a text to font compatibility.
Fix : Don't check type of extra width elements with yshow.
Fix : The CPSI compatibility for 'clippath' starting point. pscet_status.txt : A better classification for strokepath problems.
Fix : 'clippath' didn't set the current point.
Fix (font renderer) : Expand the Type 3 character box to negative coordinates.
Properly handle ASCII85EncodePages=true for the Contents streams. This was not implemented previously. Bug #689030 for customer #1.
Fix: Don't read past end of input image stream in simscale.c. Fixes bug #689029.
Fix (TrueType renderer) : Always access metrics via get_metrics callback.
Fix : Removing a dead code about USE_ttfReader.
Fix  : Removing a dead code about USE_ttfReader.

Fix (shadings) : A fixed overflow happened while computing a color (continued). THIS IS INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE : The device virtual method fill_linear_color_scanline now restores the semantics, which was defined before revision 7510. In other words, this incompatible change reverts the recent incompatible change.

Fix setpagedevice /Install procedure handling so that a error from the Install will restore the previous (presumably correct) Install and apply the Policies for the error handling. Also fix the .execinstall so that the plumbing will leave a predictable number of elements on the stack in case of an error. Bug #689020 for customer #661.

Fixes several user path problems: upath didn't signal nocurrentpoint for empty paths in CPSI mode; appending an empty user path didn't set current point in CPSI mode. (PS3 CET 13-27-3, 13-28-4, 13-29-3)
Fixes bug: gs_upmergepath didn't propagate the imager state current_point members.
Fix off by one error pulling data from the cursor stream for xps uncompressed zip data.

Fix (shadings) : A fixed overflow happened while computing a color. THIS IS INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE : The device virtual method fill_linear_color_scanline now gets half color values as the gradient parameters.
Fix (shadings) : Align coordinate data and color data to byte boundary (continued).
Mark some fixes detected in regression run (exact fix rev unknown -- probably from lpd). Note that 23-12W-2 now has only a single difference.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve the handling of SMask.
Fix (Resource machinery) : Place temporary 'resourceforall' data into the local VM.
update bug list for last change.
fixes a long-standing regression where the gl/2 circle command sets subpolygon to true.  I don't know the history of this one.
Added some bugs back in that are fixed but not cleared.
Fixes bug: if the source of a ReusableStreamDecode filter was a string, the filter did not appear to be closed after executing closefile.  (PS3 CET 23-12W-6)
Added a couple new bugs.
Fix (stroking) : The CPSI compatibility about the strokepath starting point (continued).
Fix : Line join was missed at 'closepath'.
Fix : A CPSI compatibility for 'rectstroke'.
Reenable the jpxparmfix call, after making it check specifically for a JPXDecode filter. Adding a ParmDict to filters that don't take parameters caused problems with some PDF files. Bug 688869.
Fix some misspellings ("schedulled"), and remove a duplicate .undef.
Fix : A CPSI compatibility for 'rectstroke'.
Fixes bug: the ReusableStreamDecode filter treated Intent values other than 0..3 as errors, rather than as equivalent to 0. PS3 CET 23-12V-1
Mark as OK two pages fixed by rev 7489. Note that improvements were made on the following: 23-12G-1, 23-12L-1, 23-12M-1, 23-12N-1, 23-12O-1, 23-12P-1.

Fixes bug: the PNG predictor filters produced incorrect data for the last pixel of each row.  (The encoder and decoder had matching bugs, so encode+decode produced the correct result!)  Fixes a diff in PS3 CET 23-12U-1.

Fixes bug: closing a filter pipeline with more than one adjacent temporary stream (such as a compression filter with a predictor whose target was a procedure) failed to flush all intermediate buffers, causing failures in PS3 CET 23-12*.  NOTE: This code (stream.c:swritebuf) is extremely delicate. Regression checking is essential!
Update bug status.

emulate 4600 rop3 oddities.  Apparently pcl uses the same rules for defaulting rop3 upon stroke as pcl xl but it is not documented as it is for pcl xl.  Fixes (emulates 4600) for fts 2110 and 2114, partially fixes cet 33-05 page 5 and 9 (customer bug #440).  Fixes 28-04 page 20 (customer bug # 96).
Partial fix for bug 687981, changing the PPD only for Windows 2k/XP. The INF changes for Windows 95 etc. are not included in this change.
Fix : A wrong 'frac' color comparison caused an incorrect 12 and 16 bpc image rendering.

Fix bug 688749 silent/unattended uninstaller. Add silent uninstall option to MS-Windows ghostscript uninstaller. Reformatted part of the code to make it match the GSview uninstaller, on which it was based.  For a silent uninstall, use   uninstgs.exe "path\to\uninstal.txt" -q
Fix : A wrong 'frac' color comparison caused an incorrect 12 and 16 bpc image rendering.
Following PLRM 3 handle instances of CIDFont resource in findfont, definefont and undefinefont. Partly fix CET 32_all, 33_all, 34_all, 25_all.
In gl/2 bitmap characters should not be scaled by the SI command. Fixes many problems in cet 30-19 and 30-20.  Fixes customer bugs 437 and 438.
Fix bug 688932 mswinpr2 doesn't clear temporary files. Unwanted temporary file was being recreated during page output. We now delete the temporary file when the device is closed.

Fix bug 688930 mswinpr2 allocates wrong memory size for DEVMODE. A printer DEVMODE structure is usually bigger than sizeof(DEVMODE) due to printer private extra data.  Allocate the correct size DEVMODE to include this private data. Remove old Windows 3.1 and Win32s code.

Emulate exactly when a font is selected when selecting by id and how the setting of "allow bitmaps".  SB was not initialized with DF and the variable.  Fixes several font selection problem in the 30* series. Customer image #436 #119.6-12-08 11:36:59 -0800 (Fri, 08 Dec 2006) | 4 lines
Disable the jpxparmfix at the point of invocation since it causes many PDF files to fail with /undefined in --run--.

Documents a CET workaround and anomaly.  Customer image #'s 42, 43 are hp firmware bugs we will not emulate.  Customer image #'s 1, 16 can be printed correctly with the workaround provided and will not be an issue with Documents a CET workaround and anomaly.  Customer image #'s 42, 43 are hp firmware bugs we will not emulate.  Customer image #'s 1, 16 can be printed.
Fix some errors in the TTC table parsing.
Fix : Wrong current point after uappend.

CET 20-01-2 is re-classified AOK; CPSI modifies the content of the array arguments, if any, when operator >> fails. Ghostscript matches Tek and Distiller 5. This is a bug in CPSI we don't want to reproduce.
Fix (stroking) : The CPSI compatibility about the strokepath starting point.
Add missing debug help (OSTACKPRINT). Note this and ESTACKPRINT don't have any effect on "Unrecoverable error" printout since those are usually an error in the error handler
Fixes bug: makepattern didn't create all of its structures in local VM. (two diffs in PS3 CET 30-07-3)
Fix MIN_INTVAL handling in the operator mul. CET 25-13.
Raise the debugging level required for reporting the raw decode option key.

Add a 'raw' option key to jp2_decode() to pass the raw palette data back to the client without applying the included palette for indexed images or otherwise remapping the data. Required for Colorspace override when embedded in PDF documents. Partial fix for bug 688869.
Fixes bug: currentcolorscreen attempted to copy a screen procedure even if it wasn't readable.
Change pages fixed by Peter detected in last regression run as improvements.

Fixes bugs: many places in the implementation of resourceforall did not always create temporary objects in local VM, which is necessary because some of their elements may be in local VM.  Fixes the cash06 diff in PS3 CET 30-07-3.
Mark a few other tests as "OK" after CPSI fixed to implement 'setflat'. and add a note to a timing dependent output.

Fixes bug: save objects are simple in LL1 and LL2, but composite in LL3, so restore must treat save objects on the stack differently depending on the languagelevel.  (PS3 CET 30-04-2, and some file in the PS2 tests, actually care about this.)

Fixes two bugs related to PS3 CET 23-07-1: Failure to find a resource category signalled undefinedresource rather than undefined (PLRM3 bottom of p. 105), and always reported --findresource-- as the error command rather than the correct one.
Fix to PCL downloaded symbolsets max char index is 255.

The revision 2683 to fix Customer #160 was not complete.  Because the result is clamped and the command is executed this unmasked a problem in the command itself (Customer #161).  The symbol set definition must have data equal to the symbol set header plus the table.  The old code only checked there was sufficient data. CET 36-01 p. 11.
fixes and analysis from Peter.
Fixes a bug that could cause a SEGV when reading binary token arrays on systems where sizeof(ref) > 8 (e.g. 64-bit systems).

Move the cet bug list and the script for tallying bug statistics from the pscet_status.txt file to the public release.  Also includes a couple of reassignments and fixes from Peter.  See the diffs for details.
Fixes bug: setcolorrendering returned CRD names as strings rather than names.
Fixes bug: In case of an error, setvmreclaim and setvmthreshold reported an error in setuserparams rather than the correct operator.
Fixes bug: printobject and writeobject didn't signal an /undefined error if currentobjectformat was 0.
Match arbitrary-seeming CPSI behavior (when CPSImode is set) regarding incorrect ucache placement causing typechecks with some but not all upath operations. Fixes 11-28-5 and improves 11-22-3.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't write min_int as XHeight.
Silently accept incorrect ucache placement in CPSI compatibility mode. Fixes CET 11-23-3 and (partly) 11-24-3 and 11-25-3.

Reverses order of subpaths in gx_path_copy_reversed, which is the implementation of the reversepath operator. PLRM3 says that the order of subpaths is unspecified, but CPSI reverses them, while old GS had them in the same order as the original path. Fixes CET 11-05-6, 11-14-5, 11-22-7, and 11-28-11.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A wrong font substitution for glyph variations.
Fixes for CET's. Halftone dummy lpi and angle are real for Adobe. Also setdash must return typecheck for wrong type top operand even if there is no second operand (09-36-3).
Fix typo in previous commit (commit from a non-working directory after testing on another system).
Check for rangecheck condition BEFORE doing the divide. Prevent FP exception on MSVC-6/x86. Fixes problem causing CET 25-09.ps to abort.
Fix : Skip images outside the clipping path.
Trap errors from setpattern implementation and re-throw them as setpattern errors. Fix CET 09-47c-01.
Read the JBIG2 Global Context from the stream as an array of strings to create the correct size bytestring for .jbig2makeglobalctx. Bug 689005 for customer 870.
Fix (shadings) : Radial shadings sometimes missed Extend.
Fix 09-33-5 -- return the screen procedure as an array instead of packedarray.
Fix for 09-29-1 -- force result from BG, UCR procs to always be a real.
Fix stackunderflow on 09-13.ps caused by mistake in rev 7124.
Fix for ILLEGAL (\000) (r) file case seen with 23-09.ps

fixes long standing issue of incorrect line widths in fts 2040 and makes many improvements for the 35-* CET series.  Improves 35-02 (Customer image #159).  Also removes a hack related to 0 line widths (?).
Fix (filling) : Very long lines sometimes painted in a wrong direction.
Fix (filling) : Very long lines were missed sometimes.
Fix (shadings) : Align coordinate data and color data to byte boundary.
Fix (shadings) : Restrict shading function data with the shading function Domain.
Validate the argument of setcolorspace before trying to process it. Catch errors from setcolorspace and re-throw them from shfill. Fix CET 12-14d.
The symbol set definition command clamps its argument to 32767.  Fixes Customer #160.
Add Customer pcl-pxl bug list as a text file.
Fixes for PCL passthrough in PXL. Remaining C705 bugs: pg 20 missing wedge, pg 43 shift of cap, middle of pg.
Return a read-only dictionary from currenthalftone. Partial fix for CET 09-12-01.
Pass the arrays with correct attributes to setdash and setcolortransfer in gs_cet.ps to match Tek printer. Fix CET 09-07, 09-08, 09-22.
Fix (functions) : Provide a tolerance for insuffitient Domain elements (CPSI compatibility mode only).
Fix : A minor bug in the visual trace code.
Several cet files were not drawing hpgl/2 edges because our interpreter returned a "range" error for chord angle 0.  Fixes cet 33-01 page 1 and 34-02 page 6 (Customer image #154 and #155).

fixes missing data on page 2 of cet 30-25.  The hp manual has a typo for the DT command. It say "LF" cannot be a data terminator but then says the corresponding character code is decimal 5 (not LF but ENQ). Experiments on the device indicate LF can be used as a label terminator and ENQ cannot.  (Customer image #136)

The hpgl/2 SB1 command allows filling but not edging of characters. We disallowed both operations resulting in the missing large characters in cet 30-06.  Placement of hpgl/2 characters when label origin was in effect was not correct.  At the end of each label the origin adjustment should not be included in the final position.  This fixes the bad placement in cet 30-23 and 30-24.  This checkin also include more reorg for the labeling code as well.
Return 60.0 0.0 as Adobe dummy values with Halftone dict (real not int) Fixes 09-05-6
Set the correct default value for CIEBasedDEF and CIEBasedDEFG colorspaces. PLRM p. 233 states value is to be as close to 0.0 as is valid in RangeDEF[G]. Fixes 09-03-3
Return real instead of int from tint transform as Adobe does. Fixes 09-02-2
Fix (shadings) : A non-contiguous color function could cause infinite recursion,

stage 1 of the hpgl/2 label code rewrite for cet compliance.  This is mostly a reorganization in preparation for fixing other problems.  The following is a partial list of cet pages and bugs fixed by this change alone:
Fix (shadings) : Don't fill ShadingType 1 when the region is outside the function domain.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack, part 10.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack, part 9.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack, part 8.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack, part 7.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack, part 6.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack.
Fix (shadings) : Remove colors from C stack.
Fix (shadings) : A better average color when filling a triangle.
Return floating point values for some cases of currentgray, currentrgb, and currentcmyk operator that are implemented in PostScript. Fix CET 09-10.ps, 09-19.ps.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings
Fix : Provide a single color stack for entire shading.
Trap errors from findfont, etc. and re-throw them as selectfont errors. Partial fix fot CET 13-16.ps
Change the order of argument checking in kshow operator. Partial fix fot CET 13-12.ps
Fix (shadings) : Improving radial gradients.
Make UniqueID error reporting match Adobe's. Partial fix for 13-05.PS.
Fix : Rearrange gs_client_color_s to allow saving RAM from color components.
Fix (shadings) : Improving radial gradients.

Prepend $(DESTDIR) to unix 'make install' paths for the convenience of packagers. This assumes make will substitute an empty string for undefined makefile variable, but this is a widespread convention. Bug 688948.
Remove the deprecated ps2write.bat, which does not work. ps2ps2.bat is the correct script to invoke. Bug 688977.
Use standard vector product formula to decide whether the 2 tangent lines in arct operator are collinear. Fix CET 11-03.
Fix (gs_cet.ps) : Patch 'setsmoothing' for a better view of shadings in CET tests (continued).
Fix (gs_cet.ps) : Patch 'setsmoothing' for a better view of shadings in CET tests.
Adjust error reporting from sethalftone to match CET 09-40. Fix an error in sethalftone redefinition. Halftone can read from the current file; sethalftone cannot be redefined as { pop } .
Fix CET 09-32: Adjust error reporting from setcolorrendering to match the test. Make TransformPQR a required parameter, as specified by the PLRM.
Fix (shadings) : The monotonoty check for Stitching function was wrong.

Partialy fix CET 13-05: - Trap errors in definefont procedure and re-throw them as definefont errors. - Throw "invalidaccess in definefont" error for the no-access font dictionary   instead of invalidfont that happens without the check. - Silently ignore invalid /FID attribute.
Adjust error reporting from findencoding procedure to match Adobe. Make "null ... findresource" throw /typecheck instead of /undefinedresource . Fix CET 13-06.PS

Change attributes of the array form of the device color spaces. Fix a bug in HSB to RGB conversion introduced in rev. 7124. Simplify equality testing of color spaces: names match corresponding array forms, all other match when color space arrays are equal. Accept float value as a color value for an indexed color space. Fixes CET 09-06.PS and many other test cases.
Fix error reporting for setdevparams operator, CET 27-08.
Accept negative value for MinFontCompress user parameter and silently substitute with 0. Intercept setuserparams errors and re-throw them as setcacheparams errors. Partial fix for CET 27-07.ps.
Accept negative argument for setcachelimit operator and silently substitute with 0. Intercept setuserparams errors and re-throw them as setcachelimit errors. Fix CET 27-06.ps.

Fix: Change /.OrigFont key to /OrigFont to match (undocumented) Adobe behavior. Fixes CET 15-04-1 et al and 16-08-1. Note: test file Bug687615.ps depends on old undocumented behavior, but has been patched in the comparefiles repository.

Fix: Fixes clipsave/cliprestore nested with gsave operations. Correct behavior is to save clipstack into saved gstate, and clear the clipstack in the current graphics state, as clarified in PLRM3. Fixes 450-01.ps and CET 09-54-2 et al, and 11-06-2.
Make arcto and arct operators throw undefinedresult when the start point or the end point is the same as the center making calculation of the tangent impossible. Fix CET 11-04.ps.
Fix some typo's editting blunders. No code change.
Fix (imagemask) : An optimization for imagemask with a shading color, continued 2.
Fix (imagemask) : An optimization for imagemask with a shading color, continued.
Fix : When filling a path with a shading, the filling rule was missed.
Add prototypes for _ftelli64 and _fseeki64 for MSVC 6 builds. Allows > 2Gb clist when building with MSVC 6. Bug 688394 for customer 330.
Make resourcestatus throw typecheck when resource category is not a name. Partial fix for CET 23-26.ps, page 4.
Fixes a bug: 'bind' would affect non-writable ordinary arrays, rather than doing nothing per the PLRM.  ('bind' still affects packed arrays, per the PLRM.)  Fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 31-01-2.
Fixes a bug that caused certain 1-operand math operators to return typecheck rather than stackunderflow if the stack was empty.  Fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 25-05-1.
reimplementation of passthrough to comply with the the PCL 4600 CET. Fixes Customer image #'s: 17, 18, 19 20, 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 30 (improved), 37, 38, 39, 97.
Makes 0 0 exp return 1.0 rather than signalling undefinedresult, to match Adobe interpreters.  Fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 25-07-1.
Fix : Don't replace FDArray for a built CIDFontType 0.

Fix decoding of the indexed color space in the smooth shading. Adjust error codes to satisfy CET 12-14a, 12-14b 12-14e, 12-14f, 12-14g Change gs_errorinfo_put_pair() to take char* instead of byte* a more common type and move all errorinfo-related functions to idparam.c because they are most often used with dictionary parameter functions.
Fix : MSVC warning.

Fix: make out-of-bounds string DataSource reads return 0 bytes, rather than UMR. Spec calls for /rangecheck, but CPSI silently returns garbage. Improves 09-47B page 12 (focus on test 6), but exact match to CPSI is probably not feasible.
Fix (TT font reader) : Obtain Unicode codes from Encoding glyph names of a special format.
Fix for quoted filenames containing spaces input via standard argc argv commandline arguments.
Fix : Some type casts were potentially harmful.
Fix : Specialize the build_char function argument type (continued).
Fix : Specialize the build_char function argument type.
Fix : MSVC warning in the last patch.
Fix: /bind load printed --.bind-- rather than --bind--. Partly fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 31-01-2.
Replace inexact decimal literals in the HSB<->RGB algorithms with more exact computed values, so that (e.g.) 0.2 1 1 sethsbcolor currenthsbcolor returns 0.2 1 1.  Fixes problems in PS3 CET 09-41-4.

Implementation of imagemask scaling. Fixes CET 09-24 page 3 and many other instances of the interpolated "turkey" bitmap. This implementation mostly matches Adobe, but differs in one bit; further analysis of the Adobe algorithm would be necessary to make it match 100%.

Add a routine to create and store [/key any] array in $error.errorinfo for better conformance with Adobe PS interpreters. This routine will be called from many places that reports errors in dictionary parameters. Use the new routine to fix one case of error reporting in the inage operator. Bug 688956.
Normalize bounding box retrieved from PostScript BBox parameter in the shading dictionary because Adobe interpreters accept denormalized box. Bug 688937, customer 200.
Fix (imagemask) : An optimization for imagemask with a shading color.
Fix : Repair the character cache logics with persistent cache entries (continued).
Fixes bug: xshow/yshow/xyshow checked the length of the widths array incorrectly, and the outcome of the check was ignored.  Partially fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 13-27/28/29.

Fixes bug: the user path operators didn't check encoded user paths to make sure that the operand string/array and operator string allowed read access. Partially fixes a discrepancy in PS3 CET 13-29-3.

Changes exec, stopped, and .stopped so that if the object to be executed is noaccess and executable, the invalidaccess error occurs with the object still on the operand stack.  Fixes an Adobe incompatibility in PS3 CET 28-14-1.

FIX: Fixes CET 18-02A p4 and others. Optimization for filling shadings by installing a clipper device with the path, and rendering complex color through it, does not produce correct results when fill rule is eofill. This patch simply disables the optimization in the case of eofill. We should probably look at why the optimized code produces incorrect results, as that may affect correctness of eoclip, not to mention the performance issues.
Fixes for PCL fontselection.

We missed adding a pcl xl 2.1 feature - BeginPage can be used with no parameters in which case it should use the values from the previous BeginPage.  Fixes Customer problem #11 - CET 601.  This code is not quite right.  It is not clear what should happen if a BeginPage without parameters is issued without a preceding BeginPage that set up the state values.  For now our implementation simply complies with the CET tests for this operator.
Fix (psi) : Provide a right finalization for the Postscript interpreter, part 3.
Fix (psi) : Provide a right finalization for the Postscript interpreter, part 2.
Fix error returned from currentdevparams. Fixes PS LL3 CET 27-03. Thanks to Noriyuki Matsushima for this patch.
Fix (plmain) : The output device was released to a wrong memory pool.
Fix for 688880 Encrypted PDF can not be processed.
algoritmithic bolding should not be applied to character paths.  Fixes Customer image #2 cet C422 page 33.
Fix (psi, pl) : Provide a right finalization for the Postscript interpreter.
Fix (psi) : Flush stdout when switching to another interpreter.
Fix (gs_main_finit) : Provide a right finalization for the language switch project.
Fix (MSVC makefiles) : Remove redundant targets and unuseful comments.
Fix (psi) : Erly initialize the pointer to the interpreter instance.
Fix (psi) : Provide debug options to Postscript interpreter.
Fix (memory management) : Restore the memory wrapper code consistency.
Fix : Repair the character cache logics with persistent cache entries.
Fix (Resource machinery) : Improve working with ROM file system.
Fix (makefiles) : gs/Resource was not included into the romfs data.
Fix (MSVC makefiles): The FAPI feature was not compiled.

delta row compression did not work properly with raster patterns. Fixes Customer image bug # (GS_Core00012) pages 1-10 C603.bin, except page 7 where the pattern is still not the same as HP but it is improved.

Fix for bug 688929 -- Genoa test 412-01.ps defines a couple of Type 42 fonts without anything in the 'sfnts'. This hack switches it to a Type 3. This is harmless for normal files since the check is quick and is only executed when fonts are loaded.
update xps so that it does not pass gs_memory to debug print functions and many other functions. now it works with the normal ghostscript branch again.
Fix (FAPI) : Restore the functionality and the documentation, which were broken with commitments 6998 7077 7078.
Fix (MSVC makefiles): The FAPI feature was not compiled.
Fix (clist) : CCITTFaxDecode consumed extra byte.
Fix (spot analyzer) : Clean pointers when closing.
Fix (memory manager) : gs_heap_free_object could break itself.
Fix 'bound_0_1' procedure to return 'real' rather than 'int'. Fixes CET 09-02.PS
Fix (MSVC makefiles): Choose UFST fonts table when building with UFST.
Fix (MSVC makefiles): Provide building with %rom% file system.
Fix (PS interpreter) : Dont print "Returning error -102." that is not an error.
Fix (stroking) : Zero lengh dashes have been missed, part 2.
Fix (MSVC makefiles): Inconsistent compiler options.
Fix: pspcl6_msvc.mak defined targets twice.
Fix: plulfont.c didn't follow ANSI C standard syntax.
Placement of some character were incorrect with vertical writing mode. Fixes (Customer image #GS_Core0057)  The following CET's are improved:
plulfont.c, plftable.c: Brings forward artifex scaler font fixes to the ufst.  The monotype metrics for pcl resident fonts are not compatible with the 4600, so we provide the correct metrics.
Merge fix from pcl tree, writing a display list with a contone device seg faulted.
Pacify Valgrind. Copy a non 0-terminated PS string to a local buffer to avoid scanning past the end of the string. Bug 688882.
Following Acrobat Reader 5, ignore everything outside of begincmap..endcmap Bug 688812, customer 170.
Avoid the operand stack overflow. Construct CharStrings ductionary without .dicttomark operator. Bug 688802, customer 130.
Use correct transformation matrix for calculating the current point movement for PDF text rendering mode 3. Bug 688756, customer 700.
Fix a reference to an incorrect bug number in toolbin/vg_bugs.supp

Fix off-by-one error in the PDF font subset prefix generator that mixed in an uninitialised byte when the object size was odd. This error caused indeterministic PDF generation and Valgrind warnings. Bug 688911.

Use open_device procedure to identify the type of the device instead of the standard gs_object_type() because gs_cpath_accum_device is allocaded on the stack i.e. has no block header with a descriptor but has dev->memory set like a heap-allocated device. Bug 688874.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Pacify Valgrind with not touching an uninitialized data.

pcsfont.c: fixes long standing issue of printing the lower case 't' with the park avenue scalable intellifont.  We have been assured by Monotype that this character would not appear anywhere other than the Quality Logic tests, so there has been no motivation to fix it.  The solution provided by monotype for this problem is to require endian specific configuration "plugin" files that provide a runtime substitution of outline when the font is identified.  We simply clean up the problematic outline and make the substitution while downloading the fonts avoiding the messy configuration file.

regression introduced with supporting 0 byte allocations in standalone mode and could be a problem in the language switch memory manager. The fix is to properly return a range error for a 0 byte raster pattern.  The graphics library behaves erraticly with such a pattern - i.e. different results on different device and memory violations.

Fixes indeterministic behavior caused by the soft management font routines attempting operations on the resident fonts resulting in memory corruption.  This effected several CET files, 19-08.BIN has an outright segmentation violation with the ufst build if run with -Z@ and a "free wild pointer" warning without initializing memory to random values.  The fix also recovers several missing pages from other tests.
Fix incorrect move of a block of code. Performance impact no visual differences expectd.
Duplicate JPX image channels if the cmap box has multiple references to satisfy the expectations of later parsing. Bug 688869.
Have the configure script check for fopen64 before using it. Bug 688394.
Remove debugging test code for ufst lineprinter fonts.
Fix calculation of the PDF font subset prefix. This change has little effect, except enabling previously unreachable code and generating different prefixes in some cases.

New version of vg_bugs.supp for the recent Valgrind and gcc. This file covers all bugs detected on the regression test suite except the bugs in the system calls and CRTL, which are difficult to suppres in the platform-independet way.
Change s/stream/strm/ to fix a MSVC 6 warning: C4224: nonstandard extension used: formal parameter 'stream' was previously defined as a type.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't use sscanf on a non 0-terminated PS strings.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Properly intersect rects when composing transparency buffers (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrinting a PDF/A, convert True Type fonts into CIDFontType2 (continued 2).

Fix Valgrind warnings: (1) don't use sscanf on a non 0-terminated PS strings. Temporaty replace the last character of the string with '\0' before scanning. (2) Don't assign a structure to itself. Check for this case and skip the assignment. Bug 688890.
Fix missing current point after painting path in PXL.
Fix : pdfinflt.ps didn't work with some files.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrinting a PDF/A, convert True Type fonts into CIDFontType2 (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrinting a PDF/A, convert True Type fonts into CIDFontType2.
Work around a bug in the image operator, which doesn't always restore the operand stack when it fails. Bugs  688532, 688646, 688672, 688736, 688740, 688899.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Uninitialized variables.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generalize pdf_finish_font_descriptors (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generalize pdf_finish_font_descriptors.
Add the PDF/A and PDF/X prefix source files to the installed library file list. Bug 688861.

Add a few new files to the unix makefile installation target. In particular, opdfread.ps is needed by the ps2write device. We also install the new ps2ps2 convenience script for invoking it. Bug 688861.
Correct a broken link. Fixes bug 688896.

Add a 'ufst' target for building the ufst library dependencies (if the code is present in the tree) and add this as a dependency on the ls_udebug and ls_uproduct targets. It does not attempt to pass non-debug flags to the ufst makefiles when building the ls_uproduct.

Fixes missing output in CET 28-10 p. 1, 2, 3, 4, and 12.  The polyline encoding command uses fractional bits in an undocumented manner.  If fractional bits is negative it has the effect of scaling its argument up... probably just emulating a bug.
Change s/steram/stream/ introduced in rev. 7040 and causing compile errors on old versions of MSVC. Bug 688893.

Emulate 4600 bug where hpgl/2 fill lines ignore the orientation of the pcl logical page.  Many cet gl/2 graphics (landscape) using line fill type 3 and 4 are rotated 90 degrees.  The artifex output (before this change) does match older hp printers and seems a more sensible interpretation of what should happen but now we emulate the bug by default and provide a compile time definition that can be used to enable the old behavior.
Copy a non 0-terminated PS string to a local buffer to avoid scanning past the end of the string. Also fix a few compiler warnings. Bug 688882.
Pacify Valgrind. Initialize penum->planes[i].source.data in gsimage.c These pointers are enumerated during garbage collection. Bug 688886.
Fix (type1 hinter) : Delayedly adjust matrix precision with sbw data.

Make the gs configure check the exit code of the jasper configure script and print an error if it fails, avoiding a later build error if jas_config_ac.h is not generated. Patch from Marcos H. Woehrmann. Closes bug 688887.
Check for a jpx image decoding fewer than the expected number of channels, returning an error instead of a segfault. Work around for bug 688869, customer 531.
Fix macro to pick up the needed includes and defines (-I and -D) options to let mkromfs build on Cygwin (and presumably other unix systems). Fixes stdint related issues.
Fix (pdfwrite) : CIDFontType2 must not embed into PDF 1.2 .
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fixes a minor logic bug relating to handleerror introduced by rev 6970.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve the encoding choice for 'glyphshow'.
Move the debugging information to a single line to reduce log noise.
Fix : pfont->uid.xvalues uses a wrong allocator

Pacify Valgrind. Initialize an uninitialized variable and break up an expression, which, after overly aggressive optimization, causes an access to uninitialized memory. Partial fix for the bug 688845.
Use an integer format to print uint32_t value instead of a long format. We don't support 16-bit platforms but we do support 64-bit platforms where uint32_t and long are of different size. Bug 688860.
Fixing ps_impl_set_device to properly erase the page.
Fix for matrix operation floating point accuracy differences in the CET 10-xx.ps files.
Fix harmless but incorrect merge.
Fix merge error, restores UFST language switch build.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Provide a conservative choice of BaseEncoiding.
Fix rangecheck problem (688841) and wrong .notdef appearance (688803) for customer #130.
Fix (pdf14 device) : Properly intersect rects when composing transparency buffers.
Fix (stroking) : Zero lengh dashes have been missed, part 1.
Fix (ps2write) : Didn't write the OPDFRead procset.
Fix for 'invalid restore' in CET test file 16-04.ps.
Fix : Improving the documentation about computing a text object tag in gspaint.c .
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix : MSVC compiler warning.

pginit.c: HPGL/2's P1 and P2 were not being updated upon pcl resetting the page.  The artifex interpreter was depending on there being an hpgl/2 initialize command (IN) to get the ctm right.  Fixes 27-01.BIN p. 2 and 27-06 p. 2 & 3.

pctext.c: fixes cet 20-01 p 11, 13.  Symbol set type 0 is now treated as symbol set type 1.  This is according to several hp devices and contrary to the specification. We provide a preprocessor definition which can be uncommented to support the behavior in the spec.  Thanks to Jan for his analysis on this problem.

Fix for CET test file 18-02F.ps.  The makepattern operator creates a pattern dictionary that contains an 'Implementation' entry. The PLRM 3rd says the following about the contents of the Implementation entry:  "The type and value of this entry are implementation-dependent."  However 18-02F.ps page 2 expects that this entry be an array and that the second element of the array be a gstate.  We are making GS compatible with what the CET expects.
Fix comment formatting.
Fix missing return of combined string length and add missing return cundition documentation.

The pitch mode command effects both primary and secondary font selection tables.  The media select command "homes" the cursor as a side effect.  PCL motion commands in user units only have their arguments truncated to integers.  Fixes cet pages:

Handle IODevice specifications in file name in gp_file_name_combine_generic by detecting leading '%' and returning the filename unchanged. The file_name_ combine logic is platform dependent, but IODevices don't use the same rules, so an IODevice prefix can't be meaningfully processed.
HP fixed a bug which we used to emulate leading to a vmi discrepancy. This can be seen on several pages of cet 16-10, we do not include page numbers as the problems relate to pagination.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Quiet the heal validation procedure.
Fix : MSVC8 compiler warnings.
emulates hp hmi bugs in cet 16-09 (p 15,16,19,20)
Fix (resource machinery) : 'resourceforall' truncated names of file-based resources.
update the underline position if the left margin is moved.  Fixes cet 16-05 page 26.

when drawing a wedge with a 360 sweep the start angle was not provided.  This bug can be seen on 15 hpggl/2 cets jobs average occurrence of 5 pages per job.  So this time we won't enumerate the jobs and page numbers.
Fixes cet 16-04 p. 40, text length default caused mispagination. Anomaly added for pcl5cfts panel 411.  Other changes cosmetic.
Fix (font renderer) : Clean up the character cache after a character rendering fails.

The ustrokepath operator has an optional matrix parameter. This matrix is concatenated to the CTM.  The specified path is then stroked.  This change restores the original CTM after the path has been stroked.  Fixes the much25 test on page 2 of the CET test file 10-15.ps.

The default pen 1 is not selected with IN (Initialize).  There are actually many other CET pages fixed other than the list below but the problem is obviously the same in each CET file so we only list the first few files and pages where the fix is visible.
Fix a type size issue that prevented mkromfs from running correctly on 64 bit machines. Bug 688792.
Report rangecheck or typecheck errors rather than undefined when the image type is not known. Partial fix for 12-07a.ps and 12-08b.ps .
Return undefinedresult instead of rangecheck from dict_int_null_param() and dict_uint_param() procedures when the key is not found. Partial fix for 12-07a.ps and 12-08b.ps .
Emulate sequential operand checking for colorimage operator. Reject strings of different length as multiple date sources for sampled images. Fix a typo in img_unbuild_image_dict procedure.
Fix : gs_fillpage passed a low level color to high level devices.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A stronger condition for skipping the initial fill with a white color.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Prevent an infinite loop on an incorrect contour.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Upgrading the documentation about AutoFilter*Images.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong xref : Unuseful object ID when a font is not really used in the document.
Fix : MSVC8 compiler warnings.

font spacing fixes, cet 19-08 pp 6 and 7, 19-10 page 10.  Also adds a substitute wingding font instead of doing the substitution in the code.  The substitute dingbats was never properly selected because it was bound to the wingding symbol set.  Note the new font must be copied to the user's pcl font directory.
Fix: Change pdfwrite pattern bbox to use PDF compliant syntax for float bbox coordinates, rather than sprintf %g. Fixes (reopened) bug #688167.
Fix for 688822 failure to repair broken xref table.
Fixes a just-introduced bug in the stackunderflow case of the user path operators.

Fixes pcl5c fts panels 291, 301, 310, and 320 where lineprinter was selected instead of courier.  Sets correct height and pitch for lineprinter in the font table.  Fixes mistake where pitch was adjusted by a small factor, we believe there was some "unit confusion" here. The last change affects almost all test files as any fixed spacing font will be slightly displaced.  Simplifies scaling of the lineprinter font in pctext.c.
Work around a bug in "MSVC .net 2005 express" CRTL, which doesn't support "%+02d" format.
In hpgl labels, fixed space font space widths from the font where ignored resulting in extra wide spaces.
Fixes bug: several dictionary operators (known, undef, where) did not cause a typecheck error if the 'key' argument was a null.
Fixes eq and ne so that an array is never eq to a packedarray, even if both have zero length.
Fix for 'invalid restore' in CET 09-47n.ps.
Pass a 32-element string to cvrs in instances where the int could be more than 32 bits on some architectures. After a sketch by L. Peter Deutsch, Closes bug 688794.
Remove the 'dosdefault' stamp file, whose creation causes problems on MS Windows 9X. Closes bug 688816.
Makes gs match an apparent bug in Adobe interpreters, which cause an invalidaccess error when 'exec'ing a noaccess literal (other than dictionaries).  Fixes a "failure" in Genoa PS3 CET 24-09.

Makes gs match the behavior of Adobe interpreters, which allow executing noaccess on a readonly or noaccess dictionary, even though Red Book 3 says that changing the access of a read-only dictionary is not allowed.  Fixes a "failure" in Genoa PS3 CET 24-09.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Incorrect image conversion with CompatibilityLevel=1.2 .
Fix for pages 4, 5, 13, 14 of the CET test file 12-02.ps. This file creates colorimages with a size of zero.  The CET expects that these colorimages will be ignored.

plsymbol.c, pctext.c, pcfsel.c - factor out symbol lookup so xl and pcl can share it.  Character complement simplifications. pxfont.c - fixes "duped" code. plvocab.c - bring msl -> unicode mapping in line with the pcl comparison guide and provide character names. plulfont.c, pllfont.c - enable font loading debugging conditional with -Z=. plftable.c - the avant garde demi fonts were attributed too boldly. This change effects every header page of the CET and fixes the font selection problems in 1812. pcsfont.c - removes unnecessary intellifont character complement hack which was effectively masking we did not have msl->unicode correct.

Fix for segv in CET files 32-32.ps and 22-11.ps.  Both files use binary object sequences with an object type of 'user name' however no user names have been defined. The fix consists of checking for this situation and returning an e_undefined error.  (The choice of error is because CPSI also returns a 'undefined' error.
Accept string values of page device, halftone, and rendering intent names. PLRM specifies that all these values can be names or strings. Bug 688776.

Fix for CET test file 12-14c.ps.  This file was seg faulting. The cause was some uniniitalized pointers that were being freed when given invalid function parameters.  (The test file was verifying the handling of invalid functions.)
Fix CIDFontType 4 (FontType 32) handling so that read-only font dicts can be used. Fixes PSLL3 CET 35-02.ps 'invalidaccess in -put-'.

Add in aliases for glyphs that have the same Unicode value in the Adobe Glyph List version 2.0. If both names are defined (presumably unique) don't change them. If either name is known, make the other name an alias. Bug 688799 and 688800 for customer 130.

Finishes implementation of LeadingEdge parameter, primarily intended for rotating pages to fit paper tray orientation. The LeadingEdge parameter is an Adobe-defined setpagedevice parameter, and can be set by PostScript code for explicit control over rotation, or can be set by the device to reflect device knowledge of the tray orientation (the mechanism for the latter is documented in Drivers.htm). This patch completely replaces the old TrayOrientation parameter, which had similar goals but was not standard, and fixes some problems with that implementation.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warned unuseful variables.
Establish alias glyph names (instead of replacement names) for example Ldotaccent as an alias for Ldot. Bug 688799 for customer 130. --this line, and those below, will be ignored--
Fix for 688788 /rangecheck in resolveR.
Fix for 688787 /undefined in /BXlevel.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Support OS/2 table version 2 in True Type fonts.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A further improvement for the text rotation logic.
Fix : MSVC8 compiler warnings.
Fix (True Type font loader) : A wrong encoding created when no 'post' presents.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued 6.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued 5.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued 4.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued 3.
Fix gcc reported problems.
Fix missed edit to remove RESOURCE_LIST from top makefiles.
Fix null ptr dereference committed on rev 6866
Replace empty MediaBox or CropBox box with a box that is equal to the current page size. Bug 688744, customer 384.

accidentally backed out this fix last checkin.  It turns out that something of this ilk is needed to print t310.bin but c310.bin prints correctly if the matrix is singular.  With the most recent pxl font code it is not striclty necessary to have an invertible character matrix the output simply maps to 0 but is not treated as an error.

Adds new segments for truetype font.  We don't actually make use of the data, just parse the segment correctly to prevent erroring out. Fixes sort check for the VT table which can have multiple identical entries.
Modify cmap table handling routines to support a large ( >= 64K ) table represented as an array of strings. Bug 688688, customer 562.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued 2.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience, continued.
Use /PageSize from the currrent page device dictionary when the /MediaBox pget fails. Bug 688771, customer 581.
Fix (pdfwrite) : More PDF/A-1b complience.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Write out the PDF/A compliance label.
Increase the operand stack size limit to the current working maximum = 65414. Bug 688764.
Fix calculation of the index in the DecodeDEF[G] table. The old code rendered wildly different colors when the range of RangeDEF[G] was not close to 1. Bug 688763.
Clean up memory when the gsapi_delete_instance is called. Prevents leaks from repeated invocations of ghostscript gsapi_ instances. Bug 688181.
Add support of AdjustWidth parameter to tiffg32d and tiffg4 devices. Bug 688748.
Add embedded OpenType support to the PDF interpreter. Bug 688729, customer 700.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve the filter choice logic.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Luratech filters must not apply to indexed images.
Fix (TT font loader) : Work around a wrong specificID.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Preserve ToUnicode for Type 0 fonts when re-distilling a PDF.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't create a group from an image with SMask.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve the documentation about generating a PDFX document.
Substantial performance improvement on Windows platforms to JPEG2000/JPXDecode filter made by making jasper 'seek' work within the buffer.  Bug 688073 and 688758 for customer #531.
Fix (CIDFontType 1) : Check for GDBytes elements to point past the 'loca' table end.
fixes bitmap font scaling regression (sigh).  Affects the following cet files: C201.BIN C202.BIN C203.BIN C204.BIN C205.BIN C206.BIN C309.BIN C313.BIN C425.BIN
Fix (FAPI Font resource, CIDFont emulation) : Relative paths with FAPIconfig-FCO.
Fix (UFST resource handling) : Provide an uniform way for specifying FAPI font map and configuration.
Fix (FAPI) : The cache device had a wrong HWResolution.
Fix (FAPI Font resource, CIDFont emulation) : Always convert FontName into a name (continued).
Fix (FAPI Font resource, CIDFont emulation) : Always convert FontName into a name.
Fix (FAPI Font resource, CIDFont emulation) : Load resident fonts into global VM (continued).
Fix (FAPI Font resource, CIDFont emulation) : Load resident fonts into global VM.
Fix (UFST resource handling) : Provide alternative FCO map files.
Fix (UFST resource handling) : Provide alternative FCO map files.
Fix (FAPI) : Implement a lazy font object acquisition, part 2.
Fix (FAPI) : Implement a lazy font object acquisition, part 1.
Use more aggressive PDF identification. Consider PDF every file that has "%PDF-1." not preceeded by "%!PS" in the first 127 bytes of the file. Bug 688743.
Fix broken definition of customcolorimage. Bug 688750.
Add code in getencoding to accept an array for the Encoding in a Font dict. Only a name or dictionary are legal PDF. Bug 688741.
Fix a typo.
Fix string overflow in cvrs on 64-bit systems. Suppress the sign expansion of unique ID. Bug 688725.

Make the pointer the last element of gs_pixel_image_t structure. Otherwise, on LP64 platforms, the padding at the end of the structure overwrites the 1st member of the derived structure when the base structure is assigned to the derived structure. Bugs 613909, 688725.
Fix handling of TrueType fonts with a large number of glyphs in the 'post' table. Bug 688723 for customer number #130.
Fix (Font resource machinery) : Improve finding encodings in gs_fntem.ps (issue 2).

changes for ufst 5.0.  Also supports a new configuration using the artifex scaler and the monotype TrueType screen fonts.  We will be leaving some font debugging stuff live in the development tree for a short while.  This code is not backward compatible with pre 5.0 ufst releases.
Fix an infinite loop on 64-bit platforms; make the size of max_import_coord to be as big as the size of the 'fixed' type. Bug 688724.
Fix (Font resource machinery) : Improve finding encodings in gs_fntem.ps .
Clean up the code that opens starting arg files (@ files). Use iodev_default when it is available. Otherwise use the staticly initialized %os% device. Bug 688720.
Fix FPE in t1_hinter__set_stem_snap() on Alpha. Don't process stem snap elements when there's none. Bug 688727.

In generating the changelog files in the documentation, treat "DIFFERENCES:" the same as "EXPECTED DIFFERENCES:". Also trim everything from the log message after this point since that section is of ephemeral interest. Bug 688715.
Fix incorrect element size argument of qsort(), that causes SEGV on platforns with sizeof(void *) != sizeof(int) since rev. 6669. Bug 688721.
Ignore errors when zlib streams fail on the checksum. Fixes bug 688716.
Fix (Font resource machinery) : Apply general methoid for finding a font substitute.

Cast character values to (unsigned char) before calling isprint() and friends. They are designed to work only with ASCII characters, but some implementations support passing 8 bit character data but only if it is positive to avoid conflict with a (-1) definition of EOF. Thus we should cast to map the high characters from negative to positive values on systems where char is signed by default. Bug 687529.
Move a negation inside the test(1) exprepression for better portability. Fixes bug 688713.
Fix : 'space' charater was missed in Unicode Decoding resource.
remove debugging code... should not have been included in last checkin.

Allocate scanline_buffer for DCTDecode filter in stable memory to prevent it from being freed twice: by restoring the state before the filter was used for reading and by closing the filter. Bug 688694 from the customer 632.
Change example code so that users/customers that copy it will avoid the memory leak mentioned in bug 688599.
Fix for 688675  Reading / Converting PDF File created with Adobe Lifecycle Designer 7.0.
Fix for yet another non-spec PDF that Adobe Acrobat Reader handles silently. (missing whitespace after 'endobj'). Bug 688695 for customer 580.

Use pkg-config to request linking with GTK 2 in the unix dll build instead of the older gtk-config with specifies GTK 1. This will break the (generally unsupported) dll build on very old systems but fixes it for most current and near future platforms. Bug 688701.

Remove ARCH_STRUCT_ALIGN_MOD entirely and revert to ARCH_ALIGN_MEMORY_MOD not having the extra jmp_buf alignment requirements. This satisfies the assumption that structure alignment and sizeof(ref) agree in the Ghostscript code and should finally fix 687643.

Fix so that dictionaries that grow preserve attributes. Several problems reported including a potential security hole when in SAFER mode. Thanks to mat Gh Savulescu (SaGS) for the bug report, the patch and excellent analysis of the problem.
Correct a typo resulting in inproper glyph placement with transposed text and a top left reference corner. Fixes bug 688645.
Correct a typo resulting in inproper glyph placement with transposed text and a top left reference corner. Fixes bug 688645.
FIX: Allocate jmp_buf with padding, to satisfy alignment constraints. Fixes bug #687643.
Document how to compile Ghostscript with the Luratech compression libraries. Bug 688665.
Update Language.htm to better describe the current level of PDF support. Bug 688661.
Always make read progress is s_jbig2encode process when there is data available. Fixes bug #688658.

Mods last fix slightly.  Apparently we should not undo the page orientation for bitmap fonts, HP now does rotate bitmap fonts with page orientation.  Last change made this specific to the UFST, but it was a bug in any configuration.  Also, update the README with font environment variable information.
Fix for 688686 segfault in find_bit_map().

We must reset the state structure pointers passed as userdata for the luratech library read and write callback from within the s_jpxe_process method because the garbage collector may have move the struct since the call to s_jpxe_init. Fixes bug 688657.
UFST XL bitmap character rotation with page orientation bug.
Upgrade Japanese Unicode CMap resources from ftp://ftp.oreilly.com/pub/examples/nutshell/cjkv/adobe/aj16.tar.Z Bug 688685.

pxldis.py - see previous log entry for this code, should have been committed under that entry. pxparse.c - the pxl parsing puzzle now prints the operator number in debugging mode. pxfont.c and plchar.c - xl bolding algorithm was wrong and the problem was masked by a fudge factor.  The correct amount of bolding to be added is the bold fraction * height of the character applied to *both* sides of each stroke.

Fix a missing image problem seen in 468-03 (part of 468-01.ps). Even though this test appears to violate the rules in the PLRM for Mask and Data Image sizes for ImageType3, Adobe CPSI and other RIPS ignore the problem.
reading past the end of one type hex dump format was a problem with new xl cet files, also adds a few improvements to ease debugging.
Add a note about additional license change cleanup to be done when making GPL releases. Bug 688677.
Fix (UFST bridge) : Update makefile for UFST 4.6 .
Fix SEGV when 'reversepath' invoked with a currentpoint but no segments. Detected with the CET Global Interference test.
Fix for 470-01 at some resolutions (90 dpi failed, 125 dpi worked). Zero width or height clip box confused shading logic.
Try to fix corrupt pdf files by fixing their metadata.

Fixes for supporting passthrough CET.  Also arbitrarily sets an rgb color (black) in the current graphics state when srgb is used in images.  This has the side effect of intalling a crd rendering dictionary which is needed for the color space in the image.  It does not give correct results if a pcl raster operation depends on both the color in the image and the paint pattern see 328 special test A for example.  This will be corrected shortly.
Fixed regression where picture frame scaling shouldn't create anisotropic pen widths.

Change ASCII85Decode EOD handling to make sure that the EOD characters are consumed before we provide the last bit of data to the caller. The ~> sequence (actually could be <cr> <lf> ~ <cr> <lf> > ) left in the currentfile would cause an /undefined error. Bug 688618.

Yet another apparently broken PDF file that Acrobat Reader handles silently. In this case a 'Tj' operator when the font is an embedded double byte font (CIDFont) has an odd number of bytes in the string. Change to return a .notdef' glpyh for the tail of the string. Bug 688670 fro customer 562.
Fix for 688648 Too many MAP file names.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Work around degenerate CTM while stroking a path.
Fix a typo.

Implement the status operation for the %rom% device. Restructure the makefiles to correct some dependency problems. The creation time of files in the %rom% device are now set to the build time. The need for this was established during bug 687094.
Fix (MSVC build) : Always use nodebug CRTL when building a nodebug Ghostscript.
Fix (memory manager) : Reduce the CPU time consumption for 'restore', step 2.
Fix (memory manager) : Reduce the CPU time consumption for 'restore'.
Indirect W, W2, Dw or DW2 values were not resolved at the correct point which caused a check for 0 length W and W2 arrays to not work. Bug 688649.

check for format 20 instead of using a heuristic to determine resolution fields in a user defined pattern.  Fixes pcl5c cet's 21-09.BIN, 23-10.BIN, 24-03.BIN, 30-06.BIN.  Thanks to stefan for unearthing the format 20 docs from the pcl implementors guide.  It is not mentioned in the technical reference manual.
Fix typo. IdoimSet was in RESOURCE_LIST instead of IdiomSet. Thanks to "Edward" for spotting this. Bug 688644.
more awkward fixes for pathological cases from the cet.  Handle the case of 0 area src raster dimensions, and what to do for font height 0.
Fix for 688068 Problem with overprint in 1bit cmyk device.

The .ResourceFile logic did not work with the %rom% device since it relied on the 'status' operator. This change avoids the use of 'status' by using the 'file' operator in a stopped context. Bug 687094.

Fixes macro/palette stack interaction.  This also "fixes" fts 2410, The HP 4600 does not print this fts file correctly.  Our output is the "expected" result.  Files: 22-09.BIN 22-15.BIN 23-01.BIN 25-05.BIN 25-06.BIN fts.2410
cet 23-01 fix.  User defined downloaded colored pattern was interpreted as being a 600 dpi mono pattern resulting in a corrupt pattern.
fixes 30-05...  pitch ceiling.

Two fixes for CET 20-01.bin, handling downloading of corrupt fonts and symbol headers.  There are several other problems in this test where we reject or accept fonts and symbol set and the HP 4600 behaves differently.  However the tests indicate the 4600 contradicts what the test expects.  We'll negotiate these problems later, this fixes the problems preventing the test from running.

debug warning message for setting a non invertible matrix and GL/2 fixed space fonts were scaled incorrecly.  The scaling was effectively the floor of the actual value, so this change effects many files with non observable differences.  Fixes pcl5c cet 27-09 where pathological fonts sizes smaller than 1 plotter unit were floored to 0 resulting in a 0 font scale matrix.
When substituting a cie color space the cid headers were not checked or corrected, resulting in a lot of lost output in the pcl5c cet.  The following cet files are affected by this fix:
Fixes for 64bit linux pointer math in plalloc.c
Disabled hack to do -Z# debugging by default.
Fix for 688625 5x to 15x slowdown between 8.50 and 8.53 (ref#10273).
Fix missing memory arguments in 64bit only code.
finish the integration of libpng.  Various fixes to get the shared language build working.
Fix all obvious cases where the name of an operator for signalerror procedure is searched in the dictionary stack instead of retrieving it from systemdict. Bug 688548.

Fix rangecheck in shfill caused by floating point inaccuracies in the function logic. Previous logic allowed for inaccuracy, but the value scaling was wrong making the test too stringent. Bug 688574 for customer 531.
Work around a bug in GCC 2.96 for x86. Pre-load stack pages to avoid a SEGV. Bug 688574.
Recognize PDF fonts by the first 4 bytes of the font stream. Simplify Type 1 font reader and PFB font reader. Bug 688569 from customer 850.

Fix /ioerror when the length of the string data target is equal to number of generated bytes. Calculate the exact number of \n characters inserted by ASCIIHexEncode filter instead of the high bound Bug 688569
Enable redefinition of /image and /imagemask operators in PDF interpreter whan DELAYBIND option is in effect. Bug 688555
Fix for 688608 image rendered black in PDF-file
Return a success code from the clist compression initialization functions. Bug 688603. Thanks to "Nix" for spotting this.
Fix typo in double inclusion protection.

Fix a problem handling ' " and \ characters that gave false postives when checkin sources for C++ comments. Remove some modules from the 'skip' list that did not belong there (IMHO) -- they were probably there due to previous false positives.
Fix luratech-based encode filters. We now appear to work correctly.
Use .languagelevel operator instead of languagelevel name to prevent languagelevel redefinition to affect Ghostscript operation. Bug 688583
Change PDF curve rendering to use 'accurate' curves. PostScript method is retained for Adobe CPSI compatibility. Bug 688434.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The font copying and the font comparison didn't work with segmented True Type data.
FIX: Fixes segfault in wts persistent cache logic when no cache key is generated. Fixes bug #688132.
Fix printafm to properly handle files with more than 256 glyphs. Patch from Michail Vidiassov. Bug 688610.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A minor code cleanup.
Fix : MSVC, Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix compile problems and MSVC warnings.
Add ToWrite dictionary to complete the environment for pdfwrite.ps procedures and enumerate JBIG2Globals parameter before the image to avoid recursion during stream copying. Bug 688556
Fix (pdfwrite) : Order embedded fonts against an indeterminizm.
Remove excessive debugging output.
Fix color procs to get gray scale instead of _b_w_.
Use gput procedure to store data in the PDF graphic state instead of the plain def because initial graphic state is a read-only dictionary. Bug 688593 from customer 870.
Fix a typo that was introduced in r6651.
Fix : gx_path_merge_contacting_contours incorrectly released path segments. DETAILS :
Fix : Shading fill applied a wrong path adjustment. DETAILS :
Add missing initialization to the streams allocated on the stack or in raw memory. Bug 688572
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Work around an internal compiler error C1001 in MSVC 7.1.3088. Split expressionss with multiple type conversions into 2 expressions. Bug 688579
visual brush could only be invoked once, thanks to stefan for the fix
Fix : MSVC8 warnings.
