Fix filename lookup in the %rom% device to match the lenth of the requested path, not just a common start.
Fix the unix install to include Fontmap.GS. This was the cause of 688567.
corrupt ,v files fix.
fixing ,v corrupt file.

Handle yet another PDF that Acrobat Reader accepts silently that does not conform to the specification. In this case the /Subtype is /TrueType but the font is in the /FontFile, not the FontFile2 or FontFile3 stream. Bug #688585 for customer #780.
Fix a problem with CMYK JPXDecode filter image streams.

Move init files on %rom% device to lib directory prefix (%rom%lib/). This prefix is used independent of the host OS. Requested by Ralph and Stefan. The -d destination prefix might be useful for adding other directories from other source directories to explicit locations in the %rom% device.

Fix opening of lib files so that %rom% files can be found. Previous code only worked for default (os) device. Change iccinit1 so that gs_init.ps is opened with .libfile allowing gs_init.ps to be changed even when COMPILE_INITS=1. Remove another vestige of the old 'static resource' approach that is no longer needed by COMPILE_INITS=1.
Fix a problem with the jasper assembly code. Bug 688545.
Report error codes returned by the lwf_jp2 library to allow better bug reports.
Output more debugging information with -Zw instead of switching on the special JBIG2_DEBUG preprocessor symbol.
Fix : A slow rendering of a colored halftone (2nd attempt).
FIx output format handling for -sOutputFile string. Thanks to Gh Savulescu for the detailed analysis and patch. Bug 687621 for customers 670 and 770. --This line, and th se below, will be ignored--
Fix for 688551 Need to process transparency in annot appearance streams.
Fix (gxfill) : Unwinding the revision 5699 change due to regressions.
Fix mkromfs to generate 32-bit big_endian values in memory, not native byte ordering. Corresponding change in gsiorom.c to always read big_endian 32-bit values.
Fix (gxfill) : The scanline algorithm could miss a spot boundary.
Fix : An MSVC warning and C style in a recent patch.

Remove CWD_PREFIX from makefiles -- mkromfs file list is reordered. Add the %rom% device to the LIBPATH list in imain.c so that .libfile works. Also export print_resource_usage for use in non-debug builds. Thanks to Ralph Giles for the suggestions.
Document the pexit_code and user_errors arguments to gsapi_run_string*() and provide an example for how to parse a PDF file from inside the interpreter. Bug 688549.
Remove the redundant Fixed type from the internal freetype code and replace uses of it with the TT_Fixed type. The un-namespaced version conflicts with system headers on MacOS.
Fix missing declaration on Windows platforms.

Implement %rom% IODevice and use it for the COMPILE_INITS=1 builds. Data is compressed and can include fonts as well as lib init files, Resource directories and other. The (%rom%) path is inserted as the first path on the LIBPATH list when COMPILE_INITS=1. The default GenricResourceDir is set to %rom%Resource/ unless the command line sets -sGenericReourceDir. Bug 687485.
Fix : A slow rendering of a colored halftone.
Fix (shadings) : Save C stack space with removing rudimentary data.
Repair incorrect ToUnicode CMap streams that have no CMapName key. Bug 688517
Addition to the fix for 688177 Eliminate the 64 bit pixel size limit.

Implement yet another hack for an invalid PDF file that Adobe handles. If a parameter is missing from the Page tree, check the Root Catalog. This case had MediaBox in the Root dict, but not anywhere in the Pages tree. Bug 688562 for customer 670.
Fix for 688560 DeviceN with InDesign gradient causes segmentation fault.
Fix recognition of executable names "if" and "ifelse" as valid operations in the calculator function. Bug 688547.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Propagate error code from s_DCTE_put_params (continued).
Update the "RCS" keyword check script to recognize SVN style as well as CVS style Id keyword lines. Bug 688554.
Correct the accidentally changed hardwired install prefix.

Have the update_ghostscript function return the new SVN revision number and include it at the head of the report for clarity. Also, when the complete report is trimmed from length, indicate so. Bug 688541.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Updating the list of standard CMap names.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : When emulating the text rendering mode 3, don't render the text to the target device.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handle charpath with default implementation.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Propagate error code from s_DCTE_put_params.
Fix : Unwinding the change from rev 6573 to 6574 due to a pdfwrite problem.
Upgrade ttf_OS_2_t structure to support v.2 (96-byte) OS/2 table. Bug 688536.
Clamp bbox rectangle to avoid q
Calculate the last byte of the character code modulo 256 to prevent the final value exceed 256 and cause an rangecheck error. Bug 688535.
Removes hexadecimal conversion from the code and pass the encrypted part of the type 1 font to eexec operator intact in all cases. Bug 688385 from customer 1110.
Consume EOD character in the Hex stream when the stream length is > 0. Bug 688512 from customer 232.
Fix (pdfwrite) : 'shfill' doesn't write a shading's Background.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Allow instandard glyph names when synthesising an Encoding for 'glyphshow'.
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxccman.c (continued).
Following FreeType 2 implementation, ignore incorrect SHC command. Bug 688501
Fix for 688177 Eliminate the 64 bit pixel size limit.
Code cleanup. Remove unused headers and report decoded image parameters through -Zw instead of with general or -Zs debug prints.
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxccman.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gzspotan.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from siscale.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxcht.c, gxdhtserial.c
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxdhtserial.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gsfunc0.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gsfcmap.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gdevpsft.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from the FreeType FAPI bridge.
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gdevpsf1.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxpflat.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gdewddrw.c, gxdtfill.h .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxshade1.c .
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxshade1.c .
Fix (font machinery) : Remove the dependency of the graphics library code on the PS interpreter code.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Devcice parameters placed in a wrong memory space.
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxshade6.c .
Use the TT font 'Full Name' (name id #4) if the PS name (id #6) is not present. Related to Bug 688523 for customer 580.
Fix : A wrong CTM in clist after a create compositor command.
Fix  : Removing 'assert' from gxshade6.c .
Remove an unnecessary terminal '\' in the definition of JAS_EXCF_ which causes problems with make in SGI Irix. Closes bug 688529.
Fix (font machinery) : Dereferenced NULL in gx_add_char_bits.
Fix a missing dependency in the new sjbig2 build rules.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 6.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 5.
Fix (font machinery) : Inaccurate condition in zfont_mark_glyph_name.
Make ps2epsi create a temporary file more securely in an owner-locked directory. Closes bug #687243.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 4.
Handle indirect object reference for CIDSystemInfo element. Bug 688515 for customer 870.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 3.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Remove pdf_begin_char_proc_generic.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 2.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Avoid the dependency of a charproc on char code, step 1.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Prevent extra encoding elements (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Prevent extra encoding elements.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Optimize cos_dict_put_copy.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Incorrect computation of a FMapType 9 text size.
Fix : A minor modularity improvement.
Remove the errpage.ps utility. It is not being used by developers and is no longer functional. Bug #688511.
Add required 'quit' execution to avoid prompt thus requiring a double 'quit'. Bug 688497.
Repeat the reference to autogen.sh in the Unix-specific build instructions. Bug #688504.
Infix .pdf. in the output of make_two_pdfversions.
Fix (ps2write) : Incorrect xref offsets.
Add backward-compatible glyph names for new TTF glyphs. For instance, /mu1 (micro symbol) is aliased to /mu (greek letter). Bug 688265
Increase the halftone cache size to improve the performance of large halftone cells. Bug 687525
Fix : Unwinding the 6449 change (Fix detection of hexadecimal encoding in eexec portion of Type 1 fonts).
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite, PDF/X) : Implement TrimBox, BleedBox and related Distiller parameters.
Fix (pdfwrite, PDF/X) : Implement TrimBox, BleedBox and related Distiller parameters, continued.
Previous patch had matrix1 matrix2 operands exchanged so scaling by cmmatrix was wrong. This now works for resolutions other than 72. Bug 688485 for customer 850.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't embed unused fonts.
Accept '-r <revision number>' as well as a date spec to the update_specific script. Bug 688498.
Print error messages, don't leave them on the stack. Bug 688491
Fix (pdfwrite, PDF/X) : Implement TrimBox, BleedBox and related Distiller parameters.
Apply assert patch for CMYK JPEG 2000 images from bug 688142.
Added hack to double the png image size, until the size computation is fixed.

Apply a SubFileDecode filter to streams if the Length is valid. This prevents reading past the end of data for filters that are not terminated, expecting the PDF Length or 'endstream' to terminate the data. Bug 687435 for customers 780 and 870. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for this patch.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Loss of graphics with GraphicsAlphaBits > 1.
Fix (type 1 interpreter) : c1_hsbw of the main subglyph was replaced with one from the glyph.
Comment about gs_debug['#'] usage
Fix (type 1 interpreter) : Improve the mlodularity about seac data.
A better approach to avoid having uninstallpagedevice free a device that needs closing. Bug 688494. Thanks to leo for the suggestion.
Make sure that the final gs_closedevice isn't called on a device that has been freed during the final .uninstallpagedevice. Bug 688494.
Fix (pdfx) : Registered printing conditions don't need an ICC profile.
Fix (type 1 interpreter) : ce1_setcurrentpoint was wrong in a subglyph.
Update the PDF text matrix basis (TextSaveMatrix) when a 'cm' occurs within a BT/ET section. Bug 688485 for customer #850.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Type 3 font indeterminizm.
Minor cleanup to remove a line that was left in from a cut-and-paste when this call was added. Discovered during bug 688487.
Fix for 688487 A crash from garbage collector pointer validation. This is an addition to 688413 DeviceN under implements 'attributes'
Added mt_throw macros to do a debug printing and error returns. See mt_error.h
fix rgb colors.  Good evidence we haven't looked at any interesting color tests.
Fixed printf format string argument missmatch warnings.
Added printf format string checking for gcc to std.h Fixed some warnings this found.
Fix an out of range subscript in Gimp (XCF) export device and a few minor issues identified by Intel C++ . Bug 687292
Fix detection of hexadecimal encoding in eexec portion of Type 1 fonts. Bug 688385
Fix for 688488 Since Jan 7 2006, many regression files get 'typecheck in --execfunction--'
Better hack for Fixed part indentification
Fix potential compiler error for post increment.
Move back-up CharString construction procedures (RD, ND, ...) to a special dictionary and put it below userdict to avoid warnings when the font defines them in userdict. Bug 688464
Fixed incorrect advance of glyph_index by combine_cnt, should just +1 combine_cnt should only affect the unicode array indexes.
Fix missing permissions argument to mkdir()
fix incoherent comments.
path data fixes and cleanup.
remove an unnecessary debug statement.
truncate debug output.
Fix for zip container that ends with: end of input stream end of write buffer with more data to write in the zip stream
Update the regression code to use the new SVN repository. This also includes some other minor fixes. The new version of update_specific hasn't been tested.
Partial fix for 688413 DeviceN under implements 'attributes'
Add the PDFA_def prefix file to the file documentation.
Implementation of the remaining TN 5044 operators, Bug 688268
Fixed error with reads smaller than block size.
Remove the unused ARCH_CACHE defines and the code in genarch.c that creates them. Bug 688469.
comment fixes.
fix for incorrectly translated images.
Fixed incorrect length return in zip part length.
Skip over a zip bug with large font files, outputs a warning and continues.
Added zip parse capability for metro/xps files. See pltop.h to disable. See zippart.c for debug zip files written to /tmp/XPS/*
Clean-up temporary parameter files created by batch files. Bug 688471
Enable use of "Bold" in BaseFont name when doing font substitution from PDF files that don't embed all fonts. Bug 688432 for customer 670.
Latest CMap files from ftp://ftp.oreilly.com/pub/examples/nutshell/cjkv/adobe Bug 688412
Fix handling of broken TrueType fonts that have a loca table that is not in order (continued 2).
Fix handling of broken TrueType fonts that have a loca table that is not in order (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : CID fonts got incorrect FontBBox.
Recursively enumerate filter parameters and resolve indirect objects. Bug 688415 from customer 670.
Correct a few typos in 16-bit pixel differencing filter. Bug 687986
Move ReadString and related procedures from systemdict to local environment to avoid a name conflict in a file that defines ReadString in userdict. Bug 687848 from customer 1120
Add missing ps2write device to Makefile.in Bug 688420
Fix serious warnings generated by GCC 3.2 on Cygwin. Bug 687622
Fix (pdfwrite) : A tolerance to a long 'head' table of a TrueType font.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Can't skip identity ToUnicode CMap for a composite font.

Pass the CFLAGS makefile variable when building auxiliary programs on MSVC. This is necessary to that genarch sees the GX_COLOR_INDEX_TYPE define to calculate the corresponding sizeof define. This is already the case in the autoconf/unix build. Bug 687523.
Document the change synchronization issue with the two GX_COLOR_INDEX_TYPE fallbacks. Bug 687523.
Have genarch define ARCH_SIZEOF_GX_COLOR_INDEX in arch.h. Bug 687523.
Remove references to the bug-gs mailing list in the manpages, and add references to bugs.ghostscript.com to gs and ps2pdf. Also list Artifex as an author before artofcode.
Remove the bug report instructions from the documentation. Clearly no one is using this, and just pointing people at the tracker is simplest.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Uninitialized data access while interpreting a high subglyph tree (continued).
Skip '+' character in real numbers during CFF font generation. Ignore the reserved nibble 0xd in encoded real numbers in CFF fonts. Bug 688449
Fix : Iproving the coding style.
Continuation of previous patch for another branch to handle the /URI key in a pdfmark, moving it into the /A (Action) dict with /S key value /URI. Bug 688414 for customer 515.
Normalize the BBox value in the shading dictionary. Bug 688433
Provide more specific fonts for the headers since CJK Windows, uses a bitmap font for just 'sans-serif'. Closes bug 688442.
Improve the wording of two error messages. Related to bug 688451.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Uninitialized data access while interpreting a high subglyph tree.
Fix a spelling error in an error message, s/fhe/the/ . Bug 688451
Fix (pdfwrite) : Upgrade the PDF/X version identifier.
Fix (font machinery) : Improve the font-matrix cache management.
Fix (font machinery) : Provide an additional debug data about text enumeration.
Fixes 3 test crashes due to mismatched color index sizes.
Fix : Remove 'assert' from gxccman.c .
Added memory pointers to debug printf's
Work around a compile error on Solaris 9 (Sun C 5.5). Bug 688411

Work around a bug in PDF files produced by SPIRIT 12.30. Create the missing root of the page tree when /Pages entry in the document root points directly to the 1st page instead of the /Pages node. Fix bug 688419 from customer 850.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Imprecise clipping.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A coding style improvement.

Change handling of /URI key/value pair in pdfmark parameters to move it from the upper level Annot dict down into the /A (Action) dict with a /A (Subtype)i value of /URI so that Adobe Reader will recognize it as a hyperlink to a web site. Bug 688414 for customer 515.
Remove gnu.ghostscript.bug as a suggested group because it isn't very active, and may actually be dead.
Fix data for Huffman table B.12.
Correct an operator precedence bug that was corrupting reading of uncompressed collective bitmaps. Also improve debugging messages.
Promote artimetic debug printout code to JBIG2_DECODE_ARITH from plain JBIG2_DEBUG to cut down on noise.
Handle immediate lossless generic regions the same as immediate generic regions. Fixes bug 688397.
Fix (pdfwrite) : ToUnicode CMap was written with incorrect Postscript.
Fix : Dangling pointers after a font cache overlow.
Fix : Prevent a crash with an invalid FontInfo.
Fix a SEGV in ps2pdf conversion of imagemask when -dConvertCMYKImagesToRGB=true Fix bug 688390
Fix: Remove attempt to cleanup GS state at gs_abort(), because the attempt to cleanup often triggers a recursive abort. Fixes bug #603934.

Regularize the use of signalerror (a private Ghostscript operator used to report errors from within PS procedures) so that standard PS operators use the systemdict version (which is usually defined with 'odef') so that the error message is not misleading. Fix one instance of a missing operator name below the error name on the stack. Bug 687806.

Fix for 688348 transparency image smask bug.  The test file used PDF 1.4 transparency and had an SMask which was a type 1 image with 16 bits per component.  The SMask logic assumed a maximum of 8 bits.  There was a second problem with the image enumerator structure not being initialized with the imager state.
added device argument and turned on debugging.
Fix: Disable run-length grouping of identical pixels when image is rotated or skewed, as numerical problems at T-joins of rectangles can cause dropouts. Fixes bug #688362 and #688179.

Clarify the Ps2pdf usage, particularly the use of array and dictionary distiller options when using the script/batch 'helper' files and the limitations imposed by the simple script. Bug 687373. Thanks to Richard Yeh, Alex Cherepanov and Ralph Giles for suggestions.
Fix an error in Unicode to ASCII conversion when the font name is empty string. Fix bug 687938

Add capability to display text Value strings in Widget Annotations. Multi line support is not yet implemented, but basic Tx types are supported with /DA appearance string (used to select font and color, etc.) as well as /Q (quadding == justinfication) properly supported. Bug 688368 for customer #670.

Use .bind operator (instead of bind) in the image interpolation logic because it is nor affected by -dDELAYBIND or -dNOBIND flags. The redefinition logic assumes that all operators, including .interpolate are bound, i.e. requires a working bind operator. Fix bug 688231
Pacify Valgrind warnings, initialize the image buffer overshot area. Partial fix for bug 688379
Insert a space character before "%%" or "%!" in ASCII85Encode filter to avoid confusion with DSC comments. Fix bug 688079
Work around a bug in PDF files produced by Enfocus PitStop 3.1. Handle annotation border object depending on the actual type of the object, not the key name. Fix bug 688013
Improve error reporting in the jpeg driver. Initialize report_error member of jpeg encoding stream and propagate stream exceptions to the interpreter level. Fix bug 688005
Fix : An unitialized data access.
Fix (pdfwrite) : /BP pdfmark could create dead PDF objects (continiued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generate ToUnicode CMap data from 'uniXXXX' character names.
Fix (TT font parser) : An incorrect Encoding entry type appeared.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Prevent a crash due to an incorrect Encoding of a Type 42 font.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The DestOutputProfile stream dictionary requires the N entry (improved).
Fix (pdfwrite) : The DestOutputProfile stream dictionary requires the N entry.
Improve documentation of -d and -c switches (slightly). Thanks to Chapman Flack for his suggestions. Bug 688321.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Provide Resources dictionary for Type 3 fonts.
Make sure procedure target of an Encode filter gets called with the end of data condition, i.e., 'false' condition. Bug 688326.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Safely close the output file when the device initialization fails.

Fix for regression introduced with patch for 688182 (rev 1.46). The /Length entry is required in stream dicts to prevent undefined in --get-- errors. If the Length is invalid, set it to 0 to prevent using the incorrect value. Fixes bug 688347 for customer 770.
Fix for 688344 Error: /invalidaccess in --setfileposition-- after finding bad XREF.

Fixes broken compile on amd64 platforms (see bug #688047 for details). This patch should be safe on all platforms with 32-bit longs, and is my best guess as to the right thing to do on Tru64 (where long is 64 bits).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Suppress floating point number format in pdfmark operands (continued 2).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Suppress floating point number format in pdfmark operands (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Indexed colors were distorsed with encryption.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Propagate error codes from pdf_write_value.
Fix (pdfwrite) : /BP pdfmark could create dead PDF objects (continiued).
Fix : Don't instantiate pattern when rendering to null device.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Skip a clip path, which is set by setcachedevice (continued after July 28 205).
Fix (PS interpreter) : Allocate gs_screen_enum in same space as its components.
Fix: Cygwin/gcc warninhs.

Fix serious bit rot for building History# and Details# from Changes and Details created by split_changelog.py. Allows the instructions in Release.htm to actually work. This file invoked by toolbin/makehist.tcl.

Two changes needed to fix a single bug. First, the GC 'limit' logic was collecting too frequently. Second, the PDF ICCBased colorspace logic was repeatedly creating a ReusableStreamDecode filter for the DataSource element. Fixes bug #687117 for customer #850.`

Tolerate 'null' as a single argument form of setcustomcolor. This is not documented in TN5044, but older Adobe ProcSets apparently use this mode. Fixes 'misc/cnurse.ps' of the smoke test used prior to release.
Fix (some of) the gcc compiler warnings (at least the really easy ones).
Fix for 688316 SeparationOrder device parameter causes "/undefined in --get--".
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve DCT compression quality with a hewristic choice of DCT encoding parameters (continued 3).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve DCT compression quality with a hewristic choice of DCT encoding parameters (continued 2).
Fix for 688310 pdf open error in op_show_continue.
Fix (pdfwrite) : High level pattern handling was incomplete.
Change reporting of some noisy (irritating) Warnings generated from many PDF files that don't strictly follow the spec. Bug 688229.
Fix handling of TrueType fonts with zero length name tables. Bug 688305 for customer 870.
Fix handling of EOD sequences when decoding CCITT data with EndOfBlock false. Bug 688306 for customer 780.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve DCT compression quality with a hewristic choice of DCT encoding parameters.
Fix: /SP pdfmark must synchronize the clipping path (continued).
Fix for double 'endstream' in a Content stream. Now endstream terminates the object the same way 'endobj' would. Bug 688303 for customer 670.
Fix handling of paths so that 'cm' will affect pending path operations (fill stroke or clip). Verified that with this patch we do as Acrobat Reader from 4 through 7 does. Bug 688299 for customer 870.
Fixed bug with downloaded Intellifont processing with UFST.
Fix (ps2write) : Suppress floating point number format in pdfmark operands.
Fix (ps2write) : Adjust the graphic state before executing a Form XObject.
Change to accept PDF with names that mis-use the '#" escape character when characters following the # are not hex (AR 7 does this). Bug 688297.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 12 (fix 2).
Fix (ps2write) : The vector device virtual function dorect was not clipped by page.
Fix (pdfwrite) : /BP pdfmark could create dead PDF objects.
Fix (garbager) : Provide a method for relocating a parameter string and use it in the pdfwrite device (continued).
Fix (ps2write) : pdf_substitute_resource was misspelled.
Fix (garbager) : Provide a method for relocating a parameter string and use it in the pdfwrite device.
Fix (garbager) : Provide a method for relocating a parameter string and use it in the pdfwrite device.
Fix for 688275 Overprint problems in Display driver - Gs 8.50 and Gs 8.51.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 11 (fix 1).
Some minor corrections and bug fixes.

Fix incorrect detection of the end of input data during processing of (next_code == lzw_decode_max) branch in s_LZWD_process(). Return the error status only when there's not enough data in the buffer and the buffer cannot be refilled. Fix bug 688287
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 10, final.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 9.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 8.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A code restructurisation : factor out pdf_substitue_resource.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 7.
Fix for 688252 Signal 11 in set_color_ht_le_4 on AMD64.  The fix comes from Alex Cherepanov.  Add a cast for force signed math when working with a signed and unsigned value.

Encode the indication that the EPS file has been cropped into EPSBoundingBoxState and suppres subsequent messages about cropping the file. The warning is false when BoundingBox preceeds HiResBoundingBox and BoundingBox causes cropping but HiResBoundingBox doesn't. Fix bug 688062
Fix handling of zero length input files so that .peekstring does not give a rangecheck error. Bug 688199.
Fix for large 'loca' table counts in TrueType fonts causing stackoverflow. Bug 688277 for customer 870.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 6.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 5.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 4.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 3.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects, part 2.
Fix (device intervace, PDF interpreter) : High level devices need to know whether the mask is an image or a group.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix some small bugs and add additional error checking to the huffman decoding support.
Invalid xref was not detected causing some objects to be defined as 'null' which could cause 'typecheck' or other errors. Bug 688285 for customer #870.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handling transparency as a high level objects.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Provide a bbox for .begintransparencygroup (issue 2).
Fix: Validate the number of transparency Background components.
Fix (device interface): Provide an access for the number of transparency Background components for high level devices, part 2.
Fix (device interface): Provide an access for the number of transparency Background components for high level devices.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : provide a bbox for .begintransparencygroup .
Fix (pdfwrite) : Use DeviceGray when writing SMask image.
Change ResusableStreamDecode filter implementation to avoid using .bigstring so that languagelevel 3 is not required for this filter. Patch thanks to mat. Gheorghe Savulescu. Bug 688150.

Work-in-progress commit of huffman text region support. Fix a number of bugs in jbig2_huffman_get_bits() and implement symbol id huffman table decode (a custom table is always included inline in the text region segment header.)
Fix (the device interface) : High level devices need an access to a transparency transfer function object.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve the logic of combining a text rotation with ViewingOrientation.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Allow degenerate CTM by a rendering with no hinting.
Fix (pdfwrite and other vector devices) : A compatibility to Adobe when stroking with a degenerate CTM.
Fix (pdfwrite and other vector devices) : Indeterministic result when stroking a path with a degenerate CTM.
Fix: /SP pdfmark must synchronize the clipping path.

Hack around the lack of subtree support in jbig2_huffman_table_build() by allocating a bigger flat table. This should be fixed the correct way at some point, but lets us proceed with huffman text region decoding implementation in the meantime.
Previous change for ignoring 0 area clip path was not sufficient and made other files misbehave. Fixes bugs 688121 and 688259, reopen 687136.
Fix : Unconforming line join.
Remove huffman debugging printouts. Preserve the state dump functions for future use, but #ifdef protect them.
Fix for shift right 32 bits of unsigned int being treated as shift right 0.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Exit a text context before resetting a clip.
Fix : Clipping was missed while stroking a path with a pattern color.
Fix : Divide long lines while flattening a path.
Fix : Develop.htm must reference all relevant files (continued).
Fix : Develop.htm must reference all relevant files (continued).

Fix for 688250 Another overprint problem with the tiffsep and psdcmyk devices.  The fix ensures that the various bit mask and shift fields in the device's color_info structure is set for the tiffsep, psdcmyk, and spotcmyk devices.
Port the 4-bit EGA device to the new DeviceN color mapping. After a patch from William Bader. Fixes bug #687795.

Fix calculation of the row width on 64-bit platforms. Remove bitmap_raster() macro because Windows bitmap is not affected by the source platform alignment constrains. Initialize padding bytes to 0. Fix bug 688247
Fix (TT font reader) : Allow 'post' over 65536 bytes.
Fix (ps2write) : A workaround for an HP LaserJet 1320 bug in 'resourcestatus'.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Optimize the debug support.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Skip TT instructions if the font program or the cvt program fails.
Fix : Develop.htm must reference all relevant files.

Replace memcpy() with overlapping intervals to memmove() in Type 2 font generator. The old code violated the C spec and failed on HP aC++ compiler with +Olibcalls option. Thanks to Hin-Tak Leung for the patch. Fix bug 687360
Remove the check for 0 CTM in the type 1 font hinter to support PDF files with 0-size fonts or 0 CTM. Fix bug 688237
Pacify Valgrind: don't copy memory on itself. Partial fix for bug 688225.
Fix an off-by-one in reading the SBDEFPIXEL and SBCOMBOP fields of the text region segment flags, which caused us to clear the region background to the wrong value. Bug 688244.
Fix : Maybe line breaks are broken by the last patch. Commit it again with right line breaks for sure.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Skip a clip path, which is set by setcachedevice.
Commit an off-by-one fix from Alex Cherepanov related to bug 688244.
Fix : Ignore XUID if Metrics[2] has been changed.
Work in progress commit of huffman support. This version is still buggy and includes some serious debug spew.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Delay the assignation of object id to a color space until its creation is completed.
Fix for 688052 Segv with test file for 687980 and the psdcmyk device.
Use memmove() instead of memcpy() in Ins_MINDEX() because of the overlapping memory blocks. Fix bug 688224.
Fix off-by-one error in Decode array testing. Fix bug 688223.

Fix for 688218 gdevpng.c(148) : A harmful warning from MSVC8.  The warning message was due to a math overflow for the dither_grays and dither_colors fields in the device color_info structure.  This occured due to the addition of the png48 device which has 16 bit components.  The fix is to increase the field size to a uint (typically 32 bits).
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Merge equal function resources.
Fix (ps2write) : Some of Widths elements could be missed.
Fix : Move character raster buffers into the memory space of gx_show_enum.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Synthesized bitmap fonts had zero character width in charprocs.
Fix undefined in -get- caused by previous (1.38) patch that ignored zero length tables in TT font. Previous fix for 687457. Bug 688220 for customer 580.
Fix (ps2write) : Initial commit of the ps2ps2 documentation.
Fix (ps2write) : The default value for MaxInlineImageSize was incorrect.
Fix (ps2write) : Bring the script to the traditional form (continued).
Fix (ps2write) : Bring the script to the traditional form.
Fix (ps2write) : Bring the script to the traditional form.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Tj must account the Widths rounding when converting to a bitmap font.
Skip CFF tables at 0 or negative offset because some CFF fonts put empty tables at offset 0. Bug 688160. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for this patch.
Fix handling of Some Type1C (CFF) font subsets where the tables may not be completely contiguous. Seen with PDFs created by pdflib. Bug 688216 and 688040 for customer 562.
Remove the arbitrary limit of 256 max_colors from the dci_ macros. This is related to bug 688204 and allows shadings (gradients) to have more than 256 steps for high precision color devices.

Add a 48 bit RGB PNG raster device for testing deep color output code paths. The new device is called 'png48'. Note that this is a different naming scheme from the the other PNG devices, which use number of colors instead of the log of the number of colors to distinguish between the different output formats. Related to bug 688204.
Fix for 688209 Incorrect equiv color for 'Dark Blue' in test file.

Don't use Length value in the stream dictionary when it's incorrect. All filtered streams are self-terminated. Unfiltered streams are most often occur as contents streams. Their processing is terminated by execution of endstream operator. Unfiltered image streams will only read the data required by the image. Fix bug 688182.
Fix (ps2write) : Don't replace Encoding for standard fonts.

Increade the limit on the .libfile operand length from 200 to the full gp_file_name_sizeof . The OS also limits the length of the file name, for instance, on WinNT, NTFS to 252 characters. Fix bug 688198.
Fix (ps2write) : Don't replace Encoding for standard fonts.
Fix (ps2write) : Embed standard fonts, which use extention glyphs due to encoding conflicts.
Fix for 688206 rangecheck in --setcolorspace--.  Actually there is a problem with the PDF test files.  The 'fix' is to make Ghostscript more tolerant of errors.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : A missed glyph needs cached_fm_pair_s.
Fix (ps2write) : EOT marker was missed.
Cast color components to type gx_color_index before shifting when composing a chunked index color in gx_default_rgb_map_rgb_color(). Partial fix for bug 688204.
Fix : MSVC8 Beta 2 doesn't handle the compiler option Gi.
Fix MSVC compile error
The gdevdsp.c file was missed in the previous commit for the fix for 688192.
Fix for 688192 Resolution dependant problems with tiffsep.  Note:  The actual problem is related to garbage collection.
Bug fix for 688196.
Fix (ps2write) : Allow .HWMargins in the printer's userdict.
Fix (ps2write) : CIEBased* images must use DecodeABC as Decode (continued).
Fix const compile error.
Fix broken comment, compile error.

Fix for 688144 Overprint problem wtih emitting a single separation from tiffsep.  The overprint logic assumed that overprinting was never applied if there is only one component in the output device.  This is true for a DeviceGray process color model.  However it is possible for there to only be a single output component in other process color models (like CMYK) if the SeparationOrder device parameter is used to select a subset of the device's colorants.  This fix removes the undesired optimization.
Fix (ps2write) : CIEBased* images must use DecodeABC as Decode.
Fix (ps2write) : Imagemask incorrectly synchronized color in the !HaveStrokeColor mode.
Fix : A dangling pointer from pdf_image_enum.
Fix some additional typos in the documentation install rules. Closes bug 688158.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : A recognition of Type 3 glyph variations was inaccurate.
Fix for 687989 PDF to any format raises /invalidfont in /R21.  The test file was created by an imposition program.
Fix : A global restore was applied at save level 1.
Fix : A global restore was applied at save level 1.
Fix : Dangling pointers due to 'restore' left an internal save level.
Fix typos in the the jasper makefile. Closes bug 688148.
Fix : Reference count for gx_clip_path::path_list was incorrect.
Fix : Always place the image enumerator into local memory (continued 2).
Fix : A wrong allocator was used to release the glyph cache.
Fix : Always place the image enumerator into local memory (continued).

Partial fix for 688132 WTS crash with pdf input.  Ghostscript does not serialize a WTS halftone.  (This is required for clist processing.)  As a result, an error code is being returned.  The error code was not being properly returned.  We then seg faulted due to a pointer not being set in the error case.  This fix corrects the problem with returning the error code.  The problem with WTS serializaton remains.
Fix : Factor out any dependence on sizeof(gx_color_index) .
Fix : zchar.c needs a prototype of z1_set_cache.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Type 42 fonts got wrong Width (continued).
Fix : Remove an unreasonably big array type definition related to color index.
Properly initialize the decode result field of the segment header struct to NULL to avoid problems on free. Bug 688053.
Fix (Ps2pdf.htm) : ConvertCMYKImagesToRGB was wrongly documented.
Fix : Always place the image enumerator into local memory.
Fix (ps2write) : A bug while computing an n-argument m-result function type 0.
Link to the relevant section of Use.htm for details about the GS_LIB env variable. Fixes bug 688051.
Add some newer documentation files to the unix install target. Fixes bug 688049.
Fix a documentation typo: NeverEnbed vs NeverEmbed.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Type 42 fonts got wrong Width.
Fix : Interleaved images could miss Decode, step 4.
Throw an error when JBIG2 decoding fails in the library instead of segfaulting. Bug 688053.
Throw an error when JBIG2 decoding fails in the library instead of segfaulting. Bug 688053.
Fix : Interleaved images could miss Decode, step 3.
Fix : Interleaved images could miss Decode, step 2.
Fix : Interleaved images could miss Decode, step 1.
Fix for 688116 DeviceN spot colours are corrupt in display device.
Fix for the BeginPage and EndPage procedures used for N-up processing.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The memory descriptor of gx_device_pdf missed some strings.
Removed extra && and space from last commit (fix for 687973).

Fix to allow CCITT data without EOFB when EndOfBlock is true (the default) to return normal end-of-file (EOFC) status instead of ioerror (ERRC) as long as the row count given by Rows is satisfied. Bug 687973.
ps2write : Fixed problems with Separation color spaces.
Update a few of the paper sizes used in reading/writing PXL. Fixes bug 688118.
Fix : TT interpreter had problems on 64 bit platforms.
Fix : A failed pattern color could cause a crash in vector devices.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Skip empty images when converting a shading into a bitmap.
Fix for 688113 null ptr crash in gdevp14.c.  With the -rXXXxYYY switch specified and high resolution PDF 1.4 transparency files, GS would crash.
Fix : 'strokepath' could generate wrongly oriented contours (continued 2)
Fix : 'strokepath' could generate wrongly oriented contours (continued)
Fix VM space for userparams. Problem and patch courtesy of Paul Vojta. Bug 688107.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Wrong shading coordinates when converting to PDF 1.2 .
Fix for 688010 Errors in overprint with halftoned output.
Fix (pdfwrite, ps2write) : Shading background was missed in PDF1.2 .
Fix : 'setcachewdevice' must always clip characters.
Fix : 'strokepath' could generate wrongly oriented contours.
Fixed bug where bounding box device was installed without valid memory pointer.

Fix for yet another broken PDF that Adobe Reader handles without complaint. Circular references in Resources are now detected and handled (with a warning). Bug 687946 for customer 580. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for this fix
Fix (pdfwrite) : A wrong line join with 'stroke'.
Fix (ps2write) : Complete supporting vierws which have no stroke color.
Fix (opdfread) : Some glyphs were substituted with .notdef .
Fix a typo in a comment.
Fix (ps2write) : Did not write halftone, color transfer, and some other graphic state parameters.
Increase the artificial limits in the spot analyzer device to accommodate Xterra-Regular font. Fix bug 688077.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Properly encrypt the document Info values.
Fix overly agressive xref format checking that was tripped up by double <cr> instead of <cr><lf>. Bug 688082 for customer 580.
Partial fix for 687814 dithering artifacts.  The given test file shows some faint halftone dots in the background when rasterized using the bmp256 device.
ps2write : Fix problems with shadings.
Handle CIDCount value of 65536 which might be seen with Identity CMap. Fix for customer 562.
Fix implicit cast warnings from MSVC. Bug 687988.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Properly account FontMatrix of a CID font with 'glypshow', 'cshow'.
Fix for 687883 tiff32nc device and PDF transparency and for 687980 image missing with psdcmyk driver.
Fix for 688048 ijs driver broken in 8.51 for ProcessColorModel=Gray versus 8.50
Fix (pdfwrite) : Uninitialized variable when encrypting a string from a pdfmark.
Fix (pdfwrite) : font file objects encryption was broken when worked on ps2write.
Yet another symbol set patch. Fixed 2 incorrect unicode names in 2N 8859/2 latin 2
Speed up shadings : fixed a crash with unlinear color devices.
Use the OrigFontName from an embedded font's FOntInfo dictionary since this is where Windows PostScript dirver puts the real font name when embedding fonts. Bug 688006 for customer 32.
Prevent out of range ImageType 4 mask array entries from causing an error as Adobe Acrobat Reader does. Bug 687611 for customer 870.
Fix for bug 687984.
Fix: use identity matrix (rather than scaling by font matrix) to prepare parameters for CDevProc procedure in pdfwrite code path. Fixes bug #688033.
Fix a SEGV when ImageType 4 has MaskColor values outside the range. Detected with the PDF file from bug 687611 for customer 870.
Fix for SEGV when PreserveHalftoneInfo=true is given as a pdfwrite option. Bug 688018.
Fix for 688019  /configurationerror in --setpagedevice--.  The PDF interpreter was incorrectly determining the size of the page.
Fix : An MSVC8 warning.
Fixed bug in pcl top margin.
Add an explicit cast to quiet a warning on MSVC. Bug 687988.
Conveys input tray selection info (/ManualFeed and /MediaPosition) setpagedevice requests to PCL devices. Fixes bug #687899.
dd a missing break; in the segment release dispatch. Release of symbol dictionary segments was falling through and causing a double free of the result. Bug 688004.
Disable non-fatal jbig2 debug messages unless JBIG2_DEBUG is defined in the C preprocessor. Previously, all messages were reported in the general gs debug build, which was distracting.
ps2write : Fix problems with encodings.
Fix : LZWEncode filtyer template didn't provide a set_defaults method.
ps2write : Improving a debug printing.
Fixed null pointer access in pdfwrite.
Fixed null pointer access in pdfwrite.
Fix for 688011 Segment fault with -r150 and the mswindll device.
Fix bug where raster lookups failed on new files causing the regression tool to stop.  Also, skip processing for files without previous rasters to compare.
Add a discussion of the libjpeg6b component id issue to Issues.htm, pointing people to a patch. Resolves bug #686980.
Fix : Propagate return codes truoug gx_image3_end_image.
ps2write : Work around HP LaserJet 1320 bugs (continued).
ps2write : Fixing problems with TrueType fonts.
Fix for 687434, 687835, and 687982.  These reports are  /vmerror in --eofill-- or --fill--.  They are caused by the pattern accumulation device trying to allocate excessively large buffers.
Set PJL RENDERMODE to GRAYSCALE or COLOR depending on whether device is pxlmono or pxlcolor, respectively. Fixes bug #687990. Thanks to Jonathan Kamens for the patch.
Add the missing ijs-config.1 manpage so our distributed ijs tree builds cleanly as a separate package. Include other sync changes to the 0.35 release. Closes bug 687991.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't apply ASCII85Encode to page contents streams which appear to be already ASCII (continued 2).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't apply ASCII85Encode to page contents streams which appear to be already ASCII (continued).
ps2write : Work around HP LaserJet 1320 bugs.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't apply ASCII85Encode to page contents streams which appear to be already ASCII.
Fix : Building GS with MSVC, use a proper CRTL version (debug|nodebug).
fuzzy.c : Fixing the error message format.
ps2write : Fixing an initial matrix bug.

Keep the operands of knownoget_safe pseudo-operator on the stack to ensure proper restoration of the operands when it fails. Correctly adjust the stack in the caller when knownoget_safe fails. Fix bug 687473 from the customer 780.
Fixed bug with macros and pcl cursor stack. Moved cursor stack out of the pcl state. This and the cap are not restored after macro calls.
Fix : MSVC8 warning.
Fix : Coding style and MSVC8 warning in gsciemap.c .
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
ps2write : Fixing minor problems with text placing.

Fix for 687696 PDF 1.4 transparency can use large chunks of memory. Prior to this fix the handling of PDF 1.4 transparency features used one or more full size image buffers.  With high resolutions and large images, these buffers can be multiple gigabytes.  As a result, we were not able to handle these files.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Inconsistent transform coefficients after the dynamic glyph scaling.

Initialize ColorSpace parameter in ijs driver to DeviceRGB. This prevents a PostScript error in "currentpagedevice setpagedevice" and similar code when ColorSpace is not explicitly initialized. Fix bug 687013.
Add FillOrder device parameter to TIFF fax devices and document the changes in Devices.htm . Fix bug 687324
Fix (pdfwrite) : Equal image merging could break the Mask object of a type 3 image.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't create a CMap resource list.
Fix : MSVC 8 debug build was broken.
Fix bug #687958 gswin32: Assertion fails due to a bug in dwtext.c. Keep argument to isprint() within 0-255.

Eliminate a performance problem when a TT font has a large 'loca' table. A fix for 687889 used .sort on the 'loca' table but this takes a long time if the table is large. Only run the .sort if the table is out of order which is rare since the TT font spec requires an in-order table. Bug 687968.
Fixed missing paren copiler error in last commit.
Fix: Move setting of #copies userdict entry outside restore operation so it doesn't get clobbered. Fixes bug #687964. Thanks to Leon Sha for the patch.
Fix a problem with .dividesfnts for large Type42 fonts introduced with the previous commit. Also replace macro with C-Style compliant inline function.
Grammar fix.
Fix handling of broken TrueType fonts that have a loca table that is not in order. Bug 687889 for customer 670.
ps2write : Fixing minor problems with debug printing.
fix infinite loop error on one case of bad pxl input.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improving the heap consistensy with compression chooser.
Fixed compiler error on MSVC target.
Fix : Erase all pointers initializing a font structure.
Fix (pdfdwrite) : Don't apply FlateEncode generating a PDF 1.2.
Allow null memory pointer in debug error printfs.
Fixed last commit to only clear permanent patterns on Permanent reset.
Fix conformance problems in ghostpdf.ppd.  Now tested with cupstestppd.
ps2write : Fix problems with hex encodings (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improve garbager methods of pdf_image_writer.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Implement an explicit initialization of pdf_image_writer.
Tolerate non-printing garbage characters prior to the %PDF header of a PDF file. Bug 687942 for customer 670.
Fix: make sure that transfer functions and spot functions are permuted to the same order as the other halftoning parameters. Fixes bug #687916.
Fix (the filling algorithm) : Drpouts could appear at Y-extremes of the path (continued).

Provide more robust handling of errors in an attempt to prevent badly formed error handlers defined in the PS file from causing nested errors (and the infamous dump-like "Unexpected interpreter error"). Refer to bug 687925.
Fix a problem with the initial matrix when the InputAttributes has a page size range (four element array) with the lower bounds greater than 0. Patch submitted by Till Kamppeter for bug 687902.
Fix so that outline links to non-existent pages do not get processed or included in the outline passed to pdfwrite (via pdfmark). Bug 687917.
Fix for 687935 rangecheck in stroke while overprinting on the display device.
ps2write : Fix problems with heh encodings.
Revert to the redistributable Identity-H and Identity-V CMaps (same as the CVS revision 1.1). Bug 687933.

pxsessio.c: formatting/indenting. pxtop.c: font dictionary release when pxl state is released. pxstate.c, pcfont.c: the character cache machinery was not being released properly (fixes leak). pcuptrn.c: the pcl pattern dictionary was not being restored after macro invocation leading to later memory corruption.  (fixes crash). plsrgb.c: deprecate reading from a crd from a device.

Fix for 687849 Unrecoverable error, converting PDF to TIF.  Igor determined that the file has a problem that that causes the XREF rebuilding logic to be invoked and that object 74 0 was not being found.  With this fix, we are able to rebuild the file.
fixes several memory leaks in color space setup and pcl passthru mode.
Fix for miterlimit value that is smaller than PostScript PLRM allows. Bug 687895. Somewhat based on patch from Alex Cherepanov.
Fixes iodev leak. Fixes parser errors on trailing esc or leading esc truncated files.

gsstate.c and gsstate.h: new api for freeing view clip, removes redundant clip_path and path allocations. pcl6_gcc.mak: add -rdynamic linker option. pcpatrn.c and pxsessio.c: free pattern cache. pglabel.c: fix stick font leaks.
Some dependencies were missing that caused the build to fail when a subset of DEVICE_DEVS were included. Specifically, zlib and the 'display' device were problems. Bug 687920 for customer #580.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improving the check for a degenerate curve.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Uninitialized variables when applying LZWEncode.
fix memory leak for indexed color space data when banding.
fix memory leak for index color space data when banding.
Fix : gx_forward_pattern_manage missed a return code.

fixes a number of memory leaks because the operator pxDefaultGS was not properly implemented.  The new solution constructs a pxl stream of commands that default the interpreters state, this leverages the memory cleanup code of the existing operators.
Fix: Resolve indirect object references in Widths array. Fixes bug #687906.
Fix update_specific so that it gets the correct parameters for pdfwrite testing.  It was previously using the superset of raster parameters.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : A minor change for fixing the repository consistency.
Fix for an infinite loop in a PDF file that uses Patterns. Bug 687802 for customer #850.
Fix (the filling algorithm) : Drpouts could appear at Y-extremes of the path.
fixes halftone leaks while banding - see code comments for details.
Always rebuild the jasper autoconf header when configure is run to prevent the persistence of stale versions. Closes bug 687852.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Register charproc XObjects with a page (continued);
Fix (pdfwrite) : Register charproc XObjects with a page.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Cygwin/gcc warnings.

Add switch -dNO_TN5044 to disable the TN 5044 pusedo operators.  These operators are needed from some QuarkXpress files but cause probems with some Illustrator 88 and Corel 9 files.  Also add documentation to Use.htm. This is part of bug 687884.
#ifdef out the cygwin stdint-from-sys/types fixup. Newer cygwin seems to provide them all, but still not define stdint.h. Bug 687873.

Fix for 687897 There are still devices not switched to new API. This change implements the DeviceN color related changes in the device API four these four source files.  These devices are not normally part of the Ghostscript build but they are present in the GS sources.
Update broken Adobe documentation links. Closes bug 687892.
Correct a typo in the installation file list. Closes bug 687891.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong options were passed to psf_write_type1_font.
[Log message beg] Fix : Unimplemented CIDFont feature with a Type 3 font descendent (continued).
Ignore / as a name of BaseEncoding; recover broken PDF files generated by J.D.Edwards OneWorld (B7333). Fix bug 687786 from customer 220.
Fix (the new filling algorithm) : Prevent painting outside the clipping box.
Fix : CDevProc|Metrics|Metrics2 did not work with CIDFontType 0 (continued 2).
Fix for possibly non-compliant PDF where the /DecodeParms for a stream is an array, but the /F consists of a single filter name. Bug 687861 for customer 700.
Fix, command list bug where change from index colorspace to non indexed same colorspace wasn't being updated.

Fix bug with null memory pointer in a mem_mono_device. The fill code occasionally allocates memory from the devices memory pointer when banding, so the concept of a NULL pointer in device->memory will not work.

pxerrors.c, pxfont.[ch], pxink.c, pxparse.c, pxpthr.c - warning fixes pxgstate.[ch], pximage.c, pxstate.[ch] - replace structure allocalations with byte allocations to get rid of gc enumeration nastiness. pxsessio.c - parameter mismatch. pxptable.c - ColorTreatment was not defined correctly.
warning fixes, function definitions, bracketing includes for multiple inclusion.
warning fixes - use gs platform routine instead of exit()
warning fixes removes parameter for "stream for back-channel reports", not sure of the history of this addition.
warning fixes.
warning fixes and unlink was broken.
Null pad bitmap font downloads and warning fix.
adds halftone api header file and fixes some warnings.
Fixed null memory pointer in rop texture device construction.

Search the whole PDF file for the last occurrence of %%EOF string starting from the last 1024 bytes. Following Acrobat example, accept invalid PDF files that have large number of junk bytes at the end. Fix bug 687474 from customer 580.
Fix : CDevProc|Metrics|Metrics2 did not work with CIDFontType 0 (continued).
Properly mask the last row byte in the shift == 0 compositor case. Fixes bug 687843.
Fix : Unimplemented CIDFont feature with a Type 3 font descendent.
Trivial whitespace fix.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Provide a tolerance to the FDef array overflow.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : The interpretation must not depend on the font subset prefix.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Propagate error code from setup_image_compression.
Fix : Targets gconfxx.h and ld.tr had an incorrect dependence in the makefile.
Fix : Restore missed dependencies on gconfxx.h .
Fix : Completely remove the platform dependent target lib.tr from makefiles.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The "NeverEmbed" logics was broken (continued 2).
Fix (pdfwrite) : The "NeverEmbed" logics was broken (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : The "NeverEmbed" logics was broken.
Fix for invalid (zero width) BBox in PDF Form Xobject or Annotation. Bug 687862 for customer 770.
Fixed bug PXL character bug. Was incorrectly using signed characters conversion to gs_char instead of unsigned characters.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Prefer 'post' to cmap 1.0, because obsolete PDF writers misuse the latter.
Fix : A hang adding over 256 glyphs for a stable font copy.
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result (continued 5).
Fix (TT grid fitting) : An assertion failed in the spot analyzer (continued).
Fix and error return. The normal 'return jbig2_error(ctx, JBIG2_SEVERITY_FATAL,...)' idiom doesn't work when the function returns a pointer instead of an error code.
Correct an ambiguous '#if DEBUG' to an '#ifdef DEBUG'. Part of the fix for bug 687830.

Error if the symbol id indicated for refinement in a refagg symbol dictionary segment is out of range. UBC test stream 042_13 triggers this, we don't fix this here, only handle the error more verbosely.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : An assertion failed in the spot analyzer.

Provide back-up definitions of /-| /RD /|- /ND /| /NP for the benefit of embedded PDF fonts that forget to define them. Issue a warning when they are used. Don't fix PS interpreter because Distiller doesn't accept such fonts either. fix bug 687824
Moved include outside of function body to fix MSVC compile error.
Fix : Disable an unuseful warning from MSVC8.
Correct an incorrect cast in the jpx filter. Bug 687831.
Fix : Improvinmg documentation for recently improced algorythms.

Code cleanup. The refinement region decode procedures use a 'GR' prefix in the spec even when the function is identical to the 'GB' prefix variables in the generic region procedures. Change our code to match.
Fix for truncated files, calls EOF on: no bytes consumed, data in buffer, and EOF on stream.
Remove the reference image debug dump.
#ifdef protect a debug image dump.
Implement text refinement regions (SBREFINE = 1 in text segments). jbig2dec commandline now decodes 1page-output.jbig2 from bug #687575.

Implements IAID procedure for decoding reference symbol id's in symbol dict segs (was incorrectly using generic int procedure). Fixes off-by- one test for image bounds in jbig2_image_get_pixel and jbig2_image_set_pixel.
Zero the sdrat values if they are not going to be used. Avoids a UMR in a later debug message.
Fix an error in REFAGG decoding, and properly warn that REFAGGNINST > 1 isn't yes implemented.
Protect the refinement region debug output with an #ifdef.

Fix: in implementation of n operator in clip mode, put pathbbox in stopped context so that completely empty paths have the same behavior as paths with empty bbox, rather than causing an error. Fixes bug #687820.
Return error code when using -f filename. Fix bug #687811 strange behavior with -f.
When doing a Windows debug build, link against the debug run time libraries.
Invert the check for refinement region movable template offsets. This was the last bug in the refinement region segment handling code, we now handle the ubc 042_22.jb2 test file!
We no longer need the result debug image; page composition is working ok.
Clean up some debug messages.
Fix (TT interpreter) : The component 'usage' buffer size was wrongly computed.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Bugs in 'flex' with disabled hinting.

Null the DEVICE_DEVS_EXTRA variable when calling the link line. This works around env space limitations on some vendor unicies when a large set of devices are passed from the make command line through this variable. Bug 687804.
Cast the gx color index to an int inside the switch argument to avoid problems with the HP-UX 10 compiler which does not accept 64 bit arguments to switch(). Bug 687804.
Fixes classic C problem of using float parameters without a prototype, fixes new CIE/SRGB interface.
Add some missing initializers for glyph_data_t->memory. Related to the 687459 fix.
Copies over new-style color procs when making a null device with a target, to avoid inconsistent states. Fixes bug #687770.
Fix regression created by previous patch for bug 687752.
Fix a missing part of the JOBSERVER implementation that makes the ^D a self-delimitting token. Fixes bug 687779.
Fix for unlimited recursion in 'cs/CS' implementation (actually in a certain path in 'resolvecolorspace'. Fixes bug 687752 for Artifex customer 190.

Fix bug 687777 to remove the makefile dependency of dscparse from the pdfwrite device. This allows non-PS to include the pdfwrite.dev in the build. Also updated zdscpars.c to add needed 'mem' pointer.
Promote the debugging get/set pixel routines to general availability. Also, fix a bit order bug: we follow the pbm convention, where MSb is leftmost, not rightmost.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Page context stream was not properly formed when starts with an invisible text.

Fix for Bug 687459 (SEGV) addressing several problems: (i) Elements fetched from a font dictionary have to be dereferenced into a ref since pointers change if the dictionary is resized (to add entries); (ii) The glyph_cache used by gs_font_cid2 fonts needs to be in stable memory since elements might be added after a 'save' and the list will still be refereced by the font, so cannot be freed by 'restore'; (iii) The gs_glyph_cache__release was never being called so creating a memory leak -- font notification (called by gs_font_finalize) is now used to free the cache list; (iv) The gs_glyph_cache__release did not work (probably was never tested since it was not being used).
Fix : toolbin/pdfinflt.ps did not decompress some streams (continued).
Fix : Improve the resource path customization and the related documentation (continued).
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix: Python opens files in text mode unless "rb" is needed.

Add an interactive image compare tool written in Python by a Python neophyte. Not quite ready for prime-time, but an interesting enough start to commit. Even though there are bugs in the differencing, responsiveness and memory usage, it is still sometimes useful. If a version # were to be applied to this, I would call it 0.1 (at least it is a positive number).

Update the MacOS X platform-specific makefile. Remove -traditional-cpp. This was added to work around bugs in earlier releases of Apple's gcc, but it is not necessary with more recent releases, and conflicts with newer cpp features used by more recent Ghostscript code. Partial fix for bug 687787.
Add handling for missing EOL following the %PDF-#.## string in the header. Yet another bad file that Acrobat Reader handles. Bug 687781.
Add missing opening quotes to the error printouts. This typo came in as part of an earlier bug fix and prevented compilation. Bug 687784.
Fixes Bug#687762.  Includes the date specification of the CVS checkout in the baseline update log.  This then gets propagated to the daily reports.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Forget cancelled resources.
Mention the issue with polygon overlap in antialiased rendering. Closes bug 687742.
Documentation update to fix some dead links.
Documentation fixes, due to changes in iapi.h.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Font size was wrong when definefont applied to a scaled font.
Fix (vdtrace.c) : Fix gcc warnings and improve C-style.
Fix (gswin32) : Opened a window outside the desctop area.
Fix (type 1 interpreter) : Replaced Metrics was missed.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Glyph positions were wrong for vertical CID fonts (continued 2).
Fix (resource machinery) : Improve the resource path customization and the related documentation (continued).
Fix (resource machinery) : Improve the resource path customization and the related documentation.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Improve the font substitution and the CID font substitution.

Add libctx memory pointers where required in the compiled-fonts code. This was missed in the initial commit. Also, add the OBJ directory to the include path when compiling the font data, since stdpre.h now requires the generate arch.h header. Closes bug 687758.
Fix : CIDFont-CMap construction didn't work with substituted CID font resources.
Build an unoptimized version of the refinement template context calculation to assist with debugging. This one doesn't seem to work either.
Fixes copying of paths into clipping path list so that it works even when the path is allocated with local_segments. Fixes bugs #687401, #687612, and #687750.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Subglyphs were positioned wrongly (continued).
Fix (TT interpreter) : Subglyphs were positioned wrongly.
Fix (TT interpreter) : A tolerance to bad TT instructions.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Glyph positions were wrong for vertical CID fonts (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite, PDF interpreter) : Glyph positions were wrong for vertical CID fonts.
Fix : Degenerate segments must not paint when caps is not round.
Fixed shear bug in pxlfts2.0/t310 01
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Don't align glyph width to pixels.
Fix : toolbin/pdfinflt.ps did not decompress some streams.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Fixing some Type 3 encoding problems.

Fix for pxl rotated bitmap font scaling. Removed dead code in px_text for scaling px_set_char_matrix() now does the char matrix scaling for bitmaps the y axis flip is remove then page scaling is applied.
Fixed bug where VMI incorrectly reset. Changed logical page to default HMI an VMI only on initial reset.
Fix (pdfwrite, PDF interpreter) : Correctly handle different widths for same glyph (continued).
Fix LZWEncode filter to use the EarlyChange parameter and also correct the tifflzw device to initialize EarlyChange to the proper value (1). Bug 687726.
Fix (pdfwrite) : *bfrange boundaries may differ in the last byte only.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The function same_type42_hinting was indeterministic.
Don't overwrite CFLAGS variable if it is already defined. Bug 687739
Fix initialization of C stack streams that did not perform s_init(). Bug 687709 that could result in a Segmentation Fault (SEGV)
Add a missing dependency on version.mak to the generation of gconfigd.h. Without this the revision number isn't correctly updated in an incremental build. Closes bug 687733.
Fix (TrueType interpreter) : Calls to user defined instructions were not implemented.
Fix : The 'gslibctx' patch had broken FAPI.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : 'int32' conflicts with AIX compiler standard types.
Fix : Optimize gs_c_decode with a binary search.
Add TrivialCMYK color space, which simulates standard PostScript CMYK to RGB conversion on device-independent level. Fix bug 687711
Fix for 687706 Display device 8-bit native incorrectly dithers grays. This is a partial fix and also needs Dan Coby's fixes to the post DeviceN halftoning.  The DeviceRGBK color model is added.
Fix for 687718 The tiffsep device fails when the size of gx_color_index is 32 bits
Fix : Moving type1_cis_get_metrics to the graphics library.

This is a partial fix for 687706 Display device 8-bit native incorrectly dithers grays.  Russell Lang is improving the 8-bit (256 color) display device to allow more shades of gray.  This change is required for that effort.
Fix (the filling algorithm) : Unite trapezoids if they have a common side.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Handle more than 32 TrueType subglyphs.
Fix : Don't apply fill adjustment when stroking a character.
Fix : Pattern metrics was imprecize.

Export the prototype for gcst_get_memory_ptr() which is now used by ilocate.c as well as igc.c to igc.h so it is available in both files. Remove the cast that was papering over the warning this causes. Completes the fix for bug 687617.
Remove a comment about LZW-compatible code that is no longer apply. Bug 687554.

Cast the read standard illuminant to icIlluminant instead of icStandardFlare inside icmMeasurement_read() inside the icc library. Not really our code, but resolves an enum mis-match warning. Bug 687694.
Add string_.h to some files missing prototypes. Bug 687694.
Properly include the portability version of the stdio error. Corrects type confict problems on HP-UX. Closes bug 687689.
Fix bug #687705 Compile of 8.31 fails on OS/2.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : A further improvement of the glyph rendering quality, step 3.
Fix SEGV caused by premature free of the bbox device with high level devices that use the bbox_device of the vector high level device. Bug 687631.
Add the LZWEncode filter that actually compresses using the LZW method, rather than the dummy encoder in slzwce.c that expanded the input, but that avoided the patent issues. Bug 687554.
Fix error with automatic baseline creation for files which contain spaces in their names.
Fixes underlined text with text rotation.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Alwasys write the file ID in hexadecimal encoding.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Alwasys write the file ID in hexadecimal encoding.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generate an error message when pdfmark points beyond the last page.
Partial fix for 687657 Text in transparency mask yields rangecheck in discardtransparencymask.
Fix for 687403 Poor halftoning for 16 color (4 bit) devices.
Fix for 687664 tiffsep sometimes producing apparently corrupt files sometimes.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Could merge fonts with insufficient subrs.
Fix : Degenerate curves could cause a too big number of flattened curve segnments.
Fixes bug #687690 MSVC6 warning in dwimg.c.
Fix : vd_save caused a yntax error in a release build.

Changes bbox device forwarding logic so that get_page_device requests are always forwarded to the target. Fixes bug #687421. Note: this change backs out a change made to gdevnfwd.c between GS 4.70 and 4.80, with a confusing explanation in the change notes. Changes to the page device behavior in forwarding devices would not be surprising. See the code review notes linked from the bug for more details.

Fix handling of CMaps to be able to handle large number of CMap entries seen with some (Adobe) CMap files. Also fix name of a CMap file and remove garbage at the end of one of our CMap files. Bug 687555. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for the changes to allow large CMaps.
Sets explicit umask for nightly regression run.  Fixes Bug #687648.
Fix support for filenames that include spaces.  Also add '.ai' as a PDF type extension.
Fix a typo made by someone's previous commit.

Added new gsutil module for utility functions.  Changed all file extension checks to use new gsutil.check_extension().  Added support for '.ai' as a file extension.  This should fix the problem of several files in comparefiles not making it into the nightly runs.
Add log rotation for the Ghostscript stdout and stderr logs.  Fixes Bug #687574.
Fixes bug #687683 "gswin32c : Ctrl+C doesn't stop the application". Make Ctrl+C in the image window act the same as Ctrl+C in the console window, which generates a signal to exit the process.
Fix for 687625 Incorrect spot color behavior in tiffsep.  Garbage text was being printed for the spot color names.
Fix for 687625 Incorrect spot color behavior in tiffsep.  Garbage text was being printed for the spot color names.

Use PSOBJDIR as a staging area for the name-rewritten scripts at unix install time. We previously used 'sed -i' to modify the installed file in place, but this option is a recent extension and insufficiently portable. The install script also isn't capable enough to accept files through pipes, so we much have an intermediate staging area. PSOBJDIR should be a safe place to write to for this purpose. Fix for 686863.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Correctly handle different widths for same glyph.
Fix : A library context was not provided for bbox device.
Fix a typo in and earlier commit.
Fix : A syntax error in a recent patch.
Fix the problems reported by HP aC++/C compiler but unrelated to the crash. Partial fix for 687643
Fixes crash on fts.2300 with UFST 4.6 (plufont.c).  Adds gcc macro debug information so macros can be expanded in gdb (ugcc_top.mak). Fixes UFST 4.6 configuration error (cgconfig.h).

Fixes bug 687542 Print with pswrite gives 'Could not open the file \\spool\yourprinter'. Add a %printer% IODevice for OS/2, which opens to a temporary file then later copies it to the print spooler.  This will need "%printer%yourprinter", not "\\spool\yourprinter". This is needed to make pswrite write to a printer queue.
Ignore MediaPosition when selecting a media type. Adobe CPSI does it this way, and the PLRM suggests that this is advisory only. Bug 687547 for customer 780.

Handle CS/cs PDF operators that have a colorspace array as an operand instead of a name as the specification requires (yet another broken PDF that Acrobat Reader handles without complaint). Issue pdfformaterror when bad CS operands are seen. Bug 687610 for customer 770.
Fix : Improve the error reporting about a dangling resource map record.
Fix : Type 3 charproc must inherit flattnes from the text context.

Fixes for security problems not fixed in previous commit and fixes for other problems identified by SaGS in bug report -- detecting recursion, allowing r/w strings in procedures (but not in PermitFile arrays). Bug 687559.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : A further improvement of the glyph rendering quality, step 2.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : A further improvement of the glyph rendering quality, step 1.
Translate the name of the gs executable stored in the utility scripts at install-time on unix. Closes bug 686863.
Add some job server related support. The -dJOBSERVER option defines the ^D to start a new encapsulated job, and the ^D is changed to be a self- delimitting token in the scanner. Fixes 687079.
Add missing memory argument in 'I' interp debug printing. Also remove local prototype for debug_print_ref in favor of using idebug.h. Fixes SEGV when using -ZI or (I) true .setdebug.
Propagate memory pointer gs_malloc() changes to the optional lj3100sw device. Patch from Harald Koenig. Closes bug 687636.
Fix : Unwind an unintentional change to setup_image_compression.
Fix for 687640 Unable to set default halftones for PDF.
Fix ResourceForAll Category procedure to make sure that the path given by GenericResourceDir systemparam is included in the enumeration. Bug 687641.
Trap C stack overflow exception on Borland C and MSVC. Without the trap the application silently terminates when C stack overflows. Fix bug 687461
Fix : Arcs were imprecise (continued).
Fix : Arcs were imprecise.
Fix for 687607   Text missing with TextALphaBits=2 and tiffsep device.

Fix for security problems with user parameters, in particular the /PermitFileReading array. Also corrects handling of parameter arrays that contain a 'mark'. Fixes bug 687559. Thanks to mat. Gh. Savulescu (SaGS) for the bug report and for a suggested patch.
Update release notes and open bug list for the 8.31 beta release. Bump the release date as well.
Fix half-toning for display device, bug 687629.
Fix for image matrix having negative values.  Thanks to Len Sorenson for submitting this patch (author unknown).  Bug #687411.

Close the font file after the font has been processed (loaded into VM). This prevents a problem with using up too many file handles detected on Solaris. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for the patch. Bug #687066.
Fix to close streams at EOF (not only filter streams), as required by the PLRM. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for this patch. Bug #687505.
Bind all operators in DefaultGray, DefaultRGB, DefaultCMYK color spaces. Partial fix for the bug 687608
Fix (pdfwrite) : A page compression type change could cause a crash.
Fix : gs_lib_ctx was wrongly accessed while looking up a dictionary stack extension.
Fix : gs_lib_ctx was not accessible while clist_playback_band.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Provide a tolerance to an inconsistent cvt length.
Fix (TT interpreter) : A minor portability problem.
Fix : Makefiles missed a dependency.
GS DEBUGGER fixes.  These changes should have been included in the initial debugger checkin.
Fixed dependancies for gslibctx.h
Fix (pdfwrite) : Check for glyph name conflicts while font merging.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong glyph positions with CIDFontType2 with no vmtx.

Add PDFSTEP debug aid. Prints a step number at end of PDFDEBUG line, and sync's the display, then reads a number of steps to skip (<cr> == single step). This is rudimentary but somewhat useful. Invoked with -dPDFSTEP.
Add support for PDF single stepping debug aid (PDFSTEP). Actual interpreter changes made separately.
Handle invalid PDF's that use 0.0 font scaling (Tf operator). Fixes bug 687606 for customer number 780.
Correct the previous MSVC 8 updates to allow compilation with debugging.

When scaling factors of /ImageMatrix in a image mask for ImageType3 are negative, translation offset values for image mask rendering are incorrect and it makes abnormal output (eg. white lines). This patch fixes this bug #686843. Thanks to Len Sorensen for the analysis.
Fix bug 687038 that resulted in a crash if the initial device was not pdfwrite.
Include stdio.h when required for pbm debug output.
document previous fix
Properly initialize the page buffer to the default pixel value. This caused, among other potential bugs, garbage and overlay effects under some malloc implementatons, though not on GNU/Linux.
fixed bug with iapi, removed gs_lib_finit()'s call of gs_malloc_release.
Fixed uninitialized fstdio2 pointer.
Fixed incorrect function pointer prototype, const gs_memory_t *  argument was missing.
fixed typo in last commit.
Add variable declaration for the path to the ghostscript executable to the unix wrapper scripts. This simplifies changing the invocation name. Partial fix for bug 686863.
Fix : .OrigFont was not provided when an embeded font is defined.
Fix : True Type font loader : numLoca run out the PS string size limit.
1. Fix (PS interpreter) : The FontBBox validation check was too strong. 2. Fix (pdfwrite) : Explicitely set line parameters in a charproc.
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result (continued 4).
Fix for 687572 AFPL Ghostscript 8.14 fails with some PDF files.
Fix for 687591 Overprint Preview is not documented.  This change adds documentaion for how Ghostscript handles overprinting and spot colors to Use.htm.
Fix to make sure that device deactivation is invoked before final close of the device when exit. Bug #687557.
Fix so that compiled fonts have the dictionary permissions set correctly. Bug 687444 for customer #531.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Provide a delayed stream writing.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Discard the output file seekability requirement in the /PS pdfmark implementation.
Fix (pdfwrite) : text.operation was inconsistent after replacing TEXT_FROM_GLYPHS.
ps2write step 35 : Fixing more problems with color spaces.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't write DeviceN, DevicePixel colors with CompatibilityLevel<=1.2 .
Include string_.h for missing prototypes of strlen() &c. Bug 687541.
Cast pointer type to avoid a warning. Bug 687541.
Correct some types to unsigned to match the gp_file_name_combine() prototype. Partial fix for bug 687541.

Fix to pdfwrite initialization to make sure initial distiller params are incorporated into the device. Also add collection of distillerparams when building currentpagedevice. Fixes bugs 687325, 687436 and 687458.
ps2write step 33 : Fixing problems with color spaces in image XObjects.
ps2write step 32 : Fixing problems with color spaces in inline images.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't write shadings with CompatibilityLevel<=1.2 .
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong /Matrix from /BP pdfmark (continued).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Dont create the alternative image compression if a loseless compression is only allowed.
ps2write step 28 : Fixing tab characters in the source code (continued).
ps2write step 26 : Fixing tab characters in the source code.
ps2write step 25 : Fixing various problems in functions and color spaces.
ps2write step 18 : Fix : Length was written to a wrong file position.
ps2write step 15 : Fix : ObjectRegistry expansion code was wrong.
ps2write step 14 : Fix : fonts may have no Encoding.
Fixes bug 687451 "default resolution for display device" Set the display resolution from the MS-Windows display resolution, using a device parameter -dDisplayResolution=DPI.

Fixes bug 687562 "vector devices close output file incorrectly". Vector devices open the output file with gx_device_open_output_file, so should close it with gx_device_close_output_file, not fclose.
