This was preventing pswrite from correctly closing special files such as "%printer%Printer Name" on Windows and OS/2.

Fix for 687565 Incorrect equiv color for Orange in Altona test file. The altona test file Altona_Visual_bb_1v1_x3.pdf contains a spot color called Orange.  An incorrect equivalent CMYK color is being determined for this spot color.  The result is that the spot color is being displayed as black for the devices which handle spot colors and attempt to determine equivalent CMYK colors for the spot colors.  These are the psdcmyk, tiffsep, and display (with -dDisplayFormat=16#a0800) devices.

Log Message: Fixes bug 686956 Display device does not support separations. Add support for separations to display device. This requires a change to the display callback structure. Support is maintained for clients using version 1 of the structure.
Fixes nonportable code in the vasarely.ps example file so that keeps to reasonable page size values even when default clippath is very large (as is the case with the bbox device). Fixes bug #687549.
Fix (pdsfwrite) : Compression of XObjects implicitely depended on CompressFonts (continued).
Fix (pdsfwrite) : Compression of XObjects implicitely depended on CompressFonts.
Fix : MSVC compiler warning.
Fix for 687553 rangecheck in .sethalftone5 and SeparationOrder.
Fix : True Type grid fitting must not apply to FAPI fonts.
debugger documentation.
Modification of Ghostscript debugger.  This code is not stable.
Fix : A dangling pointer from TExecution_Context could cause a memory corruption.
Fix: Unwinding the recent change to gsdparam.c becauase it breaks the PDF interpreter.
Fix (TT interpreter) : The implementation of INSTCTRL did not follow the TT specification by Apple.
Fix for 687534 Unable to determine equivalent CMYK for spot colors that are only used with overprint.
Minor change to avoid a spurious compiler warning about 't' used before initialized. Fixes bug #687412.
Disable idiom recognition feature during execution of .bindnow because it has no effect except burning a few seconds of CPU time. Fix bug 687521
Fixed CMYK to RGB conversion.
Fix macro to use it's arguments.  Platform specific, under exersized code.
Fix (ps2ascii) : Provide a tolerance to old versions of dvips output.
Add new CMaps and update older ones to latest. Bug #687470. Thanks to A. Cherepanov for providing part of the newer files.
Round elements of Mask array to the nearest integer following implementation of AR4, AR5, AR6. Fix bug 687494 from customer 580.
Fix : Arithmetic errors could cause a function monotonity misrecongition.
Fix parsing of -2147483648.5, min_int followed by a fractional part. Fix bug 687500
Fix (pdfwrite) : Allow named object reference in the Action key of /ANN pdfmark.
Try to use long long as a 64 bit type in the genarch fallback stdint definitions. Fix for bug 687514.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A wrong CFF string index randiomization.
Make pdf_dominant_rotation() return unknown text rotation for the file without text. It returned 0 rotation before, which excluded consideration of DSC comments later on. Fix bug 687515
Typo fix: move free before return.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : an indeterministic bug in t1_hinter__simplify_representation.

Fix (type 1 hinter) : 1. Ever align the Y-coordinate of a glyph origin to pixels. 2. Improve the unaligned pole interpolation; 3. Set a waeaker angle threshold in t1_hinter__is_stem_hint_applicable. 4. Allow an offset fuzz in t1_hinter__is_stem_hint_applicable. 5. Align upper/lower horizontal stems by the upper/lower edge. 6. A dependency was missed in lib.mak .
Fix (pdfwrite) : Merge equal ExtGState objects.
Fix (pdfwrite) : 1. After used a process color, continue using it for same client color space. 2. A bug in pdf_set_initial_color could miss some color commands.
Fix (pdfwrite) : ConvertCMYKImagesToRGB crashed.
Fix : 'midpoint' formula was wrong.
Fix for 687477 Bad incremental update to a PDF file.
Fix : A Cygwin/gcc warning.
Aviod a PostScript error in ps2ascii when the source file uses composite fonts. For now, dump the strings in the unmodified encoding when the corresponding font is composite. Fix bug 687466.
Correct various compiler warnings from MSVC and gcc.  Fix for 687441.
Update the open bug list in the release notes.
Enable separable_and_linear and separable for the display device. Fixes bug #687442.
Use ST_MTIME instead of the ctime to determine the date of the last baseline update. Partial fix for bug 687481.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Wrong processing of a big CIDToGIDMap.
(pdfwrite) : 1. Implementing a dynamic recongnition for Type 3 charproc variations; 2. Bug : Viewer state could desynchronize when entering a charproc accumulation.
Fix reference count of overprint compositor so that it doesn't get freed too early. Fixes SEGV of bug #687425 for customer #1110.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrong /Matrix from /BP pdfmark.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Form XObject`s /BBox could contain reals in exponential format.
Fix an MSVC compiler warning.
Fix for 687453 Problem with overprinting and shading.

Add /WhiteIsOpaque page device parameter to provide user interface to the corresponding bbox device flag. Fix a bug introduced in gdevbbox.c v.1.9 (for bug 645531) that left bdev->white and bdev->black uninitialized, resulting in black objects skipped as white. Fix bugs 687410, 687478
Fix (pdfwrite) : Add Encoding element even if the font has no glyph.
Remove unused label. Partial fix for bug 687441.
Fix regression reports (the previous commit accidentally did the exact opposite of what we wanted).  Also, cleaned up the way the report is built so that it is much less confusing.
Avoid a numeric exception; throw /rangecheck when .getbitsrect operator is invoked with raster width = 0. Fix bug 687223.
Fix some warnings about unused variables and undeclared functions generated by MSVC with warning level 3. Move the definition of WARNOPT and add ifdef's. Partial fix for bug 687441.

GCC with -ffast-math compiles ang/90. as ang*(1/90.), losing precission. This doesn't happen when the numeral is replaced with a non-const variable. So we define the variable to work around the GCC problem. Fix bug 687420.
Ignore 0-length tables that occur in PDF files generated by Crystal. Fix bug 687457.
Correct a problem in the fix for 687418 detected by Russell Lang.  Also make the routine check_device_separable public for use by the display device.  The prototype is in gxdevice.h.
Disable the fix for 687418.  This is causing many errors in the regression tests.  These need to be investigated.

Limit the number of timing runs we're willing to do to detect the cache size, preventing an infinite loop if the os timing calls never measure appreciable elapsed time. After a patch from Patrick TJ McPhee. Bug 687095.

Fix for 687455.  The overprint logic creates a temporary device which is used to initialize a set of procedures.  This temp device is only paritally initialized.  The partially initialized device is being set up as a forwarding device but the target device is not yet present.  This created a problem when check_device_separable executed.  This change sets the temp device to 'not separable' so check_device_separable does not try to do anything.
Fix for 687418 WTS does not work with bitcmyk driver.  This fix is applicable to most devices.

Document that we no longer support loading truetype CJK fonts directly from /Resources/CIDFont as worked in 7.0x for Japanese fonts. This has been replaced by the more general, if less convenience, cidfmap mechanism. Closes bug 686949.

Replace locally-defined (u)int32 typedefs with the stdint_.h types now that they're universally available. This avoids conflict with typedefs that are pulled in from sys/types.h on some systems. Bug 687404.
Fix for 687441 New: MSVC warnings.  Correct some warning messages from MSVC.
add escapements to pcl font table and more verbose debugging output upon loading ufst fonts.  The latter may be removed in the future.

Keep calculation in signed types to avoid conversion of the negative int to the big positive long, which caused infinite loop on Alpha in t1_hinter__adjust_matrix_precision() inline function. Fix bug 687417.
Document the use of .setpdfwrite and the relation of vmthreshold to the accumulation of shared object data in the pdfwrite device. Closes bug 687409.
Fix to make sure that both stroke (CA) and non-stroke (ca) opacity is set. Support for customer #32 that wants to create transparent effects in PDF from PostScript input.
Fix 687189 for bbox_forward_add_rect infinite recursion. This problem caused segment faults or apparent hangs with the x11alpha device.  This fix also works for 656414 segfault when using x11alpha
Fix for 687402 Missing color on annots.pdf.  This is actually not an error.  Instead it is due to some confusion about the displaying of link annotations.
Fix regression where 1 byte chars were not ignoring vertical substitution.
Fixed cut and paste typo.
Handle (yet another) invalid PDF that Adobe Acrobat can open. If the Font /Subtype is / then assume Type1. Also issue a **** WARNING message. Bug #687422 for Artifex customer #670.
Use ld_length instead of length because RMap is a long dictionary. Fix bug 687363.
fix an embarassing typo.
Correct DOS line endings accidentally committed to the repository. Bug 687415.
Remove some unused variables. Bug 687413.
Fix: Disables platfonts when antialiasing is in effect. Improves rendering quality, and fixes bug 687368.
Fix (pdfwrite) : /XObject <<-1 0 R>> was written to a pattern dictionary.
Fix : Restoring the non-cache-device constraint in setcolor.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Skip empty hint ranges, improved.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Skip empty hint ranges.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix : MSVC6 compiler warnings.
Fix : setcachedevice must not depend on a BuildChar color and on gx_show_text_retry.
Fix for premature freeing of a 'image' device (makeimagedevice or the similar makewordimagedevice). Bug #687227. Thanks to Alex Cherepanov for the patch.
Fix for inherited MediaBox for the page Group dictionary (transparency). Bug #687293. Thanks to Felix Pahl for the analysis and fix.

Fix for 687390 GhostScript 8.11 inserts rendering artifacts with GIFs as source.  The actual problem is an error which resulted in a pale yellow being shown as a pale pink.  This occurs when dithering on devices which use a 256 color palette.
Fixed incorrect glyph in Unicode 5N symbol table.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Stack balance was broken when a CID font is not embedded.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : Use a weaker condition for horizontal stem recognition.
Remove an empty '#' line. Closes bug 687377.
Fix for unnecessary re-link when building on Windows. Bug #687059.
Check for defined(HAVE_CONFIG_H) instead of just a non-false value. Corrects a warning on the Intel compiler. Ghostscript bug 687320.
Fix (pdfwrite) : TK was written into a charproc.
Make use of the SYS_TYPES_HAS_STDINT_TYPES define we set in the configure script. After a patch from Alex Cherepanov. Bug 687377.
Fix for incorrect Annotation scaling when an Appearance (/AP) had scaling that was not unity (1) and the Subtype was not /Stamp. Fixes Bug #687288 for customer #32.
Fix for 687364 rangecheck in buildshading2 from Quark XPress PS file. This fix involves the creation of the findcmykcustomcolor and setcustomcolor functions.
Rom font compression.  This is not quite complete because it allocates space for all of the resident fonts and leaves them in memory.  Fixing this problem is a separate work soon to be checked in.
Fix : GenericResourceDir was not listed in PermitFileReading.
SunOS 5.9 does not properly replace files with ln -sf. Unlink the existing files instead. Closes bug 687378.
Fix for a long standing problem that could cause characters to be dropped when reading a file with the 'read' operator. Bug #687374 for customer #310.
Fix (TT interpreter) : Subglyphs could be placed to wrong coordinates.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Zero text length caused an access to an uninitialized data.

Fix to implement PDF specification for '/' as a valid name as opposed to the PS token scanning. Previously //name would be incorrectly scanned as an immediately evaluated name rather than two names '/' and '/name' which is correct. Fixes Bug #687277 for customer #440.
Fix name of file in raster directory so that update_pdfbaseline will be run when needed (when new files are added).
Fixed name of urw Symbol font to StandardSymL
Fix (pdfwrite) : A floating point interrupt.
Fix for 687337 Zerodivide in cie_cache_mult.  Note:  There was a typo in the previous fix.
Fix for 687337 Zerodivide in cie_cache_mult.
Fix for 687349 A wrong comment for gx_device_color_s.  This change modifies the comment on ccolor and the related variable ccolor_valid.
Merge paper size fix from gs 8.14
Fix for linedraw characters in the lineprinter font ArtLinePrinter.ttf
Fix : A Cygwin/gcc warning.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : CIDMap was wrongly created from CIDToGIDMap.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Crash after adding a glyph over a preallocated limit of a CIDFontType 2.
Fix (pdfwrite) : XObject's resources were placed wrongly.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : Hints could be lost.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Fall back to the default implementation when the output document can't handle current color.
Fix for 687349 A wrong comment for gx_device_color_s.  This change modifies the comment on ccolor and the related variable ccolor_valid.
Fix : Some Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix : Some Sun ONE Studio 7 compiler warnings (Solaris 8).
Fix : Changing the default value of AlignToPixels to 0. THIS IS INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE.
tt2pcl.c - adds more diagnostics, file offsets where font data is written.  Fixes crash that could occur if the font did not have a cvt table.
Revert documentation change. Apparenlty the problem was that the user specified an ICC colorspace and it does have an effect with pswrite if one uses the usual RGB, etc. colorspaces. Bug 687357.
Clarify that -dNOSUBSTDEVICECOLORS has no effect on the pswrite device. Bug 687357.
Fix problem with dci.max_components introduced with DeviceN changes. Closes bug #677383.
Check for jpeg, zlib, and libpng headers as well as libraries before using the shared versions. Bug 687261.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Wrong metrics when 2 font resources for same embeded font.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Annotations encrypted with a wrong object id.
Fix (Type 2 charstrings) : More tolerance and conformity.
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result (continued 3).
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result (continued 2).
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result (continued).
Fix (dropout prevention) : extra pixels at small serifs.
Immediately return the success for 0-length read from a string array. Don't seek to the offset because it may be invalid in some broken fonts. Fix bug 687340
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fix : Raster depended on bands, step 4, final.
Fix : Raster depended on bands, step 3.
Fix : Raster depended on bands, step 2.
Fix : Raster depended on bands, step 1.
Remove a debug tracing message.
Improve wording in the MSVC debug flag descriptions.
Fix : gs_function_is_monotonic computed an unused auxiliary result.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Reject encryption options if no password is specified, improved.
Fix : "KeyLength" option name was misspelled in the documentation.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Reject encryption options if no password is specified.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Floating point aritmetic applied to uninitialized data.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : The glyph trailing moveto got wrong coordinates.
Fix : Shading could cause a floating point exception.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : AlignToPixels=0 aligned to pixels.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : small resolutions caused a rangecheck.
Fix for 687274 White areas appear shaded.
Improving the MSVC debug build options.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Errors were missed processing a shading data stream.
Fix : Errors were missed processing a shading data stream.
Fix bug where changing the object tag was ignored unless the color was also changed.
Fix incorrect gs_memory_t ptr
remove CIEWORKING #define.  C based CRD problems are now fixed.
Fix : A bug in fn_Sd_is_monotonic.
Fixes bug 687317. Fix pdfwrite allowable Permissions for EncryptionR=2. Fix default Permissions.
Clean up dict stack after loading an embedded Type1 font from a PDF file. While the font is buggy, Adobe doesn't complain. Bug #687315.

Add an option to prevent the 'range' type PageSize from being added to the InputAttribute dictionary. This option is useful for printers that want the requested pages to be rotated to fit one of the available page sizes. Option is -dNORANGEPAGESIZE. Fix for bug #629335.

Add a parameter which prevents the non-standard four element PageSize entry in the InputAttributes from being included. This prevents problems with PostScript programs that examine the InputAttributes entries in an attempt to pick the 'best fit' rather than relying on the setpagedevice logic. Also most 'real' printer devices don't support arbitrary page sizes, so automatic rotation is defeated if the range type page size in included. The option is -dNORANGEPAGESIZE. Bug #629335.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc warnings.

Fix for 687279 Linker warnings with Visual Studio 6 and .NET 2003. The changes consist of removing the keyword INITINSTANCE from the def files.  The DESCRIPTION lines are changed to a comment and put at the beginning of the files.
Merging Igor's fix for pdfwrite converting type 4 image to image mask.
Fix: Documented rounding formulas in the character processing.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Converting an image type 4 into imagemask, a wrong color was written.
Fix : MSVC7 wrongly optimizes zpcolor.c .
Fixed pcl->pdfwrite bug: applying wrong colorspace to mono images.
Fixed double as int macro to use it's arguments.  Used in 64bit systems.

Fix for 687294 psdcmyk device does not write resolution correctly to PSD files.  This change adds a 'ResolutionInfo structure' into the 'Image Resources' section of the output file.  This structure specifies the horizontal and vertical resolution of the image.  (Note:  Adobe's support of asymetric resolutions is poor.)
Fix: Improving the documentation (comments) about the filling algorithm, improved.
Fix: Improving the documentation (comments) about the filling algorithm.
Fix : Visual trace could miss the current color when reinitialized.
Fix : Intel C and Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix : Some Intel C compiler warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Charproc can change scale before calling setcachedevice.
Fix : GS_LIB_DEFAULT was wrong on OpenVMS.
Update our copy of the ijs source to the latest cvs source, which includes libtool support for building a shared library version. Closes bug 687278.
Fix: Improving the decision whether the dropout prevention to be applied.
Fix (pdfwrite) : provide a compatibility of TEXT_FROM_CHARS to GhostPCL.
Fixed logic error in checking if a glyph name from the mac glyph name table can be used for pcl->pdfwrite for non truetype fonts.
Perform sign extension on 64-bit platforms. Partial fix for bug 687029.
Fix typo.
memory parameter compile fix for non debug builds.
Fix (the new TT interpreter) : A bad pointer enumerated relocating gx_ttfReader.
Fix (TT grid fitting) : A garbager descriptor was wrong.
Fix : Partially restoring the old behavior of the filling algorithm.
Fix : gx_flattened_iterator::last_filtered1_i could left uninitialized.
glyph to name behavior fixed for non-truetype fonts.  Also, removes obsolete comments and fixes debugging code.
Fix for Bug 687255  pcl output shifted to bottom of page.  Correct the order of the PCL commands at the start of page for the ljet devices.

Add check for missing raster image before getting the date of the raster. If raster is missing, run update_***baseline script to generate it since the file must be new since the last regression run. Bug 687245.
Fix (the new TT interpreter) : st_gs_text_enum_max_ptrs was wrong.
Fix (the new TT interpreter) : A bad pointer enumerated relocating gs_text_enum_s.
Fixed another steam_process routine; adding gs_memory_t ptr.
Fix : A bug in ttfmain.c caused a heap damage.
Fix : pco_accurate didn't work for curves with zero derivative.
Fix : Don't apply pco_accurate when filling a path.
Fix : The dropout prevetion did not work with "true .setaccuratecurves".
Fix (pdfwrite) : Type 3 characters were missed in the Widths array.
fix NULL memory ptr in colorspace init.
fixup memory ptr
Replace a fixed-filename tempfile fopen with gp_open_scratch_file() for improved robustness in the pnga device. Part of the fix for bug 687243.
Fix : The PCL interpreter doesn't provide pattern streams (continued).

Save the original filename template for use in the error message when mkstemp() fails. According to the man page mkstemp() can clobber the contents of fname if it does not succeed. Part of the fix for bug 687243.
Remove some very old scripts which contain /tmp races, a security risk should someone actually try to use them. Part of the fix for bug 687243.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : CropBox computed wrongly.
Fix : The PCL interpreter doesn't provide pattern streams.

Fix for "687252 subfiledecode errors on includes greater than the size of a uint".  In spite of the bug name, the problem is not related to the actual size of the subfile or to the size of a uint. The actual problem is a missing required parameter:  EODCount. However Adobe once again ignores the missing parameter and what is specified in the PRLM-3rd.

add the pdfwrite device.  For the first time we use the actual device without modification.  The only change is to remove the dsc parser device from the pdfwrite device.  Including the dsc parser is a bug in the devs.mak file.
modified debug routine to print bitmaps instead of bytemaps.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Wrong outline with a huge scale.
Fix for 687247 x11 device fails with CMYK on 8bit display.
Fix (PDF interpreter) Bug in encryption revision 3.
Fix link to GSview 4.6.
Check for hypot() availability on the configure step, fix the hypot() replacement macro, and deal with MSVC specially. Fix bug 687238.
Fix to prevent setdistillerparams from erasing the page device or reset the page device parameters. Fixes bugs 563287 and 607425.
Fix incorrect references to 8.11 in 8.13 release page.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Adobe glitches with a small FontMatrix.
Fixing a punctuation inaccuracy in documentation.

Fix problems with the "image" device when the palette is an 8-bit gray palette (uses the image8 device with num_components == 1). Since the DeviceN changes, changing num_components requires also setting the gray_index value appropriately. Also the rgb to color mapping function did not allow for num_components == 1 and used uninitialized values for the green and blue comonents. Fixes bugs 458261, 686909 and 687204.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A misprint in the previous patch.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A mangled CFF was written when an Encoding uses 256 glyphs.
Fix : removed dependence on bands in the filling algorithm.
color index fix that should have been folded in with the last checkin.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Mark copied font's glyph names when reclaiming memory.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improving heuristics in the compression chooser.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A big stack consumption writing a CFF with many glyphs.
Fix : Improving vdtrace macros.
Fix : Some of Sun ONE Studio 7 and Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Empty clip was written into a charproc.
Fixes map color rgb regression from devicen and temporarily disable the sample C based crd, which is incompatible with the most recent cie code.
Unequivocally include stdlib.h in echogs.c to avoid a warning on the Sun ONE Studio 7 compiler as reported in bug 687234.
Fix a typo in the 64-bit type selection logic. Bug 687237.
Fix some warnings reported by the Sun One Studio 7 compiler (and others). Bug 687228.
Correct a typo in the checks for stdint fixed-size types. This did not materially affect the behavior of the configure script. Bug 687235.
Fixed bug where left side bearing in gl was using unmapped character instead of using symbol set mapped character.
Fix : Removed gx_curve_split due to inprecise implementation.

Fix for fonts being displayed using .notdef character (empty boxes or other appearance). While the test file doesn't follow the PDF 1.3 or later manual recommendations for providing a [1,0] cmap for an embedded symbolic TT font, Adobe Acrobat Reader can display these characters. When the 'post' table doesn't provide the glyphs required by the /Differences list, try another cmap [3,0] to get the correct glyph (names and glyph #'s). Bug #686959 for customer #1060.
Fix : monotonize_internal didn't work properly.
Fix : Trapezoid algorithm could cause topology distortions (continued 2).
Remove spurious stack adjustment that caused /unmatchedmark when the font was loaded from Resource/Fonts/ . Fix bug 687220.
Fix : Trapezoid algorithm could cause topology distortions (continued).
Fix : Trapezoid algorithm could cause topology distortions.
Fix: The (more or less undocumented) superexec operator is supposed to allow "readonly" directories to be amended. Bug #674421.
Fix : A GCC compiler error.
Fix : The character oversampling condition was wrong.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Write a smaller Widths array.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Pattern resource was not added to Resources of a pattern object.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Color space resource was not added to Resources of a pattern object.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Wrote an invalid text matrix.
Raster depended on the band size (a partial fix).
Fix : The dropout prevention code could render an occasional raster.
Fix missing semicolons inserted by previous commit that prevented compilation.
Fix yet another long standing bug in 'match_page_size' logic that could result in the wrong (too small) media being selected due to comparison of signed difference versus absolute difference.

A pair of fixes to the PDF rebuild logic.  The fix in pdf_main.ps corrects a problem that ws creatd with the PDF 1.5 parser changes.  The fix in pdf_rbld.ps corrects an unbalanced stack.  This was not fatal but did leave the string (trailer) on the stack after rebuilding some PDF files.
Fix setpagedevice problems introduced with previous commit detected by the regression tests, including 070-01.ps and many others. Also give priority to lower value slots (match_key.value.intval)
Fix (pdfwrite) : A temporary workaround for limitcheck writing a CFF with many glyphs.
Fix : Fixed a comment syntax and removed unused variables.
Add "pa4" page size requested by a user. This is the intersection of a4 and letter page size, i.e., a4 width and letter length. Bug #553187.

Fix InputAttributes initialization to have the default page size in slot 0, and all page sizes known in statusdict/.pagetypenames included with the 'fit any' pagesize range last. Fixes bug #617077 and other files that expect slot 0 to be a valid 2 element PageSize corresponding to the default.
Fix MSVC debug targets: add explicit makefile specification. Fix bug 687205.
Fix a premature closedevice leading to a SEGV when a setpagedevice follows a setdevice with the only reference to the device in the graphics state. Bug #687204 detected with ps2epsi.ps.
Properly remove jbig2.dev from the FEATURE_DEVS list in the autoconf build when stdint_h is not available. Works around bug 687007.
Fix .gethalftone to prevent /undefinedresource or other error from being left in the $error dict. Seen with UnusualFontMatrix.ps when running under startjob encapsulation.
Fix : The flattening algorithm inaccurately filtered points. Bug 687154 "Bugs in gx_flatten_sample".
Fix setpagedevice so that the Default Halftone is used. Fixes bug #687199.

In the autoconf build, only pass -O2 if the compiler is detected to be gcc. Fall back to trying the POSIX -O in other cases. The trial compile was not detecting that this option does not work correctly on the Solaris compilers. Problem report from Nelson Beebe, closes bug 687198.

Fix incorrect handling of the '\' escape character in the filenameforall implementation on Windwows. Fixes bug #687151. Also fix logic in the .scanfontdir that relied on the incorrect filenameforall implementation.
Fixed bug for -dBoolean arguements where =true is defaulted.
Fix: A prototype for memcpy was missed.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Type 1,2 composite glyphs could point to wrong subglyphs.
Update date, product name and open bug list for release.
Fix : (type 1 hinter) Invalid contours with <=2 segments caused an infinite loop.
Remove symbol dictionary export routine debugging prints and modify the dump_symbol_dictionary() call so that it does not require stdio.h.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc compiler claimed possibly uninitialized variables.
Fix : misprints in lib.mak .
Fix : an access to uninitialized data in zbfont.c .
Fix : an access to uninitialized data in gxcpath.c .
Fix (pdfwrite) : Type 1 subglyphs don't need Encoding entries.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : sbw was wrongly accounted with FontBBox over 4095 units.

Added memory_t pointer additions to macros that compile out in non-debug builds. Added memory_t to cc_no_mark_glyph(). Removed spurious semicolons at the end of functions. Added some cast const away casts for a particularly picky compiler.
Temporary patch for debugging, printf's in sting_match()
Fix for deviceN debugging, printf's

Cygwin defines unsigned size-specific types with a u_ prefix in sys/types.h in analogy with MSVC. Use these instead of the generic int types when defining the stdint.h size-specific types. Patch from Alex Cherpanov. Fixes bug 687162.

Add stdint fixed-length integer typedefs for cygwin. Apparently this platform defines the signed versions in sys/types.h so we need only define the unsigned versions. After a patch by Alex Cherpanov, bug 687162.
Typedef uint64_t from 'unsigned __int64' on win32. From Alex Cherpanov's patch for bug 687162.
Add support to pnm images with max_pixel_value < (1<<depth)-1 Fix bug 687139.

Remove the search for long long / int64_t from genarch entirely. Neither of these types is portable C as genarch must be, and nothing in Ghostscript actually requires as 64-bit type, so the feature is inessential. (We do use a 64 bit type for gx_color_index but that's passed through a separate define.) Bug 687161.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A fixed overflow in setup_image_compression.
Fix : A misspelled TRAPEZIOD.
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 12).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 11).
[Log message beg] Fix : Adding gs/Resource/Decoding/Latin1, which is used by FAPI/UFST with Intellifont fonts.

Add a fallback definition of the common fixed-sized stdint types based on the type sizes in the generated arch.h header. This should improve the portability of uses of these types within the Ghostscript source.

The previous fix to no-op text with a transparent solid white pattern was not exactly correct.  If the source is opaque then the background of the character (bounding box minus character shape) must be rendered.
Fix for 687020 and 687146.  The pdfwrite device is incorrectly converting CalRGB color spaces into ICC color spaces.  Fix #1.
Restore v.1.2 rolled back by mistake. Partial fix for bug 687029
Add prefix headers for the MacOS build to define DEBUG for the appropriate targets. Bug 686844.
Replace non-standard #if DEBUG lines with #ifdef DEBUG. Discovered in fixing bug 686844.
Replace non-standard #if DEBUG lines with #ifdef DEBUG. Discovered in fixing bug 686844.
Add some basic instructions for creating an IDE project file for the example API client code. Bug 669654.
Fix uninitialized DCT stream state memory ptr.
Replace the code that removes the additional CFLAGS added by the AC_PROG_CC autoconf macro. Closes bug 687150.
Fix : The last change to ttfsfnt.h doesn't compile on Linux and has been undone.
Fix for 687131  Incorrect rendering for type 1 images when Interpolate == true.
Enhancement for bug 687148.  Add 12 and 16 bits to the possible number of bits per component for the bit devices.
Replace non-portable types with ISO/IEC 988:1999 exact-size types. Partial fix for bug 687029

Fix the logic that conditionally disables interpolation. The previous only worked if the max_gray was set to the same as max_color, but the macro dci_std_color_max_gray set max_gray to 0 if the number of components was > 1. Detected with bug #687147 for customer #750.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Numeric errors appeared writing an UCR.

JAWS PDF generator encodes empty stream as jaws_empty[]. The stream declares that the data block length is zero but zlib routines regard a zero length data block to be an error. Check for this case and return EOF without calling zlib. Fix bug 686779 from the customer 131
First attempt to add information requested by Igor to identify when the baseline was set for a particular 'DIFFER' case. Bug #687142.
Fix : Add double inclusion protection to the True Type interpreter bridge modules.
Fix : The first clip path list element sometimes got an empty path.
Fix: Adobe Acrobat Reader ignores an empty path when setting the clip path. Bug #687136.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Transfer function was not checked for identity.
Default to empty string when there's no /ID in the trailer and issue a warning because the key is required for encrypted files. Fix bug 687135
Fix (pdfwrite) : Write high level clipping paths.

Use [/XYZ null null null] as a default destination following the Distiller example. The old destination was clearly wrong because it positioned the bottom of the page on the top of the screen, effectively displaying the next page. Fix bug 687129
Fix : ..includecolorspace caused an abnormal recursion.

Continuation on the fix for 687101, Crash in GC on some PDF files. This change adds comments to GS procedures for the imager state structure.  These comments Were added to prevent confusion about the handling of the effective transfer pointers.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Hints were not applied to the last segment of a Type 2 glyph.
Fix : Refer new source modules from Develop.htm .

Restore the invariant: effective_transfer always points to the transfer functions in the graphic state or halftone. Old code briefly left effective_transfer pointing to garbage, which caused relocation of garbage pointers and crash if GC happened at the right time. Fix bug 687101
Fix a bug with text region rendering in the Patent.pdf example file from the adobe's encoder.

Fix for 686796 tiffg4 device and incorrect halftone frequency. This eliminates a problem with not choosing the best halftone cell size when more than one possible cell size has the exact angle requested.
Add a missing header. Record warning fixes in the changelog.
Initialize cc->pair field for the external fonts, forgotten during the switch to new TrueType interpreter (NEW_TT_INTERPRETER). Fix bug 687116
Fix (font resource machinery) : Don't try reloading fonts if the platform has no native fonts.
Following the PDF spec ignore "/Encrypt null" entry in the trailer. Fix bug 687117
Fix (font resource machinery) : Provide correct font names for graphics library.
Fix (dropout prevention) : The expression for choosing a pixel to paint with narrow trapezoids was wrong (An improved revision).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 10).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 8).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 7).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 6).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 5).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 4).
Correct a typo in source leading to failure of form selection for PCL printers. (contributed by Jim Bandy) Fix bug 686815
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 2).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 2).
Fix : Simplify the filling algorithm (step 1).
Fix (dropout prevention) : The expression for choosing a pixel to paint with narrow trapezoids was wrong. The old code sometimes unreasonably shifted stems in 1 pixel.
Fix : Removing the PDF Widths project from Project.htm .
Fix (garbager) : The back pointer validity constraint was wrong.
Apply oforce to every element of MediaBox and CropBox arrays. Fix bug 687035 from customer 831
Website fix to correct the required GS version for GSview 4.5.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Shared CID font descriptors did not work properly.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Restrict Tj offsets.
Fix (pdfwrite) : MSVC compiler warning.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Optimize pdf_make_text_glyphs_table_unencoded.
Fix : ColorSpace resource files define global resources.
Always install all the available resource categories (directories) on unix, in place of the earlier hard-wired list. Closes bug 687092.
Add the new ColorSpace directory to the list of installed resource categories. This is the quick fix version of the resolution for Bug 687092.

Fix for 687099 Rebulding XREF leaves 1 object on the stack.  The  bug title is erroneous.  All PDF files were leaving one item, a zero, on the stack.  The problem was caused by an incorrect definition of pdfemptycount.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Provide an extended encoding for glyphshow.
Update a call to map_rgb_color() to use the new encode_color() with a component array argument. Partial resolution of Bug 686981.
Restore standard functionality of bind operator in DELAYBIND mode after .bindnow . Simplify the implementation logic and document the changes. Fix bug 686746
Dereference indirect objects during conversion from PDF form XObject to PostScript form. Minimize dictionary copying. Fix bug 686953.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Annotations, outlines and links pointing to non-existing pages caused a failure with -dDOPDFMARKS. Patch from Leon Bottou.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Refactor pdf_obtain_font_resource.
Complete the replacement for fname_size described in the previous commit. Part of fixing bug 686981.
Fix compiler warnings. Include gpmisc.h when needed. Fix bug 687006.
Issue a path construction command after accumulation of 500 values to prevent operand stack overflow. Fix bug 687016
Fix : Disable the grid fitting while charproc accumulation (continued).
Fix : Add newly defined resource files to static resources.
Fix : Some Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix : Disable the grid fitting while charproc accumulation.
Don't cache glyphs with a suspect bounding box. The patch tests for (urx!=0 && llx==urx) || (ury!=0 && lly==ury) but suggestions of a better test are always welcome. Fix bug 687015 from customer 440

Return correct /DeviceGray color space from currentcolorspace operator inside PaintProc of the uncolored pattern and cache device (bug 627169). Use igs->color_space to track the current color space. Fix bug 687080 from customer 710.

Fix: Pattern color spaces that used save/restore within the PaintProc would result in infinite looping with high level devices such as the pdfwrite device since the restore cleared the pattern cache so that after the restore, the pattern PaintProc would need to be executed again. Bug #687052 for customer #411.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Fonts used in a charproc were not added to Resources of some pages.
Fix (pdfwrite) : The font copying routine was imprecise.

When Glyph names data is not available for a TrueType Format 2.0 font, rangecheck error occured. It was due to an attempt to get the data even when it is not available. Now when no name data is available, /postnames is defined as an empty array and the glyph won't get a name attached. Fixes Bug#686961.
Fix error recovery code for PDF image; pop the operand of image operator restored by the standard PS error recovery. Fix bug 687081 from customer 770.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Resources were prematurely freed, causing pending pointers.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't recompute FontBBox for CID font subsets.
Fix : A minor code cleanup in zfont42.c .
Fix (pdfwrite) : A bug in memory descriptor.
Fix (True Type font loader) : 'glyf' and 'loca' were loaded emulating a CID font with True Type, causing an unuseful huge memory consumption.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Resources were prematurely freed, causing duplicated objects in the output.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Applying .includecolorspace to insert "default" color spaces.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Adjust the currentpoint saved back into TextMatrix so that it does not include the effect of TextRise.
Fix (resource machinery) : A bug in resourceforall.
Fix (Type 1 interpreter) : Provide a tolerance to a missed subglyph.
Fix (FAPI/FreeType) : Upgrading to Free Type 2.1.5 .
Fix (color space serialization) : Removing a constraint to the Sd function dimension.

Fix for 687055 pdfwrite should not fail with <</ProcessColorModel /DeviceN>> setpagedevice.  This change adds support for the DeviceN process color model to the pdfwrite device.  The DeviceN process color model is treated like the DeviceCMYK process color model except for the name.
Fix : Propagating return code from gs_main_finit to GSDLL API (continued).

Contrary to the published spec (up to v.1.5) Acrobat Distiller 3.01 for Mac can use /Identity instead of a tint transform function in /Separation color space. Extend our PDF interpreter to cover this case. Fix bug 687068.
Fix compiler warning
This is part of the fix for 687055.  This change splits the DeviceN parameter handling.  The SeparationOrder parameter handling is split into a separate routine.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A bug converting a CID to a glyph index.

This is a change that should be examined by the postscript group.  It was made to fix a severe memory leak in pcl.  When a pattern is loaded the pattern machinery uses "gstate" to copy the state subsequently this same state is grestored in the pattern's paint proc.  Because gstate sets the "saved" member of the graphics state to 0 the paint proc's grestore sees there is no saved state and creates a new one (using gsave) resulting in the observed memory leaks.  A better solution would be to have another gsate copy implementation for use by the pattern code, which is left as an exercise for the postscript group, certainly the grestore of the paint proc should not have the side effect of a gsave.  Also the complete solution should consider the interaction of gstate (not gsave) and grestore.  I did not check what happens when a gstate is grestored and it is not clear what the "saved" member should be set to.
Fix : Removing the dependence on graphic state from font cache rutines.
Fix : Characters were cached mixing alpha bits numbers (continued).
Fix : Characters were cached mixing alpha bits numbers.
Fix two bugs in testdiff that work around missing baselines.
Correct an allocation size bug that caused memory access errors when the initial buffer handed to jbig_data_in() didn't match the internal 4k size. Thanks to Tor for reporting the bug.
Handle missing /BitsPerComponent key case. Fix bug 687956.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't use Tj when real width is smaller than 1% of Widths.
Fix calculation of the area where path segments can mark the current band. Old code skipped segments above the page boundary regardless of the line width. Fixes bug 686788 from customer 710.
Bounds checking and fixed bug with a0 and black background
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't synchronize graphic state before exiting a charproc.

Convert input values to the traditional Lab range when input color space of ICC profile is Lab. Before conversion all colors were rendered 100 times darker, i.e. almost black. Fixes bug 600288 from customer 150.

gdevdrop.c: Fixes raster operation with bit tagging device.  The rop code attempted to handle CMYK devices by assuming a default transformation between DeviceCMYK and RGB.  This doesn't work for the bit tagging device or any other device for that matter.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Inline images mangled charproc stream.
Fixed bug where PCL macros were copying the polygon buffer path. The polygon buffer shouldn't be copied. path->segments is reference counted, and shouldn't be memcopied.
Fixing bug with pxl rotated characters placement. The internal escapement is now ignored.

Correct a typo in the 'make so' target link line. This also allows the Solaris linker to ignore the option, allowing the link to complete on that platform. Thanks to Bob T. for pointing out the issue. Partial fix for bug 686865.
Only the first printer job language download worked properly because the state of the file pointer was not maintained properly.  Thanks to Peter Schneider, SOFHA GmbH for this fix.
Fix : Fonts with zero FontBBox were not anti-aliased.
Fix : A bug in compare_glyphs.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't write a clipping path with setcharwidth.
Following PLRM, set identity initial matrix for non-forwarding nulldevice. Fix bug 687041
Fix (pdfwrite) : Write color commands to charprocs which don't call setcachedevice[2].
Fix : A bug in the new code of gs_rectfill (gsdps1.c Revision 1.9).

Fix: Prevent crash caused by dsc_copy_string not stopping at the end of a string occasionally. Fixes bug 687045 "Crash while parsing long %%DocumentProcessColor line". Report (atend) in the trailer as being unknown. Recognise %%DocumentProcessColors and %%DocumentCustomColors in the trailer. Allocate colour details using the correct allocator so they will be freed correctly.
Fix (pdfwrite) : A part of CID text was missed after a font change.
Ignore system-defined FILENAME_MAX when it is too small. HP-UX 11i 11.11 incorrectly defines FILENAME_MAX as 14. Fix bug 687030 from customer 1060
Fix (pdfwrite) : Stream content of ICC color space was missed. It seems a very old bug...
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improving text colors.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Image XObject was not added into pattern's Resources.
fixing incorrect error check
initialization fixed to match smaller gs_main_instance
fixing initialization error, pl_stdio = 0;
Fix : Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
Fix : Improving the coordinate precision in function fill_rectangle_hl_color.
Fix : Cygwin/gcc compiler warnings.
VMS fix from Forrest Cahoon.
Fix : Removing obsolete linker statements from Win32 linkage definitions (an addition 2).
Fix (the new type 1 hinter) : Slightly sloped stems were wrongly grid-fitted.
Fix : Removing obsolete linker statements from Win32 linkage definitions (an addition).
Apply a patch to support compilation on VMS (as part of Ghostscript with openvms.mmk). Closes http://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=686966.

Propagate CFLAGS and LDFLAGS values set in the environment when configure is run to the autoconf top-level makefile. Unlike passing the same values to make, the values are added to the generated arguments and act supplementally. Closes bug 686943.
Add 'extern "C"' protection to iapi.h for inclusion in C++ clients. Closes bug 686990.
Fix for 686948 Dotted lines messing in PDF.  Draw all line cap types for zero line lengths.  Previously only rounded caps were drawn.

When a PDF file has an embedded TrueType font with wrong 'name' table entry, /findname procedure in gs_ttf.ps throwed a rangecheck error. Now it just returns 'false' as an output instead of making rangecheck error. Bug# 686903.
Fix : Removing obsolete linker statements from Win32 likage definitions.
Fixing all MSVC compiler warnings (icclib).
Fixing all MSVC compiler warnings (Release build).
Fixing all MSVC compiler warnings.
Fix to allow the environment variable that specifies the font location to end (or not end) in a directory separator.
Fix decimal value of NoView annotation flag in annotvisible logic. Fixes bug #687010.
Re-enable tempfile creation with empty string prefix - was disabled as part of tempfile prefix_is_simple checking patch.
Fixing some Cygwin/gcc warnings.

Fix for 686998 syntax error in findxref for customer 580.  The given test file does not have 'startxref' on its own line.  This is a violation of the PDF spec.  However Adobe Acrobat accepts the file. This fix adds a check for this case and prints a warning message. File processing then continues.

Fix non-conformance of "startjob" if password check fails. Previously, the "quit" operator in systemdict was masked by a definition of /quit as /stop in userdict, even if startjob failed due to password check or other reason.
Add some more CMap files that have been encountered in files recently submitted as bugs. Newer versions of some of the ETen CMap group are also provided.

Cleans up the behavior of the .tempfile operator, primarily making it consistent across all the platforms, ensuring that the TMPDIR and TEMP environment variables are effective, the system temp directory is used when these are not specified, and the permissions for tempfile creation work as expected (allowed in the simple case, but closing off potential vulnerabilities in other cases. Intended as a final fix for bug #686922.
Convert ASCII range font names found during the FONTPATH scanning to simple ASCII aliases (original Unicode names preserved). Fixes bug 686861 for customer 131.

Pass path across grestore using base "identity" coordinates to prevent limitcheck errors. The upath operator returns coordinates in the current user space, but these are no longer valid across a CTM change such as "grestore" or "setgstate" causes. Fixes SF bug #687001 for customers 580 and 590.
Fixes two pointers to freed objects that were left dangling in the PDF 1.4 transparency logic. Fixes bug #686994.
Fix make files and portability layer to compile on Borland 5.5 freeware compiler.
Include time.h and sys/time.h on Intel compiler as requested by Duraid Madina. Fix bug 686984
Update non-DLL version to support visual tracer. Fix bug 686993
Fix portability issues: add a portable header for sscanf() and use specific handle HDROP instead of generic HANDLE.
OpenWatcom doesn't define LPRGBQUAD. Add the corresponding typedef. Partial fix for 686816
Fix : The condition for empty environment string was wrong in ztempfile. Bug 686922 "no default temp dir"
Fix (pdfwrite) : The default implementation of stringwidth is incompatible with Type 3 font processing.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Don't write OP into charprocs.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Check a run out charstring while converting Type 1 font into Type2.
Fix for Bug 686991  Memory leak in CET test file 12-07.ps.

Adjust internal string lengths to allow for long path/filenames such as for Resource paths. OS limits may be shorter than the 8192 length allowed for after this changes, but now interpreter internals won't cause a failure. Customer 590 found this with a long GenericResourceDir. Bug #686989.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Widths were computed wrongly with Type 3 fonts.
Allocate larger buffer for generated charstrings. Old allocation was insufficient for gray block characters. (Unicode 2591, 2592, 2593). Fix bug 686987.
Fix incorrect line endings.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Providing an access to the original font matrix via a special font dictionary key /.OrigFont (part 2).
Fix (pdfwrite) : A workaround for Type 3 fonts with instandard BuildChar.
Fix (pdfwrite) : xshow, xyshow array index was wrong.
Fix (pdfwrite) : gs_copied_can_copy_glyphs used glyph names instead glyph indices with Type 42.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Providing an access to the original font matrix via a special font dictionary key /.OrigFont .
Update News.htm with current open bugs and incompatible changes.

Create a table that decides whether the glyph index belongs to [WinAnsiEncoding, StandardEncoding, MacExpertEncoding], or SymbolEncoding, or none of them. Use this table instead of searching the encoding vectors for every glyph. Fix bug 686929
Fix (the new Type 1 hinter) : Accent was misplaced in composite Type 2 glyphs.
Document the .bindnow operator and the need to rebind bind to .bind after calling it with -dDELAYBIND. Closes bug 633299.
Add an initial outermost save unless -dNOOUTERSAVE option is specified. Fixes Bug #686972 and others that were closed with the instructions to use -c "save pop" prior to the file.
Properly handle the absence of a parameter dictionary in the JBIG2Decode filter implementation. Closes bug 686979.
Build fix of the jbig2 makefile. Our portable (v)snprintf implementation is in snprintf.c, not vsnprintf.c. Reported in bug 686966.
Fix a SEGV that could occur during 'shfill' if a GC occurred between the .buildhading and the .shfill internal operators.

Fix security issue with .setnativefontmapbuilt. Procedures that change the systemdict must be execute-only so the .forceput cannot be extracted and used to change other parameters. Thanks to Russell Lang for this.
More transparency fixes: set color space when computing /BC in soft-mask transparency groups. Implement /TR transfer function in soft-mask groups.

More transparency fixes: fix broken remapping of Separation and DeviceN colorspaces in PDF 1.4 mode. Convert background color for soft mask groups to DeviceGray colorspace using PostScript code (currentgray).
Use JBIG2_DEBUG instead of plain DEBUG for compile-conditional debugging output. This reduces unnecessary output when we're compiled with our client's CFLAGS. Request from Ray Johnston.

Read a PostScript embedded ICC input profile into a bytestring (.bigstring) rather than a temp file. This is faster and doesn't leave the temp file laying around. Bug #686926 for Artifex customer #1110.
Added casts to remove some warning messages from MSVC.  Partial fix for bug #686592.
Comment out the #define for the DUMP_TO_PNG debug mode (it will need make file changes to compile correctly since png.h may not be on standard include paths.
Update version information and links to the web and bts sites, after a patch from Ambrose Li. Bug 686939.

Generate the list of X11 libraries we need to link to in configure. Previously this was hardwired, but some systems do require the addition of the X_PRE_LIBS and X_EXTRA_LIBS discovered by the configure macro. Closes bug 686938.

Prevent divide by zero when invalid Bounds arrays are encountered. Earlier we allowed invalid Bounds to be compatible with Adobe, but did not supply a non-zero denominator value. Fix required for ChineseOpera.ai
Fix: Cygwin/gcc warnings.
Fixing a C++ style comment in fapi_ft.c.
Don't redefine _Windows, since msvctail.mak passes it on the command line. Fixes a warning under MSVC reported by Igor Melichev.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Enlarge font resource arrays on demand.
Implement C++ style comment checking.  Partially fixes bug #538033.
Initial check in of the native font enumeration mechanism with an implementation for MacOS. The code is currently disabled pending resolution of bugs regarding some font files.

Apparently Metrowerks CodeWarrior defines _WINDOWS_ instead of the normal __WINDOWS__. Support both for determining the calling conventions of the client api. Problem reported by Des Courtney as bug 686934.
Fix (Type 1 hinter) : -dAlignToPixels=0 was ignored with -dNOCACHE.
Report upgraded baselines in the last 24 hours. Closes bug #654532.
Change the release instructions to refer to GPL Ghostscript rather than GNU Ghostscript. We're no longer part of the GNU project. Closes bug 686913.
Document passing -DGX_COLOR_INDEX_TYPE in unixansi.mak in response to the confusion reported in bug 686876.
Correct a bug with zero-length files in .findfontvalue, used by .findfonttype and .findfontname.
Document the need to set /OutputFile to a valid filename before calling 'setdevice' with the pdfwrite device. Closes bug 686784.
Fix : merge Adobe Glyph List to gs/Resource/Decoding/Unicode.
Fix premature increment of a nested string counter. Skip white space characters before '(' on 0 level.
Include default font map into compiled initialization files but use it only if the default font map file fails to open at run time. Fix bug 414985.
Fix a typo in a comment.

Fix for 686927  Bug in implementation of .hsb2rgb (gs_cspace.ps). This is a bug report, fix, and a test file from Heiko Oberdiek. I love it when the bug reporter also includes an analysis, a fix and a test file.  The problem was an error in the calculations for an HSB (hue, saturation, brightness) color to RGB when the hue was 1.  The only change that I made in Heiko's fix was to change a few more comments.

PDF fonts can have different widths assigned to character codes corresponding to the same glyph. There is no equivalent feature in PostScript. In this case we define a new entry in CharString dictionary, and change Encoding vector and Metrics accordingly. Currently the font adjustment is applied to Type1, MMType1, and TrueType font resources as defined in adjustfonttypes dictionary. Fixes bug 623292

Don't oversample characters for rendering in non-pure color. Search the character cache for the exact match -- don't do routine downsampling. Move cached image depth calculations to compute_glyph_raster_params(). Fix downsampling depth calculation although it is not expected to be used in normal operation. Leave the downsampling code intact because it is also used for error recovery. Fix bug 570772 from customer 1.
Fix : Improving an error message.
Fix : gs/Resource/Decoding/Unicode contained wrong codes for Cyrillic and Hebrew.
Fix (pdfwrite) : pdev->black and pdev->white were not set when ProcessColorModel changes. Bug 686921 "/ProcessColorModel /DeviceCMYK causes black page".
Fix (pdfwrite) : Improving the condition for writing ToUnicode CMap for simple fonts.
Fix : Remove LONG_MIN from gxfill.c for a better portability.
Give the explicit maximum buffer size in bytes. Suggestion by Ray re bug 686925.
Document the 64 KB length limit on input data passed through the gsapi_run_string* and gsdll_run_cont() calls. Fixes bug 686925.
Link to the 8.10 beta release directly from the the AFPL index. Closes bug 686915.
Remove <limit.h> inclusions as it defines types that conflict with our std*.h on HPUX and probably other systems. Fix for bug 686920.
Fix (pdfwrite) : FontMatrix was wrong when a standard font is used with various encodings.
Windows 2000 driver includes PJL into %%BeginFeature block. Identify this from the operand stack pattern: countdictstack lucas mark and fail the feature request. Fix bug 686916
Fix mis-identification of every DSC-conforming file as EPS.
Add a paragraph documenting current page orientation options, document limitations on ps2pdf options, and show a work-around. Fixes bug 592930
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Don't apply alignment zone to horizontal stems when the shift is bigger than half pixel.
Fix : (type 1 interpreter) : ce1_setcurrentpoint was wrong (3nd attempt).
Fix : (type 1 interpreter) : ce1_setcurrentpoint was wrong (2nd attempt).
Fix : Errors in a comment documenting gs_glyph.
Fix : (type 1 interpreter) : ce1_setcurrentpoint was wrong.
Edited to reflect new capabilities of Bugzilla and current bug reporting practices.
Change links from SourceForge bug tracker, http://sourceforge.net/bugs/?group_id=1897 to Ghostscript Bugzilla, http://bugs.ghostscript.com Fix bug #686888
Add hyperlinks to Ghostscript Bugzilla bug entries.
Permit explicit specification of /GDBytes equal to 0 for incrementally downloadable CIDFonts. Fixes bug 686890 from customer 131.
Fix : Removing an unused code.
Fix : Completing the extended semantics of gs_glyph.
Fix (PDF interpreter) : Account Encoding while building CharStrings for TrueType fonts.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Convert Type 0 fonts with multiple CID font descendents into Type 0 fonts with single CID font descendents (the part 3).

Process encryption dictionary after reading all parts of xref. Old code resolved encryption dictionary after reading the latest part of xref only and returned null instead of the dictionary for some files. Fixes bug 686907 from customer 1060.
pdfwrite : Don't add subset prefix when a font doesn't embed. Ghostscript Bug 686893  NeverEmbed for Japanese CID fonts doesn't work correctly Patch from Koji Nakamaru.

Fix for 686785 segfault with PDF 1.4.  The PDF interpreter was calling PDF 1.4 transparency features (begin_transparency_group) even though the alpha involved was 1.0.  The fix is to set a flag when the need for transparency is done at the start of a page and then testing it when transparency may be needed during the page.
This fix corrects a recursion loop that exists with PDF form objects with a transparency group.

Count 1st page objects as shared objects. This is the 1st version that generates files compatible with AR5 used as a browser plug-in. Earlier versions of Acrobat ignore malformed hint tables. All versions ignore the tables when they read the file from disk. Fixes bug 592841
pdfwrite : Glyph indices were wrongly computed with copied FontType 11. Ghostscript Bug 686894 "Corrupted CMap".
Previous commit was from a bad version of the file (prior to a local correction in a different directory). This fix is the correct fix for embedded fonts that have Length 0 for customer #590.
Some PDF files have embedded fonts with Length == 0. These should default to the same handling as when there is no embedded font. Fix for customer #590.
Add a prefix header file for the MacOS Carbon build to enable target-specific settings.
Check for a valid filter name before trying to parse jbig2 global context streams. Fixes bug 686829.
Remove spurious '-c' options to install. Closes bug 686895.
Initialize current color value as null when pattern color space is set. Fixes bug 686805
Fix : Don't fail when GlyphNames2Unicode can't be provided for a CID font.

A pair of fixes for Bug 686791   Device bitcmyk produces wrong output The bitcmyk device produce the wrong output if GrayValues=8.  In this case the pixel size is 32 bits.  The encode_color procedure was sign extending the  MSB into the upper 32 bits of 64 bit gx_color_indexes. The fix in gdevbit.c prevents this from happening.  The fix in gdevm32.c makes it so that it does not matter.  I am including both for completeness.  The bitcmyk device should not produce garbage in the remaining bits.  Thus the first fix.  However there may be other devices with this problem so I am including the fix in gdevm32.c. There was a recent report from an AIX system with a similar problem
Stream 'position' was not update correctly under some conditions. Fixes Bug #686859 for customer #600.
Fix : Removed a debug hack.
PDF Forms that contained indirect objects need to be resolved prior to processing with 'execform'. Bug #686884 for customer #150.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Convert Type 0 fonts with multiple CID font descendents into Type 0 fonts with single CID font descendents.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Removing the 'vdata' argument to simplify internal interfaces.
Our bug tracker is now at ghostscript.com.
Update open bug list for release.
Fix to start next label at carriage return position after a line feed in hpgl LB command.  Test case: label-cr-centered.pcl
Work around 64K limit in a few probable places. Fixes bug 611727
Fix (pdfwrite) : Merge the Encoding of the 'complete' font copy when merging fonts.
Fix (pdfwrite) : 'loca' was wrong in some cases embedding a TT font subset.
The TrueType font loading was quite a bit slower than it should be. This optimized font loader is up to ten times faster. Fixes bug #686851.
Security fixes. Add detection of %pipe% device when in SAFER mode. Also fix detection of 'renamefile' to prevent rename from a file that is not on the PermitFileControl list.
Fix to prevent Windows function from creating file names like (xxx/\\yyy). If there is a trailing path sep, GetTempFileName needs it to be \, not /. Also remove extraneous ^M from previous commit.
Fix uninitialized variable in gp_open_scratch_file() when the temporary file prefix is an absolute path. Fixes bug 686874
Disable binary encoding. PDF doesn't use binary encoding and may contain characters in the range 128 to 159 in names. Fixes bug 686866
Wild core returned sometimes as an error code from pdf_image_end_image_data() caused unexpected PS error and a low level stacks dump. Fixes bug 686870.

Revised fix for 686872 token operator sometimes leaves extra data on stack. With some strings, the token operator can leave extra data on the stack. In the test case, the token operator is generating a syntaxerror.  The error is expected.  However the token operator is leaving 3 items on the stack.  It should only leave one:  The original string.  This fix corrects the problem.
Fix negative shift count in operator << . On 80x86 processors the shift argument is implicitly masked by 31. Fixes bug #686743.

Fix for 686872 token operator sometimes leaves extra data on stack. With some strings, the token operator can leave extra data on the stack. In the test case, the token operator is generating a syntaxerror.  The error is expected.  However the token operator is leaving 3 items on the stack.  It should only leave one:  The original string.  This fix corrects the problem.
Following PDF spec make MatrixA equal to WhitePoint of CalGray color space. To avoid clipping set the max values of RangeLMN to the corresponding values of WhitePoint. Fixes bug 686749.
Fix : margin_set::y was not initialized starting a fill (2nd attempt).

Linearized PDF hints are rewritten as following: (1) added shared object hint table (2) added padding after every per-page entry in hint tables (3) changed the values of some entries Fixed a PS error in PDF files with empty /Contents array. Added a check for encrypted PDF. Fixes bug #611694.
Replace generic always-on debug printfs with if_debugN() calls. To get the old behavior, pass -Zs to the debug build.
fixes typo in last revision.
Workaround to clean up after a PaintProc which leaves additional garbage on the operator stack. Fixes bug #686855.
Fix (type 1 hinter) : Overshoot thresholds were wrongly computed with TextAlphaBits > 1.
When enumerating files on Windows, do not return directory names.  Partial fix for Bug 686853  filenameforall enumerates directory items.
Fix : margin_set::y was not initialized starting a fill.
Fix : gx_path::procs was not initialized in some cases.
Further conditionalize the symbol dictionary debug dump: it's now enabled with DUMP_SYMDICT instead of just DEBUG.

Fix for 686857 bitcmyk has problems with -dBITS=2.  This fix corrects a problem with the halftone calculations if the number of bits per component is more than one and the process color model is subtractive.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Pattern phase was wrongly computed for pattern stream accumulation (2nd attempt).
Fix (pdfwrite) : Pattern phase was wrongly computed for pattern stream accumulation.
Fix : Add the static resource gs/Decoding/StandardEncoding .
Fix (file_name_combine) : Check .tempfile permissions.
Fix (AlignToPixels) : Provide a better stem contrast.
Fix (AlignToPixels) : Rounding formulas for glyph positions were wrong.
Fix : FONTPATH was broken with lib/gs_fonts.ps revisions 1.17 and 1.25 .

If reopening the display device fails after setting the callback, display an error message. Allocate the large display bitmap using a low level allocator to avoid exceeding the memory limit of the previously used device stable memory allocator. Fixes bugs 686836 "-r doesn't work" and duplicate 686838 "Ghostscript doesn't do anything".
Add the bbox device to the default macos shlib build. Bug 686811.
Fix scanline size calculations and channel mix-up.

Following PDF 1.4, chapter 4.6.2 pattern is instantiated in the graphic state harvested at the beginning of the pattern's parent content stream. This patch fixes PS graphic state parameters only. PDF specific parameters are still inherited from the current graphic state. Bug #686834

Fix ASCII85Decode filter to match Adobe's when strings that are not multiples of four are padded with other than zero. Tested against CPSI for exact match. Also overflow error detection added to conform to the PLRM and CPSI. Fixes bug #686840.
Add processing of %%BeginICCProfile DSC section for (some) EPS file, notably Adobe Photoshop. Final part of fix for bug 686797.
The DeviceN merge broke the command line -dUseCIEColor option. This patch restores basic CMYK color conversion when -dUseCIEColor is set. Partial solution to bug #686797.
Remove some debug printouts.

In the display device, store the line pointers separately from the bits, so that the bits can be placed in special memory (e.g. allocated in video memory).  Fixes Bug 686780 display_memalloc() asks for too much memory.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Applying a generic resource writing method to charprocs.

Calling the gsapi polling function from the Macintosh gp_check_interrupts function violates the layering of the interpreter over the graphics library. Therefore we isolate the offending code to a separate module 'macpoll.dev' in a fashion analogous to the mspoll feature dev available on the windows build. Enable this by default in the CodeWarrior build. Partial fix for Bug 686810. After a patch by Russell Lang.
Use different output file names for the Classic and Carbon MacOS shlib targets. Closes bug 686818.
Call the gsapi polling function from the Macintosh gp_check_interrupts function. Partial fix for Bug 686810 "CHECK_INTERRUPTS should allow shorter worst-case abort".

Call the gsapi polling function during the main interpreter loop timeslice code.  This allows a client to abort the interpreter when running "{} loop". Fixes Bug 686810 "CHECK_INTERRUPTS should allow shorter worst-case abort".
Fix (pdfwrite) : Compress charproc streams.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Use cos_write_stream for charproc accumulation.
Fix (dropout prevention) : sfill was unintentionally slowed down.
Create more specific DEBUG switches in the interpreter initialization modules to allow debugging to only include information of interest. If -dDEBUG is set, then set all of the specific switches.
Fixed rcs $Id:$ line.
Fix : Increasing the text alpha bits thresholds. Bug 686775 "Large text is not anti-aliased".
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generate pseudo-random font names for subset fonts from the glyph usage array. Bug 686807 A "subset fonts" error in Adobe Acrobat from files made by GS8.00
Fix : Remove an unintentional rudiment of a debug printing.
Sort the list of devices in the output of 'gs -h' so they're easier to read. Also list the default device separately as it's no longer first. Based on a patch from Nelson Beebe. Closes bug 416746.
Use fstat() function to determine whether the file is seekable. This should work on all supported platforms and seems to be the only way to get the file type using a MSVC CRTL function. Bug #686773
Use standard sRGB CRD. Fix color cast in the light areas caused by chromatic adaptation done in the wrong (RGB) color space. Bug #650802
Fix (pdfwrite) : Generate a page when input file has no pages. Bug 686792 "Empty PS file generates produces invalid PDF".
Fix : Ignore a missed CMapType, because Adobe does so. Bug 686800 "Error converting PostScript file with vertical Japanese text".
Fix (pdfwrite) : The monitoring of fill overprint parameter was not conforming to PDF 1.3, 1.4 spec. Bug 686802 "Stroke Overprint lost making PDF".

Extensive reorganization of how ufst fcos and ufst plugins are loaded. It is now possible to load multiple fcos and plugins supporting the various printer emulations discussed in the ufst documentation by the setting of three environment variables: UFSTFONTDIR, UFSTFCOS, and UFSTPLUGINS.  Todo: documentation for these is needed and the code has not been tested in the MSVC build.  Also, this checkin fixes several problems with the resident font table.
Fix : Ignore a small noise skewing in the character caching criterion.
Fix (type1 hinter) : The overshoot suppressing code was wrong. Bug 686812 "Incorrect font rendering for Zapfino ampersand".
Fix: Restores logic to improve shading quality, which was clobbered in DeviceN merge.
Initialize the legacy global pgsdll_callback to NULL to avoid problems if it isn't properly set. Part of bug 686768.

Avoid calling a null pgsdll_callback, as can happen with the new client api and CHECK_INTERRUPTS. This fix affects only MacOS, similar protections are already in place for other platforms. Also return EOFC in the mac stdio stream process if no callback is defined. Closes bug 686768.
Fix: Make the pdf 'q' operator not affect the current path, in conformance with the PDF spec. Fixes SF #596009.
Document that setpagedevice keys can reset the effects of pdfmark commands. Closes bug 645677.
Fix documentation for -dAdjustWidth. This parameter takes a integer rather that an boolean as was stated. Closes bug 538033.
Fix a typo causing "/typecheck in restore" in documents with /Threads . Bug #611701
Try to set the output format based on the extension given in -o if any. Also fixes a bug where the format was undefined with -o. (yay valgrind!)
On some devices the initial page size is rounded up but page size is rounded to the nearest pixel when set by setpagedevice. Changing default page size to match the setpagedevice. Bug #686795

Multi-target rule that generates all of the targets at once was executed for every target obsoleting some of the files generated earlier and causing recompilation. Replace the multi-target rule with a single-target rule and make the target a prerequisite of the remaining targets; use empty command to disable default build rules. Bug #685341.
Prevent UMRs and when an image3x type image only has one of the possible two masks. Hangs or data garbling could result. Related to bug #686782.
Use the systemdict version of "quit" from gs_main_finit so that we can still quit if /quit has been redefined. Bug #686783. Analysis by Raph Levien.
Improve .copyparam to handle arrays as well as strings, preserving the 'executable' status of arrays. Fixes bug #647685.
Fix : A bug processing an error in .schedule_init .
Fixing some compiler warnings (unused variables, etc.).

Fix (pdfwrite) : Provide a complete monitoring of the viewer's graphic state while generating a PDF output. The old code misses the synchronization of the viewer's graphic state with its internal copy when generating a 'grestore' command to undo a clipping. Bug 686763 "pdfwrite is not correctly handling OPM distiller parameter".
Fix (pdfwrite) : 'write_range' was buggy (inconsistent) since zfont42.c rev.1.11 (17 Jan 2003).
add a link to the bug database to the website
Fix (pdfwrite) : The recent patch for the bug 653140 changed the font embedding condition with too narrow one. Restoring it to the old one.
Fixes a bug where baselines weren't being reverted if they already existed.
Fix (CFF parser) : Warn and ignore missed tables instead giving up. Bug 686772 "PDf file breaks in ghostscript works on other PDF rips".
pdfwrite : Fixing the bug 653140 "use NeverEmbed to restrict CIDFont embedding"
Remove -dNODISPLAY flag from ps2ps.bat because nothing is generated when the flag is set. There's no -dNODISPLAY flag in UNIX or OS/2 versions. Fixes bug #686776
Check i/o errors in PS and EPS generation drivers. Return ioerror soon after the error is encountered in the output stream. Fixes bug #686741
Check i/o errors in PS and EPS generation drivers. Return ioerror soon after the error is encountered in the output stream. Fixes bug #686741
Fix (file_name_combine) : The operator .file_name_combine returned a read-only string.
Fix (pdfwrite) : When advance width has non-zero y component, the width was set to zero. Bug 686764 "Overlapping characters".
Fix (pdfwrite) : While embedding a font, prefer font name to key name. It conserves original font names and allows derived fonts to merge.

catch-the-leaked-malloc-call code for debug only.  Each allocation is assigned a unique sequential number and stored in the node.  The number is printed out in the leak report so that a malloc without a free can be caught with a conditional breakpoint next run.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Unwinding another part of the previous patch which wrote a wrong numLongMetrics.
Fix : Increasing the threshold for the dropout prevention invocation.
Fix (file_name_combine) : A bug in gs_fapi.ps .
Fix (pdfwrite) : Unwinding a part of the previous patch and improve the OS/2 table writing an embedded CIDFontType2. Bugzilla Bug 686759 "pdf to pdf doesnt work".
Replace the win32-specific code for seeking with a generic version. Partial fix for bug #686739.

Fix for 686740 PDF file causes gs8 to core dump.  The test file uses PDF transparency.  This is a PDF 1.4 feature however the file header says %PDF1.3.  The implementing code has tests for PDF version 1.4 before it tests for transparency features.  The fix simply lowers the test level to 1.3.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Never write cmap embedding a CIDFontType2. Bugzilla Bug 686759 "pdf to pdf doesnt work".

file_name_combine : 1. Always search command line argument files in (.) . 2. Throw invalidfileaccess from .libfile . 3. Always check permissions with reduced file names. 4. Ignore "./" prefixes in permission lists, except for (./*) .
Fix : setweightvector did not set the copy of WeightVector in gs_type1_data_s. Bug #686753 "Wrong Display of Multiple Master Fonts".
add a debug message about segment page association
Fix (file_name_combine) : Improving the OpenVMS path syntax.
Fix (file_name_combine) : Renaming no_neighbour with no_sibling.
Fix (file_name_combine) : Improving the file path syntax for OS/2, DOS and Windows.
Fix for #686755 sgirgb device.  The sgirgb device would produce compiler errors if included in version 8.00 or later.

Fixed PXL downloaded characters that include metrics and glyph_id in the ReadChar download. Different offsets for the glyph_id are based on PXL character format and class. Downloaded PXL compound glyphs are now supported.
correct a nested debug #ifdef
Fix (file_name_combine) : Relative paths in GS command line did not work. This patch changes disabled code only.
Fix (file_name_combine) : An improvement to .locksafe .
Fix : A bug in CIDDecoding category definition.
Fix (file_name_combine) : A bug in .locksafe . This patch changes a disabled code only.
Fix : removing an unused variable.
gp_file_name_combine : Fixing the OpenVMS parent syntax.
gp_file_name_combine : Fixing a comment about OpenVMS.
gp_file_name_combine : Fixing the OpenVMS parent syntax and generalizing the ankor parent check. Thanks to Jacob Jansen.
Fix : A compiler warning in platform dependent code for gp_file_name_combine.
Fix : A syntax error in platform dependent code for gp_file_name_combine.

Add .endjob procedure for use by job servers. Remainder of job encapsulation and documentation to follow later. Also fix potential "invalidrestore" problem with "exitserver" and "true <passwd> startjob" caused by stuff left on the opstack or dictstack.
Fix : Improving a comment in lib/FAPIconfig.
fixed a line draw glyph in 11U and 9T.
Fix (pdfwrite) : -dSubsetFonts=false did not work with incremental fonts.
Fix (pdfwrite) : Removing pdf_font_resource_s::copied_font.
Fix (FAPI) : improving a comment.
Fixing a compiler warning.
Fixing the device finalization problem.

Avoid dictfull error; allocate page dictionary as large as the image cache size. Wrap the image data string in the executable array because some interpreters require the procedure data source. Fixes bug #643398
Use the correct debug macro in the recently committed struct_array allocation checks. Only relevant to the debug build.
Return error immediately when glyph ID is not found in GlyphDirectory. Avoid access to partly constructed GlyphData and obscure failures there. Fixes SourceForge bug #672129
Add runtime validity checking related to struct_array allocations. This is only enabled for DEBUG builds so the checks will not slow down production builds. Related to bug 669170.
Fix SEGV when cmap allocation failed (check for pcmap==NULL was misplaced).
Fix : Don't generate the warning "/Unicode /Decoding is not accessible" when working with no pdfwrite device.
Fix : A structure descriptor was wrong allocating an array of gs_cid_system_info.
Fix: Use default procedures for non-forwarding component bbox device. Forwarding procedures cannot be used if there's no target device.
Fix : Improving the CIDFontType 2 font copying.
Fix : Improving the seekability of the init string file.
Change the fixed point precision for device coordinates to 8 bits. The previous 12 bits was too large to accommodate large format inkjet printers at modern resolutions of 720 and 1200 dpi.
Fix (pdfwrite) : hmtx was wrongly written with CIDFontType 2 subset.
