Fix: dict_matrix3_param didn't work correctly on platforms where the compiler aligned structures to a boundary larger than sizeof(float), causing incorrect output or arithmetic exceptions for CIE color spaces.
Fix: CFF CID fonts in which the FDSelect array occurred before the CharStrings caused an error.
Fix: -dSTRICT caused an error, /undefined in SIZES.

Fix: CIEBasedDEF[G] color spaces computed incorrect results or caused invalid memory accesses, especially if DecodeDEF[G] is not the identity function.  (This bug had probably been there since these color spaces were first implemented, unnoticed because DecodeDEF[G] is almost always the identity.)
Fix: The 'monitor' operator was broken (probably had never been tried!).
Modified to use a fixed space fonts for unix commands in the "Quick Install"
Fix for URW font than has an undocumented (large) value for LanguageGroup in the Private dictionary. Adobe only documents 0 and 1. Values outside this range are mapped to 0.
Fixes minor syntactic incompatibilities with "traditional C" compilers.
Fix: Returning an image compression parameter dictionary didn't close an enumeration, failing to free a bookkeeping structure.

The pjl parser did not correctly parse an assignment statement unless there was intervening spaces on each side of the '=' sign.  This was initially noticed as a language switching bug, in fact the PJL language assignment was not being interpreted correctly resulting in choosing pcl instead of pxl.
Fix: -q (-dQUIET) didn't suppress all warnings from the PDF interpreter.
Fix: If a file made no marks at all, ps2[e]ps produced bad output.
Fix: The "compressed data" command encoding was wrong in one place in the documentation, and the code used the incorrect encoding.
Fixes a couple of minor Windows NT compatibility problems in script files.
Fix: The code for adding elements to small-string free lists was wrong, possibly causing an endless loop.
Fix: Once again, corrects an incorrect dependency list.
Fix: shfill didn't go through the device fill_path procedure, preventing it from being written out as a high-level PostScript or PDF construct.
Fix: If the DataSource of a shading was a reusable stream, the stream wasn't reset before rendering the shading.
Fix: PatternType 2 (shaded) Patterns caused errors.
Fix: file_limit wasn't initialized properly in some cases.
Fix: A "0 ||" was omitted, potentially causing some kinds of errors that never happen in practice to be overlooked.
Fix: A procedure name exceeded VMS's 31-character limit.
Fix: The rule for the recently-added gdevhl12 driver omitted the space before the colon.

This is an interrim version of pdf_main.ps and pdf_draw.ps to fix a problem reported by AccuSoft.  This is basically 6.12 (6.01) plus the PDF annotation logic.  I did not want to bring them up to current development version due to the large ammount of changes.

Relative dashed line pattern lengths were incorrect is scaling was isotropic.  Normally the pattern length is 4% of the diagonal distance between P1 and P2.  With isotropic scaling the pattern length is 4% of the diagonal distance between the minimum and maximum scaling points. Fixes wrong line pattern on fts 2290.
Fix: A null Pattern color caused an error.
Fix: localfork didn't properly initialize userdict in the new context.
Fixes a few typos, and adds GS_FONTPATH to the list of environment variables to be unset for a pristine test run.
Fix: Loading an unknown font gave a spurious "non-string font name" message; unknown fonts with names containing style strings like Bold or Italic caused an error.  (bug introduced since 6.20)
Fix: Patterns were sometimes written twice, with an empty definition the second time.
Fix: Patterns were sometimes written with a duplicate Type element.
Fix: The color space for images wasn't always written in the correct form (an object reference for image XObjects, a resource name for in-line images).
Fix: The URL for the Arphic free Chinese fonts had become incorrect.

Fix: Colored annotation borders caused an error; 0-width borders were drawn even though they shouldn't be; Link and Stamp annotations weren't drawn at all.  Also adds a new -dPrinted[=true/false] switch to choose whether to produce "screen" or "printer" output.  (code from Artifex)
Fix: ps2epsi removed all ^M characters in the input, possibly corrupting binary data.
Fix: The [e]pswrite driver produced incorrect output for color images with multiple data sources.
Fix: The "point matching" feature of TrueType composite glyphs wasn't implemented, causing some composite (accented) characters to have their accents misplaced.
Fix: If a font specified Subtype = /TrueType but the actual font used was not a TrueType font, any Encoding in the Font object should be ignored. (This is a hack required by the PDF specification.)
Fix: *Really* fixes the problem of data source aliasing for masked images.
Fix: PDF Patterns weren't written correctly if the ProcessColorModel wasn't Device RGB.
Fix: Masked images weren't drawn properly, because the two data sources could reference the same file.
Fix: Patterns were written upside-down.
Fix: PDF images with a bitmap Mask caused errors or produced incorrect output.
Fix: .reusablestreamdecode wasn't defined for use in LanguageLevel 2.  (The ReusableStreamDecode filter itself was properly defined.)
Fix: Colored Patterns requiring masking weren't written properly.
Fix: Images with multiple file DataSources where two or more of the files were the same caused a crash.
Fix: The structure descriptor for ImageType 3 images was public rather than private.

Fix: The PixelDifference filters (Predictor = 2) weren't implemented for Colors > 4 and BitsPerComponent != 8, and they dropped trailing bytes if the length of the data wasn't an exact multiple of the pixel size.
Fix: Showing a string in a Type 1 font with a singular combined matrix (e.g., after 0 scalefont setfont) caused an error instead of doing nothing.
Fix: Backs out the change that allowed embedding of the base 14 fonts, because it produces invalid output.
Fix: The recent optimization for using the ' command in PDF output lost track of the leading value between blocks of text, causing lines in later blocks to overprint each other.
Fix: Indexed color spaces used in in-line images were being written incorrectly.  Also optimizes Indexed images by converting RGB palettes to Gray if all the entries are actually gray.
Fix: The elimination of stdin/out/err also eliminated some #defines that are needed for error printout.
Fix: When pdfwrite was producing PDF 1.3 output, the base 14 fonts were never embedded, rather than being handled like all other fonts.
Fix: A table of constant strings wasn't declared as const.
Fix: The Color LaserJet 5 drivers were incorrectly identified as "supported" rather than "contributed".
Fix: When processing a PDF file, the font substitution heuristic based on the FontName sometimes overrode the Flags information in the FontDescriptor.
Fix: The fix to make setpagedevice ignore 4-element PageSizes in InputAttributes was broken.  (It's impossible that it could ever have worked, despite the fact that we tested it.)
Fix: When choosing a substituted font, 'Serif' had priority over 'Sans', so unknown fonts with 'SansSerif' in their name would have a serif font substituted.

Fix: Attempting to set a PageSize with 4 elements actually set the PageSize (to the first 2 elements), rather than ignoring the attempt.  (This is just a patch to prevent some PageMaker files from being thrown off by the 4-element PageSizes in Input Attributes.)
Fix: putdeviceparams allowed a PageSize or .MediaSize value with the wrong number of elements to take effect.
Fix: gxdcolor.h was required for gxpcolor.h, but wasn't included.
Fix: Downsampled mask images could cause a memory access error.
Works around a bug in the AdobePS5 Windows driver, which emits CMaps lacking the required CMapName entry.
Fix: CIDFontType 0 CIDFonts in which some FDArray element had no Subrs caused an error.
Fix: flushfile and closefile didn't properly flush streams whose final target was a procedure, and closefile didn't actually close them.  (This is a very old bug.)
Fix: CMaps with more than one code space range weren't converted to the internal form correctly; begincidchar and beginnotdefchar caused errors.
Fix: `make install' didn't install all the documentation files.
Fix: Bitmapped characters weren't written properly on the output file (new bug since 6.20).
Fix: The PDF writer could get an ioerror when downsampling images whose size wasn't an exact multiple of the downsampling factor.
Fix: Compressing with DCTEncode tried to add the compression filter twice.
Fix: Pattern resources were written with incorrectly scaled XStep and YStep, and without a Type entry.
Fix: The changes for the new color handling code caused stroked graphics not to output the line width.  (new bug since 6.20)
Fix: Backs out contributed changes of 2000-03-05 because of bugs.
Fix: Setting pdfwrite parameters for a DCTEncode filter could cause a crash (memory fault).
Fix: pdfwrite output could contain commands to set the line width to a negative value, which PostScript allows but PDF doesn't.
Fix: The pdfwrite driver sometimes compressed images in an Indexed color space with the DCTEncode filter, producing garbage.
Fix: If a font didn't have a FontName (which is the case for bitmap fonts produced by recent versions of dvips), ps2epsi caused an error.
Fix: Once again, the dependencies hadn't been updated.
Fix: Embedded subset CFF fonts in PDF files were defined using the name in the font data rather than the font name in the PDF resource object.  (bug #102901)
Fix: Attempting to build an invalid FunctionType 4 function could cause a memory access error.
Fix: The dependencies in the makefile weren't updated for the pdfwrite font embedding overhaul.
Fix: /Category defineresource didn't make the category definition dictionary read-only.
Fix: One picky compiler complained about (1L << 31).
Fix: gdevpdfe.c was omitted from the check-in for the overhaul of pdfwrite font embedding.
Fix: gsmisc.c didn't compile in DEBUG mode on systems with a non-standard prototype for the sqrt function.

Fix: Writing a Type 2 CFF with multiply-encoded glyphs produced an incorrect Encoding.  Also, when producing output for PDF 1.2 files, no longer emits certain opcodes that cause an (unjustified) error in Acrobat Reader 3 for Linux.
Fix: The Cos objects of resources not shared between pages weren't freed at the end of each page.
Fix: FILE_IMPLEMENTATION=both was broken (by the introduction of sread_subfile).
Fix: The e-mail address for reporting problems was out of date.
Fix: the most recent 'fixes' for loading font resources caused all built-in fonts to be returned as null.
Fix: A -> should have been a . (only shows up on 64-bit systems).
Fix: Automatic loading of fonts from resource files didn't work (usually caused an unmatchedmark or typecheck error).
Fix: A dependency wasn't updated when moving the gdevpsf* rules from devs.mak to lib.mak.
Fix: `makemaster' referred to an undefined variable.  (How could it ever have worked?)
Fix: gsmake would get into a loop if the makefile was not a symbolic link; `gsmake check' didn't accept a makefile name on the command line.
Fix: `make install-data' didn't install lib/gs_frsd.ps or lib/pdfopt.ps.
Fix: Some makefile macros were used before being defined.
Fixes some signed/unsigned char * mismatches.
Fix: maketars and related scripts didn't handle version numbers #.#0 correctly.
Fix: Removes some occurrences of $,I,d,: that shouldn't be substituted.
Fix: The location of the lists of supported and unsupported drivers was incorrect.
Fix: If an alphabetic font defined and used a .notdef character, pdfwrite always converted it to a bitmap.
Fix: Some Adobe font downloading code assumed that loading a resource file would never leave extra values on the stack; our implementation didn't ensure this (by popping them if needed).
Fix: The just-checked-in fixed for resourceforall didn't work properly for the IdiomSet category.  (They probably failed for other categories that had no instances, but we didn't check this.)

Fix: The implementation of resourcestatus wasn't compatible with some badly written code in an Adobe font downloader that assumes that the implementation of resourcestatus in Generic and Font is the same.
Fix: resourceforall didn't enumerate external (loadable) instances, and would enumerate an instance twice if it had both a local and a global definition.
Fix: Updates clients for the change in the last argument of cff_string_index from uint * to int *.
Fix: Replaces a final exit() with a return, to avoid a compiler warning.

Fixes several problems in resourceforall and resource loading: the operands of resourceforall were restored even in the case of an error in the client's procedure; the name Instances had special meaning for some Adobe code; resourceforall caused an invalidaccess error if an operand was in local VM but the current VM was global; loading a resource from a file could cause a typecheck error if the file left values on the operand stack.
Fix: If there was a CIDInit ProcSet defined in the filesystem, the code for initializing the built-in CIDInit ProcSet became confused.
Fix: The internaldict "operator" was allocated in local VM, preventing it from being bound into procedures allocated in global VM.
Extends .forceput to handle arrays as well as dictionaries, required to fix a bug with internaldict.
Fix: When printing on monochrome LaserJet/DeskJet printers, the driver didn't set the number of copies to 1; on the LJ 4si, this sometimes caused double printing.

Fix: Resolving a Shading didn't create a reusable stream for the shading data; since the data was then read at unpredictable times, the shading or other constructs in the PDF file could read incorrect data.

emulation of unusual hp characteristic.  Angles of vector line fills are always relative to the plotter unit coordinates system not the current user coordinate system.  This fixes the angles and spacing discrepancy in fts.2360.
Fix: If two embedded fonts had the same base font, the PDF file could wind up with an invalid entry in the xref table.
Fix: The new C BuildGlyph code for CIDFontType 0 fonts didn't handle GlyphDirectory or Type 2 CharStrings correctly.
Fix: MSVC versions before 5, not before 6, recognize /FPi87.
Fix: The MSVC++ 6 compiler no longer recognizes the /FPi87 switch.
Make sure the bug-form points to support@artifex.com.
Fix: Text with a Pattern color scaled the pattern according to the text matrix, not the default matrix of the marking context.
Fix: Filling or clipping with ridiculously large (out-of-bounds) coordinates could cause an internal overflow that produced incorrect results.  (This is probably not the last such bug.)
Fixes a couple of typos in the recently checked-in image interpolation fix.
Fix: When FPU_TYPE <= 0, the image interpolation code lost too much accuracy, producing color streaks in the output.  (Fix by DanCoby.)
Fix: The PCL XL 2.0 value for sRGB color space was wrong, and the attribute for writing mode was missing.

fixes typos...  2 examples specified the wrong directory for test files, the wording of the location of the font file names was screwy and the last line of the table of directory names was not inside the html table.
Fix: Re-registering a CIDFont with definefont, or defining a CIDFont with definefont instead of /CIDFont defineresource, caused an invalidfont error or a crash.
Fix: In some cases, re-registering an existing font or CIDFont with definefont would cause an invalidfont error.
Implements LockDistillerParams; completes the StartPage/EndPage fix checked in just before.
Fix: The name of the EndPage Distiller parameter collided with the EndPage page device parameter.

Fix: In the output of the pswrite driver (pdf2ps, ps2ps), the showpage for each page occurred before, not after, the restore that ended the page contents.  This contradicted Adobe's documentation, and made utilities like N-up printing not work properly.
Fix: The SP pdfmark didn't check that its argument was a graphics stream.
Fix: If a page ended with an incomplete outline tree, an invalid memory access occurred.

Fix: The "fix" for FunctionTypes 2 and 3 in PDF files had made things worse, because the code didn't distinguish between resolving to a PostScript function (for shadings) and resolving to a PostScript procedure (for halftones, BG/UCR, alternate color space mapping, etc.)
Fix for CID font CIDSysinfo problem.  No longer check this info for fonts.  Bring Artifex version to match Aladdin.
Fix: A couple of places in the Windows code didn't correctly handle Ghostscript version numbers of the form #.0#.
Fixes a warning about aliasing produced by one extremely picky compiler.

Fix: In PCL XL output (pxl* drivers), if a PostScript image didn't provide enough source data, the remainder of the output image was erroneously filled with pixel value 0 (typically black or the foreground color).
Fixes a bug in the mswinpr2 driver in the handling of BitsPerPixel.
Fix for CropBox problem.  (Black data outside CropBox.) Bring Artifex version to match Aladdin.
Fix: In PDF files, the page CropBox was not being used to clip the output.
Fix: When ProcessColorModel=/DeviceCMYK, if the first object on a page or after changing the clipping path was white, the PDF writer would write it as black.
Fix: The test for whether an CIDFontType 2 outline string was large enough to include prefixed metrics was backwards, which would have caused problems with any font that used MetricsCount.
Fix: The addition of the dummy cid_Setup procedure in gs 6.01 was accidentally commented out.
Fix: The color_info member of the Windows and OS/2 printer devices (and other devices using PC-style palettes) wasn't initialized properly, causing improper behavior.
Fix: The referenced libpng version hadn't been updated to 1.0.5.

Fix: The computation for testing whether a tiled pattern could be represented in line, and whether it exceeded Acrobat Reader's size limit, was wrong, causing some patterns not to be represented as Patterns.

Fix: The pointer enumeration procedure for pdf_image_enum was wrong, possibly producing a mangled pointer and a memory access error if a garbage collection occured while writing an image in a PDF file.
Fix: Separation color spaces didn't store the separation name.

Fix: If log2_transfer_map_size > 8, identity transfer functions returned garbage.  The fix requires that if a client wants to set a transfer function to the identity mapping, it must call gx_set_identity_transfer rather than simply setting the procedure to gs_identity_transfer.
Fix: .buildfont0 should not check CIDSystemInfo compatibility.  The PLRM3 says PostScript interpreters do not make this check, even though the PLRM2 says compatibility is required (!).
Fix: FunctionType 2 and 3 functions didn't work.
Fix: Enumerating the elements of a dictionary-based parameter list returned garbage for the keys.

Fix: the PDF interpreter hadn't been updated for the move to library-based FunctionType 4 Functions, and still tried to bind the names true and false to the no longer existing operators .true and .false.
Fix: The AutoPositionEPSFiles Distiller parameter was misspelled AutoPositionEPSFile.
Fix: ImageType 4 images didn't give an error for out-of-range MaskColor values.  The file also had an unnecessary #include.
Fix: The parameters of SubFileDecode filters weren't initialized fully (required by a change in this version).

Fix: TrueType fonts didn't use vhea/vmtx if WMode = 1.  Also makes gs_font_type42 subclassable, for implementing CIDFontType 2 fonts, and makes its procedure for getting a glyph's side bearing and width virtual, required to support MetricsCount in CIDFontType 2 fonts.
Fix: param_coerce_typed, which works with any parameter list implementation, was incorrectly described as associated with the default implementation.
Fix: s_add_filter didn't ensure enough buffering.  This entailed moving the NullEncode/Decode filters to stream.[hc].
Fix: Two comments in the file were incorrect.
Fix: The attribute check for Functions being executed was incorrect (always succeeded).
Fix: pdfread.dev incorrectly depended on dpsnext_.
Fix: PDF images with a Mask ignored the mask.
Fix: PDF images with DeviceN color spaces caused an error.

Fix: EXTEND_NAMES had stopped working, because not all places that needed the index of a name ref used name_index rather than r_size (ilocate.c), and because the high_index value in the name sub-table was set incorrectly (iname.c).
Fix: Reading embedded compressed CIDFonts wasn't implemented.

Fix: The CFF reader gave an error if a font included any Subrs (it's very surprising that this hasn't surfaced before, but apparently Acrobat Distiller always produces CFF fonts with no Subrs); the CFF reader didn't default lenIV to -1 for Type 1 CharStrings; the CFF reader wasn't able to read CIDFonts.
Fix: Font substitution was broken.
Fix: In the X driver, the full-page buffer controlled by -dMaxBitmap= wasn't allocated with a stable allocator, possibly leading to memory access errors if save/restore were used.
Fix: For printer devices, a non-null definition for OutputFile was required even on platforms that had a default printer (as implemented by gp_open_printer for that platform).
Fixes a typo in the fix for putting stdout in binary mode.
Adds information on building with the Intel C/C++ optimizing compiler (requires the Microsoft Visual C++ environment), and fixes a typo in the link to ftp.cdrom.com.
Fix for problem with gradient fill.  GS bug #103059. Bring Artifiex version to match Aladdin version.

Fix: The code for Axial shadings incorrectly assumed that if the shading axis was horizontal or vertical in user space, it was also horizontal or vertical in device space: this caused incorrect results when the CTM wasn't orthogonal.

Fix: The X driver's algorithm for deciding when to update the screen was changed several times between 5.50 and 6.0, and one of the more recent changes caused it to copy many more pixels to the screen than necessary if the file was making marks on the page in widely separated places.

Fix: Directly-loaded TrueType fonts (including embedded TrueType fonts in PDF files) could get confused with each other in the cache, because their XUIDs were based on the font checksum field, which some fonts don't have set correctly.

Fixes a problem producing too much black in the output; also adds support for 5 new printers (H-P Color DeskJet 690, H-P DesignJet 750, and Epson Stylus Color 200).  Note that this is user-contributed code.

Adds the ability to set the ProcessColorModel of the pdfwrite device to /DeviceGray, /DeviceRGB, or /DeviceCMYK.  This affects the color space used for fill, stroke, text, and imagemask, and for images that (for whatever reason) can't be written in their specified color space.  Note that this is a short-term fix: pdfwrite should output colors in the color space in which they were specified.  However, a proper fix will require more significant architectural changes.
Fix: The gs###src.zip and gs###lib.zip files weren't mentioned as being included in distributions; News.htm and Changes.htm weren't mentioned at all.
fixes a typo in the previous intellifont spacing fix - see last log for this file.
Account for the fact that agfa intellifonts assume 72.307 points per inch.  This fixes a long standing spacing problem in the legacy test file MC508WW2.BIN.
Changes the default undercolor removal and black generation functions back from f(k) = k to f(k) = 0.  This fixes some, but not all, of the reported problems with color inkjet output in 6.0.
Fix: gsmalloc.c didn't include the prototype for gs_exit(), which it calls.
Fix: The documentation for building with pthreads on FreeBSD hadn't been updated.
Fix: the "all architectures" build and test script hadn't been updated to use different STDLIBS values depending on where the platform provides the pthreads library.
Fix: The Windows zip archive didn't include font metrics files.  (This change only fixes the build procedure: it doesn't actually update the currently released zip archive.)
Fix: The Watcom compiler switches didn't force enums to occupy a full int, leading to execution errors because the code casts (enum *) pointers to (int *).
Fix: The Unix install process tried to make links without deleting them first.
Fix: The [e]pswrite driver produced invalid output if the input file didn't end with a showpage.
Fix: The ps2pdf*.bat scripts didn't set PS2PDFSW to the empty string if there were no arguments, causing the same file to be processed again.
Updates the Brother HL7xx drivers with a new user-contributed version, plus a couple of minor fixes.
Fix: The makefile still referred to a long-gone driver for the DEC LA70.
Fix: The dependency list for coslwxl omitted a $(DD).
Fix: The description of the value returned by code_map_decode_next in *pchr was incorrect.  (documentation bug only)
Fix: The %ram% IODevice was defined, but should not be (it represents a RAM-based file system, which Ghostscript does not provide).
Fixes incorrect documentation of several procedures.
Fix: When operating in buffered mode (MaxBitmap > 0), the X driver sometimes failed to copy all of the updated area to the screen.
Fix: resourcestatus for fonts was broken.
Fix: The check for a show within a cshow procedure for a CID font was wrong.
Fix: Images with input from a file or filter demanded 1 byte of data too many, sometimes causing the last line of the image to be dropped.  (bug probably introduced in 6.0)
Fix: fileposition didn't give an error for filters or non-seekable streams.
Fix: findlibfile didn't handle %iodevice% prefixes correctly.
Fix: CloseSource and CloseTarget were effectively ignored for Flate and LZW filters with a Predictor, and for the DCT filters.
Fix: An incorrectly formatted procedure couldn't be converted correctly by ansi2knr.
Fix: Writing of dictionaries in binary object output, a non-standard extension, was enabled by default, and also had to be enabled at startup time if it was ever going to be used.
Fix: The mswinpr2 driver didn't handle setting BitsPerPixel to the same value when the device was already open, possibly causing an error on restore or grestore.
Fix: When converting PostScript to PDF, selecting /Bicubic as an image DownsampleType caused an error instead of defaulting to /Average.
Fix: The type of the %pipe% IODevice was /FileSystem, whereas it should be /Special.
Fix: The prototype for gs_exit() was not included even though gs_exit() was called.
Fix: RasterOps with source transparency = 0, texture transparency = 1 didn't match the (very peculiar) H-P specification even if TRANSPARENCY_PER_H_P was defined.
Fix: The code for handling execstackoverflow errors didn't cut back the stack correctly, possibly causing invalid memory accesses if an incorrect attempt was made to run a cleanup procedure.
Fix: When interpreting a PDF file, substituted small-cap fonts were created with incorrect scaling.
Fix: When interpreting a PDF file, text drawing operators didn't reset the text position, so strings could get displayed on top of each other. (bug introduced by a fix in 5.98)
Fix: When interpreting a PDF file, the Install page device procedure got more and more deeply nested after every page, eventually causing an execstackoverflow.

Fix: Incrementally downloaded TrueType fonts produced truncated Widths tables in the output.  We have patched this with a ******HACK****** that causes such fonts to be converted to bitmaps: the correct fix (to delay determining the range of valid characters until the font is written) is too large a change to make in a bug fix release.
Fix: The change in 5.99 to work around Acrobat Reader's 32K limit on user space coordinates caused all 0-width rectangles to disappear, which had major effects on some files.
Fix: In-line images emitted an extra 'q' (gsave), causing the CTM to become incorrect, entries to pile up on the dictionary stack, and an invalidrestore error to occur at the end of the page.
Fix: The terminating $ on the $Id: line in gsmalloc.c was missing, and dwuninst.rc lacked a $Id: line.

Fix: (%os%) currentdevparams didn't return (fixed) values for InitializeAction, Mounted, Removable, Searchable, SearchOrder, and Writeable, or (meaningful) values for BlockSize, Free, and LogicalSize. Currently, the latter values are dummies.
Fix: When reading the strings of a binary object sequence, having to get more data from a procedure-based stream sometimes caused a syntaxerror.
Fix: If an error occurred while loading a font, it wouldn't produce an error message.  (This is a 'fix' of a 'fix' of a 'fix': it might well break something else.)
Fix: The loader for the stochastic halftone incorrectly assumed that the resource file left the resource on the stack, causing a stackunderflow error.
Fix: There were extraneous 'def' commands that caused definitions to be made in the wrong dictionary.
In ansi2knr, adds user-contributed support for concatenated string literals and character constants, and fixes for a couple of minor bugs.
Fixes a typo.
Fix typo -- missing ':'
Fix contributor's RCS keyword to not be Artifex's Revision.
Fix capitialzation of RCSfile.
Fix (again!) the mangled $Id: section - had to admin the file as -kb
Fix mangled CVS keyword area -- also this file now has -kk admin'ed.

From what I can gather...  pxl treats ellipses as degenerate if both width and height are 0 and other objects are degenerate if either the width or the height are 0.  This fixes the missing lines CET 328 SetRop 0x7B Special Test A.

These changes fix a problem that can occur if there is a problem in an "install" procedure inside of setpagedevice.  We had a case from Xerox which created its own "install" procesure which failed.  After the failure we were leaving the display buffer uninitilized.  This resulted in garbage in an image.  This fix makes setpagedevice more armored against this sort of problem.
Fix to use -x 23 instead of '#' character (for Watcom wmake)
Incorporate the image operator fixes -- ImageType 1 and 3 both had problems.

(Fix from Peter) Fix to detect potential coordinate overflow in fast case for stroke and use the slower algorithm.  Fix parallels a fix in gs5.99 and fixes the missing diagonal lines in pxl cet 322.bin.

Halftones have to be set before rendering patterns, this change fixes the incorrect patterns in the final frame (09) of fts 421 and several cet files.  Also, the pattern origin should not be shifted with the halftone phase as is done in postscript.  In PXL the pattern and halftone origin are independent.  We compensate for the anticipated shift in the library by modifiying the pattern ctm when rendering the pattern.  This fixes several pattern origin problems in c306.bin and many other frames throughout the cet.
Fix for unitialized pointer caused SEGV.
Change to make non-debug the default.
Fix ImageType 3 for file and procedures. Add new API gs_image_next_planes needed to correctly implement ImageType 3 (masked images).
The last change fixing pixel placement cause a bug with 0 width lines.

Uses gx_translate_path() to emulate pcl pixel placement.  Also, we now properly emulate gl/2 character fill, apparently characters are filled first, then edged.  Also the edging stroke must be done with the default raster op.  The combination of these two changes fixes the problems on fts panels 2390, 2391, and other pixel placement panels.
Fix RCSfile (was RCSFile)

We now emulate the unusual HP Line Type 0 behavior (fixes fts panel 1503) and phase of dashing has been fixed to exactly emulate hp (fixes fts panels 1482, 1483, 1484 and others).  The hp spec is not clear exactly what happens when assymetric scaling is combined with vector fills 3 and 4.  We now apply the x and y scaling to x and y spacing when the fill type is crosshatch (4) and apply the maximum spacing for single line fills (fill type 3).  This was done to fix fts panel 2380. This entry and code mods are too "heavy", each of the problems above should have been checked in separately.
Fixes for some missing/wrong filenames and one missing font (Univers CdBd)
Documents hpgl/2 character placement bug in HP printers.
Fixes hpgl (FT3 & FT4) polygon fills to support non-zero winding and even odd filling.  Thanks to Ray for finding this problem and explaining my misuse of "clip".
fix for a font initialization problem.

It seems that HP would prefer 6 digits of accuracy while scaling.  The test file cd60bw22.bin actually requires this lesser accuracy to print correctly.  This fixes the stray lines on the baseball players face on page 3.  The truncation was empirically derived.
Change default sub-directories to 'obj' instead of 'debugobj'.
Fix problem with buffer device being destroyed too soon.

Raster state's graphics margin was not being reset when a pcl reset was issued, potentially resulting in an obscure bug.  If the margin was set in raster mode and raster mode is subsequently entered implicitly, after a reset, the graphics margin was improperly retained. Running the fts test panels 2278-83 immediately followed by fts panel 2290 improperly retains the graphics margin which resulting indirectly in a misplaced vertical line.  The probability of this occurring in any real pcl file is very low.
Fix reference counting for painted paths so they are freed correctly. Prior to this fix paths were retained, using up memory.
removes setting of the entire pcl state to 0 bugmask at the beginning of a job.
Fix for recursive gs_gstate reference in patterns that caused large C stack usage at end of job.
Fix for uninitialized client color when gathering 'color_used' info.
Fix for SEGV caused by using bbox device instead of the target device.
Fix non-standard comment after #endif to use /* */ - prevent warnings

Updgrades XL to use the Licensed HP fonts like the pcl interpreter. This fixes the bad spacing for letter gothic, garamond and marigold on the test file my70boj3.bin.  The fix does not correct the spacing for the strings "Style Regular" and "Lithos Regular" in the center of the page, this requires a line printer font with fixed spacing to print correctly.  Also, the following files recorded checksum differences in testing and have only been spot checked, the preliminary results suggest font fixes on these fts tests: t308.bin, t309.bin, t310.bin, t311.bin, t312.bin, t313.bin, t316.bin, t318.bin, t319.bin, t320.bin, t321.bin, t324.bin, t403.bin, t411.bin, t421.bin, t425.bin, and t426.bin.
Fix clist_change_tile so that it propagates errors from 'cmd_put_tile_index' upwards as it should. Allows clist_VMerror recovery to work better.
Fix for error code propagation upward from 'cmd_set_drawing_color' that interfered with clist_VMerror recovery.
Allowing unnecessary "pen ups" in polygon mode when placing beziers in the polygon buffer.  Fixes missing graphics in lotus 1-2-3 generated files: ls40c1d3.bin and ls40d1d3.bin.
Corrects a typo in the last pgpoly.c fix that used the wrong pen state structure.  Thanks to Larry Baer for noticing this problem.

Fix gs_makepixmappattern to set the color space for the saved gstate of the pattern to DeviceGray. This removes any possible reference to a more complex color space (such as Pattern) that may contain a link to the previous gstate. The link causes reference counts left too high and eventually really deep recursion upon free.

The partial implementation of continuation (see below) did not allow for more than one continuation command.  This change should work for any number of continuation commands.  This fixes the truncated large bookman font that prints the number '200' on fw21fww3.bin.

In contradicton to PCLTRM Select Pen is not ignored in polygon mode. This also fixes problems seen in legacy ls4031d1.bin and ls4051d1.bin. NOTE: I have not tested if this is also true for polyline encoded select pen command.
normalizes angle on second pass of gl/2 vector fills to the 1st or 2nd quadrant, specifically [0..PI).  Fixes problem in test file c3.bin bug number 199912.

Improves algorithm to determine if a path should be closed.  We now make comparisons of gl/2's first and last point of a subpath in device space instead of user space.  Fixes missing miter and join in test file golfer.pcl.
resets "parse other" to pcl upon receiving a printer reset in case we received the command after entering gl/2 mode.  Fixes the overlay macro bug page 3 fts.2230.

Modified to parse the RCS file: (not Working File:) field of the cvs log output and always print the module name followed by the file name (i.e. pcl/pcparse.c instead of pcparse.c).  Also removes obsolete code to get working directory and debug print of log file.

The pcl font machinary was changed (see below) to maintain a flag in the font selection state indicating if the font should be selected by id.  Unfortunately, we forgot to clear the flag when decaching font and font selection parameters.  This fixes the missing characters seen on pcl5e ats file mc608w22.bin and others.

Improperly qualifying an undefined glyph.  In pcl parlance undefined glyphs are space characters, for some reason this rule was not being upheld in all cases.  Fixes the bad spacing on page 1 of mc608w22.bin.
This file should have been checked in with the change to implement soft font continuation - see last entry for file pcsfont.c.  This fixes large missing 4 character in ats file pl30aw22.bin.
HP does not stop processing an SD or AD command because one or more of the parameters are out of range, out of range parameters are skipped. File bug410.pcl.

Change to not automatically treat ascii character 32 as a space.  As a hack we only do this for internal fonts which shouldn't have a real character mapped at position 32.  Download fonts may hava a real character mapped at position 32 in which case the escapement for the character (not hmi) should be used.  Thanks to Jan Stoeckenius for fixing this one.
fixes pitch selection problem - scalable fonts should score worst not best when a fixed pitch font is requested.  Improves font selection debugging code, as well.
Fixed bug introduced during cvsroot -> cvsroot2 change. Minor improvmenent to text wrapping.
Horizontal relative cursor motion logical error fixed.  Relative cursor positions less than 0 were not handled correctly.
Fixes date option implementation.
removes conditional debug flag.
Misspelling of a device resulted in not including initialization code for the pgcolor module.  Fixes black background regression present in many of the ats files.
Script for the user that doesn't want to do it the hard way which is (from the bugs directory):
rc fix from gs5.87 (peter).
adds debugging assertions for current devices while devices are being removed from the pcl interpreter's instance.
Fix missing 'gdevppla' module when building with bmpa... devices and no pbm... devices.
casts color mapper devices to normal devices for gx_device_retain and fixes a typo.
adds gdebug.h, indirectly needed by reference counting code. Modification for gs5.84 color space interface.

fixes static removal regression.  The pcl cap can reside in the pcl state but is not really part of the modified print environment.  After macro invocation, copy back the cap to simulate this behavior.
corrects typo and fixes a compiler warning introduced in the last modification.
Increase STACK to 64k to support nested macros (fixes fts.1060 failure) and make BANDLIST_MEMORY == file.
Fixes 2 problems with polyline encoding: After PE is executed, the previous plotting mode (absolute or relative) is restored, but the pen up and down status is maintained.
Add 'int_freed_top' to track when free list consolidation is needed. This is to fix sandbar problems in the chunk.
Add initialization for hpgl parser. Fixes exception error.
Remove debug statement inadvertently left in previous version.

Fix for (probably bogus) file that has undefined Annotation Link Dest name '/0'. Allow/ignore undefined Dest in Links. Also allow the '%%EOF' to be truncated to '%%EO' - fixes another bogus file problem that Adobe Acrobat reads.
Fix (from 5.80) for font substitution for PDF files, problem primarily with Bold font not being picked when it should.
Fixes (from 5.80) for PDF font substitution problems, primarily with Bold font not being picked when it should.
Fix from aladdin gs5.67.  Images with non-default ImageMatrix weren't written correctly in the band list. (bug introduced in 5.60)
Fix "Pointer Type Mismatch" warning.

Fix clist triangle and paralleogram functions to respect the disable_path flag. This plugs a hole in clist VMerror recovery that is not handled by clist_put_polyfill. Later, maybe fix put_polyfill to use TRY_RECT END_RECT macros so that VMerror recovery will work for these higher level (but still simple) paths operations.

Fix rotation method (again). This now uses a new function that prepends a parameter list for use by gdev_prn_put_params. Also a private 'rotated' flag is used to keep the MediaSize correct for get_params and put_params.
fixes initialization problem with LT and reworks most of the logic in hpgl_LT().
Fix crash caused by changing width and height after gdev_prn_put_params is called. Margins are now ignored in clj_print_page.
incorrect format specifier in debug print statement.
Fix for improper handling of the return code from clist_VMerror_recover. (related to HANDLE_RECT_UNLESS fix in gxcldev.h -r1.6)
Fix HANDLE_RECT_UNLESS to prevent a >0 return code from terminating the loop.
Fix to properly clip rasters.  A detailed explanation of this change is in the header file pcl/rtrstst.h, item 4.

Change to forward open and close by calling gs_opendevice and gs_closedevice so that the is_open flag is correct for the target device. Bbox is a special type of forwarding device that needs to do this. This fixes a problem with PCL5 main freeing memory and exiting while async rendering is still in progress (exception with -Z@).
Fix problem of rangecheck during put_params for call following set of ForceMono=1. Need to set num_components back to real value during call down into gdev_prn_put_params -> gx_default_put_params.
more emulation of hp bugs: LT with no parameters does not in fact reset the line patterns it only sets the current line type to solid.
Fix ForceMono handling so it doesn't revert to color on subsequent put_param calls that don't include ForceMono.
Fix for partially degenerate arc cases when only one axis has zero size. This fixes FTS 321-07 missing gray rectangle inside the ellipse.
Adds fts 765 and reverts adaptive compression fix.

new evidence from the ats test indicates the IW soft clip command defines a half-closed clip box and the hpgl/2 picture frame defines an closed clip box.  Also add more path and clip path debugging information for hpgl/2.
2 current ctm fixes: SC does not reset the ctm before deriving the current user position in device space, and the routine to get the default picture frame did not properly restore the ctm.

Fixes ats file floating poing rounding and truncating error.  For the particular transformation in effect, the initial horizontal position of 7008 centi-points would come back as 7007.9994... centi-points, which was converted to 7007 centipoints, which would come back as 7006.9994... centi-points, and so on. The process finally stopped at about 6600 centi-points, due to a change in the least significant bit of the tx field of transformation matrix.  Now we round the calculated centipoint position before converting to an integer.
Fix for unintialized caches when using CIE color space. Problem seen with PCL5c fts0871.bin. CIE_CHECK_RENDERING macro was checking the wrong status.
Fix non 32-bit tool make to include the SYSTEM and OPTION STUB directives.
Fix non 32-bit tool make to write to $(ll_tr) before appending.

Fix problems that kept this from working. Change to make 32-bit tools and target the default. Update it to work with the new directory structure. This is probably the first workable version for Watcom.
Fix building of pclver.h to use '-x 23' instead of '#' which breaks under Watcom/Dos.
Fix PCLCCC to use $(I_) macro instead of hard coded -I which doesn't work on Watcom, VMS, etc.
Fix to use correct INCLUDE macros (instead of hard coded '-I'). Needed for Watcom, VMS, etc.
Fix PXLCCC to use correct INCLUDE macros (instead of hard coded '-I'). Needed for Watcom and VMS, etc.
Fix LIBPATHS syntax, put !ifndef around most definitions to allow pre- definition (from pcl/pxl make). Add WAT32 section to build for NT char mode executable.

Fix problems for make under Watcom. Use GLSRCDIR (not GSDIR), instead of 'type' to update time stamp, use >> (prevents file truncation). Use '~' as the genconf escape character (special in .bat files). Increase stack to 32K (needed for high level clists). Correct some missing directory prefixes.
removes pcl clipping region bug - not actually a bug but a problem with the device driver.
Added check for adaptive compression mode in transfer_raster_row() to avoid duplicating last line of raster data (fixes fts.0717).
Fixed problem with adaptive compression (if the last command was repeat previous row it was ignored, showed up in adaptivecompression.pcl).
Fix condition where cie_joint_caches would not be initialized after alloc. Caused bad colors (near black), only detected with PCL5, not PS.

Remove the extra space after $(O_). This messes up platforms which cannot have a space. Correct fix is to define O_ correctly for platforms that require a space. See common/unixdefs.mak where O_=-o $(NULL).
fixes day of week error - dates were correct but the day of the week was always monday.
Added space after -o to fix problem with Sparc gcc.
fixes a stupid typo that was messing up the clipping region in gl/2.
Fix for uninitialized value in 'cursor' structure causing FP Exception (showed up Pentium). Change flow to call gs_currentpoint when there is a valid current point.
Fixed degenerate triangle problem (using Peter's fix).
updates for recent fixes.
fixes render table check.
moved debug definitions from gsalloc.c to avoid a compilation problem on with Watcom C (ray).
fixes comment.
Fix for pattern phase (Peter)

I fixed the stdout logic, so that the output can be redirected with the sequence;       /.show.stdout (outfile.txt) (w) file def interposed between loading (running) ps2ascii.ps and loading/running the file(s) to be converted.
OOPS! Fix error caused by bad edit. See comment on previous revision.
Fixed problem with version number under msvc (and watcom).
Fix for PDF files that use Patterns to make sure the /Resources of a Pattern are included in the context during the /PaintProc. (ref #852)
removes unwanted debugging print statements mistakenly added to the last revision.

Prefixes devices with $(DD) and moves zlib configuration variable initialization to the to the top level unix makefiles.  Someone else will need to check the other makefile systems.  This change requires that we set ZLIB variable in # PLATFORMS SUPPORTED * 2 (pcl and XL) places instead of one, but will allow the code to be compiled with gs5.66.

the fix to not free a reserved page entry is no longer handled by initilializing the page queue info structure when it is allocated. Instead we avoid freeing the information by removing the call for the case of reserved entries.
fix from johnd that I haven't had time to track down.  Apparently it prevents arace condition in the async code but I am not sure of the details.
Peter's fix to print rectangular images.

Fixes bug that was confusing band height and band width, also add workaround to set the band buffer space and the buffer space equal. Later the tile size cache is calculated to be different between reader and writer if the band buffer space and the buffer space are equal.

Changed mdev->band back to prdev->is_open in gdev_prn_maybe_reallocate_memory() to fix problem with 64 bit CPUs and banding mode.  This breaks PCL code but works for PostScript (though it may not work for forwarding devices).
updates for fixed bugs and a spell check.
updated for recent bug fixes.
Fixed problem with /MediaBox with non-0 lower left corner (effected budget2.pdf test file).
fixes to properly clean gs files
factors out common code for side effect of changing the picture frame.  And fixes a fixes bug where we were not setting the default plot size correctly.
canonicalizes filenames to 8.3 and fixes clean makes for msvc.
Last change did not include another bug fix: currentpagedevice /OutputFile known not
Fix for '&' wmake problem on Win95 and Win NT, and add support for building using 32-bit Watcom compiler.
Fix for (illegal) PDF files that have xref offset on the same line as the "startxref" [ref #849].
Fix for downloaded TrueType fonts that have an ID of "true" (caused /invalidfont error.) Also fix /limitcheck problem in some signed logic.
Fix for compilers (Watcom under Windows) which don't define "stdprn", but do support opening of "PRN".
Fix for build using Watcom wmake on Win 95, Win NT, where '&' causes problem (background execution or split command lines).
Fixes problem for rotated pdf files.
Changes made by Peter to fix banding problems discovered during gs550c regression testing.  Fixes problem with banded and dithered files, banded rgb files, and rotated PDF files.
fixes for character edging the pen was not being defaulted correctly in CF and the hpgl/2 drawing machinery was filling the character in addition to stroking hpgl/2 vector fills
proper usage of debugging memory switches
restores symbols (-g) to the debugging configuration
fixes benevolant type mismatch
fixes improper initializion of the tile size in the banding code
Changes a variable name from fixed to pfixed to avoid a spurious warning from the Solaris C compiles.
adds color laserjet driver, fixes makefile header file dependency typos and, removes unused variables.
changes to not compile main with debug.
Fixed typo in pattern_set_shade_gl: a solid pattern should be used for an unrecognized intensity if the intensity is > 0, not <= 0. This gave rise to an anomally on panel 1815 of the PCL 5c FTS.
fixes memory allocation problem introduced because a new field was added to the symbol set data structure.
fixes a finger slip.
Fixed a bug/memory leak in pcl_cmap_map_raster. If a new raster array was allocated to hold the re-mapped pattern data, its pointer was never being placed in *pout_pixinfo.

1.  Fixed a pair of memory-related problems in the push/pop palette code:     pop palettes were erroneously getting an extra reference, and the     palette stack global was not being set to NULL after the palette had     been cleared.

Fixed a memory leak in set_threshold_ht. A fourth threshold string was being generated to handle the case of a 4-color output device, but this was overwritting the red-component threshold array allocated previously.  Not output error occurred because the two arrays were meant to be the same, but the previously allocated array could no longer be freed.

Fixed bug in pcl_cs_indexed_update_lookup_tbl. A new indexed color space may have been created via the "unshare" operation, but the color space pointer was never being updated. Hence, the lookup table was being modified in the old color space. This bug is visible on PCL 5c FTS panels 2410 and 2411.

Work around to stroke lines gl/2 style fills individually instead of accumulating the entire fill in one path.  This guarantees that a fixed amount of memory will be used for fills.  It was changed to fix fts 1462 which creates a path that is much to large, not due to the size of the graphical object being filled but the algorithm fills from GL/2's anchor corner and clips the resulting fill to the graphical object.  We should find the equivalent maximum value for the anchor corner such that the coordinates are less than the X and Y origin coordinates of the bounding box of the object being filled.
fixes typos for symbol set 8M.
Add tcl test scripts for debugging memory leaks and printing genoa fts suite.
fixes pctag.h bug added as a test.
new path code in pxpaint.c and change in pxl_ugcc.mak to fix handling of gs generated files.
fix for ignoring error command - the next release will do this slightly differently.
2 bugs introduce by john's code involving / (unix) and \ (dos)
change to directly set bits due to a compiler bug in the Solaris C compiler.
const was defined to be NULL due to an old gcc bug - apparently fixed.
fixed for const warnings.
